title: I love this wrap! Grows with your changing body and keeps baby secure!
author: Elizabeth
comments: I've tried a few wraps out there - but this one - this is the real thing! Many other wraps require you buy a certain size (S, M, L, etc) - this isn't helpful as your body grows or slims with pregnancy. This wrap is extremely versatile, as it moves and grows with you. I've fluxed approximately 60lbs and can still wear this sling snug and tight throughout my body's changes. Also, the product itself is very well made - the fabric is high quality and there's plenty of it to securely swaddle both you and your child, together.I will most definitely be purchasing a second one in the near future! Bonus: so many great color options!

title: Compared to two other wraps I chose this one
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I am a petite mom (4‚Äô11 102lbs) so I ordered this wrap and two other wraps (the baby wrap ergo and Keababies wrap- you can find both on Amazon) I wanted to measure them all and see which one would be the shortest so that it wouldn‚Äôt be too long.I got to say all other wraps I mentioned were all great but they weren‚Äôt as stretchy as this one. So depending on what you‚Äôre looking for each one has its perks.The Keababies was definitely the shortest out of all of them and there wasn‚Äôt so much fabric, it was also a cool fabric so baby wouldn‚Äôt get too hot. The fabric wasn‚Äôt very stretchy.The ergo baby wrap was the same length as the Boba wrap it has less fabric on the width though and it is also not as stretchy as the boba, the fabric is also cotton and therefore pretty cool.Overall the reason why I kept the Boba wrap was because of its stretchy material. My baby didn‚Äôt like the other wraps because she felt a little tight in them but she loves this wrap. As for the length it doesn‚Äôt seem long at all once you wrap it around you.

title: Hands down the best baby wearing wrap out there!
author: Lauraavon83
comments: This was actually my second purchase! I had one before, but didn't find myself using it a ton. I found myself using my lillebaby carrier more. So I gave my original wrap to one of my good friends who had just had her third baby, and was having a tough time trying to figure out how to juggle daily tasks and new baby. It completely changed her life, and her husband loves to wear it as well! I then had a trip that I was going to be going on, that I thought I would be nice to have a wrap in conjunction with having my lillebaby carrier. I wasn't sure if I should spend the money for another Boba, so I try to knock off brand. I regretted it instantly as I put the other wrap on. It was way too tight, and had no give to the fabric at all. I'm used to tying tight with the Boba wrap, so I had to completely undo the tie and do it again a little looser, which was just a huge pain in the middle of our event we were attending. I was really bummed, but knew immediately how worth it it was to have a Boba. That night I ordered my new wrap without hesitation. I told my friend that a Boba is gold to have, and I wanted her to keep mine. They are so worth their weight in gold, that I had bought myself another one.

author: EME
comments: I was really excited to receive this boba wrap since it had come so highly recommended by reviewers. I am sadly disappointed and currently on the search for a new wrap,however. The wrap is much too large and a hassle to put on. I practiced with it before I gave birth to my little guy and practiced again before carrying him around the first time. I understand how to tie, yet it is nearly impossible to get this wrap tight enough around my body to feel secure. It folds over easily and the material bunches up. I am petite - 5‚Äô5‚Äù and 115 lbs postpartum. My now 4 week old was just about 6.5 lbs at birth and I‚Äôve been carrying him around since. The material itself is certainly stretchy and feels comfortable. I agree with other reviewers it‚Äôs hot for summer time. Baby wrapping is meant to be my main transportation for my baby in and out of the car seat, etc. and this wrap takes much too long to put on and adjust for it to be convenient. While I appreciate the different positions available as baby grows and the quality material, it‚Äôs not worth a recommendation due to its large size and inconvenient design.

title: A little disappointed
author: Alexandra G.
comments: I ordered this for my newborn. I loved it at first . But the material is very very stretchy. So I bought this to be hands free- and throughout the day I found myself still holding baby even though he was in the carrier. This thing is kind of a pain in the butt to put on. I wish the material wasn‚Äôt so stretchy. It‚Äôs very hot too. I love the concept. I will still use it. I find myself taking it off and attempting to tighten it and even then I still have to hold and support baby with the carrier on. It‚Äôs not as hands free as advertised. I also have lower back problems and this carrier seems to make my back ache a lot more than other ones that I have purchased. I ended up buying a super cheap carrier from target for $29.99 and I absolutely love that one and I don‚Äôt suffer from back pain while wearing it.

title: a nifty video showing this one came up and it looked easy enough. First
author: Elizabeth B.
comments: I swear by baby baby wearing and was specifically wanting a wrap I could breastfeed in.  I bought this one because when I googled breastfeeding in a wrap, a nifty video showing this one came up and it looked easy enough.  First, success!  I can feed my baby in this wrap---if I tie it a lot lower than the instructions say, and if I get lucky.  Second, I really like the soft, stretchy fabric---it's really comfortable to wear and feels really secure at the same time.  But it's A LOT of fabric compared to my other wrap, which makes it a lot harder to get on.  Once it's on, it's great.  But because it's not easy to throw on, I don't tend to use it as much when out of the house, which is when I do most of my baby wearing.  I think it's a matter of personal use & preference, and I do like having this wrap in my stash of options!

title: Great for a cuddly fussy baby! Gets her to sleep!  Plus size ok too!
author: Rian
comments: My baby: 10 lbs 5 wks and has fussy periods where she wants to be held non stop. After too many sleepless nights I got this to help calm her and take care off other children. Immediately she took to it! She loves it and it‚Äôs now a routine for us!My body: 5‚Äô3‚Äù postpartum flab, 215 lbs, size XL or women‚Äôs 14, chest large at 36 DDD. Wrap fits fine with just enough room to tie the ends easily. I think up to a size 16-18 female may find this comfy.My environment: mid 70‚Äôs to 80‚Äôs and the baby gets a little warm if it‚Äôs mid 80‚Äôs outside. I feel like I‚Äôm wearing a light cardigan but it‚Äôs not too hot.Material: soft and stretchy, which makes putting baby in and taking baby it easy. The stretch helps me pull the fabric and take baby out while asleep so I can transfer her to crib or car seat.Comfort: I was able to mop the floor today with baby and feel no back pain. It‚Äôs fairly comfortable and I love that it doesn‚Äôt feel like a hiking backpack. I also love that I can keep it on if I‚Äôm running around busy.Convenience: I have 4 different baby carriers and this is my third baby. Carrying around a backpack style carrier can be bulky when you need to take it off but transport it. This folds up easily into the bag and will fit well in my diaper bag or car.

title: Great for new moms and baby!
author: Kitsey Burns Harrison
comments: This is one of the very first things I recommend to any new mom I meet. I love love loved my Boba wrap. My son spent lots of time cuddled up with me in this wrap. It's so comfortable and helps baby feel safe and secure. My son took many a nap in this wrap. It's great for newborns. I treasure all the moments I had to snuggle my little one close in this wrap.

title: Useful as a second carrier, but if you can only choose one, go with a soft-structured carrier
author: Martha H Seneta
comments: I liked:  soft fabric is comfortable to wear for me and guessing for baby as well; does hold baby pretty well as described in pictures; easy to wash.I didn't like:  all that fabric (wrapped around us 3 times) makes me and baby get hot and sweaty; the shoulder straps don't actually stay on your shoulders if you're doing anything other than sitting still, leading to less comfort for me and less support for baby; even after doing it about 20 times it still takes 1-2 minutes to get the wrap ready and get baby in, which can feel like a long time if baby is screaming; I wore this a couple times when I was walking around the neighborhood and found that baby always ended up sliding down, so now I only wear it around the house; head support is only there if baby's sleeping and has his head under one of the side straps, and I found that baby's head tends to slip out and even with it in, I often feel like I needed to hold his head with my hand, which isn't hands-free after all - hard to fold laundry or load dishwasher; dryer can never seem to get the ~20-foot long wrap all the way dry, so I have to hang it to finish, which means more hours when I can't use the wrap.

title: I want to love this wrap ... but it is so hard to get right
author: Acadian Echo
comments: I have bought a couple of different wraps, and this was the best cost wise. I wanted to love and utilize the wrap, but I felt like my baby was going to slip out of the bottom. I am sure that part of this is my fault, but even after watching YouTube and trying to manipulate the wrap for myself, I just felt like it was not going to hold. I will try again when she gets older to see if it is better when she is not a newborn.

Also, I like that Boba sends you a sack for storage in nursery or in a diaper bag, a babywearing safety manual l, and a bobawrap how-to guide with photos to understand more about how to properly use the wrap in a safe and secure manner. There‚Äôs a lot to know about these things as a first time mom, like which positions are okay and those that aren‚Äôt, even if you might think some of it is common sense. Common sense isn‚Äôt that common to some folks!Stretchy and very thick fabric. I hope I don‚Äôt get too hot wearing this during these Phoenix summers! I won‚Äôt be outside often but I sure do sweat more in the summer. (108 degrees at the highest so far. Yikes!)I can‚Äôt wait to purchase another already! I love the new colors that I‚Äôve seen on their website and I wish I could spit up $40 each for these things. This seems to be a better quality than most wraps out there.Thank you for fast overnight shipping! Ordered at 11PM and arrived at 9AM next morning with amazon prime. Thanks for a great product!!!

I haven't quite figured out how to breastfeed him with it, but that will get figured out. Best of all, I can put it on and put him in it without help, which was the main factor in choosing this wrap. No buckles, no straps to adjust, just wrap, tuck, and done!

title: Too time consuming - not worth it!
author: Megan
comments: I got this as a gift from my registry. A family member suggested I get one as a ‚Äúmust have‚Äù baby item for my 2nd little one. A lot of not-so-glowing reviews state they had issues with putting it on correctly or the fabric stretched out quickly. I didn‚Äôt have those problems. It‚Äôs fairly easy to understand how to put it one once you watch a couple instructional videos, it isn‚Äôt complicated. I don‚Äôt have fabric stretching issues either, in fact it stayed quite tight and I always felt baby was secure in it. I‚Äôm giving it 2 stars due to convenience. This thing has SOOOO much fabric! Putting it on isn‚Äôt hard because the instructions are difficult, it‚Äôs hard because you‚Äôre fighting with so much fabric. I‚Äôll compare it to trying to tie shoes with laces that are 5 feet long on each side. Tying shoes is easy, but that much extra crap to work with makes it hard. I had to put this thing on before I left the house and went anywhere so I didn‚Äôt have to do it when I got to where I was going, which isn‚Äôt comfortable in the car to say the least. There‚Äôs also no easy way to put your baby in it. They don‚Äôt just slide right in, it‚Äôs a hassle to tuck your baby into, and I pissed my kid off almost every time tucking and pulling fabric all around him to get him where he was supposed to be. It‚Äôs just not convenient at all, period. I‚Äôll be going back to a normal baby carrier I can just throw on and buckle, instead of taking so much time to tie this thing up and wrestle the baby into.

author: Mrs. Smith
comments: A friend suggested this to me and I‚Äôm so thankful she did! It wasn‚Äôt hard to learn how to wrap, watched a few YouTube videos prior. I don‚Äôt recommend trying to put it on while your out in the parking lot. It also seems warm inside so I don‚Äôt put tons of layers on my son before putting him in. Even just a onesie is enough. Too tight baby is not comfy.  Too loose he doesn't feel secure. I put this on before leaving the house because I don't like the material hitting the ground.  It makes it easy to get out of the car and put him right in.  This way I can also grab my 3 year old's hand and get things done  (i.e. costco runs, park, amusement parks). I have loved it.  I was in between 4 and 5 stars but gave it a 4 because out can get a little too warm at times.  Also the instructions it comes with are not the best.  You tube is the way to go.

title: Not a fan of it...
author: Lisa Freeman
comments: Pros: Baby slept well in it and I could get things done around the house. No straps.Cons: A pain to put on! It‚Äôs extremely long piece of stretchy fabric that drags all over the floor until you get it on. It‚Äôs not easy to get on at all. I felt it was hard to get baby in it, but once in it, baby was fine. I did feel I had to keep adjusting fabric or baby to make sure baby‚Äôs face was not covered too much and baby could breathe. I feel it‚Äôs just way too much fabric and uncomfortable to wear due to too much fabric over the body. Bringing it out in public would be a pain due to having to place it on and adjusting it as you place it on and it dragging on the ground until you get it all on. Personally, it‚Äôs just too much of a hassle to wear.

title: Best Baby Purchase
author: Shaila Walker
comments: My top pick is the Boba wrap baby carrier. When I bought it for myself, I thought, "Wow--this is a very expensive piece of fabric!" But it is seriously the best thing we own. I used it for pretty much every single errand  and outing until she was about 7 months old when I moved her to sit in the cart because she could sit up by herself for long periods of time. I also used it for most of my housework and cooking for the first 3-4 months. (She HATED her swing.) That wrap was my everyday accessory, like a part of my outfit daily--not the most fashionable, but so functional! Now she's 16 months old, loves to run everywhere, and I don't use it much...BUT, we travel a lot, especially for the holidays, and it's my saving grace in the airport. I have no interest in lugging our stroller around, and if I did, she would just want to get out of it and run around. With the Boba wrap carrier, she tolerates long TSA lines and moving about the airport, getting on and off the plane, all of it! It's comfy for both of us and so easy for me to just wear while I take her in and out.

title: Worth the price
author: Brittney
comments: I purchased for an old friend. I loved mine and thought she'd benefit from it...SHE LOVES IT. Its soft, stretchy and keeps her new son snug and warm. I'd definitely purchase again.

I can adjust the tightness easily and I felt safe with my baby inside. It cuddled my baby in my body as if she is still in the womb. She was very comfortable with it. I used it daily to walk my dog with my baby. Now that she is 3 months and heavier, I felt her weight is well distributed and did not cause shoulder pain like the Tula carrier.The front fold is great for me to stick my phone or keys inside and it holds small items tight enough that it won‚Äôt fall out - a great makeshift pocket!

As much as I wanted to love this item, I ended up spending the extra cash for an ergobaby carrier instead...

title: YOU NEED THIS WRAP!
author: KayLigg
comments: Absolutely love my wrap.  I got one for my daughter 9 years ago, again for my son, got one for my sister, my cousin and this latest purchase was for a friend.  She was using another wrap and had issues with it and not feeling like the baby was secure.  The Boba Wrap is THE BEST because of the stretchy material.  It makes all the difference in keeping baby snug and secure in there.  The fact that you can tie it tight also helps control fatigue on your back.  My son is 15mos now and I can still carry him front facing.  Nothing but good things to say about this wrap.  Its AMAZING!!!

author: Ashley C.
comments: I used the Baby K'tan with my first, and basically lived in it. But when I tried it on with my newborn, I couldn't get comfortable in it, and I felt like I had to keep 1 hand on it, which defeats the "hands free" purpose. I ordered the Boba and put it on the second I got it. It's easy to figure out with the booklet, not intimidating to wrap at all. My baby feels so secure in it, leaving my hands free to do everything else! Highly recommend!

title: NEW MOM'S LIFELINE!!!
author: Lauren Mitchell
comments: So convenient! This product was is a newborn Mom's lifeline. It was the best product recommendation I received from one of my fellow mommy friends. The first few weeks of my baby girls life I found myself struggling to get my day to day tasks accomplished while still being able to engage with her in the way she required.  With the Boba wrap I could eat, complete household chores, run errands, all with her conveniently laying on my chest. I was even able to nurse her whenever I needed without missing a beat. I have the bulkier, more substantial, Ergobaby carrier that has all the bells and whistles l as well (I mainly utilize that one for trips out of the house) but the Boba is my go to for indoors and day to day. With the flexibility fabric it's no muss or fuss. Definitely an essential item.

title: Not practical
author: Jo'L Rojas
comments: The product itself was excellent; the 3 star rating is due to my own preferences.‚Ä¢The boba wrap was exactly as described. The material is nice and soft/stretchy so it forms around you and baby nicely. Instruction videos (I looked on their website for a link) made it super quick to learn how to use. It only took a couple of practice ties to get it down.‚Ä¢ The 3 stars is because I‚Äôm 5‚Äô2‚Äù & the wrap seems like it‚Äôs a million feel long (that‚Äôs an exaggeration,obviously). I found this wrap to be impractical when leaving the house because I didn‚Äôt want it on the dirty ground and then wrapping around my newborn/infant and being that it‚Äôs so long, it‚Äôs unavoidable. Because you have to wrap so many layers (due to the length) it becomes extremely hot since the heat has no way to get out- my baby & I would get sweaty quickly and I didn‚Äôt like the idea of my baby getting overheated.

title: Not for me. I'm not in the circus!
author: Kou
comments: I was so excited because the Boba video explained that it was so easy to use that I bought one to show off to my wife and let her use the wrap on our 2 month old baby girl. The packaged came in and I opened the box. It was a very long strap, almost like a polyester material. Stretchy and wide. My wife looked at me and was concerned. I told her that the video makes it look easy. I attempted to prepare the wrap by following the instructions. From step 1 to step 2 was ridiculous. Out of nowhere, the lady in the instructions have the wrap inside the first wrap on your body. What a joke! After I finished the instructions successfully, I looked at my wife and she started bursting out laughing like, "What the heck? You look like you're getting ready for a work out!". I was so embarrassed that I stuffed the boba wrap into the box and sent it back the same day. In my culture we use a similar wrap style but this product takes the cake on the most craziest type of wrap! Wrap your gut, over your shoulder, jam it inside your first wrap, wrap around your belly button and tie a knot! No thanks, I'll use a baby bucket carrier!These moms that posts 5 stars must have been practicing some kind of kung-fu or acrobatics. It seems like their wraps are not dirty from dragging the wrap around the floor to complete the wrap.

title: Great wrap.
author: T-Rex
comments: The only reason this wrap gets 4 stars is because it is a bit difficult to learn how to put it on, and even when you know what you're doing, it's a bit awkward to make sure everything is in place. However, when it is on and when baby is inside, it works wonders. Our baby loves it. She feels comfortable and secure and almost instantly falls asleep. It works well for my husband and myself. One other possible con is that it can get hot when you're wearing it since the fabric isn't that breathable and your and baby's body heat are making things warmer. But I just have to remember to wear a short-sleeve shirt. All in all, I would recommend this.

title: Recommend

comments: I received a different wrap as a gift and couldn‚Äôt figure it out! Did some research and decided to give Boba wrap a try and so glad I got it!  Looked like it would be confusing but I followed along to a video and figured it out right away! I also like that it is super soft and stretchy. My newborn fell asleep right away!

title: Amazing .

I expected it to be hard to wrap but I only had to watch the video a few times and had no issues! I highly recommend this for carrying your newborn!

title: Pass on this.
author: Jason
comments: Cool idea, but a pain in the butt to put on. There's way too much fabric to deal with. I could never get the baby to be 100% comfortable.

title: Great baby wrap
author: Miranda 36
comments: I bought this for my daughter. She used it a lot when my grandbaby was first born she's 4 months old now and she still uses it occasionally... very good product but you need to make sure you read the instructions and are using it correctly. It can be dangerous for the baby if it's breathing is obstructed.

title: I think the fabric is very heavy.
author: Isabel C.
comments: I think the fabric is very heavy. I went for a walk with my little one and I had to keep on putting the baby in place because she was going down as I walked

title: Five Stars
author: Ellyn Ricker
comments: This was a gift and recipient was very happy with it.

title: A new mom necessity!
author: hallie
comments: The only way I can get anything done! Very soft and I actually prefer it to my Moby because it has a nice stretch but still very comfy and supportive. I ordered the navy but received a black one--would have returned it but I was too eager to use it!

title: You Need This!
author: LaBronna
comments: I absolutely Love mine! Our carseat stays in the car so I use my wrap to carry baby while shopping as well as when we go walking. So it is used a a lot. I've learned that when baby slips or doesn't sit in there right, it is because it isn't tied tight enough. I watched a YouTube video on how to tie it and it took me all of 5 seconds to figure it out. Before I go to the store, I'll tie it around me son can just slip baby in. But I've put it on in the parking lot many times. I just lay the ends in my seat so they don't get on the ground. As far as getting hot, i was surprised that it didn't make me get sweaty or baby too hot. I got black thinking it would make me sweat, because I sweat more then a normal woman. But it really doesnt. I chose this one so both me and hubby could both wear it. We are two different sizes and this wrap is a one size fits all. Baby loves the wrap. He immediately closes his eyes and goes to sleep everytime. It is an Amazing product!

title: Great product
author: Heather Gorman
comments: This is such a great product - easy to use. I have two other baby carriers and prefer this one for my 6 week old!

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Bought for daughter

title: love, i got this because i like the moby ...

comments: love, i got this because i like the moby but this is stretchier. Love it, so does my 18lb 1 year old

title: As a product and material and all that good stuff. Its a 5
author: Kylee
comments: As a product and material and all that good stuff. Its a 5. I just cant figure it out to make it worth my while

title: Love it!
author: Laci Thralls
comments: I love this for my little one! I wish I had one when my son was a baby. It makes it so easy to go just anywhere and not have to worry about that heavy carrier.

title: Disappointed on how thick and not breathable the fabric is.
author: Tiffany Rodgers
comments: While I love having my baby in a wrap, I am Kinda disappointed in this one. It is very very long. I mean I know most baby Carriers are long but this one has so much extra fabric left over. I see many other carriers, where they can be tied and tucked away nicely but that can't be done with this one. Second is that the fabric is not breathable at all. My poor baby would get so hot and sweaty with the 3 layers of the wrap over her in the hot summer months. I really wanted to be able to wear her outside and on walks but it was Impossible with this carrier because it was so thick :/ I am just disappointed because I read so many reviews and even watched videos on the best wraps and this one was one of time. I really wish I would have gone with another one.

title: Love the wrap and the color
author: Miranda Mendoza
comments: Stretchier than a Moby wrap - that's why we got it this time around for baby #2. Love the wrap and the color!

title: The best wrap out there

comments: The best wrap out there!! As a mom I researched them all and have tried many. This is absolutely the best!

title: Easiest way to carry a new baby!
author: mk

title: I figured they would love it since they chose it
author: ML
comments: I didn't get to see this myself. But I purchased this as a gift for friends who were expecting twins. Of course, the Boba Baby Wrap can only fit one baby at a time. But still! Since this was an item on their baby registry, I figured they would love it since they chose it!

title: Love it!
author: Viviana
comments: I absolutely love this! I could say it‚Äôs my number 1 favorite baby product so far! So easy to use and any loves it too! I finally can start doing things at home and baby can sleep. I used it also to travel and it was perfect

title: Too heavy
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This fabric is really heavy and it's a lot of weight to carry around on top of the weight of the baby.

title: Way too complicated, it's way too long and loose ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Way too complicated, it's way too long and loose when I tried putting my newborn in it. She hangs too low and her head falls back. Not worth it.

title: Five Stars

comments: Gave this as a gift and the new mommie loves it.  So does baby.  Very soft.

title: I love it! I actually found many Youtube videos that ...
author: shalini ayyagari
comments: I just started using my Boba wrap with my 2 week old for walks with the dog. It felt a little unstable to me at first and was also a little difficult to get the hang of tying it and making it tight when wrapping, but now that I have the hang of it, I love it! I actually found many Youtube videos that helped me learn how to tie it properly.

title: Four Stars
author: sas
comments: It was a gift. Ask giftee

title: Not really organic
author: Jennifer K.
comments: I don't think this is really organic.  It appears the word organic is part of the product name. The tag doesn't say it's made from organic cotton,  it just says it's made from cotton.

title: Just alright
author: Rachel
comments: It's a good fabric and I have no complaints for the brand. But in my opinion it is just to complicated to put on by yourself. Also if you have a baby who is squirmy or likes to see what is going on this type of carrier isn't for you.

title: you can't put on alone
author: Jessica Erickson
comments: I'm returning the product. You will be assistance to be able to put this wrap on.You won't be able to do it alon, it was very very difficult for me.I even stood in the bathroom in front on the mirror watching the video provided.Not helpful and VERY FRUSTRATING!

title: This is by far the most used baby product we ...
author: Britany
comments: This is by far the most used baby product we have. Some days, the only way I get baby to nap jus by putting him in the carrier.  He loves to snuggle up inside.

title: Used twice and sold.
author: We Don't Rent Pigs
comments: Used twice, and then sold. Couldn't get the fit right. Expected much more for the price paid.

title: Great
author: Kl
comments: Daughter asked for this and hopefully she loves it. Nice item

title: Friend loves it
author: Hannah
comments: I bought this for a friend for her shower, and she loves it. Every time I see her, she's wearing her baby in the Boba wrap.

title: I can get so much done with the Boba wrap ...
author: Jamie Grevis
comments: I can get so much done with the Boba wrap on and my little one goes is so comfy in it!

title: Great for walking baby around neighborhood
author: Nerrisa Ortiz
comments: Calms newborn and allow me to have a feee hand! (Use other hand to support baby's head). Great for walking baby around neighborhood.

title: Five Stars
author: Goldie
comments: My baby loves it!

title: Game changer!
author: Ta Family
comments: This product is a game changer. I have a ergo baby 360 but it's hard to sit down comfortably with it. My baby is almost 3 months old and doesn't want to be put down even while sleeping during the day. My baby is on the smaller side and I still have to use the infant insert on my 360 ergo carrier so it's hard d to breast feed. This wrap is fantastic for around the house and every day. I'm able to get some house work done and fix myself something to eat!! I still love our 360 ergo and use it for longer walks because the wrap doesn't have the same back support the ergo does.Highly recommend this wrap.

title: the boba wrap has become our favorite way to get around
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This wrap feels secure and comfy for my baby and I!  I tried many carriers and we both prefer this one.  Whether we're walking the aisle at the grocery store or taking a long walk, the boba wrap has become our favorite way to get around.

title: Works like a charm
author: Witchie Poo
comments: Simple to wrap. Works like a charm. Baby loves it and mom or dad get stuff done

title: so I didn't want to spend a fortunate on one and not love it
author: Amanda H.
comments: This is my first time purchasing a wrap style carrier, so I didn't want to spend a fortunate on one and not love it.  However the instructions and the video made this product so easy to figure out, and my 4 week old loves it. As a plus sized momma, I was also concerned that it would not be long enough, but it's perfect (I am a normal size 18-20). The only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5 is because it's so HOT to wear but it will work nicely during the cooler months!

title: Five Stars
author: Erica
comments: Bought it as a gift and the family loves it

title: Five Stars
author: Walther Diener
comments: Great Product

title: Have not had a chance to try out with a newborn yet but my 2 year old is only 21 pounds and she fit in it great without pull or pain on the neck or shoulders
author: Courtnee
comments: Bought for a baby due in Feb. It came with an instruction manual showing step by step how to wrap and it only took 1 try to figure out with the manual. Have not had a chance to try out with a newborn yet but my 2 year old is only 21 pounds and she fit in it great without pull or pain on the neck or shoulders. I was a little nervous to buy due to being a plus size mom (250lb pregnant and 5'5") but this works great and I was surprised there was enough fabric to wrap at the end twice and to tie securely. Haven't worn it long term yet but for the 10 minutes I had on with my 2 year old I would definitely recommend!

title: However it becomes annoying having to get the wrap on each time
author: Kristin
comments: It's a comfy wrap to wear and not too difficult to figure out. However it becomes annoying having to get the wrap on each time. We like other carriers better.

title: I love this wrap
author: Annika
comments: I love this wrap.  It's easy to tie ahead of time and to take baby in and out during the day, or while running errands. It's a little warm but all wraps are, and so are babies, so it's ok. I plan on buying a few more.

title: So far has been very easy to use for my newborn
author: Sarah A.
comments: So far has been very easy to use for my newborn, great product,  helpful how to videos  on YouTube. They also have very responsive and helpful customer service.

title: super long fabric is quite cumbersome to tie
author: The R Fam
comments: We live in Florida and it is just waaayyyyy to hot to wear this wrap. The thick, super long fabric is quite cumbersome to tie, BUT with practice, I'm sure it wouldn't seem so tedious. Was more secure than the K'tan and all of the ring slings I've tried.

title: Perfect for carrying your little one around when you have ...
author: Bobby
comments: Perfect for carrying your little one around when you have a lot of cleaning and cooking do around the house

title: Not my thing

comments: I didn't like how there's one side of the fabric that isn't as tight as the other side. Ultimately just not for me. I know others love these though

title: Game Changer!
author: nmea8629
comments: This is my third child, I never thought I would be a baby wearer but after a bunch of research I decided to try the Boba Baby wrap and it does not disappoint! It is very comfortable and fits perfectly even though I am a Plus size Mom. Now when my little guy wants to snuggle I can still accomplish my tasks hands free.

title: One Star
author: Olivia Diane Rich

title: Great buy!
author: Michael A. Peterson
comments: Stop shopping for a wrap and purchase this one. It is great quality, has the right amount of stretch, and will calm a baby in the midst of a major meltdown. Just watch a few YouTube videos demonstrating how to wrap it, practice a few times, and you will be set. I have no coordination, and I was able to wrap with ease after one video tutorial. I highly recommend this product, and I will be purchasing for friends in the future.

title: I love the wrap
author: Xochitl
comments: I love the wrap. My baby fama asleep almost instantly after putting him in.The fabric seemed to stretched a little bit, but not an issue with how it works

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer

title: He didn't like to be too thigh and if I lose a ...
author: Ale
comments: Too long to wrap and I really didn't find the right thigh amount to place my baby in it. He didn't like to be too thigh and if I lose a little it is dangerous to place the baby. So I am returning the product!

title: Five Stars
author: Kayla T
comments: One of the best baby wraps out there! Comfortable and easy to use! Very stylish as well

title: Works great for my heavy baby.
author: Oran W.
comments: I have an ergobaby and the boba, and my baby prefers this one when I wear it (he is ok in the ergobaby when my husband wears him). I compared this wrap to the mobi and the boba is so much softer and stretchier; my baby is on the bigger side and I could never put him in the mobi since it doesn't stretch. Works great with this one though.

title: it's great! Love it
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Takes a while to get used to wrapping it so it's not too tight or too loose but after you get the hang of it, it's great! Love it!

comments: Very hard to put on correctly. Great fabric and very elastic just hard to put on tight enough to hold baby without feeling like I need to hold him in place so he doesn't fall by accident. He's only 8lbs.

title: Not a fan at all, this was way to ...
author: Amanda H.

title: My 2 month old son falls asleep in it super fast.
author: Amazon Customer

author: Sarah
comments: Very comfortable..But wont be perfect in hot places.. the fabric is thicker than I thought it would be.And If u are always on the go or going to the airport, I wouldn't recommend it because of the instaling process.

title: They're happy on their own
author: Larson
comments: These are awsome for new babies. Still trying to get my twins to go in together. They're happy on their own. These are easy to tote a little one around and nurse in. My babes have always been boobie ticks and this makes life easier.

title: ... have a ergobaby 360 as a gift but very glad that I cave in
author: Baothanh Torii
comments: I was trying to save some money and not get this since I already have a ergobaby 360 as a gift but very glad that I cave in. It was wonderful to have free hands while carrying my  baby under 2 months compared to the ergobaby which would require an insert.

title: Five Stars
author: Shaka
comments: Great product!

title: Great for shopping
author: Leah Walker
comments: Really love this product. I would recommend it to anyone. Only complaint is how long and somewhat thick it is. I have to put it on before I drive to the grocery store so that I don't have to put it on in the hot parking lot or try to keep it from dragging the nasty concrete. Also, if you dont get it on just right, it can be uncomfortable for both of u. However, my baby goes to sleep rather quickly in it and seems to like it.For reference, in this pic, i'm 5'6" and 150 Lbs. My baby is 2.5months.

title: My baby prefers this over many carriers. He knocks ...
author: Gracie
comments: My baby prefers this over many carriers. He knocks out so quick. Plus there is tricks to be able to breastfeed in this :)

title: Five Stars

comments: Absolutely LOVE our Boba wrap! My little girl is now almost 5 months old, and we still use it all the time! Definitely worth buying!

title: A life saver!!

comments: This is perfect for a day out or around the house. My baby will not take a pacifier so she just always wants to be held so she can sleep. I have a toddler and stuff to get done so holding my baby all day is not an option. My baby loves this thing, she instantly falls asleep in it and it's so nice and comfy. I wish I had this with my first child!

title: Bigger & Bolder link/area to leave a message for person receiving this gift.
