title: Don't get intimidated. Easy to wrap.
author: Chaya
comments: I received this as a gift at my baby shower. Upon opening the wrap for the first time, I was a bit overwhelmed at the length of the wrap and the complexity of the instruction book. I didnt bother with it for a while but later went to You tube for a tutorial and was then able to successfully wrap the Boba in no time. I can now do it with my eyes closed in a matter of seconds. My baby is 3 weeks old. I also received an Ergo baby but definitely prefer the Boba for now.

title: don't have time to figure this out as a mom ...
author: Fashionista
comments: don't have time to figure this out as a mom. seriously...make our lives easier not harder. who has time to watch the tutorials and practice.

title: Great Buy
author: matt ruhle
comments: The boba wrap is amazing. My wife loves it and so does our son. Best tip for new buyers is to YouTube how to put it on. It takes practice but pays off!

title: Love!
author: Caitlin
comments: I love this wrap! Great product, I recommend to all my friends! I especially love that it's so versatile, AND that your baby can fit in it for longer than a few months. Love the stretchy fabric, it washes easily and wears comfortably!

title: Awesome buy for a new mommy...
author: Tifferz
comments: Baby shower gift- my friend loves it. It's very comfortable, great material, can't go wrong with grey matches pretty much everything. You won't be disappointed. Tho you will need to watch a YouTube video on how to put it on but after that you will be a natural at getting it on.

title: but once I YouTubed a few videos and practiced it became super simple! The fabric is lightweight and stretchy
author: Beth Gamble
comments: The Boba wrap seems complex at first because there is so much fabric, but once I YouTubed a few videos and practiced it became super simple! The fabric is lightweight and stretchy. Our baby loved being snug as bug wrapped close to me. I would highly recommend this wrap to anyone seeking a functional and simple way of carrying their baby!

title: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT. It makes my life much easier. They got it to me quickly and it was exactly like they described and showed in the picture.

title: Love love love!!!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This is the greatest thing ever invented!! My baby loves stimulation, so he's usually facing forward but it's convenient to carry him facing me when it's nap time and he is fighting it. This definitely TKO him in no time

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Best purchase I have made! Totally worth it! Happy baby happy mama!!!

title: hate it
author: me
comments: Expensive and aggravating

title: Great for Smaller Babies and Short Trips
author: Virginia Houk
comments: I bought this when my baby was very small because she didn't fit well into a more sturdy carrier we bought before she was born. While she didn't enjoy it immediately (she was not a fan of being restricted and having her head held down, even at one month), she did grow to like it more as she got a little bigger. Now she is five months and almost 18 pounds and we use the bigger carrier (Lille), but keep this around for certain occasions outlined below. It also took me a few tries until the wrapping procedure became second nature.Pros: better for smaller babies who don't fit well in larger carriers, easier to pack in a diaper bag, easy to keep on your body say while you drive so it's easier to take your baby around for errands without bumbling around with straps at home and again at your destination.Cons: thick fabric not ideal for warm summers, back support is not enough for prolonged use, hard not to get it on the ground when you're putting it on (which is fine at home, but kind of gross in say a parking lot), hard to find the perfect balance of tightness as it stretches a bit as you use it and baby starts to sag.In the end, we keep it for ease of packing and for short trips. Otherwise we use the Lille carrier.

title: Skip wraps, Get a Mei Tai instead
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I have two kids and have used all sorts of baby carriers.  In my opinion wraps like the boba and Moby are difficult to put on and not good for first time moms. I recommend the Mei Tai which has similar benefits but much easier to put on.

title: Best wrap! The fabric is very stretchy which helps ...
author: Sarah LaFevers
comments: Best wrap! The fabric is very stretchy which helps when wrapping and sliding baby into the front. Very happy!

title: It Sucks!
author: R Goldburg
comments: Returned it! It Sucks!

title: Great gift idea!
author: Mary Mc
comments: Was packaged very nicely! It was a nice gift to give at a baby shower!

title: Really like this. It saved me several times from a ...
author: angelajoy17
comments: Really like this.  It saved me several times from a hysterical infant.

title: Good quality, good price
author: LJ
comments: Good quality, nice material, and good price for a basic baby wrap, will work great for older baby, with newborn/small baby and just losing pregnancy weight there is so much awkwardness and time consuming trying to get it on right and TIGHT enough! (Tall, leaner new moms probably wouldn't have as much issue.)*EDITAfter a couple months of recovery (csection) and losing some pregnancy weight, and lots of practice putting it on, I love this wrap! I use it every day at home and it even works great for my husband (he‚Äôs a big guy, tall with wide shoulders and back). I don‚Äôt use it shopping too often because it touches the ground when I put it on, but I use it when out visiting (also keeps people from constantly trying to take/asking to hold your baby)!

title: Disappointed

comments: Love this thus far.....baby soon to fully test it out but seems easy enough to use!! Can't wait to see how it goes!!

title: I Love it and it's super comfortable I would definitely recommend ...
author: MamaLoca
comments: I Love it and it's super comfortable I would definitely recommend to my family and friends.... just take your time to wrap it all around....

title: If you plan to only use it in cool weather or indoors with proper ventilation then it's for ...
author: tredog1
comments: HOT. If you plan to only use it in cool weather or indoors with proper ventilation then it's for you. It makes for a very sweaty experience and quite frankly I spent more time worrying about the comfort of my baby in it than I did bonding so I didn't use it that much.

title: Five Stars
author: Lindsey Bozman
comments: Awesome product, good quality.

title: Great gift for a new mom.
author: Diane A
comments: The wrap arrived in a timely manner and was exactly as I expected. My niece loved the gift.

title: Life Saver!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This wrap was more than what I expected. I absolutely love it. I'm plus size and worried it wouldn't fit around but it did perfectly. My baby boy is so cozy in it and falls asleep. Even when he's cranky I put him in it and walk around the house it soothes him. I can now wash dishes and vacuum and still give him the extra loves and cuddles he needs and I want!

title: Five Stars
author: Megan Walker
comments: Exactly what i needed!

title: Five Stars
author: SueZQ
comments: Very helpful when you need both hands free

title: Great for newborns
author: Danielle M Guerrero
comments: A miracle worker, I bought this for my sister and because my newborn niece loves to be carried and she said it's the best thing ever

title: It's not very breathable material and it's super long so I have this huge tail that I ...
author: Jackie Staggs
comments: I am not a fan if this wrap at all. It's not very breathable material and it's super long so I have this huge tail that I have to keep knotting. It is easy to get the baby in and out of so that is a huge plus but then I have to fumble with it to in wrap it from around myself.

title: Use for my small dogs.  Excellent fast transaction.  Quality product.
author: MernieRizzie
comments: Excellent quality.  Fast transaction.  I used it for my two small Pomeranian dogs.  They love it!!!

title: ... as it is a few bucks cheaper and I hate the color of my moby
author: Andrea
comments: Originally had the moby but decided to try this as it is a few bucks cheaper and I hate the color of my moby. Unfortunately I found this to be to stretchy, the material has more elasticity than the moby and it felt like the baby was not secure. I couldn't walk around the mall without a hand on his neck and one under his bum. Will be ordering another moby.

title: Attractive, safe, and doable if you are a 3-dimensional thinker
author: Libs
comments: I love this Boba wrap, love it in Sangria color.  I bought for 2 others before getting my own.  I liked geometry, in school, so getting my head around the wrapping with a screaming newborn on almost no sleep was NBD. My husband had a harder time and couldn't figure out how to do it safely, which was more irritating in the middle of the night than the baby screaming :/.One design issue is that the flaps get onto the floor pretty much no matter what you do.  This is usually an end so not a part that touches the baby but I still don't love that.I love it and feel my baby's secure and toasty on walks despite blustery weather. If you haven't seen or used one, watch a YouTube video on the wrapping to see if it's for you.  Fortunately they fit in carriers at 8 lbs if that is more your speed.

title: the carrier is better
author: Amazon Customer
comments: i love the boba brand. its great for skin to skin (kangaroo care). However, we have the carrier. because baby cannot be in the carrier until 7lbs... and i have 3 dogs that needed walking. so i invested in the wrap. it did the job however, once baby hits 7lbs...the wrap was useless to us. the carrier is much easier to manage. the material of any wrap is too cumbersome. and after they reach 7lbs... you would rather deal with the carrier than the wrap.

title: Five Stars
author: Desiree
comments: My friend loves this!

title: Great for my 2mo old so I can care for my 2yo!
author: Susan
comments: I got this at Target on sale and it was the best purchase ever!! I have a 2yo and a 2mo old. It was hard at first to figure how to put this wrap on, but once I got it down my colicky, GER (reflux), fussy baby girl would calm down in this wrap! My little girl has to be upright 15-30min after feeding and I put her in this wrap so my hands are free to take care of my 2yo. It's not easy to take of 2 children by myself and this helps a lot!

title: Five Stars
author: David S. Bell
comments: Exactly what she wanted.

title: I absolutely love this wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I absolutely love this wrap! So easy to use and my little guy falls fast asleep in it even when he is fussy. So much easier than carting a stroller around!

title: You have to be a lover of slings.. ...
author: M. Taylor
comments: You have to be a lover of slings...I realized I am not. This thing comes with SO MUCH fabric...I could have use it as a Halloween costume as a mummy. My gosh...who came out with the idea of so much fabric needed? I don't care about the 6 rounds around my waist. I returned it and bought a Tula.

title: works well even for big breasted women.
author: Whitney
comments: I don't normally review things but I felt the need to here. My 5 week old doesn't like my big ergo adapt. I think she's just too little and feel constricted in it. Plus I like to sit down. So I got this. She's very content in it. I saw in many reviews that this doesn't work for big breasted women. I'm a size 40h and this fits better than the ergo. I was easily able to adjust the tension to fit my body style. It took me about 10 min to learn the tie and now I can do it in no time at all.

title: It's a little difficult to get baby into it, ...
author: LittleByrdEee
comments: It's a little difficult to get baby into it, and I don't always feel that she is completely secure compared to other carriers.

title: No Regrets
author: gineth
comments: I completely loved this product soft comfy and kept my baby close where you liked would totally recommend and use again if I have another

title: Definitely buy one if you can
author: Amazon Customer
comments: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS. Only downside is technically you still should hold baby if you're doing a lot of moving around. But it's super easy to use, and very convenient for small tasks or hiking even. But when there's a lot of walking around involved or bending, it's best to support baby with your hands regardless of him or her being secured in the wrap. I believe the directions state that anyway. Color is true to photo, material is of quality and is substantial in length, so my post pregnant/inflated body fit wonderfully in the wrap with material to spare.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Absolutely love this wrap!!

title: Loved it!
author: Danielle Duncan
comments: Love this wrap!

title: Great wrap
author: Alexis Becker
comments: Since I already own one and love it, I bought this for as a gift for a friend who is due with her first baby in January. It was a life-saver for me when my daughter was born and wanted to be held constantly (she's 2 now and still wants to be held). It comes with directions on how to tie it for each stage, and they're really easy to follow - although it DOES take some practice.

title: Awesome!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This wrap is amazing. Worth every penny. I tandem carried my preemie twins in it till they were 5 months old. I still use it in tandem with another wrap.It does get very warm, so it's not great for warmer climates.

title: Works Great.
author: colton rock
comments: Works Great.

title: Great Carrier
author: MegSimm
comments: I love this wrap! It's super stretchy and soft. It looks intimidating, but once you get comfortable with it it's easy to put on. My 6 week old loves being carried with this wrap - it always calms her down when nothing else will!

title: Love it. Once you get the wrapping part down
author: imagination at work
comments: Love it. Once you get the wrapping part down, it's a breeze. I do suggest wrapping at home, before you go anywhere, just so the wrap doesn't drag on the ground!

title: Baby is happy and so am I
author: Lucy
comments: My baby loves this and so do I. She doesn't like wearing hats at all and this was a nice way to carry her around without one too. I never thought wraps looked safe to use until my husband and I took a newborn care class that we got to actually try using one. These are fantastic!

title: This makes my new moms favorite list!
author: Rebekah
comments: My newborn loves this wrap! When she gets fussy or over stimulated and just needs a little help relaxing I wrap her in this and either talk a walk or get stuff done in the house. It calms her right down and puts her to sleep. Easy to figure out how to use and comfy when baby is inside.

title: Wrap
author: SHELIA M RAKES
comments: I bought 3 of these wraps as gifts for 3 sisters who are expecting & 1 of the sisters gave birth about 3 weeks ago! She absolutely loves the wrap & says it is the best thing ever! The other 2 sisters are excited about their gift too. I would definitely purchase this again.

title: Five Stars
author: Tifani Hannum Hood
comments: Comfy & easy to use!

title: He has bad gas and reflux
author: Nikita S
comments: This has been a life saver for my 6 week old baby who refused to sleep anywhere...bassinet,crib,bouncer,swing. He has bad gas and reflux. Carrying on this wrap helps him sleep and helps him burp. I love my boba wrap and would highly recommend it.

title: Great product
author: Tawodi
comments: It took a few days to get it correct. But once we figured. It out it works great and we love it thank you!

title: Essential for newborns
author: Virginia
comments: I bought the Boba Wrap because my newborn was too small to go in the Baby Bjorn yet. It took a few tries to learn how to get the wrap set up correctly while the baby cried. However, it is such a life saver! It will work with the smallest of babies because you can adjust it specifically for your child's size. Baby will calm down - guaranteed. It's great to have the option to use my hands. Love my Boba Wrap.

title: Works fine, just too heavy and large for me
author: liz
comments: Overall it was pretty easy to learn how to use and it functioned as it should. My issues were:(1) the material is too thick so my baby was way too hot, so I bought a Solly wrap instead. The Solly wrap is much lighter material, which is necessary for a summer baby.(2) the wrap is so large. I'm only 5'1" and about 130 lbs, so there was way too much extra material. Since it was heavy material it was just too much excess material for me.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It was exactly what we wanted and was not disappointed!!

title: Absolutely love the boba
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Absolutely love the boba! It's so comfy and stylish. My baby absolutely loved it. The instructions to wear it are detailed and simple to follow. Glad I purchased this. Worth the money.

title: Good product
author: G. David
comments: It's a really great product, but we had some issues with it. First, it's a bit complicated to wrap it around you while outside. As it's really long to be able to go around you many times, it's REALLY hard to wrap it around without touching the floor. Also, as we live in Florida, I think it gets too hot really fast for the baby. Unless it's winter or a very unusual cold day, our baby not always seemed comfortable inside. Besides that, the fabric is soft, and in some occasions, it worked great for us. Our baby was holding her head with 3/4 months, so, unfortunately, we had to get another carrier to be able to put her facing forward.It's definitely a good product, but check other options of carriers before buying to see which one will best fit your needs.

title: Limited use
author: Sheena Louise Richardson
comments: It says there is only one safe position to wear the baby. I wish I had paid closer attention and gotten a more usable wrap.

title: It's great for skin to skin
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Loving my Boba wrap. My daughter is now six weeks and I mostly use it around the house when I'm cleaning or just busy with Mt two year old. It's great for skin to skin, she falls asleep right away when I put her in it.

title: Five Stars
author: amanda nunnally
comments: Ryker and I LOVE this wrap. Comfortable.

title: Loved it. It did lose some elasticity over time ...

comments: Used this with my son. Loved it. It did lose some elasticity over time though.

title: It's okay
author: I wont lie
comments: I didn't get it to work like all the videos but I did buy it for the dog.  She seemed to like it.  I'm sure if people secure baby's in it it can carry a dog.

title: Comfortable
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I absolutely love this wrap! Being a plus size women is hard enough and to find a wrap that is comfortable, fits great, easy to use, and light weight was hard to do. I spend almost 2 months looking for something and spending countless hours trying various types of carriers on. As soon as I got this wrap out of the box I already knew I was going to like it. My LO agrees 100%!!!

title: baby never liked being in it
author: basso
comments: Too much hassle to put on and take off,  baby never liked being in it.

title: Love this! Put my baby in it and he ...
author: Josh Durham
comments: Love this! Put my baby in it and he falls asleep right away. I can get so much done with him in it too, such a lifesaver! It is thick so it does get hot, especially during the warmer months but I mostly use it at home anyway. Also, watch the you tube video on how to put it on. It can be tricky at first.

title: Took awhile for my wife to figure out but plenty ...
author: Chris Rosado
comments: Took awhile for my wife to figure out but plenty of YouTube videos to help. Very functional once she did.

title: We bought the Boba 4G with our firstborn and loved it, but not so much for baby wearing ...
author: HaDo
comments: We bought the Boba 4G with our firstborn and loved it, but not so much for baby wearing around the the house and not so much for an infant. A day at the zoo with a bigger infant and toddler? Yes please. So with our second, we decided to try out the Boba Wrap after doing some research on different wraps. It is great with our 6# newborn, very supportive, holds the baby high enough and securely enough, so I have my hands free, but also great for snuggling and keeping us both warm while we bond. Very comfortable. I wish we'd bought it for our first kid.

title: Can't actually get the baby in it
author: B
comments: I bought this wrap hoping for something to help me get both hands free while I'm alone at home with the baby. Unfortunately, it is almost impossible to get my newborn into the wrap by myself. Because it's tied tight around your body, you kind of have to jam the baby in with one hand while pulling the fabric away from your body with the other. By the time I manage to wedge her in there she's crying and won't stop until I take her back out again.

title: I'm 5'2 and I have to wrap it on my body like a mummy
author: frequenttraveler
comments: Too Hot. It takes a while to set up and adjust.  I bought this to fit one of my twin.  I wanted to use this so I can carry one of my 4 weeks old girl and the other be on this carrier.  But it takes a while to set up on my body.  When I use it, its falling apart or its too loose or tight.  I live in maui, it's too hot.  Also, it's too long. I'm 5'2 and I have to wrap it on my body like a mummy.  The fabric is soft however. Just didn't work for me.

title: great with some exceptions...
author: Charlieb007
comments: I've had this wrap ever since my son was 3 weeks old.  I like this wrap for hanging around the house and especially when my baby was a newborn.  I usually bounce on a yoga ball while doing some work on my laptop and he is really content!  He will sleep for hours esp if you are really pressed for time b/t feedings this wrap gives you extra time to do what you need b/c your baby will fall asleep in it and be very comfy.  The instructions for the wrap is to wear it very tightly so that the baby doesn't sag down but I found it more comfortable if I can look down and see the baby by wearing it looser.  It's very uncomfortable for me to wear it tightly b/c it presses against your breasts and if you are breastfeeding, esp the early days, it will be pretty uncomfortable and may lead to plugged ducts.I have tried this for walking and feel it is great for when the baby is a newborn but my son is now 17lbs and feel like I need to have one hand under him to support him esp when walking far.  Other than that wearing it around the house is fine for a larger baby.  As for chores around the house just do things you would do while you were pregnant.  I could fold clothes and do light chores that don't require bending.Here's a tip: so the baby can breath more easily and not breathing entirely in the wrap put one of his arms outside of one of the side panels and pull the bottom panel up over the arm.  His face will be free of breathing into the cloth. :) I also have a paci for him.  The wrap is great to bring on short shopping trips b/c you don't have to haul the stroller etc and it keeps strangers from being nosey.  It keeps him really happy.  People always comment on what a good baby he is.

title: Too difficult and complicated
author: Amber C
comments: Too complicated and unwieldy to put on. It's A LOT of fabric and really long, which is intentional in the design for safety reasons, but it just makes it difficult to deal with. Also, I find it hard to get my baby inside.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Love it

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We love it

title: This is so much better. I use it every day
author: Victoria Larson
comments: I've always used a Moby wrap. This is so much better. I use it every day. Much easier to get the baby in, and the fabric is stretchier.

title: Five Stars
author: Cleveland Barb
comments: Order 2 for a new mom. She loves them!

title: Wonderful product.
author: Carla Brown
comments: It is for my new grand daughter. Wonderful product.

title: Four Stars
author: Amanda Winstead
comments: Very cozy and snug for newborn, but the stretchy material isn't very supportive for long.

title: Three Stars
author: Jeanne M. Nichol
comments: Too cumbersome to get wrapped. And doesn't breath. Daughter couldn't use for these reasons

title: LOVE BOBA!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This is hands down ( literally I now have 2 hands again!) the best baby item I own! Not hard to learn how to wrap! Baby LOVES it!!

title: Five Stars
author: Aubrey Mallory
comments: Love this wrap and so does my little one!

title: Happy baby, happy mother
author: Hobson
comments: Got this as a gift for my granddaughter.  She had requested it, and loved it.  The item arrived very quickly and everyone was happy.

title: Forget about buying this, too hot and uncomfortable for baby
author: L
comments: I am always cold, so it would seem like I would like this, but there is so much thick fabric wrapped around you that it makes both you and baby unbearably hot. You're basically wearing a blanket. I would have returned it, but I threw the box away. I recommend going to a store where you can physically handle the sling, etc and see how easy it is to use and if wearing it works for you're lifestyle. I can't wear a blanket. Don't buy if you live in a state that's hot/warm year round like Florida.

title: Five Stars
author: Jeannine Patria
comments: New mother was thrilled with it!

title: Love my Boba wrap
author: melcubb
comments: Love my Boba wrap! Best wrap out there! It is much stretchier than the others, and my baby loves it!

title: Takes a bit of time to get it just right and my daughter doesn't seem to get comfortable in it
author: Jennifer Reeves
comments: Not a huge fan.  Takes a bit of time to get it just right and my daughter doesn't seem to get comfortable in it.

title: Three Stars
author: Sheryl Vandever
comments: I didn't really like it. I liked the ring sling better

title: Awesome
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I absolutely love it and so so my little it is great on my back and comfortable on my shoulders. Shipping was fast I got it the day before it said. Thank you

title: Five Stars
author: Alexander M.
comments: Perfect for dads who love to wear all black like me :)

title: Calmed my very alert son enough for naps
author: Emily B
comments: I was having a very hard time getting my son to fall asleep for naps throughout the day ( he's 3 months but has been very alert since he was 3-4 weeks old) I figured he might like the comfort of being close throughout our day and when we're out for walks. He falls asleep in about 10-15 min from being put in it if he's due for nap.I bought a Baby K'tan first and loved the concept but after about 20-30 min my back started hurting. I noticed the boba wrap ties lower on the back and offers some lumbar support. I have had this wrap for about a month and really like it. It took me a couple of tries to get the wrap tight enough to hold my son high enough but now it goes very quickly. The fabric is soft and stretchy but still sturdy. This is my go-to for walks, errands, going to a friend's house etc. and I feel like having my son on my chest more has made him more calm overall.

title: Not for non swaddlers
author: Jackson
comments: If your kid doesn't like to be swaddle, then forget about this. I thought maybe my special baby would enjoy this a bit more than swaddling but nope! He was crying to get out of it! Also, in the video they make it look so easy. Yea it would be if the wrap wasn't the same length as rapunzels hair! I don't like it touchy the floor and then wrapping it around my baby and me.

title: Five Stars
author: jewels
comments: Very beautiful although I have not used it yet.

title: Great for 1st month with baby!
author: Brandy lee
comments: I really liked this wrap for my newborn. I used it for the first month but once he started moving around I had to switch to a front carrier as he would wiggle out and stretch it out. I would reccommend this only for the first month and then switch to Carrier with more support after that.

title: Good price for organic!
author: Jessica E
comments: Bought this as a gift after buying a non organic one off of babies r us for ten bucks less. Returned the non organic one and bought this at a great price. I didn't want my friends baby exposed to such toxins (cotton is the number one, heaviest sprayed crop in ghe world) so I always go organic when possible.

title: Easy to wear
author: Felipe Sandoval
comments: Works great but i dont use it much my baby gets really hot in it. My baby is hit blooded so you might want to keep your babies body temp. In mind when buying this product. I might start to use it in the winter and see how that goes.

title: Love our boba wrap.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My 2 month old loves this wrap and I take him everywhere in it; the grocery store, baseball games, around the house, etc. It's helped so much during his fussy times, we cannot live without it.

title: Love this wrap
author: krysten
comments: Love this wrap, super easy to use and I get compliments all the time on the print. My baby is 1 month old and we have been using it daily for hands free activities around the house or when I go out in public to run errands

title: Better for cooler weather
author: Renae
comments: The wrap is great and very easy to use. The only problem I have is that my baby is extremely sweaty and it's hot in the south to begin with. With 3 passes of this material over baby, it's just too hot for her. But it'll work just fine as it starts to cool.

title: Five Stars
author: Brindley
comments: Fast shipping, quality product.

title: Love it!
author: Megan B
comments: I love this thing. I was a little nervous at first because I'm a new mom and had no idea what I was doing. It keeps him quiet, me productive, and both of us feeling close and cozy! Highly recommend!

However, I bought this mainly to provide support while I'm active (up and about), and for the weeks post c-section, when I'm hoping it provides a little extra support for my abdomen.  So the annoyance of having to take it off to sit is minor.

I have not tried it as a nursing cover but I'm interested to try it. My only gripe about it is putting it on. It takes more time to put it on. But it's not that bad that I'd give it a bad rating. I would recommend it to any expecting parent.

title: Love!
author: Adrienne C.

title: My daughter loved it! If baby became fussy
author: Jeanie P Walker
comments: This is a gift for friend. I previously purchased one for my daughter who wore my grandchild in it.  My daughter loved it! If baby became fussy, she was put in wrap & immediately calmed down. Baby was in wrap if gone from home--easy to put on & wear. Wonderful!

title: A MUST Have For Any Mom (or Dad)!
author: Dooter
comments: I can't say enough positive things about my Boba wrap! After researching kangaroo care and many different wrap type products, I ordered this wrap (in light blue) in 2013 when pregnant with my first child. I decided on a wrap over other types of infant carriers due to the comfort for both myself and my baby, as well as gentleness, warmth & overall coziness of a simple sheet material. I chose my Boba wrap over a Moby because the Boba has a little bit more of a stretch to the material which I think is important for a great fit, comfort, and safety.I used this Boba to bring my infant son to work with me and taught classes with him snug and happy against my chest. I breast fed him while in my Boba at his demand; so very convenient. My son and I got to bond all day because of this wrap, so naturally I saved it for my next child. She loves it too!My daughter is now 7 months old (19 lbs) and she still loves being close to me in our Boba wrap. It is still comfortable for both of us to use. We started using it from birth as I did with my son and she breast feeds in it too. Freedom together, is the perfect motto for Boba wraps.If you want to get anything done around your house, you need a Boba wrap! If you are fortunate enough to have your baby with you all the time, you need a Boba wrap. Every mom (or dad) should have a Boba wrap.The wrap is easy to wash and also makes a handy wipe if you don't have a wipe or towel at your immediate disposal. The wrap is very sturdy and has handled numerous washes over the years and still looks like it did when I bought it. I absolutely love this product. I recommend it for all moms and dads.There is a small learning curve with putting on a Boba wrap but you can YouTube videos and learn from there. Make sure you pull the slack from it so your baby is secure and you should be able to kiss your baby's forehead while he/she is in it. Again, make sure you have it on securely and your baby's head is properly placed (and supported if he/she can't support it yet). Also, I stick my baby's legs/feet in the lowest part of the wrap that goes around my waist. I did not see this in the videos but it gives their legs support so they don't just hang or flop around. Spread the material that goes over your shoulders out as far as you can for maximum comfort.My personal guide to how I rate:Five Stars = best product I've tried in this field; will enthusiastically recommend to, or buy for, family and friends. Buy this product now!Four Stars = great product I will buy again if/when needed and will recommend if someone asks for my opinion. Yes, buy this product.Three Stars = I like this product but will purchase something else if I can find a better option next time easily enough. Look to see if there is anything better if you have a chance before purchasing this item.Two Stars = item works as intended but will try hard to find a better product in the future. Only buy this product if you can't find anything possibly better.One star = if this item has a free return policy I sent it back and, if it doesn't, depending on the cost of the item and/or the cost of return shipping I may have sent it back. Do not buy this product!

title: One Star
author: Heather Horton
comments: too difficult and way to much fabric!

title: Five Stars
author: Fernando
comments: great quality, our baby doesn't like it very much, but the quality of the product it¬ø's great.

title: Happy as can be!
author: CrazyB
comments: My little one loves it! She falls asleep right away and is snug and secure. I can take my toddler to the park and she's happy as can be! I've even breastfed her in it and it kept me 75% covered. I love it!

title: A must for moms with babies!
author: L
comments: Baby and I love this wrap! He was born at just under 6 lbs and is now about 11 lbs. We've used this everywhere - around the house, running errands, going for walks, and even occasional napping. It's so convenient to carry anywhere and though it seemed complex at first to tie, it's really not once you watch the video online. My son stays still and will go almost anywhere when he's in it; unlike trying to tote him around in the stroller, he loves being close to me and we never have had a crying baby in public while he's in this. In fact, he stayed in it for 3 hours this past weekend while we walked around a festival, sleeping most of the time and only got out when I woke him up to eat then stayed content in it for the next couple hours we were there. I would recommend this to every new mom who needs free hands to do chores around home or wants to make running errands easy. Only thing I'd do different is order it in black; I really like the grey but for my post-partum body, black would probably be more slimming.

title: Great baby gift
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This was a baby gift- the new parents sent us a picture of them hiking in Montana with the baby all wrapped up safe! They love it!

comments: A friend bought me this exact Boba and it is honestly the best baby gift I've gotten aside from diapers. It's a life saver, I can get house work done and be able to use both hands and still have him close to me. And going out places is a lot easier now that I have this, and not to mention, the baby loves it! If you're thinking about getting one, I would definitely do it!

title: Great Purchace
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It is amazing. I love it

title: Great for high needs baby with acid reflux
author: Susan E
comments: My little one has acid reflux and is high needs; we can't put hit down during the day without crying. We have the ergo with infant insert but found it to be bulky and a little stiff. The Boba wrap is perfect - no buckles to undo / redo, very easy to tie own and great sturdy material. Huge lifesaver as we're working through the "4th trimester".

comments: Very easy to use. My baby loved it. She slept for hours in it, not a single cry. I was pleasantly surprised.Definitely recommending this to future mommies

author: Francesca

Once in a while she would cry for no reason and once I put her in here she would fall right asleep. My daughter is 6.5 months old now and does not enjoy it even with her legs free (there is a different way to place older babies) and I really miss the days of her snuggled tight to me! Very easy and very useful. I machine washed and dried it several times with no issue! Also I am plus sized!

author: Amazon Customer
comments: I love this wrap! I have 3 boys, ages 6, 3 and 3 months. I needed a way to carry my baby and have my hands free. The baby carrier I had hurt my back and had way too many buckles and straps. I got this a few weeks ago and I use it every single day. It makes the walks to my son's school easy and my back doesn't hurt at all. I use it around the house and my baby loves it. It's so cozy and easy to use. I recommend watching a video on how to wrap and practice a few times to make sure it's tight but not too tight. The material is stretchy and lightweight but it does get a little warm after wearing it for a long time. I wish I had this when my other boys were babies!

comments: My newborn falls asleep instantly when I put him in this wrap. Worth every penny

author: Megan C.
comments: Love, love, love my Boba wrap!! My little man (3 weeks) does not like to be put down and screams bloody murder when you do.  I've been having to hold him almost 24/7 for him to be content, that is until I purchased the Boba.  As soon as I put him in it, he becomes so content and quickly drifts off to sleep.  I feel that he's very secure while in he wrap, however I do have to hold his head if I'm bending over or down to do something.  It is a little tricky to put on at first, but after watching a quick YouTube tutorial you'll be a pro in no time! This has really made a HUGE difference in my days, as I'm able to have my hands free and get some housework done without him crying the whole time. Highly recommend!!

He falls asleep almost immediately and it allows me to me hands free with my daughter.  Its great for shopping, trips to the playground or even around the house.  The material is super soft however it does get hot easily.  I wish the material was a tad thinner and also the straps not so thick but I guess depending on the style of wrap you are using it would be tough to make those modifications. It is very comfortable, no back pains at all.

It is also pretty "bouncy" while wearing. Again, I love this wrap at home, but when I need some more support I use my ergo. For petite bodies, the fabric is pretty wide and a bit overwhelming while wearing, as well as kind of hot especially in summer. I wish they offered a "performance" material!
