title: Love it!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Best thing invented! My baby and I love it! Baby is relaxed and sleeps while I'm able to have both my hands and do what I need to do.

title: Great if you will use it.
author: Kyle & Brooke Peters
comments: It's a lot easier to put on then it seems. I procrastinated till my son was 5 weeks old to learn how. I didn't use it much because he was heavy and it was easier to put him in the swing or bouncer in the house or the stroller outside. Then when I tried he hated it. Lesson - figure out how to use it before the baby is born, use it early, it probably wasn't necessary to get this and a soft carrier for our first child. However I think this will come in handy with the next baby. Also, my friend got carriers and a stroller and she was the opposite of me. She used the carrier everyday and never used the stroller since she lives out in the country.

title: This is pretty much the same as the Moby
author: JEFFREY DALE WESTCOTT
comments: This is pretty much the same as the Moby. For some reason I thought it would be qualitatively different. Some people love these wraps. I don't care for them. Baby sags inside and I spend my time worrying that he's suffocating. And I do try to make it as tight as possible to avoid that. Not to mention how impractical it is to wrap the darn thing by yourself, or in a location where letting it drag on the ground will get it dirty.

title: Great Gift
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Gift for my coworker's baby shower-she adores it & the color and loves the different options for ties/weights.

title: Not a practical or comfortable
author: Jennifer Heinrich
comments: This product is way too complicated to be practical. I watched many youtube how to videos and eventually figured it out but it is way too much fabric and bunches up clothes. I also was not able to get baby in very smoothly. Maybe it takes a lot of practice but who has time for that? Carriers should be a convenience not something that needs practice. Baby screamed when I got her in. My 3 month old is pretty active so maybe she didn't like how much it confined her? I also tried the k'tan which the baby tolerated more but she also didn't like the confinement.The fabric is also very heavy and would not be appropriate to wear in warm climates or during the summer.

title: Five Stars
author: Bill Drew
comments: hope the baby likes it as much as his mom does

title: Not quite the right carrier for us, right now
author: Sarah Jones
comments: Our son is only two weeks old, so I do intend to keep trying this as he grows. However, at this stage, it is really hard to position him safely in this wrap. It is very difficult to get him upright enough, with face visible but enough neck support, and avoiding the dreaded chin-to-chest situation. Maybe it will be easier when he's older and can hold himself up more.The biggest problem, though, is that this wrap is so hot. While fine for short, casual use, taking him for a hike in this left me drenched in sweat and the kiddo looking like a broiled lobster (with me in a light t-shirt and him just in his diaper!). So possible that this will work better for us later in the year.It only took me two tries to feel comfortable putting the wrap on and inserting the baby into it. However, my husband really struggled with it.

title: Five Stars
author: rita
comments: Soft n comfy  clear instructions

title: Five Stars
author: Nani
comments: Given as a gift, was well received.

title: Four Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Very warm in the summer heat.

title: Five Stars
author: Cina Pucci
comments: I love this wrap. I'm thinking about getting another for my friend.

title: Great product! Love that it has a little bit ...
author: limberger
comments: Great product! Love that it has a little bit of stretch to it! But the fabric is thick so it gets hot. Baby and I both get sweaty after just a few minutes of being stuck together. It also does not offer much back support so I am not able to wear it got very long. Still, great for keeping baby close and comforted.

title: There are better options for the price
author: K.Vertitas
comments: Cute, stretchy wrap.  It's inconvenient to put it on whenever you want to put a fussy baby in it.  It's also rather bulky, although the fabric is soft and comfortable on its own.  It is very long and one can feel hot and sweaty in warm weather.  I find that there are other carriers that are easier to use and more comfortable on.  I also feel that at $40 it is too expensive for a long strip of cloth.

title: Great wrap for small infant
author: Stephanie Solano
comments: This wrap is great and very soft and elastic. It works great with a newborn.One of the few I found you could use with a small infant. And its great for skin to skin. The only thing its hard to wear in the summer time with the heat.

title: Five Stars
author: Kathy L
comments: Great product

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I gave this as a shower present and mom loved it

title: Love it
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Arrived in timely manner and looks as advertized.  It was a gift so don't know yet how it works

title: Mommasaver!
author: Aaron Grynol
comments: This wrap is a life saver! My little one really likes to be close and loves being held so it was hard to get much done around the house before ordering this wrap. It is a lot of material and I needed my husband to help me put it on the first few times but I got the hang of it pretty quick. Now my little one will sleep for hours in it! The one disappointing thing about my order was that I ordered the wrap in black and they sent a turquoise one instead. I didn't return it because being as fussy as my little one is, I couldn't have waited the time it would have taken to ship it back and then wait for the new one.

title: I loved it when she put it on for me
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My friend had one and showed me how to use it. I loved it when she put it on for me! However, by myself I cannot wrap it tight enough to secure my baby. She was also able to wrap it tight herself on her own body, so this is not a product issue so much as it is a user issue. If you cannot master wrapping it then you probably will not use it.

title: Best Investment Ever
author: autumntrees37
comments: If I could give this a higher rating, I would. It is an EXCELLENT product.I had my son a few weeks early and was not prepared. At all. Everything I was going to get done before his birth was thrown into the mix of diaper changes, feedings, and settling into a sleep routine. This wrap gave me exactly what I needed: A content baby, close to my heart, hands-free.Upon arrival, I laughed at the wrap. It was one long piece of stretchy fabric that I paid $40 for. I was mad. But I read the directions, hoping to get something for the money I begged my husband to invest. After you learn the knots, it is exactly what it claims to be. And tying it was easy. I only had to read how to do it once. The guide was very clear to read and my little guy loves it.My son would rather sleep in it than in the $150 swing that my in-laws got us. It is the only thing that calms him down. And he is a little on the colicky side.Best investment ever.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Fantastic product!

title: It's nice comfortable, even in the summer
author: Ashsquash
comments: After a couple of times getting it on at home I was confident to use it while out and about. It's nice comfortable, even in the summer. Baby boy fall asleep almost immediately.

title: I love my Boba
author: Chelsey Musser
comments: I love my Boba, as does my baby. The only problem I have is that I have a very hard time putting my baby in the wrap by myself. My husband has to place her in while I hold the wrap away from my body.

title: Wish I'd bought the Solly wrap instead
author: Christine Sills
comments: My baby did not take to this. Many friends have since recommended the Solly wrap and I wish I had gone with that instead of the Boba.

title: It's not super heavy but it does have some weight to it
author: Christina
comments: Lots of stretch to the fabric and long enough for plus sized and taller people. Fabric is similar to a sweatshirt material. It's not super heavy but it does have some weight to it. I had my LO in the summer so we don't venture out into the super bad heat. If you had an older child and wanted to use it in the summer, it may be too hot.

title: I love putting my baby in this wrap and everywhere we ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I love putting my baby in this wrap and everywhere we go together, people are always complimenting us on how convenient and cool the wrap is.  It's so great for travel, I took my 18 day old on an hour plane ride by myself and didn't take the car seat or stroller because they can be cumbersome when I am alone.  I just put the baby in the wrap and she slept the whole way while my hands were free.

title: Love my boba!
author: Lauren
comments: This was such a great buy!  The boba is great for walks, doing housework or shopping in. It's very stretchy and comfortable. It also washes very well.

title: Love this boba wrap
author: Hannah Anderson
comments: Love this boba wrap! I had to watch a few YouTube videos to learn how to tie it, but I feel totally comfortable with it after practice a few times. My son loves it.

title: But I did practice wrapping and the fabric seems sturdy. I'm afraid there may be too much fabric
author: Mama_L
comments: Still pregnant, so I haven't gotten to put a baby in it yet. But I did practice wrapping and the fabric seems sturdy. I'm afraid there may be too much fabric, but I guess that's better than not enough :-)

title: Amazing.
author: Ta√Øs
comments: This wrap carrier is awesome! Baby is kept warm and snug, close to mommy's body. I love it and she loves it! After trying a sling carrier and babybjorn, I definitely think that boba wrap is worth every dollar. If your baby doesn't let you put her down, give boba a try!

title: Five Stars
author: JOSHUA ESCOBEDO
comments: We love this product, we use it numerous times and are satisfied with the product.

title: Perfect carrier!!
author: Jessie
comments: What a great infant carrier!! So I started out with an Ergobaby original, which my newborn daughter did not appreciate. My OB-GYN suggested this wrap as a way to carry my daughter everywhere since she disliked being put down. It worked like a charm. It does take some getting used to trying to figure out how to wrap it; however I just looked on the manufacturers website and was able to figure it out. I used this until my daughter was around six months old and then really didn't need it anymore. I used it just about everywhere including while doing chores around the house. If I was going to run errands I would put it on and then I would be ready when I got to my destination.

title: I LOVE this wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I LOVE this wrap! It is so easy to put on and the material is very comfortable for baby and me :)

title: Love my boba!
author: S_banana
comments: Love this wrap! The sangria color is beautiful!! The only con is that it is a LOT of material and I live in a desert where it's 100+ for half the year. So I used it while my baby was a newborn and it's put away until fall. Very comfy with baby in and really easy to use!

title: Not for a petite-sized person!
author: TLD
comments: I was skeptical to order one of these because I'm 5' 3" and have a small frame, but I really wanted it to work as my newborn constantly wants to be held and I have a 16 month old as well.  But as soon as I took it out of the box, I knew I'd be returning it.  It's A LOT of material, very LONG!!  I tried to follow the instructions anyway in hopes that it would fit once I wrapped it around me, but after 20 minutes of trying and looking like a mummy, I gave up.So all in all, I wouldn't recommend if you're petite.

title: Too confusing to use
author: AmazonCustomer80336
comments: This is just way too hard to put on and I don't feel like my baby is secure in it

title: It was so stretchy that I never felt like I could get it tight enough and my baby ...
author: Rebecca
comments: It was so stretchy that I never felt like I could get it tight enough and my baby kept slipping. I'm sure it was operator error but I didn't end up using it.

title: Five Stars
author: Pat
comments: I bought this for my granddaughter's baby and she loves it.

title: Love it
author: Draya
comments: I love it, it's been a blessing having this. Specially with taking care of a toddler aND a baby. I put my baby here and I'm able to do things around the house and wi th my oldest.

title: Boba wrap rescued a new mom!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It is perfect for my baby. Sometimes she cries even I changed the diaper, rocked her and I nursed her. It seems like nothing is working to stop her crying, however, when I used boba wrap, she stops crying every time and fall asleep. It's a magic. It helped me to do other house stuff while she is in boba. I really appreciate boba and Amazon rating told me lots of moms were saying that the wrap makes baby stop crying and fall a sleep. Thank you boba! You rescue me!

title: She did not feel comfortable with being held by the wrap without me holding ...
author: MS
comments: Too hot to hold my baby. She did not feel comfortable with being held by the wrap without me holding her hip. This hurts my back.

title: but I am so happy I did
author: MaryBeth Flory
comments: Did a lot of research before buying this product and I was still sceptical after buying, but I am so happy I did! My baby loves the comfort and I love the bonding. Yes with it being the middle of summer it does get quite warm but I wear a tank top so it isn't that bad. Now it did take me a few times to put it on correctly. Although the YouTube videos and directions help out a lot! I recommend this product to all mommies!

title: Can I Give 6 stars??
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This was absolutely a fabulous purchase! My baby is 5 weeks old, and LOVES her Boba! She loves to sleep on mama, but that can make getting things done around the house quite difficult. Fortunately, I purchased this Boba, which has helped tremendously! I use it to do laundry, clean the house, pretty much anything! I even took her for a walk before we got her stroller and she loved that too! She also falls asleep almost immediately when I put her in the Boba and will sleep for hours at a time! I've seen some say it's complicated to put on, but the instructions are very straight forward, and I found it very simple to use. This is easily my favorite Amazon purchase thus far!

title: Too Complicated
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I don't know why this had so many good reviews.  Not good for large chested women.  Pain in the ass to tie and put your baby in safely by yourslef.  It's heavy and hot, definitely not good for summer. Bjorn baby carrier was way easier and simpler to put together and put baby in.

title: i like that i can breast feed my 5 week old ...
author: Tanya McClintock
comments: i like that i can breast feed my 5 week old in it while i walk around while on errands, that comes in handy. I do not like how it drags on the floor when I am taking it off and it is very hot where I am at in Colorado this summer and I am noticing that the side her head rests on my chest breaks out in a heat rash. not the wraps fault

title: It was good for the newborn phase
author: Anyhu09
comments: I bought the boba baby wrap to carry my little in and try to get some stuff done around the house.  It worked well, but I always felt let he was going to fall out of it.  It was good for the newborn phase.

title: loves to ride along
author: Jen
comments: 4month old loves to be close and ride along with Mommy while we do chores. Great instructions on how to tie around body and which way child should be placed in side once tied.

title: Great for baby bonding and nursing
author: QuidditchSnitch
comments: This wrap can be a bit tricky to get the hang of at first. As a first time mom of twins, I had to practice it a few times before I felt comfortable carrying one of my boys around with me. Even then, I still needed to readjust and make the wrap tighter.One of the perks besides the skin to skin contact is that I was able to nurse my newborn boys while wearing it, which was a huge perk. The weight is fairly even across your shoulders and back as long as you stretch the fabric out instead of letting it bunch out.My only negative comment is that any shirt that is not almost to your bum will ride up, which can be fairly annoying if you are wearing this out in public. Other than that, it was a great product for the price.

title: Five Stars
author: C. J.
comments: 5 stars!!

title: Although I think the wrap is best suited for mild weather days
author: Kelsey Mc
comments: Although I think the wrap is best suited for mild weather days, I love it. YouTube has great tutorials on how to tie it and I love that it fits any sized person. The fabric folds nicely for storage and washes easily.

title: In love with my Boba Wrap!
author: Shawnika Aiken
comments: I absolutely love my Boba wrap! I get so many compliments on it and have referred many people who inquired on where I got mines from! My baby loves it too and loves being close to me. I love having my hands free to hold the hands of my other two little ones I have when we go places! I recommend this product to anyone!

title: Comfy and Convenient
author: Sarah
comments: This is perfect for the first few months! I got this, because my newborn didn't fit in the other carrier I received. Once I learned how to wrap, it was super easy. I would wrap before we left to go somewhere, then plop her in when we got there. I'm definitely holding onto this for my next babies!

title: Best wrap I've ever worn
author: JG'sMom
comments: Best wrap I've ever worn. Baby loves being wrapped up in this wrap and it's not to difficult to figure out. The only thing bad I can say about this wrap is that baby gets hot after a long time and it would not be suitable on hot days in the summer(90+ degrees), not that any carrier would be.

title: This is nice especially for early on with baby
author: K. Grosse
comments: This is nice especially for early on with baby.  I use our Ergo more now because it's easier to get on and off and baby in and out.  Mine didn't come with a drawstring pouch for some reason.  I believe most do.

title: Great Wrap
author: Sam
comments: I really love this wrap as it is incredibly comfortable to wear, offers great support to the baby, and is easy to wear once you get the hang of tying. Two disappointing things about this wrap are the difficulty of trying to tie the wrap when running errands and it seems to be very warm. I live in Minnesota and my baby seems to be getting very warm. I have a toddler as well, so when I go to a store I try to wear the baby. I've tried tying the wrap before going but it seems to stretch a lot by the time we get out of the car.

title: Great until they get out of swaddling phase
author: SAOBAO
comments: I liked this for my LO up until she didn't need to be swaddled. It was great because it gave her security when I wore it and gave her more support than the conventional backpack looking carriers. I was able to do chores etc with her happily sleeping. However at about 4 months, And is no longer liking to be swaddled, she "found her freedom" and hates anything restrictive. I've had to switch to the Ergo 360 to give her more room.One thing I did notice, seems like after a while my LO would get lower and lower and I felt the need to support her weight somewhat, no matter how tight I made it, she would always fall down from the original position.

title: ur sweating like a pig
author: Michelle G.
comments: It's hot.  By the time u get it on, ur sweating like a pig.  Then there's the additional 98 degree heater you add (aka your precious baby), and ... Well, hotter than Hades.I ended up getting a different baby wearing thing.

title: So excited to use this!
author: Nikki Schwake
comments: It is SO long. But I really love this wrap. I haven't had my baby yet but I have tried it on (for practice) with a stuffed animal and It seems really awesome. I love the material, it is very durable, but soft and comfy. Also not bulky when rolled up so it makes it easy to carry around in your diaper bag!

title: PLEASE BE WARNED!
author: Hola Senior
comments: I do not like writing reviews especially when a product already has so many of them, but when I have a bad experience I feel it is my duty to warn others of its potential danger.I really looked forward to wearing this wrap with my first baby, but he started crying every time I put him in so eventually I gave up. With my second baby I got him in and carried him around relatively okay for the two times that we did try it out. However, the other day I sat down and my husband next to me after a few minutes noticed that my baby was turning blue! I am not a big and busty person and I can't wear this wrap too tight, but somehow when I sat down my 3 week and 8lb old baby couldn't breathe. We immediately yanked him out and after what felt like an eternity he started breathing normally and then his color returned to normal. I was busy getting ready to take him to the ER while my mom who is a trained nurse tried to help him breathe again. This was an extremely scary experience. For this reason I cannot give this baby wrap anything more than one star or recommend it to anyone ever.To end, the pros are:1. Cheaper than other carriers2. Machine washable therefore easy to clean3. Small enough to place in diaper bag and travel with4. Baby is close to mommyHowever, they are outweighed by these cons:1. Not quick to put on2. Both my babies did not like the putting in and getting out. The one would settle down once he was in, but the other one continued to cry and fuss until I took him out.3. If you loosen it to try to accommodate a baby (less than 2 months old) that doesn't want to be in a carrier, you have to use your hands to support him, which renders this thing useless.4. POTENTIAL SUFFOCATION ESPECIALLY WHEN SEATED!If you choose to buy this baby carrier / wrap, please be very careful!

title: I was expecting a lighter fabric
author: Pau E.
comments: I was expecting a lighter fabric! It's nice but the fabric is so thick I don't even want to use it in summer! Maybe for winter will be better!

title: Five Stars
author: Michelle Casey
comments: great product

title: Hot to wear
author: Anastasia Fan
comments: I do think this wrap was pretty comfortable, and it got a lot easier to use after a couple times. The only thing I don't like is that I would swear like crazy wearing it. Might just be me...

title: otherwise very comfy and easy to wear
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My baby loves it sice he was a newborn, the only con I can find is that the fabric sometimes makes me to hot and in Texas that's an issue, otherwise very comfy and easy to wear. Really recommend it.

title: Five Stars
author: D Miller
comments: Works well and is very comfortable.

title: Great for newborns
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I loved carryin my son in the Boba wrap when he was first born. Now at 4 months & 17lbs  he doesn't like to be in it as much. No matter how tight I wrap it he still sinks down and I have to support his head even though he supports his own head now, leaving me with only 1 hand to do things. This would be good when they are newborn. I wish I could still use it for him.I bought a baby carrier with straps and belts, which provides more support and structure and he loves to be in that bc he has more room to eat his hands and play with a toy, plus I don't have to support his head.

title: but seems like it'll work good
author: Blake
comments: Very long, but seems like it'll work good

title: Who has the time to put this on??
author: Kimi
comments: Sorry but as a new mother I don't have the time to spend 20 minutes putting this thing on. You have to wrap it around all these different ways. Definitely not easy to figure out. Baby katan is much better.

title: happy and close
author: kellyrenae
comments: Keeps my 2 month old calm, happy and close. He loves to be in motion this makes it so much easier for me to get things done around the house and keep my son happy the whole time!

title: If you want to be a furnace, this is your wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Maybe if you live in a really cold place, this wrap could be great. We live in San Diego. It's hot here. Now imagine wrapping a gigantic piece of fabric that is basically as hot as fleece around you 3 times and sticking your baby in there. It becomes a furnace. Wearing it outside is not an option. So I figured, I'd wear it inside with the AC on. I put the AC at 70, put my babe in it (infant and love my baby position), and within 5 minutes, we were both overheating (the baby was only wearing a diaper while I wore a loose t-shirt). I once wore it to the supermarket (cold!) and had to take her out and carry her on my shoulder because we all got too hot. I'm not sure how people wear this, walk around and be active, and not overheat. I am certainly not a person who is always hot, I'm actually one of those women who is always cold, so I know that's not the problem. Anyway, if you were to take a trip to Iceland, NYC or Chicago in the winter, I'd recommend this wrap.

title: Very comfortable and keeps baby weight off your back and shoulders
author: Talitha
comments: Keep the instructions so you remember how to wrap or you can find instructions online. Very comfortable and keeps baby weight off your back and shoulders.

title: Great for newborns!!
author: Alecia B
comments: This is the best item I've bought for the new baby. It's easy to use and the baby loves to snuggle in it. I have back pain all of the time and this makes it easier for me to hold my little one without increasing my pain. I had a different brand of wrap with my last baby and I couldn't put it on without assistance, but I can easily put this one on by myself.

title: Love love love
author: JCuartas
comments: Best wrap ever! !I have always been a baby wearer. This is baby 3 and first time using a Boba wrap. Wish I had known about these much sooner. Highly recommended.

title: Material too heavy for summer use
author: huajia Yu
comments: Material too heavy for summer use

title: Four Stars
author: Vladimir K.
comments: Good quality product but unfortunately our baby didn't like it!

title: I said I would never get a wrap!!!
author: cougs4life
comments: I originally purchased the infantino flip (which is okay) to get me through until I decided what I wanted long term. Wraps seemed intimidating and....weird! BUT this is absolute perfection. I really wish I would have spent the extra money to get this right away.Cons:-learning curve-weight to 35lbs, BUT the amount of stretch is sort of impractical after about 18lbs (need more support)Pros:-Super Comfortable-Can use with newborn-easily fits around the hip dysplasia brace my son needs-Supports baby's head against chest for naps-cute to wearI seriously am going to get this for everyone's baby shower gift now. It is AMAZING. In the future baby might be too big and we will have to look at other carriers, but I am cherishing every moment in this for now!

title: Five Stars
author: sus mer
comments: was a gift and my friend loved it!

title: Good quality but too hot
author: JJ
comments: After doing much research and reading numerous reviews, I really wanted to like this wrap. Unfortunately it was way too hot for us both. Baby wouldn't stop crying while in it.

title: Not for me
author: Jennifer
comments: I did not like this wrap. It was just so long and heavy, and I have a baby who gets sweaty easily, so it was uncomfortably hot for the both of us. I prefer the front carry backpack style carriers more. It's faster to get on and baby in in my opinion.

title: Love the Boba Wrap!
author: Lisa LaSh√©
comments: I really liked this wrap but never had the chance to use it before my baby was too big.  I gifted it to another expecting mother.  I hope she will love it.

title: I didn't like this baby wrap
author: Lindsay Pierce
comments: I didn't like this baby wrap.  The first time I used it, I did it wrong (of course) and it took 3 people to figure it out.  The 2nd time it was me and my husband and we did it better so the baby was tighter and higher up (the first time it wasn't tight enough so she kept falling lower and lower until I was just holding her).  However, she still fell over the 45 minute walk I attempted so I didn't feel all that comfortable not holding her underneath.  The 3rd time I tried it I was by myself and it just is not that easy to do while I am configuring it, putting the baby in all while I have 2 excited dogs that are ready for their walk.  I also own an ergo carrier and that is MUCH easier to just toss on and go! I got the wrap because I thought it would be more comfortable but not worth the hassle. It went back.

title: very stylish, and works well if you know how ...
author: shanebenge
comments: very stylish, and works well if you know how to use it. Youtube ideas on how to tie it correctly and your all set

title: Personally didn't like it
author: CKHODAPP
comments: I personally didn't like it because there was too many steps to try to get it on and tight

title: will not buy again
author: Patricia CCY
comments: Time consuming to wrap it around as it is so long. Material is very stretchable so when i put my 2 month old in the whole thing sag n baby bouncing around when i walk. I tried wrapping it tighter around myself but this made it hard to put baby it. My baby weigh 5kg. Not for use in warm weather as the material is thick and have to wrap it around the body a few times. Will not recommend this type of baby carrier. I prefer my existing baby carrier (i-angel) that was so much easier to use and I used that with my older child from 3 months old till 18 months when he became too heavy for my waist and back.

title: Love it! Baby loves it
author: Hannah Henning
comments: Have used this since baby was newborn. Love it!  Baby loves it!  Can keep him close while doing chores, shopping, walking, traveling,  etc. Works perfectly.  Keeps baby warm & allows bonding time.  Especially great during first months while baby too young for stroller. Would buy again!

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Fantastic

title: Extremely difficult to figure out. Tried several times and ...
author: Lindsey
comments: Extremely difficult to figure out. Tried several times and cannot figure out how to get tight enough to hold a baby. Very frustrating.

title: So comfortable
author: Rachael H
comments: My baby is so comfortable in this wrap. We travel a lot and she fell asleep even in Rome! Easy to put on. I watched a fast YouTube video and was a pro in 5 min.

title: Four Stars
author: TMitch
comments: Worked but it's super thick so my baby would get hot and sweaty when he was in it.

title: A wrap that works, finally!
author: R.Blake
comments: Very happy with this purchase. I have never been a "baby wearer" because I could never get the any ring wraps, or other wraps on quickly or easily enough, or it felt like baby wasn't secure. However, I am a "baby wearer" now. It is easy to put on, and baby feels very secure. I get to be hands free, while holding baby which is a plus with having 5 kids. My baby loves to be in the Boba wrap all the time!  She is so content in this "in utero" type of position. Currently she is 6 weeks old and we have been using this almost daily since she was just a few days old. I picked this over other similar wraps because it has a bit of stretch to it, which allows you to tighten as tight as you please with the reassurance that baby will be able to fit because fabric will stretch to accomodate (others don't have that stretch aspect which may require frequent adjustments until you figure out how much slack you need). The only thing I"d change is it is a bit long, so it does drag on the ground when I am putting it on.

title: Good Product, Inconvenient in Heat
author: Abby K
comments: The instructions for how to set the wrap up were clear and concise.  With only about twenty minutes of practice I was able to get the hang of it perfectly.  My baby is relatively comfortable in it, as am I wearing it, as long as it's not too hot. Now that's it's full-on summer time and I live in a hot area, we aren't using it at all though.  I even tried it while wearing no shirt and it was still too hot!  I bought a¬†Infantino Flip Front 2 Back Carrier, Black¬†at Target and we've used that a lot more.  When it cools down I'll probably go back to this one, but for now it's just sitting on the shelf, completely useless.

title: Better than Solly
author: Andy
comments: So versatile! Great and stretchy! Our baby sleeps so softly in it. It has great material, we recently bought a Solly Wrap, and we prefer this one to it!

title: ... baby hasn't made is grand appearance but I was pleased with the quality of the product and the speed ...
author: Lauren Easter
comments: Have not used it yet because my baby hasn't made is grand appearance but I was pleased with the quality of the product and the speed at which I received it.

title: Three Stars
author: LLB
comments: The fabric is too heavy. My baby and I sweat while wearing it!!

title: Five Stars
author: Tiana Danielle
comments: Love this wrap, although it is a little warm for the summer time

title: Great for Newborn Days, But Too Hot for Mom and Baby
author: Elizabeth G.
comments: This wrap is great for the newborn days. I didn't use it as much outside of the house, but at home, when baby wouldn't lay down to sleep, I could put him in the wrap to take a nap while I did things around the house. Unfortunately, I does not render you completely hands-free, as I found I did need a hand on him at all times for support. Though it does require reading some instructions (or even better, watching a video on the Boba site), I found the wrap pretty easy to put on after the first couple of times practicing. The fabric is very stretchy and comfortable, which is nice, but I did not like how thick it is - even in winter, baby and I were both sweating when I wore him in this. I also found that at about 3 months, as baby became more curious and wanted to look around, he did not like being carried in the wrap so much - at that point, I switched to the Ergo360.

title: Lightweight
author: Jill
comments: Love this baby carrier. I need something that was light weight for a vacation to Florida (in the summer) I believe this will be perfect and a lot more comfortable then my last carrier that he seems to have already outgrown at 4 months. I just got it and already tried it out and I think I'm going to love it!!

title: Five Stars
author: Chimanian (Anca E Call)
comments: Formidable.

title: I love this wrap
author: Jocelyn
comments: I love this wrap,  i would have given it 5 stars but the material is a little to thick and after about 30 mins my sweet girl is sweating. Other then that its great, comes with a book on how to wrap it for diffrent weights and its simple to follow. It is also very comfy to ware.

title: Wear all the babies!!!!!
author: kiman825
comments: In my opinion this is a great beginner wrap. Just keep in mind, it is really only good for newborns, because of the stretchy-ness of the fabric. With that in mind, with a little practice you can get a nice and tight wrap. It is great for keeping your baby close to you, and let's face it ALL babies love to be held and Loved on.  It is NOT for long term use though in my opinion. The material is just to stretchy, so as your baby gets older and bigger, the wrap will not stay as tight. I also think is is important to note that if you have a summer baby, this wrap keeps the heat in. I had a winter baby, so it worked well. Now that it is summer, we both just get to hot. It is NOT breathable. You can nurse in this wrap, again.. it just takes practice and patience. If this isn't the wrap for you, please do not give up on baby wearing, just try other options.  Boba has a video online that you can watch, I recommend watching it and practicing several times. If you still  need help, try a local baby-wearing group.WEAR ALL THE BABIESIf this review helped you at all, please click the YES, this review was helpful button. Thank You

title: Two Stars
author: ConJoFitts
comments: I just want to speak with the shipper

title: Five Stars
author: Lauren
comments: Not too hard to get on and baby fell asleep in a minute

title: It works great, I had a different kind of carrier for ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It works great, I had a different kind of carrier for my kids and it pulled on my upper back so much that I would rather just carry my kids but when I got this I used it and all the weight from my son was centered around my hips and not my back! I didn't want to take it off! It took a few tries to figure out how to put it on, but once I figured it out its so easy! Definitely recommend, it's the best one I've tried!

title: Love my Boba Wrap
author: Anastacia
comments: Love my Boba Wrap! I have 3 carriers currently. The Boba, and Ergo performance, and a Baby Bjorn. The Boba is my favorite so far! I'm planning to find out if I can return my Baby Bjorn due to things I've read about hip dysplasia and I mostly use my Ergo when on the go but my Boba is my go to especially for during the day at home with my munchkin. It keeps me hands free to take care of my home and whatnot while keeping my baby close. She loves being close to me and feeling my warmth and she almost always falls asleep instantly when I wrap her in it. Would definitely recommend!

title: Too long and too hot. It was ok in ...
author: NT
comments: Too long  and too hot. It was ok in the newborn phase.

title: Cute and Comfy, would buy again
author: Tracyann
comments: My baby was too tiny to put in a normal carrier when he was born so this was a life saver.  I had to watch the youtube video a few times, but figured it out and always felt like he was safe and comfortable in this.  It is not super supportive so I would not put a heavy baby in it.  I switched to the Ergo once he was about 12 lbs.

title: I recommand it  if you want to find time to do stuff
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I am a new mom and i was looking for something to help me do as much activities even while having a baby  like doing workout , arranging rooms and waking around the house .. I found this product and i purchased it and I can't stop recommending it for my friends because it helps me make sure that my baby is save and i can watch her along with me doing my other duties and activites  and also my baby is happy seeinfg new movments and items while she is in my chest  . The fabeic is great and you can feel that it can hold strongly your baby if you use it the right way ...  Happy day everyone.

title: love my moby-style wrap - used it with all 3 ...
author: theoutcrop
comments: love my moby-style wrap - used it with all 3 babies.  the only problem i can mention is that it's hot in the summer.

title: Love this
author: Jason Perez
comments: We bought this for our second child and it is so convenient. Grocery shopping has never been the same.

title: Five Stars
author: Marshall S.
comments: Worth every penny!

title: Five Stars
author: The Calm One
comments: Works as described.

title: Works great!!!
author: Hunter Bryant
comments: Bought this for my wife and she loves it. Very comfortable for the baby.

title: Two Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Not what I was expecting it to be.

title: Five Stars
author: Mj
comments: Very easy to wear!

title: Stroller "system" v Boba- babies vote for Boba
author: Mumsers
comments: What this does, it does well.  I'm a grandmother helping out my daughter with twins. We needed something that would give us a way to walk around with small babies that was safe and this was the perfect answer- recommended specifically by the night nurse, who used it for comforting and safety.  For one thing it's soft, supports the wobbly head, and provides body temperature while safely supporting the hip joint.  We continued that protocol in the daytime.  It's easy and comfortable.  Now that babies are 10+ pounds, I'm beginning to wonder about how long my spine/back will want the weight distributed across my back and shoulders vs on a hip belt.  Babies still love their "Boba walks" and the dog has accepted he no longer gets to sniff at his pace when we have babies strapped on.  These babies hate their stroller seats and bassinets, and love the Boba. At 2 months old, they are beginning to keep their heads up on walks and look around, but still reject the stroller.

title: We love to use the boba wrap and our baby boy ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We love to use the boba wrap and our baby boy is easy to sleep when we are wrapping him. It is just quite hot during summer.

title: Two Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Felt too stretchy for baby of 15lbs

title: Good quality. Easy to use
author: Joni C
comments: Good quality.  Easy to use. Only thing is it is super hot in the summer with baby in there.

title: A lifesaver...
author: Kevin
comments: One of the best products I have ever made in my life. A lifesaver...I appreciate this product so much.

title: Meh, too expensive for what it is.
author: Kentucky/Tennessee
comments: Too expensive for what it is (long piece of fabric). Fabric is also very heavy. Not a good option for summertime. If you have a sewing machine and you know how to use the basic functions of it, you could make one of these for a FRACTION of the price,  while choosing a more versatile fabric.

title: Great!
author: Boopshkeen
comments: Good idea...but I only used it for 2 weeks...then my baby didnt like it anymore. It was also heavy on my back. I didnt find it comfortable.New review...after 6 monthsWhen I used it later, with my baby "sitting" not "laying", she likes it again. It is a bit hot for the Summer and not very practical to put on outside because it is so long its hard to keep ends not to touch the floor... :-( but I still like it. Very nice pattern, good material, ... If I know I will need it later, I just put it on at home.

title: My 3 Week Old Loves It!
author: Ruby Kim
comments: My 3 week old loves being inside the Boba wrap! It took some time to learn how to use the wrap but practice makes perfect and now I do the wrap really fast. It's a great way to multi task while keeping your baby close to your chest, also your baby is comforted by your body's warmth and hearing your heartbeat. I was going to spend more money by purchasing the Solly wrap but I'm glad I went with Boba Wrap because it pretty much serves the same purpose without the bang for your buck.

title: Love this wrap
author: oh you do 13
comments: Love this wrap! I live in the south, so any fabric would be hot to wear,  but it's not unbearable! Holds baby well!

title: Works great. True to picture color
author: Bubblie Blondie
comments: Works great.  True to picture color.

title: I have also loved it for the big crowd places that I don't ...
author: Tyler Sandstrom
comments: This has come in handy on so many occasions. Whether it be the only way I can get stuff done around the house because my baby just wants to be held, or grocery shopping so the car seat doesn't take up the entire cart space, being able to eat meals when baby refuses to be put down, or big company parties. I have also loved it for the big crowd places that I don't want to play "pass around baby" people can look but generally won't touch and won't ask to hold my baby which is perfect for this paranoid first time mom. This allowed me to comfortably take me and baby out of the house earlier than expected because of that. It's been really handy to have.

title: Warning: purple color is nothing like the picture!!!
author: nando
comments: Although the wrap works as expected, I specifically bought it as a gift for my wife who loved the color (as shown in the first picture). To our surprise, the wrap is actually a very light purple (almost lilac), CLEARLY not the bluish-purple shade shown in the picture. Very dissapointed... :(

title: My newborn loved this wrap more than any other carrier
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My newborn loved this wrap more than any other carrier. I found it pretty easy to get the hang of wrapping it too. Wish I had purchased it for my first!

title: Five Stars
author: MDinTraining
comments: Boba>baby bjorn

title: Not for us.
author: Rachael Hart
comments: This is the first baby wearing carrier I ever purchased after my daughter was born. I specifically chose this particular wrap style carrier because:1) tiny newborn appropriate (my daughter was just 7.5 lbs at the time of purchase2) affordably priced (have you SEEN the $ on some of the carriers out there?)3) resembled the Moby wrap that every one raves about4) seemed adjustable so that multiple family members could use it5) machine washable - my baby is a spit-up machine6) easily accomodates a growing baby without requiring any special insertsHonestly, I'm torn about this carrier - yes, it is nice, but I'm only inclined to use it about the house. Why? Mostly because it is so time consuming to put on, and I feel that if I don't wrap it about me just right, it's not snug enough. When it's not snug enough, my daughter sags down into the pocket, much farther down my torso than recommended - then I can't listen for her breathing. When I DO get it snug enough, it's almost as if her breathing is heavier and she wheezes. All these complications may simply be "user error", though I have devoted quite a bit of time to "practicing" putting it on and wearing her about the house for short periods of time. I can't IMAGINE having to wrap this carrier on after arriving at the store to make shopping more convenient. If anything, it would be more time consuming to wrap it about me as there would be no mirror available to check and be sure the wrap is not twisted about my back. I definetly would not be reaching for this particular style of carrier out of convenience. I grab my Rockin' Baby Sling pouch for that! Additionally, while the jersey material is SO soft and washes well, having yards and yards of it wrapped about you and baby in the FL heat is torture.Perhaps there are other care-givers out there more adept at quickly and efficiently wrapping up in their carriers, but I'm not one of them, unfortunately. This carrier left me feeling hot, uncomfortable, and worried that my baby was not secure.

title: Not as great as I thought
author: Katy
comments: I thought I would love this. I registered for it, and was excited about the prospect of baby wearing. A dear friend bought it for me, and I did use it, but ultimately it's just ok.Here's the deal. It's big. Bulky. Cumbersome. It's not difficult to put on, but there is a learning curve and it does take a minute or so, which is a long time with a screaming baby. It also takes up honestly about half of the space in my diaper bag, if not more, so it generally stays at home. Baby was generally ok with it, but I wasn't that impressed. I also have a beco Gemini, and ended up not bothering with the giant wrap and it sat in its pouch.I ended up trying a baby ktan and like it much better because it is faster and much less bulky, meaning I'll use it more, and it's still as snuggly as a wrap. I also have an SF Giants themed moby wrap-- it's bright orange so I generally only wear it on game days. I noticed no significant difference between the boba and moby.Long story short, be prepared for the time and physical space that this requires. If you like to travel light yet still baby wear, consider the ktan or a ring sling

title: Love it!
author: Chelsea
comments: Weird to put on at first but by the third time it was easy! Make sure you pull it tight otherwise your kid will be sagging on your belly. Congress with easy to read/see instructions. Also comes with a cloth pouch bag to put it in.

title: Wonderful investment!
author: Krystal
comments: I am in love with the colors of this Boba Wrap. I additionally love how it wears. The quality is great. I have washed it several times and it holds up perfect. I like how the material is soft and breathable. I am able to wear it in warm and cool weather over and under different types of clothing. My baby is currently 3 months and I have been using it since she was 1 week old. It is comfortable to wear and doesn't cause me any discomfort. I have breastfed my daughter in it a few times without having to take it off. There are several youtube videos on different methods but I have preferred just shifting my baby down and nursing that way without removing her from the wrap. I would definitely recommend this wrap to anyone.

title: Thank god for this
author: A. Richins
comments: If you only purchase one thing for your newborn aside from diapers, get this wrap.  I don't know how we'd cope without it.  It works wonders in putting our daughter to sleep (and keeping her asleep), and what's more, it frees our hands to get things done around the house.Newborns LOVE to be wrapped up next to you, and the wrap gently but firmly hugs them close to your body.  When you walk around, the bouncing motion lulls them to sleep.  You can also pull one flap over their head to protect their head from the sun if you are outdoors.  When our daughter gets hungry,she'll start smaking her lips, and I can actually feed her her bottle hands free by putting it under one of the shoulder flaps.This is actually how most cultures in human history have cared for their infants.  And studies have shown how important it is for babies to be close to their parents.

title: this is a great one. My little one gets a little too ...
author: abbottclan
comments: As far as wraps go, this is a great one. My little one gets a little too warm in it though.

title: Amazing
author: Brittany Yates
comments: This thing is amazing. I bought one of the standard ones it was just uncomfortable with too many straps and didn't feel secure enough. I read the reviews for this and figured I'd give it a try. My daughter is 4 weeks old and constantly wants to be held, I am single mom and its been almost impossible to get things done. Even making her bottle she was would be screaming. I opened this thing up and thought what the heck?! It looks difficult but the instruction manual is extremely easy to follow and after your first try you get how it works. I was worried it would be too hot too but it's very light and cozy which makes it so surprising how well it holds her in. I can literally do everything with her in this. Even go to the he bathroom!!! I can't believe how awesome this is for the price

title: This wrap is great for first time wearers
author: abbyk
comments: This wrap is great for first time wearers. It's easy to use and works well. Highly recommend a boba stretchy wrap if you're on the fence about babywearing.

title: She love it! She says it doesn't put any pressure ...
author: K. S. Manuel
comments: I bought this for my daughter to use with the new baby. She love it! She says it doesn't put any pressure on her back, and the baby loves it. She likes being close to Mama like that rather than in the carrier. And the 2-yr-old loves it because Mama has free hands for her.

title: Too much effort
author: Saad
comments: Too much work.  It basically is a huge piece of cloth.  It seemed high quality, but we don't have time to wrap up a 15 foot cloth around our body when the baby is crying.  I got a $20 infantino holder instead and that worked way better for us.

title: Good
author: KomanderKain
comments: Comfortable, versatile, and cute. Mommy and baby both love it!

title: Must have for new baby!
author: SjNebz
comments: Love this wrap! Wish I had purchased it for my first child. My baby sleeps well, it's comfortable, and allows me to use my hands to eat, pay bills, wash dishes, etc.

title: Five Stars
author: amanda
comments: Wonderful to have with a newborn! The wrap was just as expected, no complaints at all!

title: Love this!
author: Ashley
comments: I use this wrap all the time for my newborn. It's very easy to tie. I'm only 5' but I don't find the extra fabric to be a problem. The fabric is thick which makes it feel like the baby is secure but it can get warm in the summer.

title: Five Stars
author: Paloma
comments: Love it, so worth the price.

title: Worth it
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Perfect support and flexibility

title: Helps baby sleep
author: Keith Wilson
comments: A little difficult to learn how to use correctly but INSTANTLY puts my baby to sleep. It is thick so be carful to not use on hot day because baby could potentially overheat. Overall I really like it.

title: Not impressed.
author: jenerationmama
comments: I put this on my amazon baby registry due to the high reviews. Being a first time mom and all I didn't get the differences and limitations between this vs. more structured carriers. This wrap has A LOT of material. So if you are petite and slim, you will drown in it. Also, it's very hot, in warm weather both me and baby were sweating! I would only use this in the winter. Be prepared to spend time putting it on, wrapping it front and back, rewrapping it for a better fit, etc. Too time consuming for me! Looking back, this was only helpful during the newborn/early infant stage because as baby gets heavier it gets harder to carry. The material is stretchy so as you carry I feel like it isn't as secure. I have back and shoulder issues and it's hard for me to have support all of baby's weight without some type of structure,  but that's just me. Lastly, instructions recommend one style of carrying only which is inwards, I didn't realize this before I picked it. I assumed I could use it in every position.

title: My eight week little one loves how cozy the boba ...
author: Jacqueline
comments: My eight week little one loves how cozy the boba wrap is! I have to admit-- getting the wrap on the first time was tricky, but by the third try, I had it down! Benefits to the boba wraps use include-- cooking, we just tried gardening with it yesterday (worked out fabulous while he slept!), working out; are just to name a few. Added bonus- we're able to comfort each other by having constant contact with one another. This is baby number four, and I totally wish I had the boba wrap for my other three sons!! I currently own the black boba, and yellow boba. I anticipate purchasing other colors to allow for color coordinating with my dresses ;) Thank you, Boba!

title: Awesome works great
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Awesome works great. Makes going to the zoo and for walks and pretty much anywhere easier especially with 3 kids under 5 I can take them by myself

title: I can't imagine not having one of these!
author: JustMe
comments: My baby and I LIVED in this for the first few months of her life. Once you get the hang of it you can tie this on so fast and it is by far the most comfortable way to carry around a baby. As a mom you feel like your little bundle is so secure and safe and that really helped me with the transition of pregnancy to motherhood. It also helps you get things done because your hands can be free.I really can't say enough good things about this wrap. It fit both my husband and I (I'm 5'5" and he is 6'1" both good shape). It does get pretty hot in this sometimes but that's to be expected. Once on its easy to adjust to the tightness you prefer. It's quite stretchy (more so than the Moby Wrap) and I prefer it that way so it doesn't feel so tight and rigid. It washes easily and is very soft. This is a MUST have for anyone with a new baby.

title: Loved it
author: Yael R. Goodblatt
comments: Wonderful wrap, and super for my little one who was born at only 6 pounds.My only complaint is that it made me too hot in warm weather.

title: Three Stars
author: Amber M.
comments: very stretchy material my son just keeps sagging lower

title: Mommies rejoice! You can eat with both hands again!
author: SheShops_SheScores
comments: This is one of those baby shower gifts that I initially returned to the store.  In my sleep-deprived stupor, I thought this would be too complicated for me to put on and these days I'm all about quick and easy!  Well, i don't don't know if it was a growth spurt or what, but at about 2.5 weeks, my baby was super fussy all the time and didn't want to be put down. It was exhausting! I couldn't even eat anything that required using more than one hand. Then I remembered this wrap that I had returned and decided to try it again. I already had the infantino newborn carrier and Bjorn carrier, but they aren't built to soothe a baby. Mine didn't mind going for walks in the others, but only the Boba INSTANTLY soothed baby and put her to sleep for hours! Oh man, I love this thing.The material is soft and super stretchy. It is kind of thick but I have been on walks with it in 85 degree weather and not been too hot. I prefer the look of the grey but I bought the black to hide the stains that me and baby would inevitably get on this thing (spit up, salad dressing and poop are just a few of the things hidden on this thing so far).At 10 weeks, I still use this almost daily and we love it. Baby is 12 lbs and I'm still carrying her around very easily in the Boba.  Great purchase!Tip: if you're nervous about tying this thing, just watch a couple of videos about tying methods. You'll be a pro after a few attempts. Also, keep close eye on baby's face to make sure she's never nuzzled too closely.

title: Five Stars
author: Bethani Johnson
comments: I got this for my daughter and it's her favorite!

title: It's ohkay
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Too loose

title: Five Stars
author: Nosov
comments: Ok

title: Too warm but still great
author: Vic G.
comments: The wrap is fantastic for colder months or controlled indoor temperatures. However, with body heat from the wearer and baby it does get very warm for both parties. My daughter would get uncomfortable quickly when in the wrap in crowded areas or on warm days. The wrap itself is great quality and the price is fair. However, had I known that she would get too warm too fast to actually get anything done, I would have opted for the Ergo or something similar right away. If you aren't worried about being too warm and want a nice wrap to wear around the house or shopping then this is the way too go. It's also very easy to breastfeed in and perfect for newborns who love the warmth. Before getting warm made her uncomfortable, my daughter would fall asleep as soon as she was in the wrap due to hearing the familiarity of mom's heartbeat and the security of being snuggled close. I'd say this wrap is ideal for the first 3 months.

title: I love this wrap
author: Ashley Ercanbrack
comments: I love this wrap! I researched for hours to find the right one, I love the pattern and the material is very stretchy and holds my baby in just right. It is a thicker fabric, so will be toasty if I use it in the summer time. I have wrapped my baby many different ways and have really enjoyed it. Great purchase!

title: Momma knows best
author: kathy sue
comments: Per my daughter in-law -- it is perfect!

title: There are better out there. This one will let you down! The only thing it has going on is that it is popular.
author: Jorge Kondo
comments: Crappy material stretches and will keep the baby out of position.It is very warm, so baby get over heated if you do lots of movement (70F weather).Too much material. You don't need that much material. You will end up sweeping the floor.Don'y buy. and ook for others with more breathable material, less material, and less stretch.

title: Two Stars
author: Jennifer Coyle
comments: Too long and big for a petite person

title: Happy baby and happy mom :)
author: Melissa
comments: I love this wrap! It is so comfortable and snug. I watched a video to learn how to tie it and after a couple times I got it down and now it's really simple. My little girl seems to really like being wrapped and is super calm while I'm wearing her. The only drawback is that it is pretty warm, so on especially warm or hot days I have to use another carrier in order to not have either my baby or myself overheat.

title: Support small business! Buy this mirror!
author: Krystal
comments: I drive a PT Cruiser which has a very strange headrest. This mirror has not shifted from the moment I installed it.  I never get any headlight glare from oncoming traffic. It gives a very clear view into the RF seat.A bonus is this is from a small independent company. We ordered a couple of these not only for myself but as gifts. They personally called to check on our satisfaction of their product. I appreciate this extra contact to personally hear what the customer has to say. They offered a 15% coupon for future product purchases via email.I have had a couple different mirrors over the years and others fell short of satisfaction. The buckles and thin straps on this mirror really have a good hold. The pivot joint from bracket to mirror is very nice and again has never shifted. I tried several angles and it has held tight.

title: Love this wrap so far
author: k14
comments: Love this wrap so far! My husband and I were looking for a good carrier for a newborn. We have a sturdier one that worked very well with our first child but didn't work well when he was a newborn. He disappeared in it! Our baby often falls asleep in the Boba Wrap. Then I can position his head to make it hands free (awesome!). It has taken me a little while to get used to putting it on, but it's not too difficult. I watched a video online which helped. Another reviewer mentioned the tip of putting the wrap on before you get in the car when you go places (great idea!). It can be a little stretchy at times so you have to make sure to put it on tight enough so you don't feel like the baby is falling down. It's very long (I'm fairly short at 5'3") but I figure it's good for my husband who is taller. Would definitely recommend the wrap as a reasonably priced option for newborns.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Was a gift and they are very happy with the results.

title: Amazing! My favorite baby carrier!
author: Cdunker
comments: I haven't gotten to use this wrap with my little one yet (as I am still 7 months pregnant!)  However, I had one from my first baby (this is #4) when these were still called Sleepy Wraps.  I finally had to get rid of that one :( since it was falling apart after 3 kids and 7 years.  I tried to replace it with a Moby, but I really did not like it AT ALL.  This has a little more stretch so it is easier to get a good fit.  It took me a few tries to really get the tying right and a few weeks before I really "perfected it".  If you buy one and it doesn't work out the first time -- try, try again!  Go watch some YouTube videos demonstrating tying it!  One trick is to pull it very tight - as tight as you can get it.  It stretches when baby is in there (that's what I had trouble with the Moby).  I love baby wearing (and did it before it got so popular -- hipster mom LOL).  And I unfortunately cannot buy every wrap/carrier on the market (and some are crazy expensive!).  This one is so great and by far my favorite for little ones!  I'm also using it while I'm pregnant to wrap my belly for support -- google belly wrapping with a Boba wrap :)  One other great benefit -- it spread the weight of your baby around your whole back and hips.  As someone with shoulders that seem to tire easily (or just start hurting) with back pack straps or other carrier straps, this is awesome.  It makes carrying your baby much easier and keeps your hands free to take care of other kids!

title: LOVE IT! Fits Plus Size 2x.
author: Ayron
comments: The one I received was black, but I was perfectly fine with it, and in fact was looking for black to begin with. I LLOOOOVVVEEEE this wrap. Words cannot express how much. My daughter loves it, she seems very comfortable. I am plus size, 2x, and this wrap fits me and baby perfectly. She weighs almost 20lb at 8mo. Buy it, seriously. It's bonding and so convenient. Also, read the manual, and have someone there to help while you tie it 2 or 3 times at first. It takes just a second to figure out, but then it's second nature. No problems with shrinkage in the wash either. Or fading. And wipes off fairly easy in between.

title: Perfect wrap for a plus size mama!
author: Lauren S.
comments: I have tried several different wraps in the past but this is by far my favorite! Here is why:1. The fabric is so soft! Its very breathable and neither baby or I get too hot.2. It is STRETCHY. I've not had a wrap before that stretches like this. I'm plus size (size 16) and a lot of wraps have stiff fabric (like the Moby) and I'm left uncomfortable and self-conscious. This one wraps to my body securely giving me and baby a perfect fit.3. The color is bold and doesn't fade. I've been using this wrap for 2.5 months and have washed it several times. The color is still dark and bold and the material is holding up great.

title: Five Stars

I wear it under my shirts, its a tittle bulky in the back, but so worth it for the relief i get. Im in my 9th month of pregnancy.I will update one I use it with my new lo in a few weeks.UpdateMy new boy is 6 pounds and 11 inch long, so tiny, and this wrap works sooooo perfect!He goes so quite and when he is in it that i worry if he is breathing. I use this to put him to sleep when he is too cranky. I can actually use both hands when i wear him without worrying if his neck is supported.Love this wrap!

Baby had mild hip dysplasia so this carrier, which pushes the legs out was a better position than a sling, which would push the legs together.

title: Great wrap
author: Michelle Francis
comments: I'm a little obsessed with finding the perfect wrap....Love this wrap!  The stretch is nice so baby can move around a little bit.  Stretch is also useful to maneuver baby for nursing.  Fabric is on the thicker side so a little warm, but not too bad In general unless warm outside or in the sun.  After a few times I'm now able to get it on and baby in it within a minute, and comfy for several hours!  And at 7 wks she lulls quickly to sleep with the motion.  (Just make sure to have good posture and use your core, as with any wrap!).I also have the ktan and like this one better over all (ktan not too bad but less stretch.  Can get the ktan on super fast though!)Maya wrap is nice too and can get her in it quickly, but I need to experiment with other positions now that she's getting bigger.  It also shows lint horribly so get a light color if you try the Maya ring sling.  Boba >> Maya/K'tan.Sollybaby.com has a thinner version of the boba with slightly less stretch and gorgeous color options!  Boba = Solly...different perks to each.  Solly is pictured in the black... Boba in turquoise.Last but not least.... MeeYoo brand (on Facebook) is gorgeous and handmade in my hometown by my cousins!  They are on the high-end spectrum of wraps but worth taking a look at if you are really into the whole baby wearing movement!

title: I kept wrapping and wrapping---practice makes perfect, right
author: grand slam
comments: Shipping was quick! When I first received the wrap and tried wrapping the first time (I watched a video on YouTube on how to wrap it on me), I became skeptical about the product. My baby kind of sagged in the product. I kept wrapping and wrapping---practice makes perfect, right!? Anyways, after several and several tries I began to have my doubts. The whole wrapping situation can get you frustrated. Even, trying to put your baby in it. I even got to the point and mentioned possibly returning it. I had a friend tell me she loved hers so I decided to keep on trying. I was new to the baby wrap. I never used it with my other children. I finally found my solution to my issue. You kind of have to be aggressive and make sure you wrap as tightly as possible. Once I put my baby in it, she fell asleep. I gave this product four stars mainly due to the struggling issue I had at first with it. It's a struggle and takes practice. Overall,  I think this product is worth the buy. I do think it could be at a cheaper cost.

title: My little one and I love our boba wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My little one and I love our boba wrap. I use it every where we go (Target, mall, etc.). It's easier than having to carry the baby. I would recommend it.

title: Five Stars
author: Nicholas J DeTomaso
comments: Had to watch Youtube to figure out how to use it, but once she did, my wife loves it

title: This was great for traveling
author: Megan
comments: This was great for traveling. I used it on our first plane trip with baby. It kept him nice and cozy.

title: Comfortable for baby and parents!
author: Anon.
comments: Why did it take me until my second baby to buy one of these? I love it. I already owned an Ergobaby, which I absolutely loved and used a bunch, but when I had my second baby I was spending a lot of time playing on the floor with the toddler or sitting down for meals, etc. while still holding the newborn. With the Ergo, it's not comfortable to sit down. But the Boba solved that. It's very comfy for the baby and works magic when it comes to putting the baby to sleep. Two downsides: 1) I live in California where it's warm most of the time. It does get warm wearing the Boba both for me and the baby. I have to plan our outfits accordingly. (I did look into some of the mesh wraps, but most of the reviews said they weren't as comfortable and would roll up); 2) even though it's pretty quick to put on, like other reviewers have noted, it can seem like forever when your baby is screaming/crying. I'd say it takes about 30 seconds, but sure can feel like eternity with a crying kid! I did figure out that if I'm going somewhere I can put the wrap on at home, drive with it and just keep it on until I want or need to put the baby in it. I should note that the main reason I chose the Boba over other wraps was because of the color choices. The other brands didn't have the light blue/turquoise color I was looking for. Overall, I really like this wrap and only regret that I waited until after I had my second baby to purchase it.

title: Four Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I love that my back doesn't hurt while wearing my daughter and its perfect for plus size women.

title: I love the Boba wrap
author: Briana
comments: Bought this from another website but wanted to make a review on here. I love the Boba wrap! Based on some other reviews I was afraid that I would have trouble tying the wrap but I got it easily on the first try by following a helpful YouTube video (here's the link [...]). After following along on the video one time I can now tie it quickly and easily. The material is so soft and comfy. My baby loves being in the wrap. He went right to sleep the minute I put him in. I was afraid it wouldn't feel secure but I feel 100% comfortable with him in it hands free and when tied properly I know he is secure and will not fall out. The only complaint I can think of is that it does get a little hot but I think that's a given with any wrap considering two peoples body heat pressed closely together. I would suggest dressing lightly and putting baby in only a onesie or t shirt while in the wrap (unless you're using the wrap in really cold temperatures). Overall I love this wrap and am definitely saving it for future babies.

I used it for the first few weeks, but after she was big enough, I quickly switched over to the ring sling. Once you get the hang of how to wrap this on your body it's easy enough, but it is still time consuming. More importantly, it is a LOT of hot fabric wrapped tightly around your body, which is both uncomfortable and overly warm.

So basically I would recommend this for the first couple months, then you have to switch to something more substantial, at least in my experience.
