title: This wrap is amazing. It's so thin and stretchy
author: Kim H.
comments: This wrap is amazing. It's so thin and stretchy, nothing compares to it. I had a Moby with my last baby and it was so thick and hard to use but this is just a dream come true. And the pattern is beautiful. Only cons is the pattern isn't on the reverse side and it's so stretchy that a non-experienced wrapper could have a hard time tightening the wrap.

title: I really wanted to love it!
author: Jaimie
comments: First I really really really wanted to love this wrap. I have already purchased and received as gifts a few wraps and slings that I had not been happy with. After reading the reviews on this wrap I felt that this would be a good choice to carry around my six week old daughter. What actually happened was I was not confident in my ability to properly wear the wrap as the instructions toward the end were pretty confusing! I couldn't figure out how to cross the weap behind my back as they said in the instruction manual it without it twisting and turning.So even though I couldn't follow the instructions to a t because the wrap was so long and it was practically impossible for it not to get twisted I wrapped it around my body the best way I could. The problem came when I put my daughter in it and she seemed really secure but I noticed right away that she began to overheat. It was definitely pretty toasty with her wrapped up so closely and tightly to my chest with even only wearing a diaper. Of course,  when my daughter's temperature started to rise it she in turn made me hot so before we both became a sweaty mess?  Off it went!So overall my complaints are the instructions which to me were pretty confusing and the fact that the material didn't offer a lot of room to breathe. Finally, the amount of time it took to put it on, this is definitely not something that you can easily get in and out of. When you plan on using a wrap when you're out on the road you're not going to have a lot of time to try to figure this out from the time you get from the car trying to get to where you're going so overall I like the idea this but it just didn't work for me.

title: Boba baby just got put in the ErgoBaby
author: Jason Wilson
comments: This seemed like the best "natural" way for carrying a baby. The pictures look cool and you would think in third world areas its all they have. It works ok. Its a pain to set up and no matter the position my baby just didn't like it. I bought an ErgoBaby and she loves that. I guess maybe some babies just don't like being swaddled that much.Hopefully I can sell and make some money back at a garage sale. I think I kept the box

title: I really want to like it but...
author: Lisa B.
comments: No matter how many times I try to tie this correctly I just don't feel like my little one is secure. I had used an Ergo and BabyBjorn with my other two LOs but I thought a wrap like this looked like it would be so much better for those first few months with the third. I have tried it on numerous occasions but find that after 10-15 minutes of trying to like it I end up just going back to the BabyBjorn. I just feel like no matter how hard I try I just  can't get it tight enough around me to feel like my babe is secure.

title: Good product but not for everyone
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My husband and I picked out this carrier, mainly because it was affordable and had a good reputation.  Some cheaper less wrap-like carriers are associated with hip problems, so we didn't want those.  I was hesitant about the elaborate process of wrapping it around me, but it gets easier over time.  It's still a bit of a hassle though and I'm not sure it's really worth it.Pros:1) The baby seems to like being in the boba.  When she was first born, the boba wrap was one of the few things that made her quiet down and was the only way we could take her anywhere.  But now that she's getting more comfortable in her stroller, the boba is getting less appealing.2) There's pretty good back support.  The weight of the baby is fairly evenly distributed so you can carry her around for awhile without too much back pain.3) It's nice to be able to carry the baby around and still have your hands free.  You can even use it just doing chores around the house if you have a baby that wants to be held all the time but you need to vacuum or something like that.4) It's cheap, easy to clean, and light weight - after all, it's basically just a giant strip of stretchy fabric.Cons:1) I'm constantly paranoid that she's going to suffocate in there.  She's still too small to hold up her head so I try to support her head with part of the wrap, but then I'm constantly fussing with it to make sure her face isn't pressed into the fabric or my boobs.2) It's hot!  I guess this happens anytime you strap another person to your body, but the weather is getting warmer and it's just too hot to walk around outside with her in it.3) The wrap is ridiculously long.  After following the wrapping instructions, you're left with feet and feet of fabric and you can either have a giant tail or wrap it around your waist a million more times.4) It's kinda a pain to deal with the wrapping.  It takes a little while to put on and then you have to maneuver a wiggly baby into it.  Where we live, you pretty much have to drive everywhere, so running errands with the boba involves constantly moving the baby from car seat to wrap.  It's much easier just to take out the car seat and click it into the stroller.5) Even if you can get the baby to fall asleep in the boba, you will never get them to stay asleep when you take them out.  My husband always compares taking her out of the boba to giving birth - very traumatizing.6) When the baby gets sick of it, she starts screaming and clawing at me with her tiny little talons.Overall it's a fairly good product, but it's not for everyone.  If you're really into wearing your baby and do a lot of walking, then you might really like this.  Also it's a nice way to give you husband an idea of what it was like lugging a baby around your midsection for 9 months - although it's not really the same since it doesn't come with nausea, heartburn, exhaustion, ect.

title: I loved wearing my little one in this when he was ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I loved wearing my little one in this when he was younger! It helped so much while grocery shopping!  I don't think I would be able to get him in it now that he's more mobile. The only thing is, you and baby can get hot and clammy depending on the temperature and season where you are. Also the material is really wide on the shoulders and would get in face so I would constantly have to adjust. All in all I'm so glad I bought it for the memories of carrying my little one and being able to keep him close while out and about is very important!

title: Best for tiny newborns
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We own a Tula, Sakura Bloom ring sling, a Hot Sling, and a Soothe Shirt and this Boba wrap is the only one I feel comfortable carrying my very tiny newborn in.  It feels secure and comfy. Her head is supported and she loves it. She will stay in this wrap for hours without making a peep. It's wonderful!

title: It's a bit of a struggle
author: Audrey Kennedy
comments: It's not very comfortable. I have the ergo baby, but was looking for something less bulky. I purchased this wrap to wear around the house, but it doesn't really provide great support and I find both myself and my 3 month old struggling to get in and out of it.

title: Secure
author: Miles' mom
comments: The only downfall is how warm it can get for my little one. Other than that, we love it!

title: Good and bad
author: noelle
comments: This baby wrap is comfortable and nice material. It takes a while to learn how to wrap it correctly (had to practice a lot at home before attempting it while out and about). Some cons: the wrap does brush on the ground and get dirty when putting it on, no matter how hard I try to hold all the material (but there's a lot), it doesn't quite support my infants head as well as my Ergobaby with infant insert - I find that I have to hold his head because the material doesn't hold it well enough, which can be hard at times if I'm grocery shopping, cleaning, or doing other errands. The good: material is soft and stretchy, easy to clean, wrap comes with a carry pouch (though it's hard for me to fold it up nice enough to fit back in there when on the go). I do try to put the wrap on at home and then go, so I don't have to mess with the tying and wrapping when out (esp if baby is getting fussy after being in the car seat). Overall I'm glad I got this as another carry option for my baby. He seems comfortable in it and loves being on my chest, esp if he's starting to work himself up. Lately I've just been using my Ergobaby with infant insert instead since it provides more support and padding, but this is good to have if you want something less bulky.

title: Awesome wrap
author: Nique
comments: My baby gets the best, most restful sleep in this wrap. We make sure we take it everywhere, we barely ever use our stroller. I've even worn my baby girl on hiking trips at our local and state parks. It's so wonderful to be able to take our little bundle further than the jogging stroller will allow.

title: its great i cant wait for my daughter to be born ...
author: will polly
comments: its great i cant wait for my daughter to be born i think she will be very comfortable in this

comments: I was skeptical of buying this because I am a plus size woman. I was concerned that "one size fits most" wouldn't include me, but it did. It fits with plenty of room to spare, and quite comfortably at that. I didn't care for the Moby wrap, but really love my Boba! It's so easy to use.

title: Nice product, but it is too big for me ...
author: Carolina Guzman
comments: Nice product, but it is too big for me I am 5.4 and 123 lbs so it is a bit too long, so literally you have to wrap it all over your upper body. I am a bit ocd so I want to make sure it looks neat.. So I had some issues putting it all bymyself.

title: Would recommend
author: kkbb
comments: The product works wonderfully and it's more convenient with an infant than some of the bulkier carriers that require a separate insert if your baby is below a certain weight/height.My only complaint is that the color shown in the picture isn't as dark as the product actually is, at least for the purple wrap that I bought.

title: it's great. The problem is getting there

comments: Once you are all wrapped and baby is in, it's great. The problem is getting there. It takes a lot of practice to learn how to wrap in a decently short time

title: Fabric was an issue
author: Stalney Wakashige
comments: The fabric was too heavy and uncomfortable for my little one.

title: Four Stars
author: coachlak
comments: Gift for my daughter. New arrival has yet to take a ride but mom likes it.

title: Amazing!
author: ck2040
comments: I wasn't sure I needed one or would even like one. It took me months to finally purchase it. I am so glad I did. Baby and I love it. It's a great way to snuggle while still being mobile. Yes, it does take some time to wrap at first, but you really do get faster and better at it. Plus, it's just fabric so it travels easily.

title: My favorite carrier
author: Lana
comments: I have this wrap, along with a K'tan, a Baby Bjorn One, and a Baby Bjorn Original (a hand-me-down). This is my favorite carrier right now. My baby is about five weeks old currently, and I have been using this since he was maybe two weeks old. I had the K'tan originally, but I wasn't in love with it. My baby didn't feel super secure in it, and I had the smallest size. The fabric of the Boba is super stretchy and soft, but I can get a really snug, custom fit. It's very comfortable for both baby and me. My only complaint is that it is rather time-consuming and cumbersome to put on, but the end result makes it worth it to me. I was able to get it on easily and securely the first time I wore it by following the instructions. It was much simpler than I expected it to be. I highly recommend this wrap!

title: Not a fan
author: rrc0112
comments: This wrap is just okay.  For the price I guess it's okay, but my issue is trying to get the thing on while my kid is losing her sh**.  I watched a few videos on how to put it on, and I have to say it's not as east as it looks.  Then you have to get your kid in it.  My baby is not a fan of this wrap. Maybe when she is older (she is currently 5 weeks) she will like it better.  I read reviews where people say to just put it on in the morning and leave it on that way you can put your kid in and out as they need it.  Ummm no, I'm not going to wear this big bulky 15 yards of jersey fabric all day to save time tying the thing

title: Must-have Wrap!!
author: Rachel
comments: This item is practically perfect. I LOVE this wrap and will buy it for all my pregnant friends now. This is the only carrier I've used that doesn't hurt my back. I can carry my 7 month old around for hours and be completely comfortable; plus she loves it! The only seeming downside is the inconvenience of carrying this 3 yard piece of fabric around, but once you get used to it, it is well worth figuring out. The instructions are simple and easy to follow. Having the baby held tightly against your body can get hot so if you can, dress in layers. Above all I want every mother with a newborn to have this product.

title: it would be great if they have different sizes
author: Sowmya Lingareddy
comments: it would be great if they have different sizes.... for big people , it just fits if you tuck in your tummy.

title: Boba was a nice neutral gray color
author: DMartinez06
comments: Boba was a nice neutral gray color, but material was thick & hot. My 3 month old did not like being so snug. I imagine this would be great in colder weather for a baby who enjoys being so snug, but definitely not for my baby.

title: Boba
author: TheYibales
comments: I love this wrap! We use this all the time for our newborn daughter. She was a preemie and it still works well. The black wrap goes with everything! I also found additional ways to wear it online after purchasing. I will definitely be ordering another color soon!

title: Great present
author: Dr Rutabega
comments: Always a great present to give to new parents. You can never have too many slings, especially since they get dirty and need to be washed.

title: Five Stars
author: Crystal
comments: Best purchase for the baby and mommy yet!!

title: Four Stars
author: Kindle Customer
comments: Baby doesn't like it, but still good

title: Two Stars
author: Joe H.
comments: It's very difficult to use, and you need two people to get it tied and place the baby inside.

title: Five Stars
author: Maegan H Calamas
comments: Worth every cent!!!

title: This baby wrap has been my life saver!! ...
author: Kate. N
comments: This baby wrap has been my life saver!!! My baby loves being worn and I can do it without getting tired now.

title: LOVE this wrap
author: Paul Lamas
comments: LOVE this wrap! Super comfy and convenient. Freed up my hands with baby so I can wrestle the other two, do grocery shopping, etc. Baby loves it and falls right to sleep most of the time. Highly recommend!

title: Convenient but warm
author: Patricia
comments: My three week old baby has decided I am not allowed to ever set him down. With this wrap I can still (slowly snd carefully) get things done around the home. He's a newborn, so I don't feel comfortable not supporting his head with one hand- once he has more neck strength, that will get easier.I was worried the wrap would be too complicated, but with a few YouTube videos and some practice tries, it's easier than it looks.I didn't give this 5 stars because it's REALLY warm. Even in the cool days of March, I can only use it for 30 minutes at a time before we start to overheat.

title: Awesome product! HIGHLY recommend!
author: Harmonica Jones
comments: I absolutely love my Boba! I am a first time mom and  my daughter was born 7 weeks premature. She was very tiny when she came home (under 6 pounds). She loves being snuggled in this wrap and I can tie it tight enough that she is supported and comfortable while I move around. The fabric stretches and holds the baby in a way that resembles the womb.The Boba also worked well when we had to return to the hospital for doctor  visits. I had a c-section and couldn't  manage carrying the car seat on my own. So, I would wrap myself in the Boba and slip my daughter in when we got to the hospital. I could tie the Boba to the side to avoid my incision as well. If you are thinking of purchasing the Boba  it's a good idea to watch a video on how to tie it and practice before you put your baby in. I highly recommend this product!

title: need to wrap around and still doesn't give a sturdy hold on the baby and have to compensate by ...
author: ela
comments: Too long fabric, need to wrap around and still doesn't give a sturdy hold on the baby and have to compensate by holding hands under the baby's bottom to make sure not falling out, and also alleviate drag on your back. Plus makes me so hot to be wrapped up like that. I definitely did not like the product and I sent it back for refund. Sorry to say, but with above in mind, I would not recommended it.

title: I like it.
author: Melissa
comments: I chose the boba for its great reputation. I like it. It is relatively easy to use and holds our newborn snug against my body. It's material makes wearing the boba difficult to comfortably wear in crowded places or warmer temperatures. I'll have to get a different wrap that's a lighter material for the summer. That makes it a little disappointing.

title: super soft material
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Color is just as depicted, super soft material. Can't wait to use it for my little one.

title: Nice but does take practice
author: Erin
comments: I like this wrap when I can get it on and baby in correctly. I've watched YouTube videos on how to wear it, but it's still taking some practice. When I do succeed it's wonderful! It gives me a chance to have a little freedom, baby's content and I can get stuff done.

title: So grateful for the Boba!!
author: Shelly M.
comments: I don't usually write reviews but felt I needed to for this. I don't know what I'd do without this wrap. My oldest daughter is almost 3 and this wrap allows me to keep busy with her while keeping my 5 week old close. My newborn LOVES this wrap. The second she's in it, she falls asleep- like a deep deep sleep. I walked 3 miles today with her in it (1 mile, 3 separate times in the day). I have other carriers however this is definitely the best infant wrap!

title: Grape
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Gift for my sister in law... baby in May... still in box... what she wanted... very purple...lol

title: LOVE
author: Annie Walker
comments: Me and my son love our wrap!

title: I really love this alot
author: Johnny A.
comments: I really love this alot. But it gets really hot. However, I would buy another in a instant. Great baby shower gift. My baby loves it and usually totally passes out once she has been in it for a minute or so.*update* after a few months of use, it completely stretched out. Super bummed, especially since I have another little one on the way.

title: Five Stars
author: Mike D.
comments: great Item

title: I love this wrap
author: Candice Robinson
comments: I love this wrap! It makes my life easier when my baby won't let me put him down to get chores done. The material is stretchy which sometimes it's hard to keep it tight enough. After a while my baby starts slipping down in a ball on my stomach.

title: Intimidating but not that hard to figure out
author: Ice Industries
comments: The Boba wrap is a little intimidating at first, it's a really long piece of stretchy fabric. It comes with a guide that explains how to use it, there are lots of ways, you can see them on pinterest too. The fabric is soft and easy to wash. Baby loves to be worn!Tip: When we're on the go, I put it on before we leave, so I don't have to do it while everyone waits in the car.Cons: It takes a couple minutes to get it on, and theres a learning curve on how tight to make it.Pros: it doesn't hurt your back to wear your baby - even when she gets big. I've also tried the infantino pack - I prefer the boba.

title: and the person loved it!
author: Leslie P
comments: It was a gift, and the person loved it!

title: So versitile!
author: Brynnon E.
comments: I love the color, true to the photo, and how versitile it is with plenty of wrap techniques to suit your little one. I even use it to breastfeed as it covers up nicely. Also, its great because I can just throw it in the washer, although I have yet to try the dryer.

title: Complicated and Long
author: Emily
comments: I LOVE babywearing, and I love my Boba 4G, but the wrap just doesn't do it for me. It's complicated to get on - it takes a long time and is hard to get super tight. The other major con is that the fabric is SO long. Like, I am 5'9 and it would be cool with me if the length of the fabric was cut in half. I rarely use this because for my family, it is inconvenient.

title: Not what I  expected for price
author: Brittany
comments: It's ok, very hard to put in yourself! The material is thick and both baby and I got warm quick. Be careful about where you put it on, there is so much fabric, it drags on the ground and gets dirty!  Other then that, when it's  finally on it is ok, unless it's hot out like  I said . It's also very tight

title: Two Stars
author: Ejenine
comments: Too difficult to use.

title: Three Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I give it to my daughter as a gift.

title: Great! The only thing I could think of is ...
author: Jacqueline S.
comments: Great! The only thing I could think of is the directions they provide didn't really help me. Luckily I found a YouTube video that explained slowly  how to use the wrap properly. Overall really great product

title: Do moms really like this products?
author: Kim
comments: I thought this would be really useful and helpful for my baby and myself. It is very bulky. My baby has been crying when she is sleepy, so I tried to wrap this boba sling around my body. It took a quite time to adjust the sling itself and I had hard time getting my LO inside the sling as well. My baby's forehead and my cheek bone got bumped against each other when I was putting her into the sling. I don't know how people are so satisfied with this product, but I personally would not purchase this if I were considering one. Now, I am going to have to purchase the baby carrier that you can wear on your shoulder since this boba wrap is a complete fail to me.

title: Material was nice, this warp just didn't work for us
author: Stephanie
comments: Material was nice, this warp just didn't work for us. Took to much time trying to figure out how to use the darn thing.

title: The best wrap!
author: KG621
comments: Bought a second wrap now that we are expecting twins. These are the best and I prefer them toThe Moby Wrap! Slightly more give in the fabric AIDS in a more secure fit

title: Great
author: Brandon Whitworth
comments: Really like how comfy it is for my LO

title: Five Stars
author: suhmanthuh
comments: I love this wrap. It holds the baby nice and snug and is comfortable to wear.

title: Love this wrap!
author: LB
comments: I needed something for my needy infant and this is great! It only took me a few tries to get the wrap on right. I'm a plus size girl and this wrap gives me plenty of room. My daughter loves sitting in it and usually falls within a few minutes.

title: This is a great product that is better than we imagined!
author: KatieJon
comments: After doing some research to decide if we wanted a Boba or Moby wrap, we decided on the Boba because of the stretch in the fabric. Very happy we chose this one! I found the initial idea of learning to use the wrap confusing... BUT in reality it is very (very!) simple. I found how-to videos on the Boba website and on YouTube and within fifteen minutes I was up to speed and had my newborn in the Boba doing skin-to-skin. This wrap also allows me to have (partial) hands-free time to get chores done (dishes, making bottles, vacuuming, folding laundry, etc) while keeping my son happy and content. I'm currently a 1X-2X and this allows for plenty of fabric to accommodate larger sizes (with plenty to spare), while my significant other is very small and it works just as well on him! As an added bonus, if I go outside for some fresh air it keeps well-meaning, enthusiastic people from touching my newborn (and passing on germs). We love this wrap so much that we purchased a second one to have on hand when one is being laundered!  (We own in in Sangria and Gray - both lovely!). Each wrap comes with a small carry bag made out of the same material. Oddly enough, the first wrap we purchased came with a convenient elastic to synch the bag closed, the second one we purchased did not come with a way to close the bag (see photo). We strongly recommend this product to parents and have been very satisfied with the product! As an added note: when using the Boba to carry my son, we kick-up a lot of heat! I would LOVE to see this company make a version of this wrap with a sturdy, yet light-weigh mesh or muslin (still with stretch) to use during the hot summer months. That would be a product we would purchase right away!

title: Bad color.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My grey was a clay color and I didn't order the dark gray, just 'grey'. I don't have a printer so I can't return it. Very disappointed :(

title: Very pleased
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I'm very happy with the wrap! Fits comfortably for both mom and baby!

title: A good wrap
author: Stephanie T
comments: We also own a baby Ktan and the ergo carrier. My daughter sometimes doesn't like the baby Ktan and I thought it might be that she's getting too squished, so having an adjustable size wrap would help her get more comfortable. The Boba wrap fabric is thick and stretchy. I ordered the purple and it is a kind of bright violet, not a royal purple. The wrap is easy enough to tie once you get the hang of it, but it still takes longer than the baby Ktan to put on. I think overall it is more comfortable than the baby Ktan because the weight is distributed around your waist as well as on your shoulders. The drawback is really the time it takes to put it on. My baby likes this one just as much as the Ktan. One thing to note is that you cannot do forward facing in the Boba wrap, which I did not know until after I purchased it.

title: Super cute colors, great carrier.
author: Adam & Gabby Leeper
comments: This wrap is awesome. The colors are nice and vibrant and you will definitely get a lot of comments. The wrap is a little tricky the first few times you use it but I figured out watching a few youtube videos does wonders and it actually is really easy. It is very long obviously so I recommend putting it on at home so you dont drop the extra pieces on the ground when you wrap. I made the mistake of trying to put it on once we got to the store and the wrap pieces were all over the ground before I tied it all up. Great wrap, super cute!

title: Five Stars
author: MGR
comments: Very nice and confortable.

title: Love love love this my son was 10 weeks early ...
author: Megan McManus
comments: Love love love this my son was 10 weeks early and he loves being snuggled up to me .

title: Easy to wear
author: J.S.
comments: Easy to wear, easy to use, easy to nurse in (standing up with hand support), and pretty to wear!  Very functional.  It does get quite warm for baby, be aware.  Also, when baby falls asleep in it, I find I have to support her head with my hand - the material does not do a very good job in my opinion for that purpose.  I still have one free hand though, so it is worth it!

title: Four Stars
author: S. Carroll
comments: Too warm for summer use!

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this wrap!
author: Nikki
comments: I LOVE this wrap. I originally had a K'Tan for my daughter but there was no give in the fabric. When you wrap this wrap you have to wrap it snug like the K'Tan but the fabric is so stretchy and comfortable for my little one. This was so worth the money and I recommend to anyone.

title: Five Stars
author: Dan S.
comments: As Advertised

title: it looks like it might be to long when you take it ...
author: allison73003
comments: Works well for all sizes, it looks like it might be to long when you take it from the box- but once you start wrapping it around your body and add the baby it fits well.

title: Grandson loves it !
author: amy wadkins
comments: Works perfect

title: Great for Small Babies
author: Amazon Customer
comments: The Boba is a great wrap for a small baby. My daughter was born at 5 lbs and didn't meet the weight requirements for most wraps. I found this one hard to get accustomed to putting on and for ease I changed to a ring sling when my daughter grew bigger.

title: Five Stars
author: CMamazon
comments: Easy to use and comfortable for mommy and baby!!!

title: Love it
author: lakisha williams
comments: Works like a charm. Easy to use and light weight. I almost forget too take it off. The caring bag helps for storage afterwards! Great buy

title: One of the best!
author: V.
comments: Very nice quality, so wide and long, breathable, just love it

title: A Lifesaver!!!
author: Heather Kelley
comments: Super cute print! Nice and stretchy....perfect for soothing a fussy baby and having my hands free for my other 3 kids!

title: I should have returned it. I'm sure I could ...
author: Amanda
comments: I should have returned it. I'm sure I could look up how to wear it and figure it out, but it didn't come with any instructions at all and it was SO long! Kudos to whoever figured out how to wrap this thing. Maybe I'll try again for with the next baby.

title: Make your own!
author: Felishia H.
comments: So, I was going to give this a 2-star but the fabric is nice. And with saying that, the fabric is also very heavy!! I was shocked at how heavy it was, I couldn't imagine a warm baby inside as well, I would burn up! I saw a lady out in public who had a very light weight looking wrap and upon asking her where she purchased it she told me she made it out of 5 yards of jersey/knit fabric. I instantly returned this and got myself some jersey fabric that was on sale and made one myself. Saved me about $20-25 by returning this and doing a DIY version. There are many tutorials on YouTube and Pinterest to show you how, you don't even need a sewing machine, really. Anyway, all that to say, do it yourself! You'll save so much more money and get more for the price of just one Boba Baby Wrap.

title: Four Stars
author: Amber
comments: I love this!! It is comfortable. Only downside is that it takes some effort to put on.

title: Two Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Makes my butt look big.

title: Love it! Terrible instructions
author: Mel2916
comments: We love this! My newborn calms down right away if nothing else works. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because the instructions are very confusing. I watched a YouTube video to learn how to use it.

title: My little guy loves it
author: Orie Lim
comments: I like it how this baby wrap is elastic rather than strecthy. I tried other famous brand but i couldn't handle it well since it would end up with my baby hanging down lower and lower in 15mins after i wear him.Boba wrap perfectly stays on where i wear it and my baby loves being in it..

title: Can never get the straps laid flat like in the picture but still works just fine
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Can never get the straps laid flat like in the picture but still works just fine.

title: Plus size wrapping
author: Kathy
comments: You can Def use this to wrap even if you are on the bigger size . It can take just a minute to get the wrap down but once you do look forward to baby wearing and doing things hands free!

title: I just love my wrap!!! And so does my baby!!
author: Milhu
comments: I just love this wrap! I wanted a wrap that's adjustable.. And this wrap is so comfortable and perfect for us. My daughter is so happy in it. You can tell she is very comfortable. I love using it when I go grocery shopping or on outings.. I am so glad I purchase this wrap for my baby!! Great buy!!

title: One Star
author: Nicole
comments: My daughter wasn't a fan.  Not sure why.  She might have been too little.

title: It's good material but too hot for summer
author: seney torres
comments: It's good material but too hot for summer. Also, this isn't hands free, it's a convenient way to carry your child but you will need your hand for support.

title: Five Stars
author: Mckibben Mama
comments: Gorgeous and great quality!!

title: I love this wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I love this wrap! So easy to put on, comfortable and convenient. I've only used it around the house so far, can't wait to wear it out!

title: One Star
author: Megan Rush
comments: Difficult to manage

title: I love my Boba wrap
author: Crystal
comments: I love my Boba wrap. My only regret is that I did not have one with my first two children!

title: Five Stars
author: Sherry Cail
comments: My daughter loves it and so does my granddaughter.

title: Five Stars
author: mary kantarek
comments: This wrap is so comfortable for both mama and baby.

title: we just purchased this and I love it already
author: Starzx510
comments: we just purchased this and I love it already! I had a hard time at first getting the fitting to work for me, it seemed like my boobs were the issue. But once I got it perfect the baby was really comfortable. whenever she is really upset but I am cleaning or working I throw this on, put her in and she settles almost instantly. I am happy with my purchase and would suggest it to any of my friends.

title: Love this wrap
author: Jessica Barnard
comments: Love this wrap. It's like wearing the baby in yoga pants it's so comfy! I wish I could have used it longer but my son is too big now.

title: Love this wrap!
author: shalinda little
comments: I love the Boba. I have the Ergo Baby from my first son and it worked well, but was bulkier than I like. I wanted to try a wrap with my second baby and this one is working great. It is simple to put on and has a good amount of stretch when putting baby in. The fabric is soft and very comfortable, but very supportive. I use it when grocery shopping all the time and the baby sleeps the whole time. I wore it to my older son's soccer practice which turned cold and windy. Baby stayed cozy and warm since he was completely covered. There were no holes for wind to get in. The wrap is very very long so it will fit most. My husband and I both can wear it.

title: Our daughter is happy with it
author: Horsey 22
comments: Bought this as a gift for our new grandbaby.  Our daughter is happy with it.

title: Five Stars
author: Megan Gibson
comments: One of my favorite items I purchased for my new baby! Comfortable to wear!

title: Thumbs way up.
author: Aaron Weshnak
comments: It's great because no matter where we go either my wife or I can wear that little man. It can't help but to sleep while he is in here. I would tell everyone to get one.

title: Five Stars
author: JC
comments: My wife loves it!

title: I love the boba
author: AshEckard
comments: I love the boba, I have been using the ergo with the newborn insert but my baby gets so hot, with this wrap she stays much cooler and it's SO much lighter and less bulky! I love that you only have to tie it on once and you can put/take her in/out all day without redoing it. I do love the ergo too but for a newborn I would definitely recommend a wrap.

title: Great for when they are newborns and little but it ...
author: Krystle
comments: Great for when they are newborns and little but it starts to pull/stretch when they get bigger. I purchased the Lillie baby complete airflow after this I'm very happy with that. I will use the Boba again when we have another baby, I love knowing there isn't any ruff material touching my newbie

title: Working mom
author: Verenice
comments: I love the boba wrap. I work from home and the Boba lets my hands be free so I can type and answer phone calls, while still having my baby near me.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Love this wrap. Very breathable for warmer weather.

title: Awesome wrap. Very easy to use
author: J. Ward
comments: Awesome wrap. Very easy to use. Has saved my sanity being able to tote my little one around while I do chores around the house. Absolutely recommend!

title: So glad I bought this!
author: aj0082
comments: One the best purchases I have made. This wrap has truly been a back saver, it has given me the ability to get things done around the house. It came with instructions, and there are plenty of resources & video tutorials online as well.

title: Yes!
author: Rebecca O.
comments: Baby loves it in here.  Once you get the wrapping technique down this thing is a life saver.  I called it "the treatment".  It was the only thing that would help calm my baby down in times of deep distress.

title: We've switched back to the Boba wrap because it works so much better! The flexible fabric allows us to make adjustments ...
author: rjilla
comments: I bought the Boba for my son before he was born. It fit him perfectly as a newborn and continues to work well as he grows. He is now four months old, so we tried our Tula carrier. We've switched back to the Boba wrap because it works so much better! The flexible fabric allows us to make adjustments for him, and it seems to make him happier. He never fell asleep in the Tula, but is napping in the Boba as I type. The Tula is great, but at this stage in his life, the Boba continues to work best.

title: Good product, not for me
author: Tara Tindle
comments: I know there are lots of great features to this wrap but it just didn't work for me. It's very well made and sturdy but when I put it on properly there was no room left for the baby.  Now, I am a larger chested gal so that could be it, but this just wasn't for me.

title: Doesn't feel secure
author: Brooke S
comments: I was excited to try this out but truthfully it wasn't that easy to get on and neither myself nor the baby felt secure it.  I watched the tutorial and had help from a few people to see if I was doing something wrong all with the same results.

title: Great concept, but hot and cumbersome
author: Brittany
comments: I really like the concept of being able to have two free hands when cleaning the house or shopping or really anything. However, I do have to list the drawbacks of this wrap. First, it is incredibly long and thus quite difficult to maneuver when trying to tie it. What I've found that makes it a little easier to use outside the home is tying it on me before leaving the house then when we get where we're going, I take baby out of the car seat and put her in the wrap. Second, like others have said, it traps heat. I have the black wrap so the color may be a contributing factor, but it definitely makes baby and I quite warm. Lastly, while I've read and seen tutorial videos about the possibility of nursing in this wrap, it is definitely not as easy as I had hoped. Maybe a little more practice will help, we shall see. I love babywearing but this wrap may not be the one for me.

title: I absolutely love this wrap
author: sarah Geyer
comments: I absolutely love this wrap! (And so does my baby). Easy to use. Washed up nicely. Affordable unlike the other brands. The only complaint I have is that we get hot very fast. The material isn't very breathable.

title: Works well for small babies once you figure it out
author: J K Waddell
comments: While this wrap is great, there is a definite learning curve with this product (or any wrap carrier). Once I finally figured out how to use it correctly it was great for around the house, at church, etc. Since I had a summer baby I did find that we would both get warm with extended wear. Also, I found that as my son hit around 15lbs it was hard to get the wrap to stay tight enough and not stretch so we switched to a soft shell buckle carrier at that point. This is good for the early newborn stage and was a great gift but I'm not sure I would have purchased it myself.

title: Meh
author: Brittany
comments: This worked well I suppose while she was tiny but it was uncomfortable for me. WAY too much fabric...perhaps better for someone bigger than me. I quit using it after 3 months or so.

title: Awesome Wrap!
author: NutsContract
comments: The first two times I put my son in it, he couldn't stop fussing like he was hungry, even though he had just been fed.Eventually though, he got used to being in it and now he loves it!I had a Graco carrier prior to the Boba wrap, and this is definitely more comfortable for both him and me. Highly recommend!

title: This is a life saver
author: PrincessRofAmazon
comments: I'm gonna have to rant and rave about this wrap because, honestly, it's the best thing since sliced bread. I just gave birth a couple of weeks ago and, as expected, there are times when my baby simply wants to snuggle with mama. Thing is, I still have other things to do around the house and I'm a full time student, which means I do need my hands. Before the boba wrap, I tried a regular Infantino carrier. That didn't work at all tho because it's too bulky, the baby's weight is all concentrated on the lower body, making my hips and c section cut scream from pain, and my baby was sweating bullets. So I looked on Amazon (all new moms' best friend) and found their best selling wrap, the Boba wrap. I asked my mommy friends about their experience with it and everyone was raving, saying it was the best helping hand they had with their newborn. So I got it. I was sorta skeptical because putting it on looked like black magic from the videos I saw- twist it here, wrap it there, flip it this way- but I still want for it because the potential benefit would outweigh the possible risk of not being able to put it on. And I'm glad I did. I only had to put it on twice to remember how to do it and my baby livres it. Only  downfalls I've found so far are: it seems to get loose pretty quicky; and baby can get too warm snuggled up so close for extended amounts of time. However, the first could be my fault- a friend of mine told me she had to wrap it really really tight in order for it to not get loose; the second is pretty standard for all carriers I've tried- two human beings together snuggled up like a sandwich have a really high chance of getting warm. Also, when you open the wrap, you may think it's too long; it's not. By the time you wrap it around your body, you have enough to tie it on your side to secure it. Go for it, this is totally worth every penny.

title: Awesome
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I have been using for three days now with my 2 month old son.  He is big, weighing in at 14lbs.  He's one of those babies that doesn't like to be set down.  This has helped my sanity and his sleep immensely.  I have a toddler and this helps me keep up with her and get out and about.  Wore it today to storytime, then playground, then out to lunch, then walk downtowm, then playground, then back to car.  He was basically in it for 4.5 hours and even nursed it it!  So far, I love it!  I also have the ergo baby which is too bulky with the newborn insert for daily wear...this fits us much better.  I think the ergo will be more helpful later on.

title: Great for husband that are looking to bond and keep ...
author: sarah jk
comments: Great for husband that are looking to bond and keep baby close. You need this if you plan on "wearing baby"

title: Very confusing directions
author: Sylvia
comments: I don't like giving poor reviews, but this wrap was the worst wrap I ever tried.I couldn't understand the directions on how to properly put it on my myself with my child, and fear of him falling out. I returned it and got another.

title: Too stretchy!
author: Josh, Jordan, Ava and Mom
comments: This wrap seemed great for the first month but after that the baby's weight pulls down on the elastic material causing him/her to sag. You'll be constantly rewrapping it tighter which is very inconvenient if you're out of the house. I wish I had gone with a non stretchy wrap. In all, it has very little use in growing with your baby.

title: Five Stars
author: Audra Arnold
comments: It's great!

title: ... didn't I have it for my first child would recommend this to
author: Megan Breaux
comments: This thing changed my life why didn't I have it for my first child would recommend this to anyone

title: I LOVE my Boba wrap
author: Jeff Everhart
comments: I LOVE my Boba wrap! It's a little tricky to put on at first, but after watching a quick YouTube video it was easy enough! Very sturdy and secure and allows me to carry around my newborn while keeping my hands free! I just purchased one for my friend & her baby too!

title: Extra material is bulky
author: Jbell
comments: I received this as a baby gift and thought I would love it, but I find it incredibly inconvenient to put on. I'm only 5'2" and 100 lbs and there is sooo much extra material that it is just uncomfortable to have. The extra material just feels bulky. They should make different lengths for different size people. I don't need as much material to wrap around myself as a larger women would need, so putting it on just is more of a hinderence than it is helpful. My baby doesn't mind being in it for short periods of time, so to take the time to put it on isn't worth it to me. I use a regular baby carrier instead.

title: Great for keeping baby close.
author: Rose
comments: Once I finally figured out how to use this, it became a very valuable piece of equipment to me. My daughter loves being worn, and I love that I can wrap her in many different positions to keep her close to me when she decides to be a velcro child. I'll be sad the day I can't wrap her anymore because she's rapidly approaching the weight limit.

title: Baby love to sleep in it when we go for a ...
author: Lukas
comments: Takes time to learn how to do it properly. Baby love to sleep in it when we go for a walks

title: Such a great wrap
author: Ashley
comments: The best wrap for my baby! I have used this for grocery shopping, walking, in the house! I love to have him close and he loves to be in the boba wrap! Love that there are easy instructions to learn how to use as well. Also has plenty of fabric

title: Amazing!
author: Dana Andrzejewski
comments: I absolutely love this wrap. I have three children and am so upset that I didn't know about this until now. I have a 6lb newborn who fits in this perfectly.it grows with them too. Super easy to put on, only took me two tries and now I'm a pro. I highly recommend this for anyone who is active and needs to get things done around the house!  Love, love, love this product!

title: I Can Use Both Hands
author: Jennifer
comments: I was hesitant to get it at first since it didn't appear as convenient to put on and take off as some other baby carriers. I love this wrap. I like how it can fit any size so my husband and I can both use it without any problems. I was super nervous the first few times I tied it and carried my baby in it, but it's really pretty secure. The videos online do a great job explaining how to tie the wrap as well as how to position your baby. I would highly recommend this to any new parents. It's so nice to be able to use both hands to do things and not worry that I'll drop the baby or hit her head against something. Additional bonus, you kind of look like a Jedi with the way it's tied around your body. üòÑ

title: Just what I needed!
author: Alexia D.
comments: This was absolutely perfect right out of the package! My happy, well-behaved 3 week old has been having a series of fussy episodes for about three hours a night, between midnight and 6 am. It's kind of like living with a gremlin, in a way. It felt like I was constantly performing voodoo magic to try to get her to sleep, a lot of which involved lengthy jiggling sessions with me dancing around like a crazy person. Needless to say, hours of jiggling a 9 lb weight starts to take its toll on wrists, hands, elbows, shoulders -- basically my arms. My arms were on fire. This wrap is a godsend! The instruction manual was perfectly clear, and I got her comfortably in place on the first try. My darling daughter, who'd been masquerading as a hellion, immediately quieted down, looked around, and then fell asleep -- all in under a minute. Thank you, Boba!

title: Snuggle time
author: N. Stew
comments: I love my wrap, I would only wear it around the house to snuggle.  It's to much work for outside wear.

title: Best wrap ever!!!!!
author: Caralee Voelker
comments: Best wrap ever. I have purchased so many and not been impressed. I still use this and my baby is 13 mos old. He fits in it and it's stretchy so he doesn't feel squished. It's easy to get him in and out and it's comfortable. No back aches here. It's my go to gift for new and expecting moms.

title: Great for Newborns not so much for growing infants
author: KAY
comments: I loved this when my baby was a newborn, I had a preemie so this worked for me for about 3 months until she became regular newborn size and she loves it so much. She loved it and would go right off to sleep as soon as she got in it. But the bigger she got the harder it was to carry her in this because it has so much give her weight would just sag it down and I no longer felt she was as secure as I wanted her to be and I could really be as hands free and I wanted to be either. I tried multiple ways of tying it and nothing felt secure once she got over 10 pounds, which isnt very long for the standard baby. If you are looking for something that will transition well as your baby ages I would go with something without any give like a sling/pouch or one of the backpack like shoulder carriers. If you are looking for something for you newborn or tiny 3 month old this is the product for you. I loved it so much and i wish it was still useable for my baby

title: Life saver!
author: Amy Martinez
comments: Absolutely love this wrap! I am heavy set and was worried about how it would fit me but I haven't had any issues whatsoever. Fits great. The baby loves being in it and it helps me get things done around the house

title: Very soft and good for plus size mamas
author: A.E.
comments: I love this little invention.  This one here is not too pricey for me, and works just as well as the other brands.  The material is breathable and very soft.  Would recommend.I am a plus size mama and I can carry my infant comfortably in this.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I Just love it wrap

title: Absolutely in total love! I'm a plus size momma and this still ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Absolutely in total love! I'm a plus size momma and this still fits around me great! Boba wrap has made my life so much easier. Wish I would've known about it when I had my first baby. It's also very supportive and doesn't strain my back.

title: Highly recommend for getting things done around the house when you ...
author: Misty Davis
comments: Highly recommend for getting things done around the house when you can't put the baby down. Frees up your hands and keeps baby close and snuggled in. Instructions are easy to understand. Material is very comfortable and breathable.

title: Great product! I would highly recommend to anyone who ...
author: Sarah Babler
comments: Great product! I would highly recommend to anyone who loves to tote their little one but would also like to have their hands free to accomplish the occasional non-baby related task. Don't be intimidated if you haven't used a wrap before, the directions included with this wrap on tying are easy to follow and even have pictures to help you along. I have had the wrap only about a month, but have been very happy with the quality and now, couldn't imagine not having it.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Great!

title: Lifesaver
author: C L
comments: Love the stretch for our little mover. My wife & my son used it for about a month before he out grew it though.

title: I do loved it. It is practical
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I do loved it. It is practical, easy to dress and my baby just loved. I use with her since she is 2 months.

title: Works great until:
author: Red_Tile
comments: It's 90 degrees in the summer, the child likes to look around, the child is too heavy or you don't have a free hand whilst attempting to adhere the child to your self.

title: I'd heard good things about this wrap-- the learning curve was not ...
author: L. Rowley
comments: I bought this because the sizing on the baby k'tan carriers didn't really work for me-- I was annoyingly between sizes. I'd heard good things about this wrap-- the learning curve was not too steep and it was pretty versatile. I haven't used it a ton since I've only had it for a couple of weeks now and it's been snowy and so I have been pretty housebound, but it's been pretty easy the few times I've tried it out. My son is growing pretty rapidly, so I'm not sure how much longer I'll be comfortable, but so far he fits pretty well and my back doesn't feel it. I'm careful to make sure that I've wrapped it tight enough and that the straps are wide across my back and shoulders. My main regret with the boba wrap is that I didn't buy it before he was born so I could have started wearing him in the beginning. Instead, I got this when he was about six weeks old and I feel like I have to get him used to the idea of baby wearing...ETA- My son is now 7 months old. I stopped using the Boba wrap when he was about 5 months old because it was just too bouncy with his weight (he was about 15 pounds when I stopped wearing him). However, I LOVED this wrap before that. I vastly preferred wearing him in the wrap to the stroller because we were both much more content (he cried less and I was more confident in knowing how he was doing). He also fell asleep probably 75% of the time I wore him for longer than 20 minutes, which is kind of a great thing when you need to be sure of a nap. I loved the stretchiness of the fabric in the beginning, but that was part of why I quit wearing it and switched to the ergobaby (which I now also love, but it's less convenient than a wrap in a lot of ways!). I would always put the wrap on really tight and then stretch it for my son to fit in pretty snug. I only felt like it was a little too tight two, maybe three, times. Not a real issue. I also loved being able to put the wrap on ahead of time-- before going in the car, etc-- where other style carriers have to be put on pretty much at the same time you're planning on wearing your baby. I am definitely keeping this wrap around in case of another baby, though I've also heard that solly wraps are better in warm weather (we get SOOO SWEATY while baby wearing! it's kind of disgusting sometimes).

title: Five Stars
author: Nadeen Boissoneau
comments: Awesome!

title: A must have
author: Jubillee Pierce
comments: I bought this for my daughter and my 7 week old grandson. They love it, she can do anything with him in it and it is very secure. She can even breast feed with him in the wrap which you can not do in a regular carrier.

title: We use this for our newborn almost everyday!
author: Casey
comments: I really can't say enough good things about this wrap. I love it! It is stretchy and soft and my newborn loves it. He is so cozy in there! I highly recommend. He is 7 weeks now and going in the wrap calms him down instantly.As a warning, the first one I received (from my Amazon gift registry) was a knockoff. No box and no tags. It was a super hassle to return to the seller, but when I purchased it I again made sure to go through Boba!

title: (spring/summer) between my body heat and the babies body heat you sweat like a beast
author: Amazon Customer
comments: VERY hot to wear in North Florida. (spring/summer) between my body heat and the babies body heat you sweat like a beast. But very comfy fitting and baby loved being in it

title: Love it!
author: Jessica
comments: Love it!! Baby is fast asleep in the Boba right now as I'm writing this review. I have a pretty short torso and I'm petite (5'0) and it fits just fine. Tying this thing is pretty easy too.

title: I loved this wrap the first few weeks after my son ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I loved this wrap the first few weeks after my son was born. I loved how close this kept him and he enjoyed very minute in there. However, he grew pretty quickly and I needed more support for my back. I ended up with an Ergo for Christmas and it is amazing. But for the first few weeks I think I enjoyed the light material of the boba and that he was so close to me.

title: Five Stars
author: Brandy
comments: Game changer!!

title: Love the Boba wrap
author: F
comments: Love the Boba wrap, takes a while getting used to wrapping it but baby loves it and finds it so comfortable he falls asleep straight away!

title: Great product! Exactly what I was looking for!
author: Kristen Harrell
comments: After shopping around and reading a lot of reviews for products similar to this one I decided the boba wrap would be the best fit for me. I was looking for a wrap to carry my 2 month old son that also allowed me to easily and descretly breastfeed as well. So far the Bina wrap accomplishes this. My son seems to be adjusting to being wrapped and carried very well there are still a few kinks to work out in the feeding department but overall I am extremely satisfied with this item. My only complaint is that I don't feel as covered when feeding as I would like.. but I am sure with time I will adjust and find the way that works best. My favorite part is the spandex feel of the wrap, it makes tying the wrap and getting my baby into the super easy!!

title: Happy boba baby
author: Esther
comments: I love my boba. It was a gift from my mom and I tell you it's worth the $$. My baby loves it and she always tends to fall asleep. The customer service was quick and prompt with my needs.

title: but my daughter hated this. Even when she was just a few ...
author: Jamie Conrad
comments: I wanted this to work for our family, but my daughter hated this. Even when she was just a few months old. I did like the length and the fabric. The fabric is soft and stretchy.

title: Five Stars
author: bp
comments: Vvery good product but has to be super tight in order to secure newborn and then bunches up

title: one of my favorite things about the Boba is that you can wrap ...
author: Gina Tia
comments: Besides me and baby loving it, one of my favorite things about the Boba is that you can wrap and tie this around your hips. The perfect thing to wear a baby with over tights and a tank top!

title: Nice while it lasted
author: Jackie O
comments: After reading many reviews, I settled on purchasing the boba wrap. The stardust pattern was very cute, although the plan color options were nice as well. There was a bit of a learning curve in figuring out how to effectively wrap, but I am good at it now. I love the quality of the material - I never felt like my baby was too cool or warm when she wore this. Only recently, at 18 pounds, am I seeing her slip too far to fast, so I feel like it is not as useful at 7 months as it was earlier. Additionally, I have washed this 3 times and I feel like each wash has worn the material down noticeably. I stained the material before my last wash, and Dreft was unable to take the stain out. I am glad I bought the wrap but wish I got a little more use out of it.

title: Way too much fabric. I hated it!
author: Kklinger
comments: I returned this. Gosh, everybody loves this wrap but I really didn't. It's SO much fabric. When I opened it up, my husband commented that it looked like I was wrapping myself up in a king sized bed sheet. I felt like it was too stretchy and just humongous on me. Instead, I got a Sakura Bloom ring sling and it's amazing! It's twice the price but so worth it!

title: Best ever for a newborn
author: Gamer Momma K.
comments: Best ever for a newborn! I used it almost daily until my daughter was too bug for it. Its a little hard to figure out at first but once you do, its fine. Great for grocery shopping, got lots of compliments too!

title: I love the idea of baby wearing but the wrap is ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I love the idea of baby wearing but the wrap is kind of awkward and nerve racking if you not skinny-I assume the thinner you are, the more the fabric will work with you. It made my shirt rise up too LOL

title: Love my boba
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I absolutely love my boba as does my baby! Helps put him to sleep, to soothe him and to just be happy

title: Its great
author: Cooper's Hawk
comments: I love this wrap, it's perfect for growing children and changing needs. Also gives privacy while nursing. The fabric is lightweight and stretchy. Washes great.

title: Love it!
author: Mary J. Badeaux
comments: My lo love been in it and it's so easy to use.

title: Five Stars
author: Joshua Smith
comments: Love there wraps have used them for the last 7 years.  Highly recommended!

title: Five Stars
author: Sukie McGowan
comments: Wonderful, very comfortable. Easy to use.

title: Marketing ploy
author: Taylor
comments: Cons:Difficult to figure out how to wrap it around you. Tends to relax when you're carrying around baby for a while. Good for when they're tiny but not for when they can start pushing back.Hard to fold by yourself. Makes a great blanket for when out and you forgot one at home.Pro: easy to wash

title: A must have fit all expectant mothers! We couldn't ...
author: MrsCollins
comments: A must have fit all expectant mothers! We couldn't have survived the first few months without our Boba. Four stars because the thickness made baby a little too warm during summer months.

title: This is not easy to tie
author: NhernandezHeredia
comments: This is not easy to tie! It's a pain if you think you can just tie and get off to the grovery store, save the money and get a baby carrier not a wrapp!

title: Comfortable!
author: Ruru
comments: Perfect and comfortable! I don't have my baby yet but I practiced wrapping and a 30 lb 3 yr old and it was amazingly comfortable!

title: Comfortable but impractical
author: S. Hilton
comments: I wanted to love this wrap.  I've only had an uncomfortable Bjorn carrier before, and it killed my back.  For my second baby, I wanted a comfy way to carry my high-needs son while nursing when needed.  The fabric is nice and stretchy and seems very sturdy, but I was pretty boggled when trying to figure out how to wear it.  The learning curve on these fabric wraps is steep...there is a ton of fabric dragging around on the ground (picking up dust bunnies!) and I had to watch several videos on youtube before I got it right and tight.  There were some tears of frustration, for sure.  Once I got it tight enough to feel ok putting my 5 week old son in, I realized how annoying actually putting the baby in was.  The fabric has to be tight for security, but that makes putting your baby in one leg at a time very hard.  He cried from me trying to maneuver him around all the folds.  I was also never able to get him low enough to ever make nursing a possibility.  But because it was comfy for me, I wanted to keep it for long walks, etc.  Then the deal breaker was when I tried to get him out.  Say your baby falls asleep while in the wrap and you want to put him down - there is no way to get a light sleeper out of this thing without waking them unless you unwrap it around them, which I wasn't comfortable with for safety.  So, when I thought about how long it takes to origami this carrier together and insert my baby while he's crying, I decided to return for a more comfortable and easy structured carrier that my husband could use, too.  I also didn't like the thought of having to go through the wrap process over and over again throughout the day.  I'm sure lots of women are experts at wrapping and laugh at my newb issues, but I guess you either love the wraps or you don't!

title: Not the most practical
author: Lauren B
comments: So. Much. Fabric.Don't get me wrong, once my 1 month old son is in it, he and I love the Boba, but it's definitely not the most practical baby carrier around. The sheer amount of fabric makes it difficult to travel with and put on in public places. I don't really want the fabric to touch the ground outside of my home, but it's virtually impossible to put it on without this happening. Also, while I didn't find the wrapping part challenging after the first time, trying to do this with a screaming, restless child waiting for you gives me major anxiety as it takes a minute to put on.Honestly, although I like using this around the home or for short walks around the neighborhood, if I were to go back and do my registry again, I would probably register for a K'Tan for the issues described above.

title: Five Stars
author: Patrick Dallas Ashmore
comments: Versital

title: I really like this Boba wrap
author: Megan
comments: I really like this Boba wrap, but I can't seem to make it fit as tight as Id like it to for my newborn. She is 7 pounds 4 ounces as of right now and slides down shortly after positioning her in the sling. I have to keep repositioning her further up closer to my chest.

title: Highly recommended! We love it!
author: Maria Richter
comments: I bought this for my daughter-in-law and she absolutely loves it! Our grandbabies love this wrap. I use it at work to demonstrate how to use the wrap to clients in beige. I have carried many babies in the wrap and they absolutely love it. It is great for toddlers too and they have a more structured carrier for babes over 35 lbs. No one can touch or take your baby. The wrap goes where strollers can't. I highly recommend this product!

title: Too thick.
author: Emily
comments: Way too thick of fabric. I would definitely go with a Solly wrap or an ergo baby carrier--much more practical.

title: Best. Wrap. Ever.
author: trezzybree
comments: This wrap saved me for the first 8 mths of my bubbas life! So amazingly comfortable and easy to use. Both bubs & I loved it. Can't wait to use it second time round!

title: Five Stars
author: Stacia K.
comments: The most comfortable and easiest wrap ever!!!

title: A must have!
author: S. D.
comments: Every parent should have one ready the day they come home from the hospital. I give one to all my expecting friends.

title: Great, but not so great
author: anon
comments: This wrap was bought for me as a gift...and honestly I wish the buyer would have saved her money.  As another reviewer stated, once it's on and baby is in, it's great - but the process of getting to that point is not only extremely confusing but also very frustrating to learn.  As a new mom who's already frustrated with the ins and outs of getting used to the change that is managing a house and a newborn, I cringe to tell that nearly every time I tried to put this on I ended up crying and giving up.  After several of these attempts and an instructional video found on facebook, I finally got the hang of it...but it was still something I had to do, undo, and redo before I got anywhere close to putting my baby in.  And my baby likes it - for about ten minutes, the time it takes her to overheat.  And this is in the dead of winter in central Pennsylvania, with a baby only 10 pounds.  I couldn't imagine when she gets bigger in the summer.  Overall, if you've used one before or have taken a class on how to use it, it could be great.  But for a first time mom and first time wrap user...not so much.

title: My son (2 months old) and I absolutely LOVE this wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My son (2 months old) and I absolutely LOVE this wrap. Easy to put on, after a few times of practicing. I love "wearing" my baby and knowing he's safe and secure!

title: One Star
author: Carla Lopez de Azua
comments: So big and I never got the hang of it.

title: Even my husband likes it
author: Rachael R Torrence
comments: So comfortable! My baby and I love it! My husband even loves wearing the baby! Instant nap for the little  one.

title: Five Stars
author: quisha s
comments: Love it. (:

title: ... have several top brand carriers and Boba is our favorite stretchy wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We have several top brand carriers and Boba is our favorite stretchy wrap. Perfect for little babies, and new beginners. Much better support and more airy than a Moby.

title: Boba! The best baby wrap ever!
author: Ipo
comments: Excellent wrap! Great for either mommy or daddy.  Basic, versatile, easy to use. Has worked and calmed our newborn each and every time, it's been a life saver so far.  Affordable, and in our opinion better then the overpriced Tula.

title: Could not be happier.
author: Mom
comments: First time mom here and I am absolutely obsessed with my Boba wrap. I have another brand wrap as well and found Boba much easier and it feels more secure for my newborn through now with my 6 month old. It was a little intimidating at first, so I practiced at home everyday for a week or two. It didn't take long for me to feel good at tying it and securing my baby in it and now I wear it everywhere. I feel so much more comfortable in it than a traditional front carrier and my little one loves it.

title: com and I absolutely love it! I used it for my cranky baby ...
author: Jodie Vasquez
comments: I purchased my green boba wrap from nickisdiapers.com and I absolutely love it! I used it for my cranky baby when nothing else helped to calm him down. I could take my youngest son to the grocery store and he would fall asleep in it while shopping. I also have an older son that I wish I had had it for him, but it made shopping trips so wonderful! I'd put the wrap on at home and when we got to our stops just get him out of his car seat and pop him in the wrap. No bulky stroller, no car seat to carry. In the summer months I would use it, but wear the top straps more like a tank top than shoulder sleeves and exposing their legs a bit if you get too warm, but it is breathable material so not too hot. I used it with the boy I babysit now and my youngest is going to be 3, so it can last you through multiple children and it is machine washable! I can't even.think of anything to complain about. It may take you 3 times of putting it on before it becomes totally natural, but once you know how to do it, it is easy and great!

title: It was perfect when she was tiny and still going strong at ...
author: jenny pert
comments: My baby absolutely loves the boba. It was perfect when she was tiny and still going strong at 5 months, 17lbs. Puts her to sleep instantly. It's also affordable and not over priced. Would purchase again and would give as a gift to a new mommy.

title: I love my Boba wrap
author: Beth
comments: I love my Boba wrap. It is easy to put on, easy to put baby in, and comfortable. The only thing is that all the fabric can get pretty hot.

title: Great gift, allowing a mom mobility while keeping her baby close (and sleeping comfortably!)
author: amrokar
comments: I gave this to a friend for a baby shower gift, and her son took to it immediately.  She used it in a range of ways as he grew.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Love using this when I need both hands and my daughter loves being toted around in it!

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I love this wrap. It is working great for my daughter and her baby.

title: Four Stars
author: Allison Breann Odle
comments: comfortable but not breathable!! kinna hot

title: I wanted to love this wrap but....
author: Kindle Customer
comments: I wanted to love this wrap but it's too darn complicated to wrap around me with the baby and it's hot.  If you use this in the summertime you better put on a tank top or a really thin t-shirt because it holds heat.  As a result, I have only used it three times.  I put it in the closet and purchased a baby bjorn.

title: Baby is happy so Mommy is happy!
author: Debbie S
comments: My baby is very attached to mommy and it makes it hard for me to move around and get things done during the day because he just wants to be carried all the time. Wearing my baby is the only thing that works and frees up my hands and allows me to finish some chores.5 stars because baby loves it and both mom and baby are happy.Minor issue:It's too long and it touches the floor during the wrapping process. I don't recommend wrapping  outside of your home as it touches the dirty floor/ground and picks up dirt and germs.

title: Save your back!!
author: The Smith's
comments: Love my Boba!  I use it all the time when I shop.  I can wear baby for hours with no back pain or feeling over heated.  I usually put my Boba on before I leave the house and put baby in whenever I need.

title: Absolute necessity. I bought a 2nd one because 1st is getting so much use.
author: Don
comments: I got this as a shower gift and was a little intimidated at first. I watched the tutorials on their website and a few on YouTube. You can practice with a bag of rice or sugar as a stand-in for baby until you're comfortable with it. Now that I've got it down, I absolutely love this product. I use it everyday, some days almost constantly. My 10-week cries like mad anytime he's put down so this wrap allows us both to stay happy and sane while I go about my business. I read some negative reviews saying that baby bounced around or they didn't feel like baby was secure. I guess not all wraps work for everyone but that's never been an issue for me. Baby is nice and snug against my chest and I can keep his head positioned so his airways are clear. He takes solid hour and a half naps in the carrier and wakes up happy and refreshed. When I get up in the morning I get dressed and immediately tie on the Boba wrap so I can easily get baby inside when he starts to fuss or get tired. I've worn my first baby wrap so much that I just ordered a second. Baby tends to drool on the fabric a bit and spits up sometimes so when one goes in the wash I can have another on standby. I use it THAT much!Some people have found a way to nurse while wearing the carrier. I've managed this once but I had to be sitting down and really struggle to get us both in the right position. I'm not sure how it could be done while on the go. But I never anticipated nursing while carrying the wrap so I don't consider this a strike against it. It would just be a nice bonus if I could pull it off.

title: Works great, but does get a little hot in certain ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Works great, but does get a little hot in certain positions.  I actually have to turn down the temperature a few degrees in my house when I'm anticipating wearing my son.Other than the temperature, which I can reduce by sitting in certain positions, it's very comfortable, and the baby likes it.

title: Like it, not in love with it!
author: Benjamin
comments: I bought this with high xpectations. It is not bad at all, but I can't give it 5 stars. It's okay, and we like it, but we are not in love with it.

title: Five Stars
author: V. Vasquez
comments: Works like magic for my newborn@

title: Third Boba purchase. Love it
author: K.Kron
comments: This is the 3rd Boba I've bought because they're just THAT wonderful. It took me about 20 times of watching the YouTube video of how to wrap correctly before I felt like I had baby secure enough but once I learned it I have used it almost everyday. Even in Texas summer, I just put any in a cotton tank onesie or diaper only. It's even better when it's raining out, I can finally fit under a regular sized umbrella again while wearing lol I love that I can toss it in the washer and I may have dried it in the dryer a few times by accident.....and it came out just fine(I'm not saying you SHOULD, just saying in mommie stupor it's okay if one does ;).)I love this product and I love it's convenience!

title: I got this and it was perfect, she would nestle in this like a little ...
author: Kela Francis
comments: My preemie daughter got discharged just around 5 lbs. I have the ergo carrier, but she got lost in it and always seemed uncomfortable. I got this and it was perfect, she would nestle in this like a little egg for hours

title: One Star
author: Rasha madani
comments: Was not comfortable. The material stretched so much that it was not comfortable at all

title: Hook, line, and baby hammock.
author: C. Anderson
comments: Putting this thing on is too much to deal with. The ergo or whatever brand back pack style is so much easier. Life is hard enough with a newborn, you don't need spend ten minutes tying a knot when you have other things to get ready when heading out.

title: I gave this wrap a good two week trial period
author: Matthew VavRosky
comments: I gave this wrap a good two week trial period, but never felt that my newborn was able to be positioned correctly in it.  I watched the 'how to' videos multiple times, and felt like I was wrapping it correctly, but when I put my baby in it she always seemed to slide down into positions that I was not comfortable with her being in.  I would end up feeling like I needed to support her with my arms still and was constantly having to readjust her.  I am going to try a more structured carrier that is hopefully easier to use and I am more comfortable having my baby in.

title: baby necessity. wonderfully made. cheaper than a moby
author: Travis Mast
comments: These wraps are wonderful. They are made from a high quality stretch cloth that allows you to wear your baby in a tight and safe way. There are so many different ways that you can wear your baby. I prefer to make sure that the head is supported with smaller babies and the larger babies usually like a little more freedom to move around.  Any of the you tube videos for the moby wraps can be down with these wraps.  The wraps are light weight enough that they can be used in all weather. If it is cold outside you can just dress your baby in layers before wearing him of her in the summer they stay cool enough to be comfortable.  I have worn my youngest under a large coat in the winter then running errands that way I could have them covered when running in and out of stores. The color of this wrap really does go with anything and can be used for a boy or girl. These wraps are really versatile and easy to use once you get the hang of it. I really find that my babies like to be worn because they feel safe and secure. The advantage for the mommy is being able to use her hands while wearing her little one.  I tie the wrap at home on myself and once I am at a store I just slip the baby into the wrap. That way I am not wasting time tying the wrap while trying to get into a store.  I feel that these wrap are an essential registry item for any mom with little ones.

title: I absolutely love my Boba
author: justthemom
comments: I absolutely love my Boba!  My son was a preemie and in the NICU we did a lot of skin to skin care. Upon coming home, my Boba was a lifesaver because it allowed my tiny son to stay close to me while I still went out my daily activities. My oldest child runs cross country, and I put my son in the Boba and run right along with her :) It is machine washable and very forgiving on my plus sized body. I highly recommend!

title: Yes!
author: Caitlin
