comments: Love this wrap! My little was secure and loved being close to mommy :)

title: I absolutely love this wrap
author: Megan
comments: I absolutely love this wrap. I've been using it with our newborn since he was three weeks (now 8 weeks). Being handsfree is the most amazing thing as a new mom, and Parker loves to nap in it. I gave it four stars though because it's not a true boba! It was shipped from China and there are no tags on it. :/

title: I like the idea of this
author: Nicole Rapp
comments: I like the idea of this! It looks comfy for the mom and baby but if you want to spend all that time wrapping yourself and the baby up go ahead. I found it kind of a hassle and it bounces the baby a lot with it being fabric and not a harness. I used mine once and it scared me that he would fall out so I have never used it since. Great idea though.

title: Perfect! I first tried a Moby wrap and then ...
author: Deborah E Young
comments: Perfect!  I first tried a Moby wrap and then got the Boba.  The Boba is SO much better.  The fabric is soft and has some stretch to it, so getting baby into a comfortable and snuggly position is much easier.  Also, the wrap stays in place and doesn't bunch up and sag, like the non-stretchy Moby did.

title: Two Stars
author: GCL
comments: Too complicated for me

title: Love my Boba
author: Nikae Carter
comments: Love my Boba! A bit complicated to use at first, but after watching a few videos I absolutely love it and so does my little one!

title: Awesome
author: Miranda Masters
comments: Love it

title: Love this wrap
author: Erin Bird
comments: Love this wrap. I have used a Moby wrap in the past and this is similar, although i like it much better. The fabric is nice and soft, as well as  little stretchy making it easy to get baby in and out. The fabric also isnt to warm which will make it nicer to ise in the summer months.

title: Terrific
author: Julia Shimko
comments: Super convenient and light weight! Easy to put on and carry babe. Very good quality.

title: Four Stars
author: Saul Goldberg
comments: Great

title: Steep learning curve but totally worth it!
author: Chelsea Wellman
comments: I cannot say enough great things about this wrap. I love the freedom is gives me and how secure my baby feels. She sleeps so well in the wrap. There was a steep learning curve but it's totally worth it and you cannot beat how easily it launders.

title: Two Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I'm not very happy with this. It stretches way too much. Moby would have worked much better.

title: Baby wearing MAGIC- saved my life, and my sanity. :)
author: Bride2be
comments: I love this thing. LOVE. I wish I had added the Boba wrap to my registry from the beginning so I would have it from the start.We had SO many nights with crying baby who was well fed, changed, clean, who just wanted to be rocked. for. HOURS.We would rock her to sleep- put her down- and then she would wake up and WAIL. This wrap soothed our baby like nothing else.I can breastfeed her in this. It has calmed her during her fussiest periods in the night. She sleeps and when she's not sleeping in it- she will just look at me calmly or look around the room. I am able to EAT and fold clothes!It is breathable fabric so she's never sweaty when I take her out of the Boba.For the people who say its so long to put on in parking lot etc‚Ä¶.Just wear the wrap out of the house and when you get to destination you can slip baby inside and make minor adjustments.For a first time user it took two tries to get it perfect for me and baby. After that it was like riding a bike and I could put a Boba on in my sleep.I think this is a must have for any new mom or dad. :)I'm wearing my sleeping baby as I type this!

title: Life Saver
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My LO would only rest while laying on my chest. It made it very difficult to get anything done. I order this wrap out of desperation and it proved to be a life saver!

title: Five Stars
author: erika edney
comments: Awesome carrier. Baby is snug and won't get pinched.

title: Not for me.
author: Amy Marconi
comments: This wrap is way too long to be functional in public. What I mean is.. I'm 5'9 and attempting to tie this according to the instructions- the wrap is dragging on the ground. Wouldn't be able to do this in a dirty parking lot or a potential dirty carpet elsewhere. You'd have to have it already on.. Not practical for me. Returned it and purchased an infant carrier instead. To each their own.

title: I wanted to leave be this but had to return ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I wanted to leave be this but had to return it. The fabric is very long and drags on the ground while you're trying to put it on. Also, I'm cold natured and I would begging to over heat while wearing this... So would the baby. Baby would start caring because of being too hot so I'd end up carrying her.

title: ... the rap as a gift and our friends absolutely loved it!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We gave the rap as a gift and our friends absolutely loved it!

title: WE loved this wrap for the first three weeks and then ...
author: GMC
comments: WE loved this wrap for the first three weeks and then it got a tear in it right in an area that is needed to stretch it out and it does not work well.  I"m bummed, thought we would use this throughout the life of our infant.  Need to go find another brand that hopefully does not tear as easily.

title: Essential
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My wife has used the Boba wrap almost every single day since coming home with our daughter. The wrap provides both a secure and comfortable hold on the baby. This allows us to go on a walk or do chores around the house while the cozy hold of the wrap gently rocks our girl to sleep. My wife loves how she can go about her day and still have our daughter intimately close. She doesn't have to miss a minute of bonding time.

title: Five Stars
author: suavemauve
comments: an absolute necessity if you value comfort

title: My daughter love this so does her dad
author: briannia graciano
comments: My daughter  love this so does her dad. Easy to use doesn't hurt your back like I found in other.

title: Hey.  Hey.  Hey.  Do it!
author: Christopher Monds
comments: Does you newborn wished to be held and cuddled, but you are ankles deep into a plate of nachos?Do you want to wash the dishes, but you also want some skin to skin time with your little love one?Desire to play Edward 40 Hands while your baby rests peacefully on your chest, unaware of you childish debauchery?Say no more!  This thing is a frackin' (Battlestar!) life saver!  Once you get over the initial complexity of wrapping this thing on, which took some time and the viewing of many YouTube videos, this thing becomes a dynamo!  Hands free it the place to be and nothing soothes a newborn like listening to your parent's heart beat, as it accelerates faster and fast from the stimulant use.

title: Meh
author: Scott
comments: Expensive for what it is but gets the job done. Definitely takes some practice to find the right fit and position. This also takes longer to put on compared to a more structured carrier, or at least it does for me :/

title: Five Stars
author: Jessica Foster
comments: This worked great!

title: Love It
author: D. DeForte
comments: Top notch, mom and baby both love using this.

title: Love this wrap!
author: Erica D
comments: I've had this wrap for over 4 months now and it works great! I used it when my baby was first born and know he weighs at least 16 pounds and I'm still using it. Once you get how to put it on it's really easy to use. It's nice because it keeps the baby close to you and when you are out and about and you don't want people touching your baby they can't because he's all snuggled close to you. It's easy to wash too which was nice. I have this and the ergo and I used both everyday!! It is a stretchy material so you have to put it on tight especially when they starting gaining the pounds. I've never tried the moby wrap, but I would imagine that they are very similar.

title: Fits perfect and baby is nice and snuggle with wife
author: Joshua Molina
comments: Fits perfect and baby is nice and snuggle with wife. The feel of the material is nice and comfortable. Would highly recommend this

title: Five Stars
author: TooLate4Coffee
comments: Perfect wrap for newborn!  My baby loves being wrapped in this, she falls asleep almost immediately on my chest.

title: love it!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My little one and I LOVE our Boba Wrap! She is 4 months old (15.5 lbs and 26in long) and still fits comfortably. The material is so soft and it doesnt get too hot (I wore it in August!) For the price,  you cant beat it.I rated it 4 stars because the wrapIs extremely long and after a while, the wrap starts feeling a little loose so I occasionally have to tighten it after an hour or so of wear.  I have to put it on at home before we leave so I dont drag it on the ground out in public.  My daughter is VERY comfortable in it though and thats most important to me.This is the only wrap I have ever tried so I have nothing to compare it to.I definitely recommend this product.

title: One Star
author: Jenni
comments: way to hard to use

title: Love!
author: Ashley Hagerty
comments: I love my Boba ! It's so soft and stretchy and makes it easy to complete tasks while holding baby!

title: My friend loved it so much that she bought a few different ...
author: Ginger S.
comments: I purchased this as a gift. My friend loved it so much that she bought a few different patterns and colors. She wears her baby everywhere. He one now and she still uses it!

title: Easy to put on
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Easy to put on, and extremely comfortable even with big hips. It keeps baby snug, close and secure. My favorite of all carriers.

title: Five Stars
author: Savanna
comments: I love the boba wrap!  It is very comfortable.

title: and they ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!
author: Felecia Chargois
comments: This was a gift, and they ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!!!!!!

title: Love this wrap
author: Erin
comments: Love this wrap!  I've never wrapped before, but my daughter loved it from the first week on.  Easy to follow instructions, and feels MUCH better on my back than other carriers I've tried.

title: Great product.  Even for plus size mom's
author: Shana Duncan
comments: I love my Boba! I  love how this product fits different sizes. I usually wear a 2x and it fits just fine on me. They give you plenty room to wrap around and secure your baby. Wonderful product, I wish I would have known about this with my other children. It makes being a mother of 3 a lot easier. And it looks and feels great I got one with a pattern. I get compliments on it all the time. My son loves being in it but dress your kid light, they will sweat.

title: Love this wrap!,
author: Melanie
comments: I love this wrap!  The material is soft and comfortable for both my little one and myself.  It's a lot of fabric, so it took a few try's before I became a pro at it.  I have 3 kids and have tried a lot of different wraps-this is one of my favorites.

title: Would recommend 100%
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This is seriously the best gift I received! My daughter is so cozy and loves being able to snuggle close and look around. I've used it since we came home from the hospital (she's 6 months now). I'll be using this as long as she fits and wants to!! I know a few people who have older girls (3 and 5 years of age) and they still love being carried in it!!! I would recommend to anyone to get this. It's supportive and comfortable, easy to put on and take off, easy to store, easy to wash, and gives you the ability to be arms free! Mine is the red one and it's a beautiful color!!! Seriously get this :] it's fantastic!

title: Five Stars
author: Char Jones
comments: It comes in beautiful colors and it's very comfortable. I would recommend it too plus size mother's.

title: Other than that it's perfect for going for a walk and such
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Would have given 5 stars, but the fabric was a bit too stretchy.  I could not lean forward with baby wrapped.  Other than that it's perfect for going for a walk and such. I kay have big babies and want to do chores while carrying him,  oh well  can't always have it all

title: I love my wrap
author: Nikki
comments: I love my wrap. It come with clear instructions on how to safely carry baby. I will say that this is made out of a pretty thick fabric. Think sweatshirt fabric. It is perfect to tote baby around this winter it keeps her toasty warm. But it may be a bit warm in the summer. I still plan to use it in the summer. We will just have to dress lite.

title: love love love
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I absolutely love my boba especially because my baby likes to be close to me at all times I got it when she was just a few weeks old and now she's 3 months and she still loves it and so do I. And I get so many compliments on it I will forever be grateful to the  Boba company =)

title: Favorite baby purchase
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Absolutely love my Boba wrap! I wore my preemie daily in the wrap from the time he came home until six months. I can still continue to wear him comfortably in the wrap, but because of the winter weather I found a borrowed buccal type carrier easier to put on in the cold parking lot.  Ofcourse, if planned ahead, I can always put wrap on before leaving house and put baby in at the parking lot.  I have also found, with more strength my little guy moves more and the stretch in the boba makes me feel less secure than earlier times and less secure than him presently in the buccal carrier. However, in contrast to the buccal carrier, the boba wrap continues to feel and look more natural and less like a baby backpack.  Bottomline... the price, soft material, and comfort for both me and baby, hands down, make this my favorite and most used baby purchase.  And, even if i only use the boba for first six months of my baby's life I still recommend this wrap to all mamas and feel its worth the purchase.

title: I love it!
author: Leticia G.
comments: My baby had colic and this was the only thing that would calm her down, when she was fussy. I love it!

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Great, comfortable wrap!

title: I have LOVED the ease of putting it on
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I've used this wrap for all three of my babies (my youngest is 8 weeks). I have LOVED the ease of putting it on. It's a stretchy material (unlike my experience with the Moby wrap) so it's easy to figure out how to make it snug enough for baby, but comfortable enough for mom. Also, it's so convenient to carry in a diaper bag. My kids are cozy and almost always fall asleep snuggled up to my chest. I have purchased Boba wraps as gifts for friends who have little ones on the way. I cannot say enough good things about this wrap. Get one! You won't regret it.

title: Love it! Experianced babywearer
author: Mamapea08
comments: I love my Boba wrap. Very useful with my newborn!

title: Great for baby, great for mama
author: Ryan Metzler
comments: I have mine for 6 month now and had been baby wearing my girl since she was born - it is a great way to have a calm baby and hands free at the same time. Baby seems to be very comfy and my back doesn't bother me. Only thing that I would notice - it's hot in summer. Like really hot! But I think it's true about any carrier - having another person tied close to you is not a cooling experience. Otherwise it perfect!Getting another one as a present for my friend, just because it is an awesome item.

title: Five Stars
author: H
comments: I absolutely LOVE my boba wrap it's so comfortable and I always receive lots of compliments!

title: Five Stars
author: Etj
comments: Best thing for a mom to free your hands and feel close to your baby!

title: Easy to use
author: Erin Anderson
comments: Easy to use.  My only complaint is that when the baby gets a little heavier, the stretchy fabric allows for him to slide down.  I had to replace this with something else when he got a little bigger.

title: Five Stars
author: Pennylane
comments: I use it every day! It's easy use light so I can carry it in the diaper bag. Baby loves it cuz it's comfortable. I can adjust it to support his head when he's napping.

title: Very nice concept and loved that I could breastfeeding baby inside ...
author: KirstRob
comments: Very nice concept and loved that I could breastfeeding baby inside it.  But, it was SUPER long and a pain in the ass to put on.  I know it has to be long for growing babies and babies of different sizes...but this prevented me from being able to put it on other than my house because I didn't want it to get all dirty and then put the baby in it.  I never wore it unless I knew I was running a ton of errands...when I did, I would just leave it on the entire time because I did want to go through the horrors of putting it on again.  When putting it on, the baby would get so fussy that it was a huge fight just to get him in it.  Once he was in, he was so cozy that when I took him out, it was a pain in the butt again!

title: I love my BOBA wrap
author: Mikey & Sharon Lehtinen
comments: I love my BOBA wrap. And so does my baby. I love being able to snuggle with him while having my hands free to do my chores.

title: Love my boba!!
author: Adila
comments: I love my boba...was easy to done it even with a screaming baby. Less than five minutes and now he is fast asleep right next to my heart. Did I mention I love it!!...

title: Five Stars
author: Katherine Rodriguez
comments: Love love love

title: Both my son and I love it! And I love that it doesn't kill ...
author: me
comments: Both my son and I love it! And I love that it doesn't kill my back to wear my son.

title: Love my Boba (sleepy) wrap
author: Jessica Kirkland
comments: Love my Boba (sleepy) wrap!! I chose over money since it had Lycra giving it the ability to stretch versus the cotton that sags.  Perfect fit every time :)

title: Close Enough to Kiss
author: Mummy Bear
comments: At first this seemed like a lot of fabric to manage, but after a couple of practices and the help of an online video I found the wrap quick and easy to wear and I now use it all the time with my newborn, in the house and out and about. It is soft, stretchy and comfortable to wear. Baby feels safe, close and secure as the wrap is good quality and nice and snug. The material is thick and I imagine it could be quite hot in the summer months but I find it nice and cosy in the winter. The wrap leaves me hands free to play with my older child, do jobs, shopping, etc. Money well spent.

title: Every mom needs this wrap!!!
author: vanessa
comments: Every mom should have this wrap!! Since my baby girl was born she's been it. She's 4 months now and I still use it everyday. I absolutely love it. The material is soft and stretchy so it hugs your baby perfectly. It's easy to learn the different ways to use it. I had the moby wrap and it was to stiff. My daughter hated it. I can go for walks do the laundry and wash the dishes. She even takes her naps in it and I'm able to do stuff around the house. I would definitely recommend this wrap.

title: loved this.
author: Clarissa1229
comments: Love love loved this for my preemie when he came home. It was great and definitely helpful for the first couple of months. At about 15lbs it started to sag so we moved to woven wraps.Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful!
author: Ashley
comments: Loved this wrap for when my daughter was a newborn.  Very comfy, easy to use.  I highly recommend it!

title: Looove!!
author: T. Mims
comments: I must admit at first I was frustrated trying to get it on but after a few tries it was super easy!! My baby loved being worn in our Boba wrap and it allowed me to get things done around the house. The fabric is a bit stretchy too so no worries about having to unwrap and rewrap a dozen times like some other wraps. It is my go to baby shower gift for any expectant mom!!

title: get a boba wrap!!!!
author: Violeta M Hernandez
comments: I absolutely love my boba wrap. Got it while pregnant and practiced wrapping before hand. After tou have some practice It takes only minutes to put on. I loved it soo much I got my sisters some for their babies! Highly recommend for tiny babies

title: Love it!
author: alejandra medrano
comments: I simply love this, it makes my baby feel snuggled and secured giving me free hands

title: Best Baby Carrier Ever!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My favorite wrap!!!! It has just the right amount of stretch to hold baby nice and snug. My baby falls fast asleep in it and hasn't fussed once. I have been using this wrap for 2 months almost every single day. Primary when I pick up my daughter from school. It keeps my hands free. I just put the wrap on myself before I leave the house and then just scoop up baby and position him in the wrap when I get to my destination. It's a lot easier to put on than it looks.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My new born baby would not sleep or calm down without it.EVERY NEW MOMS MUST HAVE

title: Most fabulous carrier out there for the first few months of baby's life!
author: amazonshopperhouston
comments: We purchased a hotsling, a babybjoern, an ergobaby with infant insert and about two weeks into our daughters life a boba wrap. This is our third baby and I really wish I had know about the boba wrap with our two older kids.Our third baby is colicky, it can be aweful - she has bouts of crying that seem unstoppable and it's as if she is in pain. The absolutely only thing that will get her out of her crying mode within less than a couple of minutes in 100% of cases is the bobawrap. She already calms down when we slide her into it, and often falls asleep within minutes. If it was up to her, she would be inside the bobawrap 10 hours a day. I highly recommend the wrap for families with high need babies or infants that cry a lot, it's been a life saver for us.POSITIVES ABOUT BOBA: Tying is less complex than it looks - watch the youtube video rather than relying on the instructions. You can keep the wrap on even when you are not "wearing" baby, almost like an extra layer or a poncho : ) Baby is really close to you and feels your body warmth and hears your voice, and is jiggled around whenever you move (slightly, not violently). In colder climates, the Boba keeps you and baby nicely warm. In comparison to most other carriers, the Boba is inexpensive and baby's weight is nicely distributed across your back/shoulders (if you tie correctly and spread the fabric well across your entire back). It's washable like a sweater and the material is soft. In comparison to the sling carriers (hotslings), it's much easier on your back and baby feels much more tightly tucked in.NEGATIVES: I don't think it's that easy to breastfeed while the wrap is on, and once it's off you have to find a semi-clean space to tie it on again (you don't want the wrap that goes right around baby's face to touch airport floors or public bathrooms), which takes a coupe of minutes longer than tying/untying babybjoern or ergobaby carriers. In hot climates, you are likely to get pretty warm in the boba wrap.Altogether, if you are going to buy only a single carrier for the first six to eight months, get this one! I am so grateful since without the BobaWrap our infant's crying spells would be lengthy and unbearable.

title: So easy to use and easy to reposition baby for nursing
author: Micah Bailey
comments: So easy to use and easy to reposition baby for nursing.  I was skeptical at first but absolutely love this.

title: Favorite, especially for newborns!
author: Sarah
comments: So comfy and warm for newborns in the winter! I could walk my dogs while wearing my newborn daughter in February and not worry about her getting cold, despite the constant wind where we live. Plus it is comfortable to wear! It can get pretty hot and sweaty though, depending on how tight you tie it. But that's a common problem with any type of baby wearing ;)

title: Love this! I thought most of these wraps looked ...
author: Nicole R.
comments: Love this! I thought most of these wraps looked too confusing to be able to put on quickly but this one is so easy !

title: One Star
author: MengSuChen
comments: Very very bad for holding baby, and very unuseful.

title: Amazing!
author: Asia M.
comments: This wrap is a life saver! I'm able to carry my babies in different positions, and discreetly nurse while I'm out in public. And it's very durable!  It's been washed many times and I was able to use it for 2 of my babies! (Yes it had it for over 2 years and it still works great)

title: Such soft comfortable material. I really wish I loved this thing
author: Fatima Berry
comments: Such soft comfortable material. I really wish I loved this thing...:( Was so difficult for me to figure out. Every time I followed the directions it NEVER came out right. I don't know why, maybe it is because I am tiny? 5'3 ? I have no clue but she sunk all the way through every time. It is so ridiculously long it's a pain in the ass to put on. Who has time to tie it all complicated when their babe is crying ?:(

title: Not for everyone.
author: Eric Nush
comments: Not as easy to use as other products. My wife still hasn't figured out the whole wrap thing. Nothing wrong with the product, but just not the right item for us. Make sure you know there's a few steps to get the whole wrap done properly. Not for everyone.

title: Looks easy to figure out
author: CW
comments: Looks easy to figure out, but it's really not. I haven't had time to figure out how to use it.

title: I found this pretty cumbersome to put on and it's too hot in ...
author: Heather
comments: I found this pretty cumbersome to put on and it's too hot in the summer. I got it instead of the other easier two piece wraps so my husband could use it too, but he almost never did because it was too difficult and hot. Like other people say, it's also really long so it's hard to keep off the ground when putting it on. So, if you are putting it on in a parking lot then it might get dirty. Also, I needed a mirror to make sure if was ok.

title: It's a great product if you can master the wrapping configuration and ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It's a great product if you can master the wrapping configuration and have a child that is accepting of the positioning. I failed at the wrapping configuration and my child disliked the positioning. I was not entirely comfortable with the configuration nor was I certain it would hold my child by the time I got to the point of enfolding her. We both were pretty frustrated by that point. Even if we had tolerated the hassle, it wouldn't have been a solution for us because our combined body heat AND the sticky heat in south Florida. Will resell it as I used it literally 3 times for a total of 10 minutes.

title: Thick fabric
author: Jeanna Bohm
comments: This is the first child I have used a wrap with but has been a lifesaver so far especially since she has been a little under the weather. Only complaint is that the fabric is much thicker than I expected and will be too hot for summertime use.

title: So sad. I wanted to love this thing but it ...
author: Jen
comments: So sad. I wanted to love this thing but it is way to stretchy. I get it as tight as possible and high on my chestu but when I put my baby in there he just sags down to my waist and I end up holding him up with my arms anyways.  Too stretchy to be supportive. Especially as they grow and get heavier.

title: Good but hot
author: Aly
comments: Decent wrap. Lot of fabric and it can get pretty hot. I usually have to undress my baby just to a diaper and then put the wrap on or we get overheated.

title: not easy to put it
author: Ahmed Lachheb
comments: Going to sale it or giving it away...not easy to put it.

title: Not bad.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Purchased this wrap before my daughter was born. I didn't use it until she was about 6 weeks old. She struggled a bit at first but I went about my errands around the house and within an hour she was asleep. Which was great!Pros:Soft fabricFrees up your handsPuts baby to sleepCons:If the weather is warm it can get really hot.Too much fabric. It will drag on the floor as you are putting it on. Which makes me hesitate bringing it outside the house.Ultimately, i am considering a sling wrap to replace this one. Less fabric and it looks like it will be more convenient when transferring my baby while out.

title: it's super easy. Very comfortable to wear and gives me ...
author: trufflepig
comments: Exactly what I needed for getting chores done with a little one. Seems daunting at first, but once you master how to wrap it, it's super easy. Very comfortable to wear and gives me both hands back!  For the money, it's great to have on hand...don't let the long fabric scare you, it's not that difficult after a few attempts.

title: Secret Weapon!
author: Tz7568
comments: My godson loves it! My inlaws went away for the weekend so I bought this for him as I am by far not the professional.  Naptime and bedtime  were a breeze thanks to this.  First time I used it he took an hour nap. Yay!

title: I love this wrap
author: Allison K.
comments: I love this wrap. It took a couple times getting used to how to put it on, but now that I've got it down I can get in on in 10 seconds or so. Having the ability to carry baby with me has allowed me to cook dinner and clean the house while keeping her happy. Most of the time she's sleeping and if not then she likes being right there to watch everything. :)

title: Stretchy material!
author: Avid Amazon Shopper
comments: The aesthetics of the wrap are similar to the other ones in the market but the material is very stretchy because of which I returned it.

title: Two Stars

title: Five Stars

comments: Love this wrap.

title: My baby love this..

comments: I love it !

title: New mom fave
author: Sherene
comments: There is learning curve you must master; You will need to watch video to use this product, the instruction can be confusing and it takes time to put on correctly. Otherwise my LO likes it and I like using it.

title: I feel in love with it
author: Amanda
comments: Its a little intimating when i first opened this however After figuring out how to use this ..I feel in love with it.

title: I love this wrap
author: Michigander
comments: I love this wrap! I don't know how I could do any shopping without it. My little one sleeps through the trip usually and if he doesn't, I'm able to bottle feed him right in my arms. This has already been worth the money for me and I've only had it for a little over a month.

title: Seems to be a knock-off product...
author: blazachic415
comments: I was very excited to try our Boba wrap after receiving it from our registry, but now we're pretty certain the one received from this link is a knock off. There is zero indication of it being a true Boba product - no tag/label like is present on EVERY Boba product you see. It's also not stretchy at all, so it's incredibly restrictive for the baby and very hot and uncomfortable to wear. Very disappointed that this is available, parading as a real Boba.

title: Five stars for appearance and ease of use
author: Annie Hiatt
comments: I love all things baby wearing and I do love this wrap. I will say that compared to my woven wrap, this wrap will give me a back ache after a couple hours of wearing. I think its because since these are stretchy, there is a little give that allows baby to bounce slightly, this just takes a toll after a while. That aside, I give five stars for: appearance and ease of use. If I'm going out shopping or to the in-laws or whatever, this is the wrap I bring along. Its so easy to pre-tie and wear in the car, then slip baby in when we get there. I haven't noticed my daughter having a preference.

title: The color is nice all is very good
author: Cynthia I. Hernandez
comments: The color is nice all is very good, just I think I a little big for me because I'm petite, but in general terms is ok.

title: Love, love my wrap
author: M.H
comments: Love,love my wrap!It is my to go gift for a pregnant women now! The only down side is it can get pretty hot on a sunny day !

title: She loved it!
author: KA
comments: Bought as a baby shower gift for my friend. She loved it!

title: Three Stars
author: Amazon Customer

title: I got this as a gift and we love this wrap
author: Ana212
comments: I got this as a gift and we love this wrap! Every time my baby is cranky and nothing I do calms him down, I put this wrap up on, put him in and he almost immediately settles down. He falls asleep in it within about 10 Min and can stay asleep until he gets hungry. Def a life saver. I love that I'm able to do things while carrying him in it. Only reason why I give it 4 stars is bc it Def took me multiple tries and youtube videos to figure this out. Every time I tried it came out loose and I would get frustrated but once I got the hang of it it's not difficult at all. Just takes some practice. Definitely a great gift to get other momma to bes

title: Not in a good way. If you are in a cooler environment ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: HOT!  Not in a good way.  If you are in a cooler environment and weather, this might be ok, but baby gets really hot as well as the parent.

I was looking for a wrap that would give him more support while he is young and found that the boba wrap is easily adjusted and comfortable for both of us.  It was easy to learn how to wrap it and I can put it on quickly wheny son is fussy.  It is machine washable for convinance.

title: Five Stars

title: My baby was born in late May so this was ...

title: Love love love this wrap
author: DeJa Clift
comments: Love love love this wrap, once I figured out how to wrap it its been great I second the other moms that say wrap it on you before you leave home and then you can just place baby in it when you reach destination and go! Easy as pie

title: Five Stars
author: Racquel McFarlane
comments: Use it every day almost. My baby is 8 months now and still falls asleep in it. Lifesaver!!!

title: This thing works like magic to calm a cranky
author: shwenga
comments: If I were stranded on a desert island with my baby, the one thing I would take with me is a boba wrap! This thing works like magic to calm a cranky, screaming, sleepless reflux newborn. It has kept me sane through raising twins. I have been using it for over 2 months now and wish I had another one so that when I put mine in the laundry I'd still have a spare. I tried the Seven Sling (naaa) and the Mei Tai carrier which is too large for a premature newborn, but might work well later. The Boba wins hands down. I love that it stretches just a bit, but can be wrapped snug so babies can't fall out the side. It feels very secure and comfortable and allows you to be totally hands free. It is adjustable so lots of different body types can wear it, husbands, caretakers etc. I had to watch the video a few times to learn how to put it on and it does take a minute to get it on right, but it is always worth the wait. Thank you Boba for providing an awesome product. If you can send me a 2nd Boba to Zimbabwe, that would be fantastic!

title: Great wat to carry baby
author: AdV
comments: Great way to carry our baby.  Now have three!!!  The baby tends to fall asleep in the carrier and frees up mommy's hands.

title: I used it to carry my 13. 5-year old ...
author: Toby's Mom
comments: I used it to carry my 13.5-year old, 13 lb dachshund when went short-distance hiking.  Still need to use one hand to support him, but I have the other free hand to hold on to things to support myself.

title: Love it!
author: Seshi Campbell
comments: I love my boba wrap. I get compliments on it every time I wear it. I suggest going on YouTube to watch how to put it on. I was intimidated by this wrap at first, but now it's second nature putting it on.

title: Three Stars

comments: Love this!I was skeptical because it's a cotton wrap and didn't feel safe without all the buckles and gadgets that a typical baby carrier.But I watched a YouTube video to help me with the instructions on putting in on and I love it.It's soft and comfortable for both me and baby.I highly recommend this wrap!

title: Perfection
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We loved this wrap when my baby was 4 months and under. She's grew way too quickly to use it longer! Boba has made my life as a mother easier and to me, that speaks volumes!

title: It's actually a gift for my daughter. She loves ...
author: Jen L.
comments: It's actually a gift for my daughter. She loves it - the material, the design is exactly what she's expecting with this order. Thank you!

title: Good wrap
author: Angela Covello
comments: You have to practice to get used to wearing it but it is comfortable.

title: Great for plus size Moms
author: A. CUNNINGHAM
comments: I began using this with my 3 week old, now 6 weeks. After looking through tons of reviews and You Tube videos, I settled in this one versus the Moby because of the slight stretchiness to the fabric. I am a large woman: 5'10, 3X tops, 24 jeans, large midsection. i was nervous that it would not wrap around me and tie properly due to my size, but it's perfect with a double knot in the back. I would not be able to front tie it, however. You have to pull it very taught when putting it on, so baby doesn't settle too much. Once I mastered that- in about 2 wearings around the house and walking the dog, it was perfect. Baby is secure, I feel totally safe being hands free and letting her hang out in there. I got black, which shows lot of lint, so may get another color soon!

title: My wife uses it every day and the baby enjoys ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My wife uses it every day and the baby enjoys it. She learned how to tie it the first day. Came packaged well with no defects

title: Good to have but not the lifesaver i thought it would be
author: Susan
comments: Not every baby will love this immediately but with Time mine hasn't minded it.  (Small tip: pat their bottom when you put them in to distract them). Cons? Quite hot! Otherwise essentially  one big long piece of stretchy  t-shirt material fabric  that you wrap in a specific way around your body before stippling baby in. One more note : people make it seem like your hands are magically free when using this but that's not the case. You still need to support baby with one hand. So that leaves just one, magically free.

title: Great wrap for my newborn who wants to be held ...
author: Melanie Sanders
comments: Great wrap for my newborn who wants to be held constantly. Wearing baby was the only way I could get anything done around the house.. Nice material with a little stretch. But it gets hot during the summer months and I find it to be a little pricey.

author: paulpolk
comments: When my wife doesn't want to use a stroller, she's using this spandex baby wrap. IT's convenient for her especially when she's breastfeeding our baby.

comments: Love, love this wrap. I wear it often and my newborn stays nice and cozy. For short amounts of time I even use a shoulder strap to help secure her head and neck when I need both hands. The fabric is very soft and sturdy. A great investment no doubt.

It's stretchy and soft, but very thick and hot. I can see how some may favor it, but I don't find it worth the purchase.

comments: This wrap is very well made and holds my munchkin nicely. :)

That way your straps aren't on the parking lot ground. I like that me or my husband can wear baby & this will be perfect till he's big enough for our Tula!

title: Not for me.

comments: Not for me. Don't know how other moms find this comfortable, I had the feeling the baby would come out on any holes, besides the fact that it takes a while to put on.

author: CZ

title: Five Stars

author: J.B

The only down side is that if you are hustling to get somewhere, which is often for us, setting up can be a bit tedious. It got better with time, but for a few weeks it was like solving a rubix cube every time we had to use it

title: Love this wrap
author: Destiny
comments: Love this wrap! My daughter is 14 months and fits in it just fine! Helps a lot whn we go on walks(:

title: Every Mother's Dream
author: KRO
comments: I wish I had ordered this sooner! Every mother needs one! This wrap is comfortable! It's very easy to put on. It's a little shocking at first to see all that fabric (it's long!), but once it's on you'd never guess it was a mile long. My baby stays tightly snuggled inside while I'm able to use my hands. I found that I have to put the wrap on nice and snug to keep my baby from drooping. You may feel like keeping it loose in order to put baby inside, but the material is very stretchy, so put it on snugly (not too tight, obviously). The wrap comes with instructions that explain everything well. I ordered the stardust wrap, and I love it! The design/color is exactly what I expected. Money well spent.

title: amazing!!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: amazing!!!!  My baby loved this way more than any of the other more expensive carriers out there!  Great for kangaroo care too!

title: Five Stars
author: Selena
comments: My daughter loves this wrap!!

title: You need this.
author: Clarissa Hawkins
comments: Baby wraps are AMAZING. Immediately puts my baby into a deep sleep no matter how tired/upset she is, AND I can get so much done while she is in her wrap- hands free! If you tie the wrap properly you definitely don't need to support the baby with your hands, as some other reviews state... they clearly aren't tying it tight enough. Don't be afraid to tie the wrap really tight, your baby likes to be squeezed tight! Her head stays up no problem, and she doesn't have a problem breathing. It is also very simple to tie, I only had to look at the directions once and haven't had a problem. Every once and a while I do have to readjust her body from outside of the wrap if she starts to slide down after a couple of hours of walking around, but it isn't inconvenient to do so.I used this yesterday to travel in the airport & airplane ALONE (just my newborn and I) and now I feel obligated to review. My baby slept the entire time I was in the airport and on the airplane, BOTH ways on my round trip. It keeps all of the germs off of her and keeps her sooo calm, even with all of the loud announcements on the airplane. You don't have to take the baby out through security, you can use the bathroom alone without any struggling, you have your hands free to carry a diaper bag (I carried a backpack), and you don't have to even worry about dealing with a stroller. Just popped her in the wrap when I got dropped at the curb, and kept her in there until I got picked up at the curb at my destination. Amazing.

title: VERY easy, comfortable, and secure.
author: Schultz
comments: Love love love. Super easy to use (after I looked up a video on YouTube that is... Took me one try after that and now I'm like a pro), very comfortable, and baby loves it. He sleeps everywhere we go when he is carried in it. I live in a very hot environment and he wasn't any hotter in the wrap than he would have been out of it. I actually liked that I could keep him close to me so I could keep an eye on his body temperature better than if he was in a car seat or something. We don't have strangers trying to touch him when he is in the wrap, and the ends work as a built in burp rag to wipe his mouth if he spits up a little while I am wearing it. It is great, I can go grocery shopping or to the park with him in the wrap, and I don't have a car seat to lug around. If he gets fussy in the wrap, I'm already holding him to comfort him so I don't have to take him out of a car seat and lug an empty car seat around. Compared to my first baby where we carried a car seat and diaper bag around everywhere we went, this is much easier and WAY less stressful. I like the stretchy fabric because it's definitely a one size fits all. Anyone of any size can use this wrap for their baby. It also grows with my baby, three months using it and he still fits just right. I don't feel like it sags or doesn't hold him well - it is completely up to you how tightly your baby is wrapped! As long as I tighten it the right amount for me and my baby before I put him in we are both secure and comfortable. Its very easy to use. I would recommend this to anyone having a baby - it really makes life with a baby much easier and comfortable, for mom and baby! I have tried other carriers and I feel like my baby is more secure in this by far.

title: wish it worked for me
author: DMK
comments: i always see women wearing these wraps so effortlessly, but i don't get it. i have tried a few and always returned them. they are uncomfortable and i feel like the baby could fall out at any moment. maybe i am just not doing it right. returned!

title: Five Stars
author: Rachel McNamee
comments: I use it everytime we go out it is so simple and quick to put on

title: Baby loves the wrap!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This wrap is great. Works well and the material is soft like a thicker jersey sheet. Now that I have it I use it every day. Baby stopped going down for long naps during the day so I put her in the wrap after she eats and has a diaper change. She usually falls right to sleep and if she doesn't she is still calm and I can get things done. The Boba wrap instructions only give you one basic position to put baby in (for safety and liability reasons I'm sure which is understandable). I YouTubed other positions because if awake, my baby wants to look out instead of facing me. The wrap is certainly long enough. I didn't go with some other wrap options out there fearing they might not fit around me. I definitely recommend buying this!

title: Super comfortable and easy to put on
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Super comfortable and easy to put on. Baby loves it and so do I! I've worn this for hours at a time without an achy back. Great way to keep my newborn close while chasing my 2 year old around. Makes grocery shopping with multiple kids easy.... A must have item!

comments: great and big and stretchy

title: Five Stars

title: Five Stars

comments: Love!! Great carrier for the price.

title: Five Stars
author: Roberto
comments: good

title: It seems to be a solid and soft wrap. ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It seems to be a solid and soft wrap. However, it is a little difficult for me to get it wrapped around my body and take it off, and my baby won't stay long in it. Comparing with BABYBJORN Baby Carrier Miracle, the latter was more user-friendly.

title: Five Stars
author: Allison Raiha
comments: I love this. I needed some freedom with having 5 kids.

title: Two Stars
author: Francis
comments: used it twice. too hustle to use.

title: Awkward and inconvenient
author: The Raus
comments: Quality of the fabric was good, but I could not for the life of me get this wrapped around me at the right tension for my daughter to be comfortable in it, even with the help of my husband.  I never felt that I could get the knots tight enough where it didn't seem like she would fall right out of it.  (She was about 3 weeks at that point.)  The fabric dragged all over the floor while I attempted to put it on, and as I intended to use this at the grocery store and outdoors, it grossed me out that the fabric would have been dragged all over dirt and germy surfaces while I tried to put it on.  The fabric, while nice, was quite thick and much too hot for August in the south.  Returned and purchased the Baby K'Tan instead, and VERY happy with it.

title: Such a beautiful wrap, love the print and was able to ...
author: Melanie S
comments: Such a beautiful wrap, love the print and was able to wrap my twins in it when they were newborns! Still use it now for one baby at a time.

title: Five Stars
author: Fabian Martinez
comments: Excellent!

title: Five Stars
author: Fatima L. Garcia
comments: Wonderful. Fits perfectly

title: Very comfortable and easier to put baby in
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I really like this wrap. I also have the Moby, and I prefer this one. The Moby is just not very flexible, and my baby gets super hot in it.The boba is more breathable and easier to put the baby in. I also feel like I have more mobility with it than with the Moby, since this one you can adjust it better, I think.The only thing is that you need to tight it really tight, or else the baby will start to sag. It took me a couple tries to get it tight perfectly, but once is done, it's so much easier to wear the baby!

title: I'm really happy with this purchase
author: Sarah L Stone
comments: I'm really happy with this purchase! It did take a few tries to learn how to tie it, but now it's the only baby carrier I use. The weight of the fabric is on the heavy side which makes me feel like my baby is really secure, but it isn't ideal for the hottest months. I've found a lot of other baby carriers to be kind of uncomfortable on my shoulders of back, but no problems with the boba wrap! I also like that it folds up to be relatively small, you can always bring it along just in case you need it.

title: I absolutely love it! My daughter loves it and slept through ...
author: AShetty
comments: I absolutely love it! My daughter loves it and slept through a whole get together in it cozy and snug. All this when she was just 2 months old.

title: Three Stars

title: Five Stars
author: Laura

title: Two Stars

title: This is wonderful for baby carrying in the winter or in colder ...
author: Allison
comments: This is wonderful for baby carrying in the winter or in colder places. I live in Florida so I can't really use this year round. It also takes a while to put on. Not too long but it can be frustrating when your baby is crying. Another thing is that when you are done tying there are tails hanging. But I just tie it around my hips one more time. If you wrap your baby snugly enough, it holds very well and is comfortable. There are no straps to dig into your shoulders and the weight is distributed easily

title: LOVE the boba wrap
author: AmazonMama
comments: LOVE the boba wrap. This one is stretchier than the Moby, which I prefer for new babies. It is long, and not easy to put on in public without having the ends drag along the ground. Put it on at home before you get in the car, then just load the baby in once you get there. Easy :)

title: Best thing ever!

title: love it! Baby does too

comments: Awesome wrap! My 7 week old loves this- he falls asleep instantly when I put him in this so I can do chores or whatever I need to do.

title: awesome stretchy wrap!

comments: I used the boba wrap from new born to about 3 months. Totally love the soft jersey type material.  Easy to wrap and nurse in. I even got my husband to use the wrap and he loves it as well. We also use the 4g carrier and love to use both for different days/situations. Awesome customer service! I recommend boba to everyone !

title: stretchy fabric
author: Tonya
comments: the material is almost too stretchy. I have to make it super tight before i put baby into it so she is more secure.

title: Babywearing for the win!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I wish I had figured out how to use this sooner! A great way to keep your squish warm and snuggly and still get things done. We did upgrade to a Boba 4G as my daughter grew. Now that I have a toddler and baby #2 on the way I will be using this so much more than I did with my first. If you're unsure how to tie it watch YouTube videos or check out a local babywearing group. You'll be so glad you did

comments: It's just a lot of fabric and wrapping. I never felt I was wrapping it properly or tight enough. I like this product but felt myself always grabbing my other carrier (Infantino Unison Newborn Carrier, Light Grey)

title: Light and very sturdy
author: Michael C.
comments: Perfect  for small babies or 0-3 months. Great alternative to a car seat carrier and travel system for short trips and walks. Helps caretakers continue to do small tasks while baby is adjusting to his/her new world. Helpful online tutorials available.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Love my boba wrap ! Just wishing the fabric wasn't so long.

title: Okay when Mama is sitting
author: Lisa Fowles
comments: I have the Moby and this Boba. The material on the Boba is very stretchy and no matter how tight I try to wrap it, the baby falls to where I can no longer kiss his forehead. I even had to put my baby on the ground at Target to re-wrap myself tighter! Because he sits so low, it does hurt my back and I feel like I always need one hand supporting baby while I'm standing, which defeats some of the purpose of the carrier. This wrap works fine when I am sitting, such as when I'm typing this review. The material of the Moby is tighter and the baby feels more secure to me. Still, I am looking into getting a sturdier carrier such as the Ergo.

title: Loved it when he was a newborn.
author: Cassie Lelis
comments: This wrap was really amazing and worked super well in the beginning when my son was a newborn. But once he hit about 10lbs it wasn't nearly as comfortable to use, and he'd start to slowly slip down the more I'd move. It also really only worked if he would fall asleep, because once he started to be able to move his head around he didn't want it tucked in, but was too little to hold it up himself, and there was nothing else to support his neck. It's also super hot in the summer, and my son would be soaking wet when I'd pull him out of it. Kinda gross... I switched to a Tula which works WAY better for us!

title: ... numerous slings and this one is by far the best one. It is so easy to use
author: Stephanie Carlson
comments: I have tried numerous slings and this one is by far the best one. It is so easy to use. I love it!

title: I despise this wrap! The material is so loose ...
author: S. Jennings
comments: I despise this wrap! The material is so loose that within twenty minutes my daughter is 5-6 inches lower than where she started. Save your money and get the Maya!

title: My wife is very happy with this wrap
author: Mike
comments: My wife is very happy with this wrap. Works better than the Bjorn for us right now. It did take about 3 times to get the hang of it but now it is very easy to use.

title: Love
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We love our boba wrap!! When baby gets fussy I wrap her the tighter the better she loves the extra snuggles and mommy does not mind either

title: Life saver!
author: RMONROY
comments: Life saver! My daughter is 2.5 weeks old, and is going through a stage where she is just starting to get distracted by things and wanting to stay awake forever.. The result is that she only wants to sleep while being held. I've tried the swing, a cradle, letting her cry... Nothing keeps her asleep more than an hour during the day. My husband puts her in a regular carrier, and she sleeps really well, but the carrier was way too complicated for me to put her in by myself. We've been doing the pick me up and change me, feed me, put me to sleep and start it all over again in 30 minutes dance for several days - till yesterday. The Boba wrap came. I practiced tying a few times while baby fussed in her swing. The directions are a little tricky, but it's not hard to tie once you understand them. Just look closely at the pictures.  The second time I tied it I felt confident enough to give it a try. Out came fussy baby from the swing, I slid her into the wrap and her reaction was "Waaahhhhsnoooooorrrre!" She didn't even finish getting out a whole yell before she fell asleep! A miracle! I've been wearing her in the Boba for several hours.  She fell asleep almost as soon as I put her in it. She loves the fact that she is right up against me, and so do I. It feels like holding her in a snuggly blanket - except I get to eat my lunch and type this review while using it!  I love having her close enough to kiss her while I get stuff done, I don't feel like she is shut up alone in a room all day now. Not to mention it's great for that mommy paranoia - is she breathing? Is she ok? I just lean down and listen, and I can hear her snoring away. I love this wrap.

title: The one complaint is that it isn't always super quick or easy to wrap it around me
author: Heidi
comments: My baby fits in it well. The material is soft. The one complaint is that it isn't always super quick or easy to wrap it around me.

title: Do not recommend
author: Mr. V
comments: Pain in the butt to use, my wife stopped even trying to use it after about 3 uses.  There are much better products on the market for the same cost, save your money and move on.

title: Patience
author: Vanessa Flores
comments: It is super long and a pain to wrap on in a hurry. I still have yet to master the right tightness.

title: Perfect for a winter baby
author: S. Beers
comments: Perfect for a winter baby.  Had a January baby and wore this all the time from January - March.  He loved it and it kept him warm.  Once spring arrived I had to switch to a lighter fabric and put this carrier away, it was way too hot to wear.

title: Unfortunately we had a summer baby, so the boba ...
author: dhijana scott-harmony
comments: Unfortunately we had a summer baby, so the boba wrap will have to wait a bit longer to get much use as she and her dad both got very hot inside.

title: Product is Heavy and Extremely Long!!!!
author: kim
comments: I did not like this product at all!!! It's very heavy and extremely LONG it can stretch the length of my living room and more!!!!! So taking it with you is difficult bc its not very compact. Imagine trying to put a VERY large blanket in your diaper bag ....yep just not possible. And it's very thick and my baby did not like it.

title: Comfortable and Super Easy to Use!
author: Terry Larson
comments: I love this wrap!!! I am plus sized so it's been hard for me to find something that was truly comfortable. I've tried backpack style carriers and two different slings but nothing felt right. When I received this I watched a youtube video to see how to wear it and got it on the first try. Then I placed my wiggly 18 month old baby boy in it and he immediately cuddled my chest and settled down. I purchased this for our new little boy due in December but I was eager to try it out and even my 18 month old enjoyed it. Can't wait to try it with my newborn!

title: Not easy to put on
author: Bass
comments: Not what I expected.  Not easy to put on.

title: Love, Love
author: Alena Nieves
comments: Love, Love, Love the wrap. Although this specific one was a gift for a friend. I've used 3 wraps before and love them so much I buy it for others! It takes a minute to figure out the wrap the first time, but the babies love it, it provides good shoulder and back support and leaves your hands free!

title: Amazing! Everyone loves it
author: Marti G.
comments: I bought this, not really sure if I would use it. My daughter is 3 months now, and use it just about every time we leave the house it is my favorite thing!Pros: easy to use, soft stretchy material, baby falls asleep right away, can do multiple different holds (newborn fetal position or feet sticking out the bottom), I get compliments all the time, vritually hands free, can have head in or out, can use it while in public going to the bathroom, machine washable...Cons: baby's head is against your chest, and if you're skin to skin baby's head gets all sweaty (I just put a burp cloth there and it solves that problem), it's about 25 feet long so if you put it on out in public, it touches the ground (I solved this by putting it on at home and just wearing it in the car) I can't think of really any cons that aren't easily solvable

title: Best wrap for your baby, hands down.
author: Nicole Powell
comments: I own this ans a Moby wrap, and if you are looking for a wrap so you can wear your baby, this is the one to get, hands down.  The fabric itself is very soft, and it even comes with a little bag that you can wad it up and put it in to take with you (and it doubles as a nice little "pillow" while in the bag if you need one!). The Boba wrap will stretch a little because there is some spandex, while the Moby is 100% cotton and doesn't stretch at all.  To me, the stretchiness of the Boba wrap is a major plus, because when I started out with my Moby, I could never get it situated so that my daughter was in the right position.  I never have had this issue with the Boba.  My daughter is almost up to 18 pounds now, and she still likes to ride in this.  You can carry your little one up to 35 lbs in this wrap.Also, this is really wonderful if you have a cranky baby; I have heard mothers who have colicky babies say how much this wrap helped.  This was a lifesaver for me when my daughter had her first round of vaccinations, because she got really fussy and wanted to be held the whole time.  Not only did she settle down once I put her in the wrap, but she actually fell asleep and got some much needed rest.Don't be intimidated by trying to get the wrap on you the correct way; there is a bit of a learning curve, but the Boba company has some very helpful videos to help you figure out how to wrap yourself up, plus there are lots of videos on Youtube.

title: Five Stars
author: Ash
comments: So soft!! And the color is lovely!

title: Five Stars
author: Kindle Customer
comments: works as described.

title: The K'tan is better.
author: LauraF
comments: The boba wrap was not for me. It was very hot and I didn't like all the extra material. I ended up returning the boba and purchasing the K'tan. I absolutely love the K'tan!

title: Panned by both Mom and Baby
author: Milo
comments: First, let me say that I understood how to put the wrap on.  That was not the problem.  And I appreciated the simplicity of the design--a single piece of cloth.  I also can't take issue with the price.  However, I simply HATE wearing it.As others have said, it is very hot even on mild days.It also doesn't fit me comfortably.  I am a petite woman, 5'-2" and 115 lbs, and I have to put the wrap on VERY tight in order for the baby (all 10 lbs of him) to not sag to my hips.  (If he's that low, he's not well supported, and it causes my back to hurt).  Additionally, the wrap causes all of my shirts to ride up and my pants to ride down.  Not exactly the look I'm going for post-pregnancy.And last, but not least, my usually mild-mannered baby loses his mind when I try to put him into this thing.  A fifteen minute walk to the local coffee shop is preceded by 20 minutes of hysterical crying, while I attempt to contort a frantic baby in, under, and through the various layers.I'll be scrapping this and giving the comparably priced Infantino Fusion carrier a try.

title: Great baby shower gift :)
author: A. Acker
comments: I bought this for a friends baby shower and here is her review: The user instructions that come with are not clear enough but after visiting the manufacturers website and watching the demonstrational video I finally have the hang of it. My baby likes the wrap except right after he has eaten and we are finding it very difficult to nurse him while in the wrap. The fabric while being a great stretchy material is very hot and I have been unable to wear it outside of the house in the summer heat. Overall it is very well made and I think we are getting the hang of it!

title: The baby whisperer
author: Brandi Betterton
comments: Boba wraps are fabulous! My newborn falls asleep within 5 minutes of being put in it. It is great for the newborn stage!

title: Nice but material could be better.
author: lyrah
comments: Material is very hot.

title: Four Stars
author: Tiffany Feria
comments: Once you get the hang of it's great. Could be too flexible at times.

title: Totally Worth It
author: Teo Frank
comments: My daughter loves this sling. She said it was "totally worth it". She likes the way it feels snugglely with her baby.

title: Five Stars
author: Tara M. Poulsen
comments: Love love love this wrap and so does my baby!

title: Excellent product
author: DS
comments: Excellent Product. Material is very good. My husband uses it a lot. Baby sleeps comfortably in the wrap. It is not exclusively for women only.

title: AMAZING, GREAT QUALITY, EASY TO USE!
author: Asha Taylor
comments: THIS PRODUCT IS EASY TO USE AND AMAZING FOR PREEMIES!!! MY CLIENT LOVES IT AND IT WORKS WONDERS FOR HER! It works on diverse body times and supports the child wonderfully in all kinds of movements. It is comfortably worn and there is a LOT of fabric, so do not think that you are "too large" for it: it will fit.The color is rich, it's easy to wash! Highly recommended!

title: I absolutely love my boba wrap and so does my LO
author: Sheena Del Rosario
comments: I absolutely love my boba wrap and so does my LO. I can't wait to use it more when it starts getting colder here in San Diego. I highly recommend all new mamas to invest in this wrap. It's a lifesaver.

title: Five Stars
author: Maria Cruz
comments: I love it.

title: maybe i would like it better if my baby had liked it but ...
author: Ashley Albin
comments: maybe i would like it better if my baby had liked it but she hated it and since i am short it was a lot of material to handle without getting it all over the floor and dirty and then you dont want to put your baby in it because it has been all over the dirty floor. I also felt like my baby was not supported enough and that she got way too hot with my body warmth. Maybe my next baby will like it more but i am not impressed

title: I Love that it fits in my diaper bag
author: Seabrie
comments: My baby loves this! I Love that it fits in my diaper bag.**it says it's for babies up to 35 lbs but I disagree. My baby is pushing 20lbs now and it's not very comfortable.

title: once I do my baby just does not seem comfortable. It does not go on easily to me
author: Tina
comments: I have trouble getting the boba on, once I do my baby just does not seem comfortable.  It does not go on easily to me.  I will try it once my baby gets slightly bigger and if it is still like this I may return it.  I am also nursing and my daughter does not sleep all the time.  She prefers to see the world.

title: I didn't know if I would like this wrap because I have tried a non-stretchy woven ...
author: athena vida
comments: I didn't know if I would like this wrap because I have tried a non-stretchy woven and not liked it, and also a moby and not liked it. But I LOVE it! It's really cute, and basically idiot proof. If you put it on at home, you can wear it in the car and not have to fuss with it once at your destination. I gave it 4 stars though because in warm weather both you and baby will be cooking. But I think that's true with almost any wrap or carrier, especially if you "run hot" like my babies do!

title: I like this wrap although it does tend to get hot
author: Emilyann B
comments: I like this wrap although it does tend to get hot. Baby gets hot and he wakes up cranky usually. Other than that it is a good wrap.

title: Finally, a wrap my baby likes!
author: Iris
comments: I am so thankful for this wrap! My baby hates the carrier and he didn't like the khatan, but he likes this! We went grocery shopping one day and used this, he actually fell asleep! For a picky baby, this wrap actually works. I like that I didn't have to worry about sizes like the other wraps. Also, I was able to put it on with no problem. Overall, this wrap is very useful for me!

title: ... has got to be one of my all time favorite baby items
author: IrieMade
comments: The Boba wrap has got to be one of my all time favorite baby items. I received the Boba wrap 7 years ago when my oldest was a newborn. I found that it was the perfect solution to carrying him around during errands and soothing him when I needed to get work done around the house.During errands, I found it much easier to leave the car seat in the car and  wear baby instead. Not only did I wear him while out and about, but most of the day at home. Since he refused to lie down by himself, most of our days were spent with him wrapped up and burrowed in mama‚Äôs bosom.  Thanks to the Boba, I was able to work from home and complete daily tasks around the house hands and tear-free.P.S. The Wildflower print? Gorg!

title: Baby liked it a lot when he was a newborn
author: RD
comments: Used this for my 6lb 10oz newborn. It works great and he really likes it. I have not had any success being able to BF with him in it - there's too much fabric to deal with! A little complicated to put on - I often put it on before we leave the house because I have a hard time putting it on without dragging the fabric all over the floor. I have found that baby likes it a little less now that he's bigger and I think that's because there are 3 layers of fabric over him and he gets too hot (so do I).

title: Good carrier, It is just a little complicated to ...
author: cassie barry
comments: Good carrier, It is just a little complicated to learn how to wrap it and time consuming, compared to the carriers with the buckles and straps.

title: Five Stars
author: Lauren Gathercoal
comments: Bought as a gift. She uses it everyday.

title: Great for younger babies!
author: Jada Q.
comments: I wish I had this with my first baby!  This wrap is what dreams are made of!I purchased this before the arrival of my second child wanting to see if it really helped or not.  This was the best $40 I ever spent.  There was a bit of a learning curve as I have never used a wrap before, but once you practice and understand, you can wrap your baby in less than a minute.  My daughter loved it as a newborn.  She fell asleep quickly and stayed asleep.  The fabric is a stretchy jersey cotton that molds to your baby creating a comforting and secure embrace.I live in Hawaii, where it reached about 90 degrees in the summer, and this wrap did not get as hot as I thought it would.  I only used it to run errands, and not for outdoor activities such as hiking.When I take the time to wrap it properly and not make the fabric all crunched up behind my back, it is very comfortable.My daughter is 5 months old, and still prefers this to my Tula.  Buy it now, you won't be disappointed.

title: Mom had a big smile :)
author: Judi Dooley
comments: The new parents seemed excited to receive it...can't speak to it first hand.

title: Like a kangaroo
author: Evie
comments: I bought this six months ago and I didn't want to write a review until I've given time to see its durability.When a baby is born, the new sounds, which are louder than in the womb, frighten them. The warmth that they felt, is gone.  The security they crave for being tucked doesn't feel the same. But the Boba Wrap offers this security and warmth.My baby felt most calm in the wrap. Because of the elasticity, I wasnt afraid she'd suffocate from the pressure other wraps may give. But don't be fooled that though it's elasticity prevent suffocation, it still kept her neatly tucked and she didn't jostle like other babies my experience from other carriers. And that's why I love it.My baby grew with this wrap. As a newborn, she was tucked in a fetal position to make sure her spine wasn't feeling pressure like other carriers do by holding by the bum. The way it wraps around her also kept her warm.My LO is now 6 months old/19 lbs and I still use it. I can even breastfeed her by pulling the ends to give more room for her to scoot down. It's an easy clean through the washer and dryer. My sisters even say that it looks like a fashionable top so I don't feel weird walking around in it if she's in someone else's hands.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Great Product

title: Very easy to wrap
author: Andrew Siedenburg
comments: Very easy to wrap! Excellent carrier, I used it for my 9 lbs chihuahua during a long hiking trip, worked perfectly.

title: Love! My go to baby shower gift!
author: Wendy
comments: I love my Boba wrap. Easy to use and keeps baby snuggly close. I nurse in mine, use it for skin to skin in the early days and then for hands free play with toddler while infant sleeps. Best stretchy wrap out there!

title: Five Stars
author: Nikkol N Stuart
comments: Very comfortable and easy to use!

title: Love boba!
author: Earthfeet
comments: Loved my boba wrap!! Great for newborn and toddler. Easy learning curve. Recommend for new parents and newborns.

title: BOBA WRAP‚ô•
author: Summer Hayes
comments: I love my Boba Wrap‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• dont go anywhere without it. I had a moby wrap with my last kid but didnt enjoy it as much. The Boba is much softer and stretches better. Has lasted much longer too. I wash it by itself then hang to dry . I don't know what I would do without it!!!! Forget carry a heavy car seat or stroller around.  Plus all the compliments I get, just can't say enough good things about this wrap.

title: I love it and so does my daughter perfect if your ...
author: Zhara Jaffrey
comments: I love it and so does my daughter perfect if your breastfeeding and need to whIle your out. Great for colicky babies kept mine calm... she fell asleep like a baby

title: Five Stars
author: Amy Cooper
comments: Absolutely love it!

title: Excellent
author: RAVINRAJ PATIL
comments: This is a very perfect match for new born n mother. It helps to carry baby with mother wherever she goes.

title: Great product
author: evan
comments: Love the Boba wrap. It's a life saver woth my newborn! I'd never get anything done without it and I always feel like my NB is secure.

title: Five Stars
author: Shannon
comments: Love my wrap

title: Wonderful for parents of babies
author: Allison
comments: The first few months of having a baby are, obviously, really difficult. The boba wrap was a lifesaver. I knew if I needed to hold my baby but be hands-free, especially when the stroller was inconvenient to take, the boba was perfect. So easy to carry around in a diaper bag, and once you get the hang of it, it takes about a minute to tie around you. I love that it can go from person to person, since it's customizable sizing. Most importantly, my baby loved it. I highly recommend to any new parent.The only downside is because the fabric is so stretchy, it can sag if it's not tied tightly enough. ALSO: I love the little bag it comes in. I just lost mine, and I'm looking for a replacement, but I doubt anything will come close.

title: Tough to use on a very hot day but otherwise wonderful - easy to wrap
author: Kate
comments: works so well to comfort baby.  Tough to use on a very hot day but otherwise wonderful - easy to wrap.

title: Not for me
author: Elsa B
comments: I really wanted to like this wrap.  I just don't.  Learning to tie it was easy, so that wasn't the problem.  I just didn't find that I was able to do much more with it on than without it.  I still always had to support my baby's head if I bent down at all, and it got hot/sweaty inside easily.  Also, unless you tie it and wear it before leaving the house, it seems kind of unrealistic to tie it once you get somewhere- the fabric is extremely long and would be all over the floor and whatever else.  It also seemed to always loosen up no matter what- not so much that my baby would fall out, but enough to just make it sort of uncomfortable for both of us. I exclusively breastfeed, and I really don't know how the heck anyone breastfeeds with ease in this. I'm going to return this and try a more constructed baby carrier.  Otherwise, maybe wearing my baby just isn't for me.

title: Awesome product and very convinent.
author: Shagolowso
comments: My wife really loved this product.  She's like it way more than any of there other ones out available at babyrus or target.  The price is right and there are so many ways to use this wrap.  Look in YouTube for different ways to wrap your baby.

title: Impractical and uncomfortable
author: Amber Overstreet
comments: I bought mine at baby r us after reading all the reviews. I returned it. My son did not like being in it. There was also so much fabric, I just didn't see how I could use it outside my home without getting it filthy. I did not feel like the wrap was very comfortable either.

title: It's easy to wrap it up but I would rather something ...
author: Shelly
comments: It's easy to wrap it up but I would rather something already put together I don't feel safe having my baby in a stretchy fabric sling

title: This product is great if you have a baby who wants to be ...
author: Polka Dot
comments: This product is great if you have a baby who wants to be carried all day. It allows you to be hands-free** to do other things around the house. The material is sturdy. One piece of advice -- the instructions that come with the product are confusing; the videos on Youtube are more helpful. I just watched one video on Youtube once and was able to master getting the product on.**In my case, I was not completely hands-free; I used one hand to support my baby's head. I was afraid of the baby suffocating (as happened to someone I know) so I made sure the baby's head was visible and not wrapped up.

title: But very easy to put on
author: Marcy
comments: I haven't had the chance to use it yet, as baby is not due until December. But very easy to put on. Can't wait to use it!

title: LOVE THIS, HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
author: April
comments: Love this product!!!!  I use it daily to keep baby close and mom hands free to care for my other 4 children!!!!  I would definatly recommend this to all my family and friends!!!!!

title: Love the thickness of the fabric
author: glouise
comments: Love the thickness of the fabric, HATE the length of the wrap. I did extensive research on the best baby wearing gear and arrived at the decision to try this wrap. The length is absolutely unreasonable! IF you are out and about and want to put this on, you will be dragging the material on the ground. I live in SF and the ground is gross here, so I cannot imagine trying to put this on while outside. If you put it on at home and then wear it around until the baby is ready to go in, then maybe you'd have a chance... but who wants to wear 5+ yards of fabric when there's no baby inside. One day i put the baby in to carry him to the car, then when I put him in his carseat i took one of the shoulder straps off... hoping to preserve the  wrap for when we arrived at our destination... when we got there i couldn't tell which strap i had taken off and i'm pretty sure I ended up putting the strap that was supposed to go around my waist up on my shoulder. So... it's complicated to deal with.The fabric is very nice and thick.. it's a bit stretchy, which makes it good in some ways and not to good in others. The baby felt very secure with the thickness of the fabric, but the stretch of the fabric caused his little head to bounce when we we walking (and yes, i had it wrapped very tightly). I also noticed that the wrap would start to sag even after wearing it while seated - we weren't walking or putting any stress on the wrap and yet it still started to loosen.If there was a baby k'tan made out of this material, then i would have arrived at the perfect baby carrier...but that doesn't exist. In the end, I made my own baby k'tan out of thick sweatshirt material that had some lycra in it. I returned the boba wrap.

title: Five Stars
author: Alyssa Bray
comments: Nice instructions. I bought as a gift and not personal use.

title: it's a great product.
author: Jennifer Shelley
