comments: I had to watch a YouTube video to really get the wrap down.  It's a little complicated.  Other than that, it's a great product.

title: I think it's excellent for Toddlers
author: RG2015
comments: I think it's excellent for Toddlers. It was very difficult for me to put my newborn into it. Also with a crying baby, it was very stressful to get it on.

title: Five Stars
author: c
comments: 5 stars!

title: A MUST-HAVE!
author: Karen Correa
comments: I just started to use my Boba Wrap for my one month old baby boy and let me just say.. WE ARE TOTALLY IN LOVE! I'll be honest; it took me at least 50 views of "How-to" Youtube tutorials to really get the hang of the wrap. And it's not because it's hard to wrap around (that's actually very easy after a few trial and error adjustments), but the hard part was placing my newborn in the wrap with assertiveness. I chickened out, but a month later for my babies' first pediatrician visit, I decided to give it a go... and now I can't see myself running any errand without it! It's way easier than having to carry my entire click and connect stroller system, especially when it's something fast (although let's face it, no errand is fast anymore once you have a baby). If I had anything negative to say about this product is that the material can get a bit hot for both you and the baby. I also get annoyed that the fabric always sweeps the floor when wrapping it around; it's pretty long! But the bond and comfort between you and your baby is so rewarding. WE LOVE OUR BOBA WRAP.

title: Baby loves it!
author: Bobbie Priest
comments: Tons of extra fabric if you're small, but my baby loves it!! I wear him around the house when he's fussy and he goes right to sleep! I also use this when grocery shopping. Takes a minute to put on, but worth it for a content baby.

title: Its ok..if you dont mind a lot of material.. Just watch video on yuotube to use it
author: Miranda
comments: Love the boba wrap, my baby enjoys the closeness, and i enjoy the closeness and that i have my 2 hands free for whatever i need to do...Only issue, it took me time to learn how to use it. Instruction Booklet that comes with boa, doesn't really help, i had to watch a video (and a lot of times) on YouTube till i finally got it. If I could change anything about this wrap it would be the amount of material.. It's tooooooo much.. When out and about, I've preferred not to use it because of the task of wrapping myself.

title: Five Stars
author: SBigelow
comments: Fits great and the little guy loves it!

title: Two Stars
author: Amanda Spangler
comments: Too difficult and does not fit my body right, too long!

title: This is great for when I have things to do around the ...
author: Jennifer Jimenez
comments: This is great for when I have things to do around the house but my little one still wants to be held. This is the best price out there!

title: I love my Boba Wrap
author: RenHin
comments: I love my Boba Wrap. I always thought things like this were kind of silly until baby #2 arrived. It's comfortable, easy to use and feels secure for the baby. I was able to carry my baby in the wrap while able to attend to my toddlers needs. I highly recommend one of these!!

title: Baby Wrap
author: Carol M.
comments: Bought this for my daughter, and I returned the item due to the fact she said it was too hot.

title: great for mom and baby
author: John
comments: I have a car seat that doesn't come out of the car to be used as a baby carrier so this has been a great thing to have. I love that it has a stretchy material to it so it doesn't have to be tied perfectly, and the purple color is beautiful. The fabric is very soft, and I'd say about a medium thickness. I wore this during the summer and was warm, but it wasn't too bad. over all I would defiantly recommend.

title: The best carrier for new babies!
author: MeganH06
comments: This is a must have for newborns. We have an ergo carrier but could never figure out how to use it early on, even with the infant insert. This wrap was perfect for my fussy baby who needed to be held all the time! I was able  to get some housework done and hold him at the same time!

title: ... out lol and the material was heavy and felt super hot. Can't imagine using this in the summer ...
author: Sarah B
comments: Couldn't figure this thing out lol and the material was heavy and felt super hot. Can't imagine using this in the summer you'd sweat to death.

title: Must have
author: StephS
comments: Absolutely love this wrap! My daughter does too, I'll admit putting it on is a bit annoying in the parking lot because it's so long but definitely worth it. I can shop while my lust one is fast asleep snuggly against my body.

title: Four Stars
author: Laura Jordan
comments: It worked great for newborn but eventually I didn't use so much anymore

title: Love it! Watch wrapping instructions on You Tube
author: Coca-colaFever
comments: Love the Boba! I wanted to use my laptop while keeping an eye on my son. He's 3 weeks old & 8 lbs. I watched this you tube video that had very easy & explicit instructions: http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=AiqgBbuXgS8 I highly recommend this video over the Boba brand videos since those are without clear instructions. Anyways, after practicing the wrap, I can wear my baby & work on my laptop!

title: Easy to use
author: K. Monson
comments: Works well! Easy to use. If you are having troubles figuring it out just look it up on YouTube there are tons of tutorials!

title: I really tried to like this thing
author: Marieva
comments: I really tried to like this thing, I really want to like it but I can't.  It's not that it is complicated to use--actually it's quite the opposite once you get the hang of it.  The thing is that it seems I can never get this thing tight enough for my now 7 lb baby (he was a little over 5 lbs when he was born).  When I try to stick him in it he just starts sliding down and I'm afraid with as much moving as he does he is going to flop right out of the thing.  I'm debating if I am going to return it or ask someone who has experience wearing their baby if I am even tying this stupid thing right, which I'm pretty sure I am.  But as of right now I'm not really impressed with the product.

title: Cant say enough great things sbout it
author: Taryn
comments: I purchased this before my son was born. With my daughter, I had used Moby Wrap and with him I figured I would try the Boba wrap to see if there was any difference. The biggest difference in my observation is that the Moby wrap is slightly thinner fabric. So if it were me, I would purchase the Boba wrap for a Fall/Winter baby or just a generally mild temperatured climate. Our son was born the 25th of August, and it works great for us.I cannot say how much I love this wrap. If I had gone without it, I'm not sure how we would have made it. Baby wearing, for both my babies was the key to happy babies and thus a happy home. I love that it's lightweight and easy to pack away without taking too much room up. I'm not one who likes to pack heavy. I also LOVE that it is so easily washable. You just throw it in the wash and you're done. I like the navy color as well because I wanted something that my husband would be comfortable wearing as well and didn't draw too much attention.My son loves being in the Boba wrap. I think it's great that it mimics their time in the womb with a snug warm place to cuddle up in, and in addition, they were used to feeling the away back and forth when their Mama walked and they get Rhett same sensation while being in the wrap. It's an instant calming technique for my son. I loved it so much I got it for a friend for her habit shower too. This will be my go-to baby gift because I know it will be loved.

title: Dissapointed
author: Jessica
comments: Bought this wrap because of the good reviews.  I couldn't wait and was really excited to give it a try myself.  When it arrived, I watched the instructions on YouTube.  Did everything right, but when I put baby in, she seemed uncomfortable.  I figured I give it time until she got used to it, but she never did. :(  Used it maybe 3 times total.  The 3 times she stayed in it she was already sleeping so I could put her in.  If she was up, she would not want to stay in.Overall, wish I would have spent the extra money for an ergo 360 carrier instead of wasting my money on a wrap I only used 3 times (an hour or less each).

title: Love!!
author: Jennifer
comments: I bought this as a gift for my best friend and she absolutely loved it!! Great purchase.

title: I like it but never used it much
author: Cassie
comments: I like it but never used it much.  My daughter always seemed to slouch down lower and lower as I was wearing it.  I tried my best to wrap very tightly and she would still keep dropping.  I felt the need to hold on to her with one hand when bending over or with much movement, and she around 12 lbs at the time so I know it wasn't a weight problem.  She did love being in it though.  It was comfortable to wear around the house and easy to figure out how to wrap with the instructions provided.  I really wish I had tried another less stretchy wrap or some sort of carrier.

title: love it
author: Three peas
comments: Love it. My little P feel so safe in the wrap

title: Easy to use!
author: Ariel
comments: Great for carrying baby! Easy to use, baby loves being in it. It's very soft too.

title: LOVE IT
author: Clayton
comments: I absolutely love my Boba Wrap. I use it when I'm grocery shopping or walking, even around the house to wash dishes or when getting the other kids ready for bath or bed I can keep the baby close while still caring for my other children. That way I'm not divided running back and forth from one room to the next checking on one kid or the other.

title: Loved wearing my baby from newborn to 3 months.
author: a-mooney
comments: Loved the wrap after I got myself wrapped but with a crying baby wanting to be held it was a pain to get wrapped just right. Also if I was going out shopping I would have to wear my wrap around just in case my baby woke up crying so I could quickly transfer him from his stroller/carrier to the wrap. I do love how close the baby is to you in this wrap compared to a structured carrier. It did get a little hot wearing the baby outside for walks but overall enjoyed the wrap and worked well when the baby was 3 months and younger and also when the baby was sleepy.

title: Can't wait to wrap my baby!
author: Judith
comments: perfect desing, smooth fabric, love the color! I'm sure my baby will be so comfortable in it as soon as she borns.

title: Hurts my shoulders a bit now that my little one ...
author: Kendall G.
comments: Hurts my shoulders a bit now that my little one is not so little anymore (8 months) but this was a necessity from 5 months and younger for those cranky days. I still use it from time to time now.

title: Must Have For all Moms
author: mayer
comments: I have never written a review before, and I purchase many items on Amazon every day that I find very useful. I just never felt so compelled to comment as I do right t now. I am completely head over heels over this baby wrap! I decided to research baby wraps as I just had triplets (yes you read that right!) and never had a moment without a precious bundle in my arms. I love holding my babies, its just that my arms would feel weak after an hour or so and nothing much else got done. I ordered this one cause the reviews looked good and so did the product. I was more than a bit skeptical to say the least. Fast forward a few weeks. My babies are in love with this as much as I am. As soon as I put one in, within five minutes, they are sound asleep! My husband keeps joking and asking if there if some kind of drug in it! It seems more comfortable to them than my arms alone! They go from sobbing to being perfectly content in a matter of seconds, and from there to la la land in a few minutes! Right now I am holding of the babies all wrapped up and I'm loving it. It's so comfortable and my back doesn't hurt and all. I just did a few loads of laundry and tidied my room and I am as calm and relaxed as this little guy in the wrap. And while I was a believer in this from the first time I saw it's greatness, it took about 3 times to get the wrap done perfectly, but now it's a breeze and I put it on and off many times daily. This is a luxury and a necessity all at once. Mothers of multiples and singletons, this is a must have! Ok now, I'm gonna go out for a walk. Just myself and my cozy wrapped babe.

title: The Boba Wrap is by far the most-used baby gift ...
author: Lane Henderson
comments: The Boba Wrap is by far the most-used baby gift that I've received! It has been invaluable for soothing, toting, and protecting my little bundle!

title: Great
author: gabriela sanchez
comments: Comfortable,  easy and really helpful!  100% recommend

title: Love it! It is heavy
author: KWalker
comments: Love it! It is heavy, not great for summer but should keep my baby warm in the winter. It will take a few tries to get down wearing correctly though. Came promptly and with instructions.

title: Better than Bjorn!
author: N. Loutsenhizer
comments: My number one new mom purchase. A best bet!  Easy to transport, more flexible and less expensive than the bjorn (I have that too). This wrap has allowed us to go out to dinner while my baby sleeps. I accomplish housework while she naps!

title: Five Stars
author: ilayda
comments: Love it

title: Life saver!
author: Stephanie
comments: This Boba Wrap was amazing while I used it! My baby had Colic so when she would get super fussy I would just throw this on and put her in and she would almost instantly calm down. I was actually able to get some stuff done around the house and play with my three year old without her screaming. This was a life saver! I wish I would have gotten it earlier, but I had a different kind previously that really hurt my back so I didn't think I would use it, but to my surprise this didn't pull on my back! We would go on walks, do dishes, yard work, etc all with her wrapped up in this and happy!

title: Hands Free And Fabulous!
author: Laura
comments: I received my Boba wrap as a baby gift for my youngest and TRULY wish that I had used it with my older babies when they were small.  It was great and easy for travel.  I used it until he reached 15-16#.  While the wrap said that it works well up to 18 months and 30ish pounds, I found it harder to get a tight wrap as he became older and wanted to look around more.  It was a life saver for the newborn/not mobile infant stages though.

title: It is awesome, right now it is too hot for it
author: Isabel lobel
comments: It is awesome, right now it is too hot for it, but I am sure I will be using it everyday once the weather cools down. Baby loves it!

title: Five Stars
author: Christina De La Torre
comments: Love this. So easy to use.

title: Five Stars
author: Lauren Callaghan
comments: great product!

title: My baby and I both felt more comfortable in the boba
author: Michelle W
comments: I prefer the boba wrap over the very similar moby. The boba has a little stretch to it, where the moby does not. My baby and I both felt more comfortable in the boba!!!

title: Perfect for squish
author: Dawn Daley
comments: Great for when my daughter was a newborn. I would have worn longer but she was born in mid summer with some of our hottest temperatures and it is a warm wrap.

title: This wrap was perfect when my babies were small
author: Jessica Sliva
comments: This wrap was perfect when my babies were small, but once they started moving around more, I didn't feel like they were secure enough. My son was very wiggly & almost fell out a few times from thrashing around. It was kinda complicated to get it wrapped tight enough to keep my babies in.

title: i tried it on inside the house but havent really ...
author: mommahlovespink
comments: i tried it on inside the house but havent really used it because its summer and the fabric makesme feel very hot

title: Five Stars
author: Maria
comments: awesome item

title: Love this wrap
author: K. Raymond
comments: Love this wrap! It does get a little warm on hot days though. The instructions that come with it are very easy to follow and I had it wrapped on my first try.

title: Not what I anticipated
author: Chuck
comments: Based on reviews, I thought I would love this. I found it cumbersome and obnoxious. My newborn ate like a bird so each time I had to take it off and readjust. It sagged easily and I had a hard time getting it tight enough. I returned it and got a different style of carrier.

title: Five Stars
author: Fuegos4
comments: My daughter likes it a lot.

title: Five Stars
author: Mildred Negron
comments: Loved it!!

title: very hard to put on. needed two people to ...
author: hassan patwa
comments: very hard to put on.needed two people to get it right.

title: It is very easy to use
author: Alison Garces
comments: My 3 wk old Baby loves it! It is very easy to use.

title: Okay, but hot!
author: Alex S
comments: I like this product ok but I do prefer the happy wrap. The boba is a pretty thick material and its stretchy which makes it hard to get tied just right. It would feel tight until I put my son in it, then it stretches so much it doesn't feel stable like he will fall out. Also, the thick material makes it bulky in the storage bag so it takes a lot of room in a diaper bag, and it's hot! My son doesn't like it yet because he sweats instantly. Maybe it will work this winter

title: I love my Boba!
author: Eliza
comments: I use my Boba all the time. It is so much better than other carriers because it forms to you and your baby. It gives me the ability to get my chores done while my baby wants to be held, which is all the time :). I highly recommend this carrier.

title: Five Stars
author: Heffrd
comments: Greatest thing ever

title: Very happy with the boba wrap!
author: Joshtalgia
comments: My wife uses the boba wrap when she's doing household chores (vacuuming, dishes, et al) and brings our little guy along with her. She's very satisfied with how easy it was to learn how to wrap everything up. Our baby doesn't take long to fall asleep when he's in it.

title: Not for the 10 pound baby
author: Courtney N
comments: My son is a big boy, and we were not able to use this much at all.  I got this a month or so in, he was probably 13 lbs or so.  It seemed like no matter how tight I stretched it, he was so heavy it sagged down too low.  I also was trying to wrap it so tight, he was very squished and not a happy camper!  This is probably great for a more average size baby, but if you have a bigger baby, probably you want to give it a miss.

title: I love my BOBA
author: Sararah Massey
comments: I love my BOBA! I have a Bijorn also and it was just way too bulky to wear. As soon as I wrapped my 3 month old up close to me he was soooo content and fell asleep! I love that my arms and hands are free to do what I need done while still bonding with closeness to my baby. We are both happy!!

title: ... to put on correctly but once it's on it's comfortable & the baby feels secure
author: Karen
comments: Very time consuming to put on correctly but once it's on it's comfortable & the baby feels secure.

title: great for small babes
author: Lindsay Y.
comments: I loved our Boba! It works great for newborn babes and small 3-4 month olds, but I prefer SSC carriers for 4+ months so we stopped used our Boba wrap.It was so comfortable and easy to use. The instructions were great, I had to YouTube for different holds but it was all pretty easy. It was easy to nurse in as well. The fabric does tend to loosen up as you wear it, but it wasn't a big problem. Easy to wash and take care of.

title: Buy this!!
author: Jen
comments: As a mother to a newborn, I was willing to try anything to comfort my baby while also allowing me to get a little housework done and get up off the couch! This wrap was a lifesaver. The minute I put her in it, she calmed down and after a few minutes usually feel asleep. It was also much easier to use than I imagined, and being petite I was worried it might be too big or too much fabric but that it not the case.  I am only 5' tall and had no issues with too much fabric or the wrap being too long, just tie it extra around your waist and you are good to go! I have used other wraps but I like the fabric of this one as it  has some stretch too it, and also the wrap actually fits back into the bag which is not the case of the other one I tried!! I love the flower pattern and overall this is one of my favorite baby purchases so far. I will use this for many months to come.

title: Wishing for a more lighter version that can circulate air...
author: Kristine Cruz
comments: It's a great wrap especially when I'm doing house chores while wanting to comfort my baby. However, my baby and my chest sweats like a bullet due to the heat being produced from our bodies which is worsen by the wrap.. :( I wish there is more lighter one to avoid yoo much heat and sweating...

title: I love it! I always steered away from wraps because ...
author: Liberty Y.
comments: My first and last wrap. I love it! I always steered away from wraps because of how complicated they look but trying the Boba wrap on with my infant really changed my world. Greatest investment I've made so far in babywearing!

title: Great product for babies!
author: Tyler Z.
comments: It is pretty difficult right off the bat for my wife to be able to do this by herself for our newborn.  But it is a quality product, and once we get it all tied together it works very well!

title: makes my baby very hot. we live in florida ...
author: Corina C
comments: makes my baby very hot. we live in florida. i cannot use this if my baby falls asleep in it I wake him up when i take him out

title: Perfect
author: CLIFTON A. GORE
comments: This was a baby shower gift and so perfect for the mother to be.

title: Five Stars
author: Tiffany K
comments: Love my Boda. Comfortable,  fits all sizes, easy to use!

title: Not for me.
author: JB
comments: Did not like. Returned it right away.It was just too much. I will stick with my Tula.

title: and its the best carrier that I've owned
author: AlmaDgo
comments: Was delivered quickly, and its the best carrier that I've owned! My Baby was put to sleep once I put her in the wrap!

title: Love!
author: anastasia345
comments: My baby, currently 8 or 9 lbs, loves it. Instantly falls asleep and says comfy for up to a couple hours.I like having my hands free and, while shopping, keeps the shopping cart open for groceries.Videos on YouTube were helpful to learn to tie it.

title: love this carrier!
author: that one girl
comments: This is my favorite carrier by far. It's comfortable to sit in, which was my baby girls main complaint with my other carrier.

title: Excellent product!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Best newborn carrier I have ever had! Soft, easy to use and a total comfort for my little peanut. When my son was just 3 weeks old, I spent 3 days in NYC. He was in the Boba wrap the entire time. He never fussed once. We both loved the closeness and security that it provides.

title: Filled with sleepy dust!
author: Kisha Burton
comments: Love my Boba wrap! It's great for little babies and sleepy bigger babies!

title: The best way to carry baby
author: Destiny Woodhouse
comments: This is the best wrap! It's so comfy for me and baby and I get compliments on it everytime I use it. I highly recommend this wrap

title: Great carrier for babies too small for soft structured carriers!
author: Becky Ann
comments: I love this wrap!  It's made of lightweight, stretchy material that snuggles baby close. I used it with my daughter as an infant, and still like it now that she's three months old. Great for babies too small for soft structured carriers!  I do prefer it over the moby (same type of carrier) because it is much thinner and less hot to wear.  I will put it on before leaving the house, then just slip my daughter in and out as we run errands. It makes grocery shopping with an infant easy, since you don't have a car seat taking up space in the cart AND it keeps them happy!  Just make sure you put it on nice and tight, because it will stretch once the baby is in it.

title: I've used my boba for three kids now and love it so much
author: Alex Minium
comments: I've used my boba for three kids now and love it so much!  My ten month old still loves it and hates all other carriers. It hasn't stretched out, is a breeze to put on once you get over the initial hump of "what the heck am I supposed to do with all this fabric?!?!", and has literally been a lifesaving in so many situations. You can nurse in it, and I take long walks (a few hours long) while wearing my baby in it and don't have any issues (and my back typically hurts a lot after carrying babies). It is my one baby must have that I tell everyone about!

title: Love it but DAMAGED..
author: Bambi
comments: Whwn I opened it the stitches are unraveling which sucks but I don't want to wait 2 weeks to get it replaced. Other then that I love it the fabric is breathable and comfy. If it wasn't for the damage I'd give it 5 stars.

title: She said she loves it because it is so comfortable and easy to use
author: Sherrie R Marlin
comments: Sent this to my daughter for her new baby girl. She said she loves it because it is so comfortable and easy to use.

title: Meh.......
author: Nicholas
comments: We purchased the Boba wrap because it had the best reviews and most everyone had glowing comments to make about this product. Unfortunately our experience with this product has been less than satisfactory. Maybe it's just our baby but she just does not like being in it. I thought maybe I was wrapping her incorrectly so I had someone teach me how to do it but still no luck. So the moral of this purchase never buy something for your baby based on reviews because each baby is different. Some might like it while some might hate it.....

title: Perfect wrap for a newborn
author: Ruth T. Barrett
comments: Perfect wrap for a newborn.  My daughter has a fussy 3 week old baby.  His happy place is tummy time on her chest.  Now she can carry him around, hands free, while he is safe and snug and happy.  My daughter is a big girl but the fabric is plenty ample and has some stretch to it, making it comfortable for both mother and baby.  Excellent product!

title: Might be useful if I convert to Islam
author: lariza garcia
comments: Bought it and then bought an Ergo carrier so it did not get much use. Might be useful if I convert to Islam.

title: Loved it.
author: Celina
comments: I absolutely loved the Boba wrap I had. It was like a little slice of heaven. I passed it along to another mother who was expecting a little one.

title: in love with it
author: Javier vera
comments: Absolutely, in love with it! Best thing out there

title: Great for small babies
author: Amanda
comments: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my boba wrap. Need my hands free with a 2 year old and my baby loves it!!! She was a preemie and came home at under 4 lbs and this was perfect for her. It kept her snug and close to me. I would highly recommend.

title: Love at first wrap
author: Dani H
comments: I've tried my fair share of wraps and the Boba wrap was by FAR my favourite.  It's super stretchy, wonderfully soft and oh so comfortable! It feels like you are tucking your baby into your favourite t-shirt (you know the one that's been there with you through all of your ups and downs over the years, it's stretched and stained and maybe has a few holes but you can't bare to let it go because when you put it on it feels like home).  Don't waste your time trying other wraps, do yourself and your baby a favor and buy this wrap now. :)

title: Love the boba
author: kate
comments: Great product. I used it for my newborn great instructions easy to use he loved it always fell right asleep hes 1 month old now and i still use it everytime we go out so much easier than carrying  the carseat he hates his car seat lol

title: Two Stars
author: Fernanda Moraes Presti
comments: My daughter gets sick everythime I put her inside, it's too tight.

title: love it
author: Cindy Gillihan
comments: Bought it for my daughter for her second baby and she loves it!!!

title: I have my arms back!
author: maria teare
comments: This thing is amazing!  Our daughter is 4 months old and 17#. I've had her in her Boba since she was 3 days old. Practice putting it on in front of the mirror and you'll be a pro in 5 mins. After 3or 4 uses it starts to get a little stretched out,  but a quick wash and dry sloves that! I've tried putting her in the ergo..  She's not a fan yet.

title: Love this wrap!
author: Sara M Nelson
comments: Loved this stretchy wrap. It was our favorite for many months and used daily. It still looked brand new and I was able to pass it on to a friend to spread the love. Don't know what I would have done without it-kept my baby happy and close and I had my hands free.

title: Love our wrap
author: MommaRachael
comments: Takes a little practice but baby and I love our boba wrap. Has saved my back and sanity plenty of times and makes it possible for us to go to dinner with the littlest of our clan. 100% love it

title: Boba Vs. Ktan
author: Mak10
comments: I originally couldn't decide whether to get the k'tan or the Boba.  I found a used K'tan and it seemed to be the most simple and so I went with that one.  It was awesome in so many ways, but in the end it didn't keep my baby in the correct position (after wearing for a long period) and just stretched out too frequently to be practical for my daily 6+ hours of use.  My favorite thing about the K'tan is that it introduced me to the proper type of carrier for a newborn (I tried the Ergo with my son and it was horrible for that age) and that it also mentally prepared me for the next step - which was a real wrap- something that was scary to me.  So I found a used Boba and have been using it for about a week.  It keeps my baby in the correct position all day and just feels more supportive in general.  It also has resulted in less back pain.  If the K'tan is the lowest introduction to infant babywearing, then the Boba is the next baby step into babywearing.  Here is a comparison:K'tan Pros:- Super Easy, not intimidating at all.  I did not need any practice with this.  Just followed the video and put the baby in.- Smaller - this makes it a lot easier to put in a diaper bag- Shorter - if I know I am going to be putting it on somewhere dirty I would rather use the K'tan because there is no chance it would drag on the ground while putting it on- Faster to put onBoba Pros:- Easy - the first use was less than perfect (but still worked), by the third use it was second nature to wrap.  they have a basic wrap that works with both types of carries so once you learn that you are good to go.- More supportive and not sized - This results in a snug fit that lasts- Can be left on when baby is not on you - so if you are running errands and you don't want to keep putting it on and off, just tie it on before you leave and transfer baby in and out.  Super quick and easy.  And if you get a pretty color it can look okay with no baby as well :)In the end I like having both.  They both allow me to carry my baby and still tend to my toddler.  My K'tan is now my backup and it works great for that.  I think it could also work for someone who does not babywear almost all day.  Fortunately I was able to buy both of these used for less than buying just one of them new.  If I could only have one - it would be the Boba.  And to my earlier self who was scared of learning to use it I would say that its super easy and not scary at all!!

title: Wrap for snuggles and practicality!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I received a sleepy wrap,  now known as a boba wrap, almost 7 years ago when my first child was born. It was an immediate winner for both of us as we rarely went an entire day without using it at least once!Learning to wrap takes a little bit of time. Once it became routine the wrap was all I used. It was especially helpful for using when I needed to shop or work on chores at home. I also found it to be incredibly useful at places like theme parks where strollers can be such a hassle. We didn't take up extra space in the walkways and didn't need to mess with stroller parking. Plus I was hands and arms-free with her in lines for rides where you can't bring strollers anyway!I am still using the same wrap now with my six month old son.  It is one of my absolute must-haves for baby. Boba is a top notch company I will recommend any day!

title: Great wrap!
author: Corrinda
comments: I bought the boba wrap when my first daughter was a few months old.  I've used it around the house when trying to get housework done, but mostly use it while at the grocery store.  It has been a lifesaver!  I now use it with my second daughter who is 4 months old.  Both of my daughters pass out within minutes of being in the wrap ‚ò∫The only negatives I have encountered are: the fact that it is a very long wrap, so tying in public can be a bit awkward when trying not to let it drag the ground & it can get pretty hot and sweaty in warmer temps.Also, do make sure you get it tied nice and snug so that baby doesn't slip downwards.

title: but others that got hot easily didn't like to wear it
author: Rbysue92
comments: If you live in a warmer climate, you may want to purchase the wrap they offer that is made with a more breathable fabric.  It worked well for me, but others that got hot easily didn't like to wear it.

title: So comfortable even with toddler!
author: J. Churchill
comments: I got this to add to my library of carriers I loan out to friends. I was curious so I tried it with my 24lbs 1 1/2 year old. It was amazing! He was sick so I snuggled him close for over two hours. He felt absolutely weightless. I have tried a lot of carriers, and it's rare when I find something so comfortable! I did tie it tighter than you'd expect. I'm petite and have a thin frame (and bad back).

title: Five Stars
author: Jillian carpenter
comments: Love!

title: My little one absolutely loves being in her Boba. ...
author: Ursula Wardy
comments: My little  one absolutely  loves  being  in her Boba. It makes getting  chores done so much easier !!!!

title: GREAT... but HOT.
author: danielle dershem
comments: I love my boba I use it quite frequently. The only issues I have are that it is quite hot here in south Florida and the boba isnt very good for outdoor events. All those extra layers of fabric get hot quick. Also, sometimes it can be a hassle to get the baby into it without an extra set of hands. GREAT if your breastfeeding tho. It takes some time to get usedto and to learn to wrap it how you like it. But over all great purchase.

title: She absolutely loves it and would recommend it for all the mommies out there
author: Daylea Wood
comments: Although this Boba Wrap fit my food baby perfectly, I decided to give it as a gift to my friend for her real baby. She absolutely loves it and would recommend it for all the mommies out there. Her baby girl gives it a thumbs up too.

title: As a new mom I absolutely LOVE my BOBA wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: As a new mom I absolutely LOVE my BOBA wrap! My son is currently 3.5 months old and we have used it regularly since he was around 3 weeks old! We use it when we go grocery shopping and also just around the house! We recently used it while picking blueberries!

title: Boba wraps work great!
author: Nelle
comments: We love our Boba wrap!! Will definitely order another as our little grows!

title: Most comfortable carrier we have!
author: sarahjpaone
comments: I absolutely love my Boba Wrap! I bought one when my daughter was around a month and a half, and I wish I had it sooner. The first few weeks of being a new mom would have been much easier if I could have wrapped her and been hands free! My daughter is now 6 months and still loves being wrapped. I have a few other carriers, including another wrap-like style, but I always find myself or my husband reaching for the Boba. I'd say it's the most comfortable baby wearing option I have. The only issues I've ever had with the Boba wrap is after washing it in the washer, some of the stiching pulled. Since then, I try to wash infrequently. I'm sure a gentle cycle would prevent any issues. Also, I've found the Boba wrap can be a little warm in the summer months, but I get pretty warm in almost all the other carriers I own as well. Overall, I highly recommend this product for a happy baby and a happy mommy (or daddy!).

title: Baby shower gift
author: Peggy Evans
comments: I bought this as a baby shower gift for a very close friend. She has used it constantly! She has received many compliments on the wrap and states that she loves it!

title: Love this wrap
author: Kayla Hebert
comments: Love this wrap! My 4 month old fits perfect in it and loves being in it. It's much easier than it looks to wrap the baby. I had spent money on a few different kinds before and hated them all but this one was perfect!

title: I like that it keeps the baby close
author: Whitney Remington
comments: The wrap is handy when needing to be hands free. I wish it had more head support for newborns. I like that it keeps the baby close. My baby falls asleep every time he is in it.

title: Five Stars
author: Judith Knick Tellone
comments: Love love love it!!!

title: I love the boba wrap
author: Phallen Montague
comments: I love the boba wrap! It is soft and comfortable for both me and my baby and my baby loves being in it!

title: I loved the Boba wrap when we first had our baby
author: Britney
comments: I loved the Boba wrap when we first had our baby. The wrap was easy to tie after watching Boba's tutorial video. We used this wrap until he became more mobile and then switched to a Boba 4G. My only complaint about the wrap is that the fabric does not breathe well and was sometimes hard to wear on hot days. Otherwise, we were very happy with it.

title: My baby and I both loved wearing her
author: Kindle Customer
comments: My baby and I both loved wearing her. She has food allergies and had a very upset digestive system for months as we figured it out. Wearing her allowed me to hold her upright to help her milk stay down, and it was so comfortable for us both. The wrapping seems intimidating but it's not hard, once you get the hang of it.

title: Awesome product!
author: Brittany Steck
comments: Works like a charm! After using it 3 or so times I'm able to tie it and put baby in by myself. It's pretty easy and secure. My 4 week old loves to be worn in this. We are able to nurse in it too, but it's a little awkward since he has little head control. I'm sure it'll get better as he gets older.

title: Boba
author: Claudette
comments: I bought this for my daughter because she insisted she needed it. I don't  think she used it much but I was satisfied with the price and delivery and it is made of high quality  material

title: I really bad back i had a diff normal baby carrier that ...
author: amanda
comments: I  really bad back i had a diff normal baby carrier that i was using for my son i saw the advertisement for the wrap and i ordered it the first day i tried it i feel in love with it out his the baby very well and it doesn't hurt my back like the carriers do i absolutely love it and world recommend others to buy it my sister actually bought one to look

title: Five Stars
author: vanessa
comments: The best wrap out there!!i love anything done by boba

title: Love my Boba
author: Dorie Duesenberry
comments: Love my Boba!! With 3 kids, it's been an absolute life saver. My son loves being so close to me and I love the convenience of hands free nursing with our wrap. My only complaint is some discoloration I've noticed after wearing the wrap in the sun, but since this is just cosmetic, I'm 100% willing to look beyond that.

title: Five Stars
author: Chanda
comments: I absolutely love my boba wrap

title: Love this wrap
author: Tyleia Prendergast
comments: Love this wrap! It's easy to use and sturdy! I love that I can breastfeed in it on the go! I have 3 other kiddos so we are always busy! My Boba makes life so much easier!

title: The most comfortable and convenient wrap I've come across
author: carrington walker
comments: The most comfortable and convenient wrap I've come across. My son is the most content while wrapped and close to me. We never leave home without it.

title: Five Stars
author: CD
comments: Awesome quality!

title: The worst baby carrier I've ever tried.
author: Lisa H.
comments: Holy mother of god this thing is annoying. It is a messy production just to get the thing on, then your baby slides and shifts around and it doesn't work. It is supposed to be a carrier but you end up having to hold your child while the thing is on, or remove your child and repeatedly readjust as it stretches again and again requiring constant tightening. Not to mention, it's HOT! You will be reluctant to use this if you live in a hot place even if you can get it to work correctly. And unless you're wearing a unitard, this thing is going to bunch up your clothes and create a constant need to tug at the bottom of your shirt to pull it back down while simultaneously holding your baby with the other arm so the baby doesn't slide further down. Unfortunately, I can't return this to Target either, because I ruined the box opening it and threw it away before I realized how bad this thing is. $40.00 down the drain. I'm going to stick with my Bjorn and possibly buy a 4g or Ergobaby.

title: I really didn't like it. It made me feel hot and my ...
author: VANESSA FERNANDEZ
comments: I really didn't like it.  It made me feel hot and my baby uncomfortable.  The material would sag after a while.

title: Seems like a quality product but I had to return because ...
author: Emily
comments: I originally bought this to use as a belly wrap to finish up my last trimester of being pregnant and help relieve some of the pressure Ive been having. Seems like a quality product but I had to return because it was a bit complicated for me to figure out.

title: Two Stars
author: CPram
comments: My baby got too warm in this wrap and he was very uncomfortable.

title: A MUST HAVE WITH A NEWBORN!
author: Snizzy
comments: Must have for a newborn.  I could not do anything when my daughter was first born.  I had no hands.  This made everything better.  It took some getting use to but it became very easy to put on.  Our daughter would fall asleep almost automatically.  There is not enough good things to say.  It is easy to wash in the machine, the fabric is so soft, and it can be used for a long time.  The only negative is that it is so long when you put it on it drags on the floor and if you are in a hot climate outside the material can be very warm.

title: Nothing special, just a 16.5' piece of fabric
author: Drew
comments: After receiving this item, I don't understand all the great reviews for it.  It is simply a 16.5' piece of fabric.  Plain and simple.  I'm sure it's washable and all, but I could pretty much go to the fabric store and get the same thing for a lot less than $40.  When trying to wrap our baby, the ends drag all over the floor (it's nearly impossible not to) and transfer dirt onto her.  My opinion is don't waste your money.

title: Love My Boba!!!
author: KBMOM54
comments: Love my Boba Wrap!!! So comfortable, safe, and trendy.

title: It gets pretty hot wearing it though because of the amount of ...
author: Tyler Apple
comments: My baby loves this wrap and falls asleep almost every time she is in it. It gets pretty hot wearing it though because of the amount of fabric, but I think the heat is one reason my baby loves it so much. I think this is best for newborn babies and I won't be wearing this when she gets older and heavier.

title: One Star
author: Nina
comments: Returned it

title: Great for when our baby was a lot smaller
author: Je. S
comments: Great for when our baby was a lot smaller. Harder to carry her around in it as it didn't seem to hold her weight.

title: Love love love it!!!!!!!!
author: DeeDee M
comments: Hands down the best baby carrier ever! We also bought one of those back pack style ones on our baby register and it was terrible. I bought the Boba Wrap on a whim and am so glad I did. The material is super comfy and stretchy. The you tube video on how to tie it was very informative and I got it on the first try. But the best part is wearing it with your bundle of joy. It's very bonding to be able to hold your baby so close to you that my daughter falls right asleep every time and I am able to do light chores when she's in it. Couldn't be happier!

title: Great wrap
author: Jess Reviews
comments: I love my boba wrap. It is great quality and the fabric is soft. This wrap is very long and very stretchy. It is easy to use once you learn how to wrap it correctly. The color is a nice grey and goes with almost everything. Once it is tied up and you and wearing your baby in it, it is quite comfortable. I do have to say if I tie it to tightly is make my shirt rise a bit. However, with some adjustments that is no longer a problem. My son is 14lbs now and he is beginning to get a bit heavy in it. I wouldn't reccomend wearing a child over 20lbs as the fabric stretches downward. So, you can use this for about 4-5 months. 6 months if you have a smaller than average baby.

title: Great buy
author: Eva Marie
comments: Very comfortable and secure. My seven pound, seven day old princess loves it! I just wish it came in colorful/African prints. Still the burgundy color is very pretty.

title: Five Stars
author: Vicky
comments: Great for newborn. My baby loves it.

title: Complicated
author: Book_lover
comments: Confusing to use

title: Comfortable but hot!
author: Alison R.
comments: The first few times I tried this it was a bit tricky but now that I realize how to wrap it it is actually quite easy. However because the pieces are so long it is inevitable that they will drag a bit on the floor when you are trying to put the baby in the wrap. Which makes it very difficult to do outside. Also the material is basically like wearing a sweatshirt so is a bit difficult in the summertime. However overall it is very comfortable and cute. I feel like my baby is comfortable and secure. Just make sure you wrap them very tightly! Otherwise they bounce around a lot! Would buy again.

title: Great product! Great customer service.
author: Sarka Miller
comments: I love this wrap and my baby does too. I have other wraps and carriers that I have got as gifts on baby showers, but this one seems to be the winner and we use it all the time. My baby girl is now four months, but we have been using it since she was born. She loves it. We go for walks, I put her in it when I have to take our dog out and she usually falls asleep or just hangs out and looks around. Around the house it is convenient also when you need two hands available. I also used it in a restaurant to quiet her down. I don't leave the house without having this with me.Also more recently I have misplaced the handy pouch that it comes with and contacted boba.com and they shipped me a new pouch right away for no charge. Excellent customer service!! I would definitely buy again and recommend this to any new mom.

title: Hot, hot, hot!
author: Jenn Jenn
comments: easy to wrap once you get the hang of it. Baby loves it but it is HOT! Baby and I are sweating in no time. Ended up purchasing a different wrap made of breathable mesh.

title: and not good for really hot climates
author: LaDonna Chavez
comments: Gets a little stretched out, and not good for  really hot climates.  Makes my baby all sweaty.

title: Four Stars
author: Julie
comments: Nice product

title: Very comfy!
author: smiths317
comments: So comfy!  This was a great first wrap!

title: I love it! My little one is very clingy
author: Kelsey M.
comments: I love it! My little one is very clingy. After he was born unfortunately I underwent 5 surgeries. (all abdominal) Carrying him at times was a struggle that I endured. But with the wrap it took away most of the struggle and pressure that normal carrying was causing and I had my love close to my heart.

title: Not impressed, it is confusing and is not a simple option for carrying a baby.
author: Gruntlife
comments: After many recommendations my wife and I bought one of these, and after trying several times to get it on just right to put our 8 week old baby in there, it turns out a mess with a crying baby.. It is just not worth the hassle for this thing. Trying to keep it off the ground when putting it on is a challenge within itself that ends in failure.. Many easier options out there, this one works for many, but it does not work for us unfortunately..

title: For Cooler weather ONLY.
author: Dross
comments: It works, looks and feels great.. 4 stars because it gets super HOT wearing.  Great for winter or cooler weather.

title: Life-saver.
author: amyunicaluu
comments: Life-saver. My son has reflux and would cry quite frequently. This wrap makes him relax and go to sleep when nothing else works.

title: Not for me
author: jenica5spd
comments: While the wrap is nice I still haven't gotten the hang of it, most times my baby seems too loose in it and he doesn't seem to enjoy being in it either. I'll likely be returning it soon :(

title: Would definitely recommend it for a newborn in a cool to temperate climate.
author: Keeper Herrmann
comments: This was great with our newborn. Really comfortable, versatile, and fairly easy to use. The material was soft and a bit stretchy, which made it conform nicely to baby, but didn't provide as much support once baby got a little bigger. I prefer more structure once baby is over a few months, and the wrap can get too warm if you are in a hot location, but I would definitely recommend it for a newborn in a cool to temperate climate.

title: Not my favorite, personally.
author: K
comments: I have a bad back. Carrying 10lbs hurts my back. I wanted to experiment with different carriers/wraps to see what I liked best. Personally this isn't for me. I can't seem to get it tight enough or I have it too tight. After a few minutes, my lower back hurts.If anyone else has back issues like me, the Ergo carrier is a good one.

title: Four Stars
author: Too much*~*
comments: For three moth or younger or small babies....

title: Meh
author: Frank K.
comments: Material way too heavy, uncomfortably hot for baby.

title: Love ittt. But these wrap is only great for ...
author: Andres Barraza
comments: Love ittt.But these wrap is only great for chilly nights and winter. But for summer noooo. They shud make summer wraps

title: I absolutely love this wrap
author: Kayla Cypert
comments: I absolutely love this wrap! The material is extremely comfortable and my baby loves it! I wish I had bought this sooner.

title: The boba is a great choice for baby wearing
author: Emery Ann Sidebotham
comments: The boba is a great choice for baby wearing. I own both the boba and the moby - both are similar and yet unique. The wrap techniques are the same and can be mastered by watching YouTube tutorials. The boba is stretchier than the moby, which is great for newborn baby wearing and warmer weather. These wraps are a must-have for any new parent.

title: Five Stars
author: Rochelle
comments: my son is 10 months old and it works perfect!

title: Nice Wrap
author: Jill Krieg
comments: Great wrap, but gets very hot.  Not so great for summer months.

title: It is wonderful to carry my baby in but takes me awhile ...
author: Michelle Edenfied
comments: It is wonderful to carry my baby in but takes me awhile to actually get it on. The length of it hits the floor as I put it on, I worry about using it in public places .

title: Save your money! difficult, uncomfortable and dangerous
author: heather
comments: I wish I had returned this asap.  I wanted to like it so badly though so tried to where it once or twice.  You have to have a lot of skill and patience to make this work. It took me 10 minutes to get in on the first time and then I had a hard time putting my newborn in it.  So the next time I did it slightly looser and then after walking for 30 minutes it became so loose the kid nearly fell out.  Its also very hot! I was wore it in the winter but cannot imagine wearing it in warm weather as not only are you wrapped ion hot cloth but you and the baby are skin to skin. I got a used Ergo and what a difference in all categories.  Now I am stuck with a $50 piece of material. urrgh

title: Five Stars
author: Kate
comments: Comfortable. Good Quality.

title: Love it
author: Alma Padilla
comments: Love this product, no need to carry a big bulky stoller. I have a 10 month old and a 3 year one this helps tremendously I don't have to worry about carrying my daughter with one hand and trying to hold my son's hand with the other. Leaves you hands free. Plus baby gets to be super close to mommy. My little one loves it

title: Recommended
author: Will in CO
comments: My wife loves it - especially as we have been traveling this summer with both kids.

title: I really wanted to love this wrap but it's very cumbersome to get on ...
author: HBSara83
comments: I really wanted to love this wrap but it's very cumbersome to get on & my son never felt secure (I watched videos on the Boba website & YouTube and still couldn't get a secure hold). It was a lifesaver a few times when my son was throwing a tantrum as a newborn but not something I use a lot now that he's mellowed out a bit. Also, it's true that it generates a lot of heat! Not bad for indoor use but I wouldn't recommend for outdoor use on a warm day.

title: Love the wrap!
author: Crissie B.
comments: Great wrap that can be used many different ways. It must have for needy babies when mom needs to be hands free for a bit. I used youtube and learned how to use the wrap. It comes with directions but I felt safer actually watching someone go through the process of putting it on and taking it off.

title: Great purchase, just be informed of the temp of your environment
author: Mrs H.
comments: I like this wrap.  It takes some practice to get the hang of it but I really enjoyed carrying baby around in it!  Just a fair warning.... IT IS HOT HOT HOT.  I stripped down to a light tank top and still ended up way too hot in the late spring early summer in Montana.  Definitely a great thing for winter time or really cool evenings but not if you are going to be in the sun haha!  I really enjoyed that with how the wrap is designed, it keeps people away and not trying to get their hands all over baby.  Keeps him snug, secure, and happy for the most part!  Definitely a great purchase, just be wary of temperature :)

title: Love this wrap!
author: Jose Gomez
comments: Love this product. We have had many happy outings and always get compliments on how useful it is, how it looks and of course field a lot of questions as to where we got it.It washes well and is a good size for both my husband and I to use.Oh, and the color is great!

title: 15 lb+ baby. Works great
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Just received and was worried since my baby is 15 lbs but she loves it! Especially facing outward on our walk. Super secure and fun. I live in a hot area and it wasnt bad walking in the heat. Just seemed like a normal shirt was on. Love this product

title: I love this wrap
author: Emily
comments: I love this wrap! My 6-month-old has loved it since she was a newborn, and she goes right to sleep with no fuss when I carry her around. I use it in the grocery store, at garage sales, at home, and on short walks. It is perfect if you are a mom who doesn't want everyone to ask you if you can hold the baby!

title: much more comfortable than many other carriers
author: Christi
comments: This is my 3rd baby carrier. Fabric is so stretchy after an hour my 13lb 8 week old is several inches lower than where I put him. Comfy though, much more comfortable than many other carriers. Best for small babies. Move onto SSCs after 15-20lbs

title: Two Stars
author: Rosa Balderas
comments: Don't use it at all it's too long and takes long to wrap..

title: Great for having hands free and he loves being in ...
author: Amy Lee I.
comments: I wear the Boba wrap constantly. My little boy is now 1 month and he spends almost all day, every day in the Boba wrap! Great for having hands free and he loves being in the wrap! Absolutely a must have! I use it when we go out in public to keep him away from germy fingers that want to touch a sweet baby and it keeps him happy when he would otherwise be fussy. He sleeps in it wonderfully. You can nurse in it. I really can't say enough positive things about Boba wraps!!

title: Difficult to figure out
author: Krystal
comments: Such a pain to figure out. Not worth it. I returned mine after several attempts to make it work.

title: One Star
author: diana
comments: ergo way better

title: hot and uncomfortable for my Wife and baby.
author: rfam122
comments: Too long for Wife (She is 5:2), and have a large chest/nursing size. She tried to carry my 9 ponds baby, and it was not good. She immediately felt hot and suffocating, imagine the baby!. Not the type of help/support for her body type. She gave it away to a taller, thin friend. Not for her and my baby :o(

title: But I prefer my ergo performance better. It's just easier to put on the baby ...
author: twin mama
comments: Does what it's supposed to. But I prefer my ergo performance better. It's just easier to put on the baby with the ergo. Plus I have older toddlers and they loved pulling on the slack on the boba. My baby liked it and she was well supported, not uncomfortable but I just prefered the ergo carier.I thought I'd try since this was my last baby because it's so cute seeing other moms with it on, but it just didn't work out for me. It makes for a perfect back up though when one carrier is in the wash or if I can't find it at the moment.

title: It was great when he was under 8 lbs (he was about ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It was great when he was under 8 lbs (he was about 5 and a half when we brought him home!). Once he grew, it's either so tight that he's uncomfortable, or he slides down. I suspect this would be an issue with pretty much any wrap. Recommend for tiny babies, but otherwise go with a standard carrier.

title: Best carrier out there.
author: Erin Girard
comments: The best baby carrier for a newborn.  I didn't get this til my baby was 5 weeks old and I wish I had it when she was 2 weeks old!  So soft and comfy for the baby and mom!  My baby did start to dislike it around 10 weeks and I made the switch to the baby bjorn.  Regardless, amazing!

title: Love it
author: Megan Mills
comments: Me and baby love! Took some practice tying but now I can do it super mom fast style. He likes forward facing the most. We usually get a little sweat on though it can get warm. Very stretchy and soft :) I switch off between this one and my baby Bjorn

title: Best Wrap!
author: Kelley Ward
comments: This little carrier/ wrap is the best!... Once I learned how to put in on... I snugged my little one right down in it and when for a walk and within ten minutes she was out like a light!... Newborns still needed head support.

title: I am having the worse time trying to wrap this correctly
author: Patricia L. Tegtmeier
comments: I am having the worse time trying to wrap this correctly. Baby is only one month old but not comfortable in it. I hope as she gets older she will like it (and so will I)

title: Absolutely love this product
author: Tabetha Walker
comments: Absolutely love this product. Still learning how to wrap it tighter so she doesn't keep getting lower. My 6 wk old loves being bundled on mama. Makes things much easier. Only downfall is getting sweaty and trying to breastfeed but that's with any wrap. This washes great and is super soft. I love it

title: Five Stars
author: Ashley Langlois
comments: Awesome product !!

title: We loved this boba wrap
author: Gura
comments: We loved this boba wrap! It works so well with a newborn! But now our baby is 3 months old and she doesn't like it so well and my back and neck gets tired pretty quickly, so now I switched to ergo baby carrier and that's works perfectly. It's structured more for older babies and so it works well now that my baby is over 12lbs. But the boba stretches  with the weight and is not as comfortable.Basically, this wrap you would only use for about 3 month and then you would probably want to switch to a structured carrier and one that distributes weight evenly and be a little more friendly for your back.

title: Fabric is waaaaay too stretchy!!! ZERO stars.
author: Rachel
comments: This was recommended by a friend because of the 2 way stretch of the fabric. It is WAY to stretchy for my liking. I wrap it as tightly as I can around myself but when I put the baby inside in any position, she falls down so far that I end up having to hold her up with at least one hand. I would return it, but I have a friend who's expecting and I'm passing it on to her to see if she has any better luck!!Truly would NOT buy this product again for myself or anyone else.  The fabric is just too stretchy. Even my husband has tried to tie it tight enough to make it work, but then it's so tight it hurts.... And the baby still falls down to far.Soooo frustrating!!!!  I REALLY wanted to love this wrap.

title: Five Stars
author: coolcomputer
comments: Great

title: Three Stars
author: nicole e
comments: Easy to use, but this product isn't really functional for a heavy baby, and not suitable for warm weather

title: Five Stars
author: Myrna
comments: They were so excited when they saw this! It was exactly what they wanted!

title: Great product but my baby didn't like.
author: Alex S Nilsson
comments: This was a great product. And I took it with me on a trip where my husband and I went hiking.  It made it so much easier than pushing the stroller and it worked perfectly until my baby decided that he didn't like it. I really like the product but my baby doesn't. The fabric is fairly thick on the gray one we got, so I think he got too hot in it. Plus he couldn't see what was going on, too bad. I would say do some research on thickness of fabric if you can before buying. Also, try to think of how your baby likes to feel. Are they particular about being hot or cold, do they like to cuddle up to you or not, and do they like to see what's around them or in front of them? There are only two ways in the instructions to wrap them up in it and it seems like a baby can't face front. Those were the reasons that my baby didn't like, so keep in mind your baby's taste when shopping for stuff like this. Very important considerations to make before purchase.

title: Three Stars
author: Olivia Gordon
comments: Works better for smaller babies, but they also need to have good head control

title: LOVE! But too heavy for hot weather!
author: Amanda Tomato
comments: I love this wrap! So easy to use after of course getting the hang of it. I love the stretch because it takes the guess work out of how tight too wrap it. Baby loves being in this! Only 4 stars because the fabric is very heavy and terrible to use when it's very hot. I wish Boba Made a wrap in a lighter material for summer.

title: Good wrap but gets hot
author: Ali
comments: I like the wrap. It is convenient and comfortable. I can compare it to the baby bojourn and I like boba way better. My only problem with the wrap is the material gets hot. I have a summer baby and it is hard to wear the wrap because both he and I get too hot.

title: Five Stars
author: Janice Harkins
comments: Very safe in the day and time

title: best baby gift ever!
author: Mimi
comments: Excellent gift, exactly as described, extremely fast delivery. Very good experience.

title: Love it for my newborn
author: Canchita Banana
comments: This thing is great!  I'm using it right off the bat with my newborn (about 6.5 lbs).  She is very content being snuggled in and there is no flopping around once she's in. I can hold my toddler's hand walking around and interact with him easily.  I also have a hand-me-down Bjorn, which is okay for a bit of an older baby, but not as snug.  I have a Maya wrap as well, but I've not found that to be as effective in holding the baby in a firm position as the Boba.  I'm thinking that it's possible once she gets bigger I may not like it as much, but for my young baby this is the winner.

title: Fabric too long for a short person, and too hot for both mommy and baby
author: Miguel Martinez
comments: [As reviewed by the wife] I originally loved this product but not so much after getting an Ergo Baby and a Bitty Bean. According to the videos, it would only take 2 minutes to do the wrap but I always take at least 5. And as a short person, The ends of the wrap always ALWAYS graze the floor and I absolutely hate it when that happens because first-time-mom and do-spray-alcohol-on-your-hands-before-you-touch-my-baby's-toes.Although you can throw this in the washer, you can't put it in the dryer. And since it's such a long fabric, it's cumbersome to hang.Also, if it's not warm then it's just HOT. That's why I got the Bitty Bean; I was looking for a summer-friendly carrier.

title: Perfect for sleeping
author: LD
comments: I was super excited to try out this wrap! I did a lot of research on various brands and was debating whether I should by the boba or the moby wrap. I decided to go with the boba because I read many reviews about the fabric being much more stretchy and comfortable for baby. It is very difficult for me to put my baby down for a nap during the day. I literally have to rock him for half an hour, and if I'm lucky I can lay him down with out him immediately waking up. A lot of people said once they put their baby in the wrap they fell right asleep. This is definitely true! Before I ordered the wrap I watched different tutorials on Youtube..(so I was practically a pro at putting it on when it came ;)) As soon as I put my baby in the wrap he started dozing off and was asleep in less than 5 minutes! The only downside it that my baby gets really hot and sweaty so it can be uncomfortable, especially  if its a hot day. I can't wait to take the wrap out and about on errands!

title: Five Stars
author: gradykeith
comments: Great!

title: I love the concept of this wrap, but it can make both you and baby overheat :/ wish I had known that before purchasing. But it d
author: SaWa17
comments: Hot! Not in a good way

title: Perfect!
author: S. L. S
comments: Great wrap. Sturdy, stylish and very easy to use. Tying it the first few times may take you a little longer, but you'll get the hang of it very soon. My son is almost four months and (still) fits just fine. When he's fuzzy I put him in his Boba wrap and go about my chores. It's really a win - win situation!

title: Great for little ones!
author: Ali B
comments: This was really nice when my son was less than 15lbs. He fell asleep in it all the time. If they fight it at first (mine did), go for a walk. After the first time they fall asleep in it, they're hooked. The fabric is soft and stretchy which is really comfortable in the fall/ winter. As it got hotter I switched to a SSC. Overall, it's a great wrap for the price. Once you're into wraps you can go buy a fancy Tula.

title: gamechanger
author: Amanda S. R
comments: I started out with the K-tan and hated it, so I thought we just werent a baby wearing mom/baby couple. But I gave this a try and I'm so glad I did. It is super easy to put on, comfortable, and my 6 week old likes it. I use it a lot after play time when she starts getting sleepy, then when her eyes start to close, easy to slip her out & down for a nap. Husband can wear it too, which I didn't like about K-tan either. We have an ergo 360, but it's cumbersome to put on, I feel like I'll use it for longer outings - but for every day around the house wear - I love this wrap!!

title: Four Stars
author: Wendy McLeod
comments: Very soft wrap and beautiful print. A little complicated to put on.

title: Five Stars
author: Una
comments: Fast shipping, item as expected! Thanks!

title: I love the Boba wrap and in this color
author: Romina C.
comments: I love the Boba wrap and in this color, it goes with everything and is super stylish. It was especially wonderful when my baby was just newborn and I wanted to keep her close and comfy without all the hard straps and clips that other carriers have. It takes a bit of time getting used to putting it on and getting it off and my biggest complaint is that it is way too hot to use in warm weather with the number of times it needs to wrap around you! Also, I wish the instruction manual came with more options for how to tie it, though you can find a lot of video tutorials on YouTube ;)

title: Boba Baby wrap is my favorite!
author: Proudmamaoffour
comments: I had the sleepy wrap( now known as Boba wrap) with my last 2 children and I loved it. I gave it away when I thought I want going to have any more babies. Surprise! So glad I found it again! I've tried many many different baby carriers. This one is by far my favorite for infants. May try something different when he's bigger for hiking but I give the boba baby wrap 5 stars!!! I love having my baby close. The wrapping is easy after you do it a couple times. You can't make it too tight. Perfect!

title: She hated hated swings
author: Kindle Customer
comments: This wrap kept me sane in the early days after having my daughter. My daughter is what you would describe as high needs (read demanding) and would not let me set her down for the first 4 months. She hated hated swings, bouncers and rockers but loved being snuggled up to me in our Boba This wrap was a life saver for us and it was easy to use.

title: Nice intro to baby wearing
author: erika cabrera
comments: Easy to use and so far baby loves it.

title: It's nice but has a few flaws
author: April
comments: I like the wrap but there are a few things about it that if I would have known before I would have skipped the purchase. First, it's kind of a pain to put on. Once you find center and do the whole little wrap it's a little frustrating if your infant decides their not in the mood for it. It's definitely something you'll be able to easily put on and off throughout the day. The other thing I don't like is that it's very hot! I had my baby in the spring and we live in So Cal so we have very limited use for this, I wish there was a cooler version. I do LOVE that it's a snuggly way to carry my baby handsfree. I think she enjoys the closeness once we've gone through all the steps of getting it on.

title: Great packaging, wonderfully made wrap my daughter absolutely loves ...
author: cheyenne
comments: Great packaging, wonderfully made wrap my daughter absolutely loves it, clear instructions, breathable fabric. Over all very happy and it was worth every penny

title: Exactly what I wanted!
author: Kayla
comments: So great! I'm still a month away from having my baby girl (first baby), but I couldn't resist and tried it on as soon as I got it. Even though I didn't have a baby to put in it and I have a big ol' belly, it felt super secure and I can't wait to use it! I chose grey because A) it goes with anything and B) because since it's so sturdy I know it will last through this baby and more to come so picking a gender neutral one, in case I have a boy next, was a must. Pre-preggo I weighed about 135 and am 5'6'' and even with a GIANT belly in the way, it wrapped around and still had more to go so I'm sure if you're heavier there wouldn't be an issue. I absolutely cant wait to use it! :)

title: Three Stars
author: Amanda doan
comments: couldnt get use to it.

title: I wanted to love this, because my Baby Bjorn carrier kills my ...
author: Natalie Harper
comments: I wanted to love this, because my Baby Bjorn carrier kills my back, and I needed a solution. I felt sure this would be it because of the rave reviews. It's not exactly what I was hoping for, but it definitely has some pros. Here are the basic details of my situation and the pros and cons for me.Situation: My baby boy is 9lbs, 8 oz currently, but I started using this when he weighed around 7lbs. He suffers from severe acid reflux, which constantly wakes him up and prevents him from sleeping for more than 1 hour at a time. He's a preemie (born at 31 weeks) and is now ~2.5 months old; ~3 weeks adjusted. I am 5'6 and am not overweight but not petite either. Overall, I am in good shape but not a fitness queen as of late.Pros: My boy will sleep for hours in this, so that is a major pro. He won't sleep this well anywhere else except in his car seat in the car while it is moving. It doesn't hurt my back right away like the baby bjorn carrier. It's less expensive than a lot of other options. There are several colors to choose from.Cons:- I HATE putting this on. There is so much excess fabric that it's hard to handle. If your baby is crying while you are trying to put this on, you feel every darn second, and it's easy to get flustered.- The excess fabric is a bit annoying once you have on. Yes, you just wrap it around as many times as you need, but I find it uncomfortable. My husband is 6'4 and is great shape, and it has excess fabric for him as well.- I saw lots of reviews that mentioned tying it very tightly and keeping the fabric neat/not bunched. I find it quite difficult to do this when putting it on. I watched the YouTube video and followed instructions, and at this point, I have still found it impossible to get it tight enough to prevent my baby from eventually drooping down very low. I start with his head against my chest and him sitting upright, and without fail, he always ends up in a slouched sling position below my breasts. In addition, I can never get the fabric to stay as neat and orderly as it appears in all the pictures/videos. Because of all this, it does start to hurt my back, and the position can be uncomfortable for me. I wish it would hold him up against my chest because that is so much more comfortable for me and allows me to get more done. Perhaps I will get better at this, but I have tried many times (with a lot of effort and hope, haha) and still have yet to accomplish it. It's simply frustrating to mess with, and I sometimes dread putting it on.Overall, I just wish there was less fabric (or size options) and that it was a little less stretchy and more sturdy. On the positive side, he'll sleep once I finally get it on and get him in it.

title: My daughter says she loved the quality of this Carrier
author: Allycm
comments: My daughter says she loved the quality of this Carrier. She has used other brands for my grand daughters and needed a new one for my grandson coming in July. She said the material felt great and the quality was very good. I'm glad I made this purchase.

title: Our newborn loves this. When she is being fussy ...
author: Nicholas Dewey
comments: Our newborn loves this. When she is being fussy will sometimes put here in the Boba and she just relaxes. Does get a bit warm though.

title: I love having her on my chest
author: Rene
comments: This thing saves my day! I can get some things done while holding baby. It also makes grocery shopping much easier! I love having her on my chest.

title: My baby doesn't like it.
author: Mom@Home
comments: I decided to try the Boba wrap when my second baby was born.  She is now four months old.  While I find the Boba wrap to be about as easy to put on as the original Baby Bjorn I used with my first baby, I am giving the Boba wrap two stars because I just can't use it.  My baby just doesn't like it.  She gets tense, struggles, and cries every time I put her in it.  I have tried several different types of "holds" including the newborn hold (in the instructions that come with it), piggyback hold, and side hold.  A couple times when she was a newborn, it helped her fall asleep if she was having a crying fit, at home, but I can't use it out and about without her really going into a full-on cry.  I really wanted to like this thing because it IS a lot more comfortable, with less back strain, for the adult.  But it seems like my baby (who by the way LOVED being swaddled) just doesn't seem to like being completely bandaged to me as I walk around.  I think it's a little too restricting for a baby who is awake and alert, which is funny because on the Boba website they have some "articles" about how other baby-carrying devices are too restricting and impede babies' development.By the way, I used my classic-style Baby Bjorn just about every day with my first baby.  We walked all the time.  I used my common sense and took her out if it seemed like she'd been in there long enough.  She never had any problems.....  in fact I think she really liked it.Our family has a big trip to Europe coming up this summer, so now I'm trying to find a helpful baby carrier before we go.  My trusty old Bjorn is okay for neighborhood walks, but it isn't great for a sleeping baby.  My top choice is the Aprica 4-way style carrier (that lets baby lie horizontally if they fall asleep).I still hope to be able to use the Boba wrap.  Maybe my daughter will like it more when she gets older... at the same time, I don't really feel like it's right to keep seeing if she likes it when I already know she doesn't. <_<

title: Soft fabric, easy to use!
author: Chelseap
comments: Bought this product for my sister with her newborn baby. The wrap is easy to use and very versatile. The fabric is soft and withstands multiple washings. The design of the fabric is cute also! Also this product is cheaper but higher quality than other similar products. Would recommend!

title: Five Stars
author: Stephen L.
comments: Best purchase EVER!

title: Boba Baby Wrap
author: Saddie
comments: it's the best thing for baby and mother very easy to use and very comfy

title: Hot
author: L Fletcher
comments: Not surprisingly, it's hot. Easy to wear but not a great choice for baby born in summer. We both pour sweat.

title: Love this! Easy to use and baby likes being ...
author: Karen
comments: Love this! Easy to use and baby likes being in it. I can not say at this time how it will work out when she is heavier because she is 9 lbs now but I imagine you would just want to make sure it is tighter to your body to support extra weight. I own a baby Bjorn and have difficulty getting getting her in and out by myself but with this it is no problem

title: Best baby wearing wrap!
author: Ashley
comments: Best baby wrap ever! I used to have an actual carrier but hated it! I had heard a lot of carriers are bad for the babys legs. This wrap is a lifesaver! It's so stretchy which I love, but it also holds the baby really close up against you. Most of the time its the only way I get the baby to sleep, by walking around with her in it! Amazing product!

title: Four Stars
author: Mehrnoush Minor
comments: The material is thick.... I get hot and sweaty wearing it any more then 30 min or so!

title: Just good for newborns
author: Debbie
comments: Good wrap for newborn baby but once they put weight on you have to be a Bodybuilder practically to carry your baby around ... Plus my baby didn't like it past newborn stage

title: I love my boba
author: The Buchanan's
comments: I love my boba. Took some getting used to the strechyness compared to the ridged moby wrap I started with. I love it. I am able to machine wash it and hang dry, and it is so much more convenient than carrying baby everywhere.
