title: Not As Effortless As I Hoped...
author: Mike P
comments: I followed the instructions and I can't for the life of me get this sling to effortlessly hold my child like the models in the pictures. Perhaps it is because I am a man and lack certain anatomical features on my chest that might help provide structural support?Oh well maybe its for the best. My wife tells me no man should be wearing a baby wrap anyways.

title: Yay for baby wearing!
author: Mikaela Zischke
comments: Love this wrap for little babies!  This was great to carry my little guy around and made it easy to go grocery shopping, babysit, go for walks, and do so many things hands free!  Definitely recommend this product.  Washes well and stays in great condition.

title: she also sleeps very well - better than in her bouncer or swing
author: Kmhambleton
comments: Life saver! My baby loves this. She might grumble when I first put her in, but it allows me to do things while holding her. Once she settles, she also sleeps very well - better than in her bouncer or swing.I liked this item so much I just bought the same one for a friend for her baby sprinkle... With a second child on the way, she's gonna need those extra hands even more!

title: I recommend if using in the summer to keep baby either ...
author: Michael Docherty
comments: Just a bit long so it does make putting it on in public a little difficult. I am 5'2". At the same time, the bottom piece won't be touching either of us so I don't mind. Also, it seems to be very warm with warmer weather for mom and baby. I recommend if using in the summer to keep baby either naked or lightly dressed. I followed the instructions and it fit well on me.

title: Wonderful
author: Braden Cooper
comments: Amazing

title: Both she and the baby love it.
author: Roberta Hodges
comments: Was a gift to my niece.  Both she and the baby love it.

title: Great wrap!
author: Courtney Pennello
comments: Love this wrap!! I'm currently 8 months pregnant so I haven't been able to use it on our newborn yet, but I used my 2 and a half year old who's 25 lbs to get a sense of how it will be. It took so much weight off me and supported my back so I can only imagine how comfortable it will be with our newborn! Love the material and color, and also like how easy and quick it is to wrap. Definitely going to recommend this to all my new mommy friends!

title: Great carrier for my month old baby.
author: NoLo
comments: Love this! So helpful when I go grocery shopping or to any outing where I need my hands!  Baby is cozy, usually falling asleep and I can get things done while toting her along.

title: its easy to maneuver
author: Flauna
comments: Hard to figure out at first but once I did get it, its easy to maneuver.  I don't like to use it when breastfeeding.

title: Five Stars
author: Emily S.
comments: Very easy and confortable  to use. My niece loves to be in the carrier,  she falls asleep instantly.

title: I can't believe people like this thing
author: TechnicalMongoose
comments: Hard to put on, unreliable when using it. Personally vastly prefer the Ergo baby with Carrier insert. My son still only likes that off and on (he's 7 weeks) - but it beats the wrap any day. Can't believe it's just a sheet with no other support to it.

title: Amazing wrap!!
author: Carolyn S
comments: I love this product! My baby is almost 2 months old and she loves it too! Some days it is literally the ONLY way she will fall asleep is if I have her in this. The biggest thing I think people will complain about is the baby sagging down in the wrap. This will happen eventually depending on how long you wear your baby. HOWEVER, to avoid the sagging until much later, you MUST have the wrap incredibly tight!! The best piece of advice I have gotten on this wrap is tie it tighter than you think you need it. Almost to where it is uncomfortable. Once baby is in there, they will loosen it up a little bit and it will be just right. The how-to wrap videos on boba's website aren't that great compared to the ones on youtube. There is one called how to's and reviews on the boba wrap (blonde girl doing the video) and I found that one to be the best one. I also found it a lot of help to practice wrapping at home and wearing baby at home before I tried to use it outside of the home. Once I was comfortable wrapping and placing her in there, I felt SO MUCH BETTER using it at the grocery store. I also think that some babies just might not like this because they don't like being so wrapped up and tight. My son, for instance, did not like to be swaddled at all. But my daughter loves it and she loves this wrap. I don't think my son would have liked it too much. So it all depends on the baby. But it is definitely worth a shot if you have more than one kid because it definitely helps you get things done around the house!! I have not yet mastered the art of nursing while baby is in the wrap but it can be done so that is also a plus to using this product! Overall I am very pleased with this thing!!

title: Too hot for Texas
author: Brian Bankhead
comments: At first it was a little daunting, figuring out how to wrap this 6 yards of fabric around you in a way to securely hold our newborn. After watching a few youtube videos my wife felt confident enough to try it out. When she can wear it she really loves it, but I had to give it just three stars because much to our dismay we're going to have to buy a hotslings as well because the boba wrap gets so hot that we can use it beyond 45 minutes. Granted we live in Texas and it's June but our newborn gets too hot from my wife just walking around the house at 6:30am. This is really a shame because the wrap is great at calming our LO, it's just disappointing that we're having to buy a second carrier so that she doesn't overheat. After about 30-45 minutes she will start to cry only calming down after my wife has pulled aside at least two layers of the Boba Wrap. When it comes down to it ourLO is wearing 4 layers of clothing (short sleeve onesie + 3 layers of the wrap) and snug against mom.I would not recommend for a summer baby in Texas but that could be a different story for cooler months. It could be we don't keep it cool enough in our house and could be better outside where there is more airflow.

title: Love it!
author: Emily Sexton
comments: I tried the k'tan & moby- returned both. The boba is def the most comfortable. LOVE IT!!! Great for 75degree + weather. Too much fabric for hot days. Even though it's long, it's very easy to use. Stays in place v well & doesn't stretch out.

title: I just love it!
author: Laurie
comments: I loved this! Easy & so comfortable! Really great for newborns who don't like to be put down.I received this as a gift. At the time it was $60, now I see it is $40.  A much more reasonable price.  If you don't need new you can easily find these for $20Pros:PoppableEasy Wash/CareCOMFORTABLECons:HOTVery long (even for fluffy moms)Only suitable for babies up to 15lbsNo back carries

title: Had one with my son. Thought we were through ...
author: Amanda Church
comments: Had one with my son. Thought we were through and gave it away. Found out we were having another baby and had to order another!

title: This works well and my wife really likes it. ...
author: Ethan B
comments: This works well and my wife really likes it. It is stretchier than the moby wrap, my wife prefers that but I prefer the moby so we have one of each.

title: Great everyday wrap
author: Liz
comments: I've used and owned many baby carriers over the years and this is a new favorite. It's a thinner and cooler material than the moby which not only makes it easier the wrap but keeps baby from getting too sweaty. The drawback to this is that I don't think it will hold a heavier baby well. My only complaint is that the edges curl under a bit but it smooths out when it's wrapped. The stuff sack is wonderful, not too small like many others.

title: üòçüòç
author: Stevie
comments: Love it so much !!!!!! üòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ

title: I love this one
author: Blank
comments: I love this one. So much more comfortable than a traditional carrier. I just wished there were more ways to carry baby with this. Also you do have to be careful about baby's face being covered by the material.

title: Disappointed - tore in 10 mins (1st one)
author: Beth Sanborn-Cowling
comments: This wrap seemed well reviewed. We received ours, watched the how to video, put it on and within 10 minutes of wearing it tore - with our baby in it. I'm hoping this was a one off happening but buyer beware.*UPDATE* my husband wanted to try one more wrap incase the original one we bought was a rare defect. The 2nd wrap arrived. I've used it a handful of times. No tearing thus far. The edges of the wrap tend to roll up which can be uncomfortable and slightly annoying. In the future I think I would prefer a wrap that is not as stretchy as this one. The stretch makes fit adjustment tricky.Overall - I'm using the wrap but I don't love it.

title: Five Stars
author: Reda
comments: Great wrap. My baby loves it!

title: Great product!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I wish I had this with my first two kids. It's perfect for the first few months since my baby is not in a sleep routine yet. I can get so much done while she sleeps in it and I really feel like she sleeps longer than if she was laying in her cradle. Wrapping it around your body is tricky the first few times you use it but after you get use to it it's so easy.

title: Two Thumbs Up
author: Chase Howell
comments: Awesome wrap! Comfortable and very handy.

title: Not for me
author: Honest Customer
comments: Couldn't figure it out baby hated it.

title: Five Stars
author: Ashley Smialek
comments: The fabric of the boba is so much nicer then other brand of wraps! So soft!

title: Comfortable to wear and doesn't get overly
author: Todd McGee
comments: Has allowed me to get a lot more done around the house when the baby is fussy.  Comfortable to wear and doesn't get overly hot

title: Five Stars
author: Johnny
comments: Wife loved this

title: Very comfortable
author: kendel
comments: Very comfortable to wear and my baby loves to snuggle. He was premature and came home on oxygen so he has extra cables attactched to him and it is easy to work with all the cables when I put this wrap on.

title: One Star
author: Fran
comments: It is very difficult to put it on, I never used it...

title: Wish I had it with my first three babies!
author: David Keck
comments: It's so comfortable and is very secure for even the smallest babies as long as it's tied correctly. It's VERY long, so I didn't like trying to tie it in public and dragging fabric on the ground. It is a bit of a learning curve to tie it just right for your body as well as the babies changing body, but that's also what makes it secure is that you tie it to fit YOU personally. I have a baby bjorn as well and it is not secure for babies with wobbly heads. My son LOVED this especially during the first few months. He is getting so long and heavy now that any carrier is getting to hard on my back, though.

title: Love this I can mop swept the floor and tale ...
author: Terimakasi
comments: Love this I can mop swept the floor and tale my baby anywhere I love it that he is very comfy.its ok for the spring or summer weather. Very safe too.

title: Five Stars
author: Daisy
comments: Love love love this

title: Five Stars
author: Milena Zamprogna
comments: My baby loves it

title: Wife didn't like it. It's basically just a long and narrow ...
author: Xero
comments: Wife didn't like it. It's basically just a long and narrow blanket, not really much more to it than that. I think she just had too much trouble getting it to feel secure/snug.  We ended up with one that snaps together more like a backpack, and she gets along better with that one.

title: great,easy product!!
author: Robert Pena
comments: Awesome baby holder!! Very secure and easy to learn. A must have for ur baby!

title: I don't like it. Baby is so-so.
author: A. Corbett
comments: I know I should like this thing, just I just don't. I've tried it at home, on the go, in the airport / airplane. It's just inconvenient. Most recently, we tried using this while traveling with our then 4 month old. Getting this thing on in the airport is like trying to do the tango in a mine field. First you have to try and find the center of this 20' long piece of stretchy fabric. You're trying to keep it off the hideous floor, trying not to get the fabric twisted up as you wrap and cross and knot this thing around your body. At the end of it, you have to get baby inside and then hope that you don't have to pee 15 minutes after you get all gussied up. It's just a LOT of work. Also, I really don't like the stretchiness of the fabric. I've heard that the Moby wrap is less stretchy, and some people like this better and some people like that better. I don't know. Maybe I would have liked that one better, but for now, I don't anticipate making the additional purchase. We'll stick to either the stroller or the Ergo.

title: One Star
author: Attaluh Walker
comments: Complicated

title: Best infant carrier ever!
author: jjzips22
comments: Wish I had discovered this wrap 3 babies ago.  Keeps my little one close and snug and happy.  It helps with her reflux by keeping her upright as well.  Best infant carrier ever!  Love the stretchy material of this wrap too.  I can get her in and out easily and bounce her lightly to keep her happy.  The Moby was harder to get on just right because i's not stretchy.

title: Confusing Instructions
author: Elizabeth
comments: I am rating the instructions in balance with the product. The instructions are ridiculously poorly done. There is a woman modeling each step - but - at key points what she is doing does not match the text at all, in fact, some of the images feel contradictory. I am so confused about how to use this! Going cross-eyed trying to understand the product based on the manual, so I'm off to look for some youtube videos on the subject...FYI I haven't used the product yet as we are still waiting for baby. It seems promising - nice, strong, stretchy fabric. Love the grey color.

title: good buy
author: M. Powell
comments: Use this wrap daily! My 6 month old loves it, she has used it since she was about 2 weeks!

title: Four Stars
author: Jaz.Ari
comments: Very strectchy gets a bit hot during the summer which it has more airflow.

title: Five Stars
author: Erica Rivera
comments: Love this! Easy to use and my baby loves being close to me.

title: Five Stars
author: RossM
comments: Great once you get the hang of it.  So far have only used it with my baby facing me.

title: All new moms need one!
author: Amanda Hill
comments: I absolutely love this wrap; it helped me survive the first few months.  When my baby was newborn, she wanted to be held all the time and this wrap allowed her to be close to me while I did things like wash bottles.  If she was a little fussy and fighting a nap, wrapping her in this calmed her immediately. I also still use it instead of a stroller sometimes when we go for walks.  It took me a few times to get it tight enough and it does get loose with time but for the price, it's great.

title: Absolutely love it!
author: Megarooni
comments: This wrap is extremely comfortable and useful with beautiful colors. I love being able to nurse or carry my baby around while having free hands, and so does she! The material is so stretchy, much better than the Moby which I used years ago for my son. Best thing you could buy!

title: Happy Baby
author: Pruitt Family
comments: I wrapped my newborn following the Boba Wrap YouTube video. The instructions were easy to follow. My baby loves to be snuggled up to me in this wrap. She usually falls asleep as soon as I put her in.

title: ... boba a couple days ago and so far so good. First i had gotten this awesome shirt that ...
author: shellie robertson
comments: I got my boba a couple days ago and so far so good. First i had gotten this awesome shirt that has a pocket in the front for baby to slide into.  It was great but has a 12lb weight limit. Needless to say she grew out of it fast. Not to mention the shirt wasn't  hands free and cost $70! I think boba, baby and I have a long future together.

title: I LOVE this wrap
author: Kellie Green
comments: I LOVE this wrap!!! I had a Moby with my first child and wish I had the Boba with him.  The Boba's material is far superior and I love the color.

title: 5 stars
author: Monica Lara
comments: Cant live without it! Exelent quality!

title: Lifesaver!
author: kashay
comments: This wrap is a lifesaver! I would not be able to do anything without it! My son loves it and would stay in it all day if I would let him!

title: But very comfortable and easy to figure
author: Mary Elizabeth Sugden
comments: No matter how tight I tie it, baby does drop a bit. But very comfortable and easy to figure out

title: Five Stars
author: Heather Connell
comments: I absolutely love it and so does my baby.

title: Four Stars
author: George Cy
comments: I fount it better than the reverse back pack looking carriers for my larger frame

title: Great product, but Stardust is white on inside fabric
author: Homekeeper23
comments: The fabric quality is great and I am sure that it will be super useful when baby comes--however, just be aware that the Stardust fabric pattern is white on the inside, which looks odd when it is tied. It is really hard to keep only the front pattern showing, and I didn't like it looking inside out. I returned it and got the navy.

title: make it yourself from a $5 fabric store remnant or old jersey sheet
author: Tory
comments: I hate that I paid $40 for a few yards of fabric and a clever booklet. Fabric is about 7' long and 2-3' wide, seamless, tapered at the ends, and serge stitched all around. It's a sturdy 4-way stretch knit like a soft polo shirt would be made of. $15 - $20 would be a good price and if it had been I would have rated it higher because the concept does have merit.

title: perfect for moms on the go
author: Ally Freeman
comments: I love my Boba... I went back to work 5 weeks after having my baby. The Boba allowed me to work with both hands and not miss out on baby snuggles! My baby is 3 months old now and still loves the Boba.

title: Four Stars
author: Sonia Mohammed
comments: A little too much cloth

title: I am in love with the Boba wrap!
author: Clover
comments: Before our baby was born, we registered for and received an Ergo baby 4 position carrier with the infant insert. I tried it once and knew it was going to be a while before our daughter was big enough for her to feel "right" in there even with the insert (not to mention it was VERY hot). I still wanted to be able to wear her around the house because she loves being held and I wanted to have my hands free. As weird as it sounds, I kept having this instinct to tie her to me with a scarf or blanket (don't worry; I didn't). I did some research and requested this as my first Mother's Day present. It arrived today and it is exactly what I hoped for. Wrapping, even the first time, is not hard at all (easier than the Ergo baby, I would say!). Our little one is happy, peaceful, and secure in there. She ready loves sleeping in it, and I feel great about how supported her head is and how clear her airways are. I already want to buy it as a gift for other moms!

title: Five Stars
author: JESSICA M. SANTIAGO
comments: The best thing invented

title: best baby gear of all time
author: Q. Johnson
comments: This thing is amazing... it its extremely long so people of all sizes can use it if you are tiny... smaller than 12 it's going to swallow you... watch the boba on YouTube to learn how to wrap it before it arrives so you can use it right out the mail. Also used as a support while pregnant... this thing is the best. I feel like my baby is safe and secure and my baby feels my heart and warmth and feels secure also.

title: Five Stars
author: Yajaira
comments: Love my wrap! I get compliments everywhere we go!

title: Love this wrap!
author: Angelique Winston
comments: I love this wrap and the closeness I feel when I hold my baby in it.  The only thing I do not like about it is that the cloth is really long and when trying to put it on our in public the cloth hits the ground and I sometimes find myself stepping on pieces of it.  However, it works and feels great!

title: Five Stars
author: Marisol Bednarik
comments: My daughter loved it.

title: novelty
author: Austin M
comments: Good idea, just didn't feel secure. Not my thing.

title: Extremely comfortable way to tote my baby boy
author: Catherine Hamilton-Genson
comments: Extremely comfortable way to tote my baby boy.  I was especially pleased at how well he fit in the Boba as a newborn.

title: daughter loves boba
author: Sheila Gosney
comments: Once I got the hang of putting the wrap on it's great. My daughter loves it and sleeps so soundly in it. I only wish it wasn't as long, I'm only 5'2 so there's lots of material that hangs.

title: Super Product!
author: rr
comments: I love this! The cost is competitive, and they have many color options. Because it wasn't priced terribly high, I could afford to buy more than one. The fabric is nice - soft and stretchy, but strong enough that I don't worry my baby is going to work her way down too far. The website may be the best part of the Boba. It's really well done, and has many instructional videos. Even if you already have a wrap from a different company, their instructional videos are GREAT!

title: Five Stars
author: Princess Victorino
comments: My daughter in law loves it.

title: Five Stars
author: Dana Lynn Thibodeaux
comments: Awesome for shopping! Especially when a stroller would be too bulky.

title: I love it!
author: marcela spadavecchia
comments: I love it !!!it been so handy with my newborn . I have two other children so having my hand free a great .

title: I love my wrap
author: Allison Mantell
comments: I love my wrap! I was worried about learning how to use it, but it was a cinch. I watched a video twice. My baby boy loves it, too. I am even able to nurse him in it.

title: baby cuddles and dishes are done!
author: Cottamia
comments: Love! I had to watch YouTube to understand how this wrap works but now its a lifesaver!

title: I love my boba it makes life so much easier
author: Cami
comments: I love my boba it makes life so much easier! I can cuddle my baby and not wish I had two more hands while holding her and managing my two year old!!!

title: Great product and service
author: Jennifer Reed
comments: Absolutely love it!

title: you won't be sorry
author: Stephan H.
comments: I purchased a black one and they are stretchyer than some of the other wraps but that is part of the boba charm.is very versatile and I have already made up two of my own wrapping techniques that works really well the 100% guarantee that boba offers is really reassuring and it came very nicely packaged and protected when mailed to me I don't have any complaints

title: A++
author: Carter
comments: A must have for a mom is always on the go.

title: I love it. I wish I would have had it ...
author: Andre Percell
comments: I love it.  I wish I would have had it for my three other children

title: GREAT!!!!
author: Nicole Young
comments: I bought the purple Boba and I just love it and so does my daughter! üòä It's so comfortable and it supports her head really well. I highly recommend this product!! üíú

title: love it
author: ldybgs828
comments: This wrap is wonderful and very comfortable.

title: Able to get things done
author: Jenn
comments: My baby is very fussy and needs to be held close and moving around all of the time. Because of the boba wrap, I'm able to make lunch and dinner without putting the baby down. It feels safe and snug for me.It's a bit of w pain the wrap around, but the pros totally outweigh the cons.

title: Great product
author: Rafael R. Vieira
comments: Amazing product. My baby and wife are enjoying its a lot.

title: easy to use
author: becky
comments: Lightweight, easy to use, wide variety of colors available.

title: Love this wrap!
author: Lauren
comments: Love it!!! So much better than a moby wrap.

title: I love this - I didn't get it until my baby ...
author: Mandy
comments: I love this - I didn't get it until my baby was about 2 months old, but I really wish that I would have had it when he was a newborn.  He would have slept better and I would have got more done.  I like that it is easily adjustable, baby feels very secure, it is washable, and you can carry baby in different ways with it.  AND I also see on Pinterest that I can tie it to a table and my other kids can use it as a hammock! :-)

title: Awesome baby wrap! Love it.
author: Stephanie Terry
comments: My baby loves this carrier! Tying took some getting used to but as long as you can tie it snug, the baby is secure and you can be hands-free while wearing baby.

title: Comfortable and so helpful!
author: Paul
comments: This is my second wrap from this company and I LOVE them! They are so wonderful to carry baby hands free and take care of my other kids. Plus my back doesn't hurt after carrying baby for a few hours at a time!

title: I absolutely love the Boba wrap I had 2 gray and purple ...
author: Rebecca Moritz
comments: I absolutely love the Boba wrap I had 2 gray and purple with my daughter. I bought this most recent one for a friend as a gift because I loved mine so much.  I had a Moby as well and only used it once because I preferred the Boba.

title: I LOVE MY BOBA!!!
author: laura field
comments: I LOVE my boba wrap!!! I cannot believe I survived without one during the first year of my first son's birth. With my second son, I have used the boba from everything to daily walks, and hikes, to house hold chores and days on the beach. This wrap is so simple to tie. I was a little skeptical at first that I would be able to get the hang of tying it, however after a couple of tries, I mastered it! My son is six months old and we use the boba almost everyday for various activities. He loves the secure feeling of being right next to me and often times, falls asleep soundly while in the wrap, allowing me to do chores and other physical activities around my home. Don't wait another day to try this wrap! You and your baby will both enjoy!

title: These are the BEST wraps out there
author: Megan Anderson
comments: These are the BEST wraps out there!  I loved wearing my baby in the wrap and he loved it too.  I just purchased my 3rd Boba wrap... my baby is almost one year and I plan to keep wearing him.  We both love it!  I had other brand wraps for my first 2 babies and they do not even compare to the Boba.  It's the best out there!

title: The best carrier ever!
author: Shawn Spicer
comments: So obsessed with these wraps that this is the 2nd one I bought. Was the only way I was able to get anything done when my daughter was in her colic phase. She loved being close and it always calmed her down. I would say it's much easier to use than many other carriers. Just took a minute to get the hang of it. At 4 months I wish our baby liked it as much still but I do feel she's grown out of it some.

title: but it's perfect for the winter- the temperature of mommy and baby ...
author: Bottlenose
comments: Because I was unable to make sure if I can wrap the baby well into this wrap, I was a little hesitate to buy it. But after watching couple videos on YouTube, wrapping the baby seems not a big problem. It is very convenient when you need to carry the baby to the place that is not stroller friendly. Sometimes when the baby starts fuzzy, the wrap can also provide the security and the baby would stop crying in just a few minutes. The only disadvantage for the wrap is -- it is too hot for the summer if you stay outdoor, but it's perfect for the winter- the temperature of mommy and baby would keep you warm.

title: Ended up going with a Baby Bjorn and love it.
author: Jacque Browning
comments: I am only 5 feet tall so this product does not work at all for me.  It's very hard to get on and keep tight.  Ended up going with a Baby Bjorn and love it.

title: Quality Material Secure
author: DreamerNorth
comments: Love this wrap.  The material is quality and wonderful for the use it was made for stretching but providing security and safety for holding your baby.

title: Five Stars
author: Laci Brooksher
comments: It's awesome

title: Easy to use and very comfortable for both mom and baby!
author: MissyCee
comments: I honestly was expecting to have trouble figuring out how to use this wrap, I've never used any wrap before and was nervous to try it. However, after just two times I had it down with no problems. It's very comfortable and my baby loves it and falls asleep every time he's in it. I only wish I had purchased this with my oldest child and saved my back from the uncomfortable baby bjorn!

title: Four Stars
author: mdttkj
comments: Had to get used to putting it on.

title: Wonderful for carrying your baby!
author: Rhonda Marcum
comments: I had the change to review this baby wrap. I don't have a small child or baby. My niece is expecting and I was going to give it to her. I will give my complete review when she has the baby. This is the most wonderful wrap to carry your baby in. The material is very durable and is very soft. It will hold a child up to 35 lbs. I would recommend this baby wrap. Sample received for an honest and unbiased review.

title: Not for a short person?
author: Rozy57
comments: I felt completely overwhelmed by all the fabric. I'm only 5'2" and the material dragged on the floor as I tried step 1 and 2 of wrapping. This may be fine at home but I can't have it dragging if I'm out somewhere. I could never get it to look tight like they show in the video It's just not practical for me, maybe for a taller person?

title: Comfortable for Mom and Baby
author: Sarah
comments: I have the Grey and Sangria wraps. I love both, but the Grey is a bit more versatile. At first I had a lot of difficulty wrapping when my baby was a newborn, but after about a week I got the hang of it (after watching some good Youtube videos) and LOVE it. It's so simple and adjusts as your baby grows.

title: Love it!!!
author: Jordan
comments: Absolutely love it!! I just wish it was a lighter material for hot summer days but still absolutely an amazing product!

title: Didn't work for us
author: Nelli Dersim
comments: Didn't work for us at all. First of all, the material is thick and both of us got hot super quickly.  Secondly, the wrap is super long so the it's partially on the floor when you are putting it on, so if you are somewhere outside - it will get dirty. My biggest issue was lack of back support: it started to hurt literally after 5 minutes of wearing.

title: Five Stars
author: Angelica Downer
comments: Very comfortable

title: A nice wrap
author: Breanne Kriegmont
comments: I really love my boba wrap. It would be best for fall or the colder months bc it's really thick. But that's okay. My newborn also loves it :)

title: One Star
author: Darryl Petz
comments: Not as easy to use as I expected

title: Instructions were kind of confusing and product says up to ...
author: Amie Bertrand
comments: Instructions were kind of confusing and product says up to 36months but it was almost impossible to get my 14month old into and when I finally did I couldn't get him seated in it right

title: Lifesaver!
author: Amy
comments: This was given to me as a shower gift and is in my top 5 baby must haves. My husband's job often makes it difficult to allow me to grocery shop without our babe. Wearing the baby is so much easier than trying to take her in the car seat (which takes up the entire shopping cart). She typically falls asleep while I wear her in the Boba, but even if she doesn't, she is very content in it. It also helps to keep strangers from feeling like they can touch her. If she gets fussy while I am trying to do things around the house, I just put on my wrap and wear her around the house.It took a couple of attempts to get it on just right, but now it is really quick and easy to put it on and put her in it. Since it is a very long piece of fabric I do suggest putting it on at the house before you leave if you know you are going to need it in order to avoid getting it filthy in parking lots.

title: Totally love this wrap
author: mrdux
comments: Totally love this wrap.  I also have a chicco wrap and a Bjorn..  both of which I wish I could return.  They don't support the baby or my posture in the same way.  This wrap feels safe and secure and my LO really likes it.

title: Four Stars
author: Mrs.P
comments: Love it and my baby. Its just it takes time to wear.

title: If you have any extra weight on it is very uncomfortable. Accentuates every roll. Too much to it for my taste. Takes too long
author: V. Thompson
comments: Works best if your skinny.

title: Five Stars
author: Heather
comments: I love it! But more importantly,  my baby loves it!

title: Boba wrap
author: HILDA DAVALOS
comments: Excellent product easy to use, hands free. I am givimg a 4 instead of 5, because it makes me sweaty, but it is based on the fabric for its elasticity.

title: Too hot
author: Kristin N.
comments: Very very hot. Easy to use, and very secure. But all those layer makes it very hot for both me and baby. Maybe it's postpartem hotflashes, but baby and I both end up covered in sweat after 10 minutes. It's really unpleasant. I wanted to wear her, I wanted to love this.

title: Love my boba wrap
author: Ida Kostur
comments: Love my boba wrap. . Light weight but strong! :) great starter wrap before getting them into the ssc boba 4g!

title: I tried to love this product
author: Carla
comments: I tried to love this product, but it is just okay. I love how snug my child is in the wrap, but I have to make the wrap so tight that I cannot wear it all day. My child loves it though so that is a plus.

title: it isnt easy when the baby is crying
author: NaeemTHM
comments: It takes too long to out this on. it isnt easy when the baby is crying, laying there waiting to be held. My baby fall alseep in there, but it slowly sags. When every time i need to take my baby out it is a big comition. I rather just carry my baby in my arms than deal with this wrap.

title: Five Stars
author: bmom
comments: A must have!

title: Too confusing
author: Apple
comments: Too confusing to use with squirming baby-- bought a lille baby carrier instead!

title: My daughter loved it and I love it
author: Laura E. Snyder
comments: I cannot rave about my boba enough. My daughter loved it and I love it. I used it every day for the first 3 months and I recommend it and give it as a gift as often as I can. It takes some getting used to to learn to tie, but it was worth every minute.

title: it's pretty easy to put on and take off
author: Ericka Schmidt
comments: This wrap has been a life saver. I read the step by step instructions the first time I put it on and have not had to read them again, it's pretty easy to put on and take off. I have been using this since my baby was a week old- I was the dishes and use it when he's fussy and needs to be close to his mama. It comes with a little cloth storage bag, but I just roll up the wrap and store it in our hall closet.

title: ... the friend I gave it to said it was pretty uncomfortable and too much of a hassle to put ...
author: Griselda
comments: I gave it as a gift and the friend I gave it to said it was pretty uncomfortable and too much of a hassle to put it on and off.

title: Two's better than one
author: D in Big D
comments: I know my granddaughter will enjoy using the one I bought and also another...she's keeping both for backup.

title: Hard to use..
author: avonti
comments: I wanted to like this product but I can't even use it. I've watched YouTube videos, read the instructions, etc, and to no avail I'm still confused. I know if I were to actually get the hang of this my son would love it. I'll update the stars if I'm able to figure it out.

title: A must have!
author: Andrea Ascencio
comments: I didn't have this (or any wrap) with my first daughter and I wish I did!  It's perfect for little babies and I love being able to be close to my daughter while being hands free.  It is really great for sleeping as they get all cozy in there and can lay their head right on your chest amd hear your heartbeat just like in the womb!

title: Love it! My 12 pound 1-month old spends quite ...
author: E. Thompson
comments: Love it! My 12 pound 1-month old spends quite a bit of time in it so he can be close to momma but momma can get things done ;-)

title: Not for Big girls
author: Jennifer lee Crawford
comments: If you are still pregnant or somewhere between a 4XL-6XL shirt this will not fit you, even to tie it the way it is intended is impossible. You'd think it would be stretchy enough but it's not. Prepregnancy I was a size XL-2XL and I have no Idea how small I will be when I need to fit into mine.

title: It's not for everybody but I love mine!
author: Persephone
comments: Ok so you have to be super diligent about learning how to put it on and it takes practice.  Initially, it is a pain to figure it out and a few times, you will have to undo it and try again because it will be too loose and Baby will hang too low.  In general I do not enjoy putting it on and even taking it off is a drag.  It is also HOT so this is not a summer item unless you're always in air conditioning.  Those are the cons.However, once I do have it on properly, I love it.  My son enjoys it too and I have my hands free to do other things. I definitely prefer it to those carriers that look like backpacks - just my personal preference but those carriers seem so impersonal.  My son feels secure and happy in the boba. I feel pregnant again (in a good way) because we're so close.  He tends to instantly fall asleep almost because he's so comfortable.  And one of the things I like the most is that I don't feel pressure on my back or shoulders.  The material holds the baby's weight.  That's really helpful when you're working with a postpartum body that isn't as strong as it once was.  So I think it's gentle on me.  My son is almost 20lbs, super long and barely 5 months.  Oh and even though it's hot, if you're out on a breezy day or if you're in a cold supermarket, it's a hassle free alternative to a blanket.  I get so tired of trying to properly cover my child with a blanket when it's falling about the place and... well you know what I mean if you've ever had to grapple with a blanket and a squirming baby.  So yeah, I love it. I would understand people who don't... sometimes I avoid using it because I feel lazy to tie it, but you get used to it if you want to.

title: love it!
author: Astrid
comments: I can't go a day without using this. Had to order a second one just so I can wash the first! (Plus I wanted another color üòÑ)

title: Five Stars
author: Kindle Customer
comments: Love it!

title: Five Stars
author: Harold
comments: nice

title: Okay wrap but sags and really really hot
author: F Chen
comments: I tried the Boba, and honestly, it's not a bad wrap. However, I ditched it for a woven wrap and found while woven wraps are perceived as more "granola", it is more versitile and not more difficult to wrap. I found the Boba to be very very warm, and sags with a 13 pound baby, and again.. really really hot.. like heat stroke hot. Woven wraps come in cotton blend, cotton/bamboo blend, and linen blend, which are much cooler, also there is no stretch in the fabric, thus no sagging. So overally, Boba is not a bad beginner wrap, but for a tiny bit more money or the same price, You can get a super colorful woven wrap, which are just far superior products in my opinion.

title: Love my Boba!
author: Anne
comments: Love this! It took me a few tries to get it on myself, but once I was confident enough, I put my 4 week old in it and he was out like a light! He loves being chest to chest, so this kept him calm and tired without me having to hold him constantly. I also use this when I run errands and i don't want to have to carry around the baby car seat or the stroller. A tip - put on the wrap before you leave the house, so when you get to your destination, you just put the baby in without having to tie the wrap in the parking lot. I would definitely recommend this to my friends.

title: Five Stars
author: Stu4jc
comments: Daughter in law loves it and will use it once grandson is born

title: We love our Boba.
author: Sarah Humphreys
comments: Everyone asks me about this when I am out wearing my little.. I wish I had it in every color but I totally went for the sale price. Baby loves it and it helps me keep my hands free in the house with my toddler to tend to, as well as in public when running errands or going to events. Everyone should wrap their babies!! It's the BEST!!

title: Love it so much!
author: Sharon
comments: I had a maya but this is surprisingly easier to use, more comfortable for me and and my baby, and better for her age of a year. Easier to take her in and out. Best part is I don't have to remove and readjust it if I do take her out!

title: warm
author: Heather
comments: My baby likes it but I always get too warm

title: Five Stars
author: khiester
comments: Wrap is fun but the color is not accurate. This is more a light brick red than sangria.

title: my baby didn't like it very much
author: Zeina Shreif
comments: It's OK. At first it was frustrating to put on, but once I got the hang of it it went quickly. However, my baby didn't like it very much. I think she was getting overheated. We used it from 6 weeks till 9 weeks old.

title: Great wrap. Way better than the Moby wrap
author: Freeman
comments: The Boba wrap is so much better than the Moby wrap! The Moby wrap would stretch out as I was wearing it and I would have to untie it and tighten it and re tie it. The Boba is made of slightly stretchy material so you tie it without leaving room for the baby and then stretch it to put the baby in and it stays tight enough to hold the baby comfortably and you don't have to re tie it. There is a bit of a learning curve when you first start using it getting the tightness right.  I'd recommend this wrap for babies 0-12m, but if can be used well after that, I just prefer a more structured carrier when they get bigger.

title: I love my boba wrap
author: Desiree Ponteres
comments: I love my boba wrap. I will not exchange it for anything else. Very easy to use. It helps me do my errands, just put my baby on it and I'm ready to go. at first I thought it was very long for me because I'm small just stand 5 feet tall but it fits me perfectly. You can easily adjust the remaining fabric by tying it twice or double wrapping around your waist. My son loves it, He easily goes to sleep when I put him on it. Just make sure you don't ever dress your baby or he will get too hot because of your body temp, him and the fabric. This is a good baby shower gift.

title: Three Stars
author: Cavalcanti
comments: It is very good, but too hot

title: Best baby item everyone should have one
author: Barbara
comments: Must have for any mom.  A bit tricky to put on at first but with a little practice it soon becomes the best baby item you own.

title: Great Product
author: Krista Robinson
comments: I love my Boba wrap! I tried a Moby wrap and the fabric is not as stretchy as the Boba wrap. I think the Boba is more comfortable and easier to adjust.

title: Great for airline travel!
author: MJanssen
comments: First I have the Mayan Wrap, Ergo & Bjorn carriers. The Boba is by far the easiest for a newborn! My child will immediately calm down when I place her in this wrap. In addition I've flown a lot with my baby and this wrap is a dream on the airplane! Tsa doesn't make you take this wrap off which is a bonus and the wrap doubles as a blanket.

title: Love it!
author: Megan Kiefer
comments: Love the boba wrap! My baby is asleep in it within five minutes and after watching a couple YouTube videos it was super easy to put on.

title: Time consuming
author: Erika T
comments: Kind of time consuming but the material is soft for a little one.

title: Love
author: Sasha
comments: I absolutely love it! Pull it right !

title: We'll see.....
author: T.F.
comments: Haven't had the chance to use it yet but so very excited it's here. now to try it out when my newborn is a little bit bigger.

title: Didn't Work For Me
author: Consumer Jane
comments: This didn't work for me and my baby. As a few other reviewers have noted, this is essentially a giant piece of stretchy fabric.  You tie it to yourself in a specific way and put the baby in it.  For me, the amount of fabric is overwhelming (it drags along the floor as you are tying it), and it is cumbersome to tie it in the specific manner needed.  Once you have the fabric tied to you correctly, it difficult to place the baby inside.  The baby also didn't seem to like being carried it it very much, I think it isn't a comfortable fit - I think the baby is too squished (my baby is currently 1 month old, I tried it when we first brought him home from the hospital, and again just a few days ago).  The quest for a suitable carrying apparatus continues...

title: Five Stars
author: KWagner
comments: These wraps are great!

title: it's so stretchy that no matter how tight I tie it my baby sinks like a stone
author: Natalie
comments: Doesn't work well for newborns, it's so stretchy that no matter how tight I tie it my baby sinks like a stone. I'll save it for when she's older.

title: SO AWESOME!
author: Ashlee blessinger
comments: Okay so I just got this in the mail and tried it in and put my baby in it and the first time I made it too lose so I tried it again and it was perfect! It doesn't put much weight on your back so you don't get tired after a while and you are totally hands free. It doesn't feel like my baby will slip out at all which is a good thing lol! But it just takes some getting used to when it comes to putting it together but it took me no longer than a minute. The box comes with instructions and they were very easy to understand. I highly recommend this to anyone with a baby that wants a hand-free option to carry your baby but doesn't like the carriers that are too expensive or the ones that hurt your back. This is definitely the way to go!!!

title: I know many moms love this and are awesome and wrangling an infant and ...
author: Lost Soul
comments: You have to be a magician to figure this out. As a first time mom I didn't have the skills to work this on a daily basis. The few times that I did use it resulted in us both over-heating and being covered in sweat. I know many moms love this and are awesome and wrangling an infant and contorting to get this thing to work, but I am not one of them. Love the concept but it wasn't for me.

title: Don't waste your money...get an Ergo instead....
author: LJ
comments: Soft and comfortable fabric--wish I had a shirt made of this---HOWEVER....my 12 pound son felt like he would fall out an any time--I never got the desired support I wanted from this and having to wrap it was a pain.  It's so long, that inevitably it will get dirty as it drags across the floor while in the process of wrapping.  I returned it and ended up purchasing an Ergo carrier, which I love.

title: Four Stars
author: Keisha C
comments: Just need practice with the wrap. It's easier on video.

title: Best $40 I've spent in a long time
author: Jamie B.
comments: I have purchased numerous carriers and this is by far my favorite for my 1 month old. He LOVES it - it is like a tranquilizer dart! He sleeps soon soundly in it.  Haven't tried BF in it yet but I am excited to try. also heard this was good for doing light working out in (squats, lunges, etc.) - also excited to try that after 6 weeks!  I like that this positions him in the center - as opposed to my/his other favorite carrier, the Maya sling.

title: ... needed a wrap quickly and this was #1 with great reviews, however in the end I find it ...
author: tatiniki2
comments: I ordered this because I needed a wrap quickly and this was #1 with great reviews, however in the end I find it takes way too long to put on and the material is too hot for the summer.

title: ... the fabric doesn't breathe very well so baby gets pretty hot. Its usefulness seems limited to cold climates ...
author: Jennifer Schur
comments: Only downside is that the fabric doesn't breathe very well so baby gets pretty hot. Its usefulness seems limited to cold climates or winter in the south.

title: We ended up getting a cheaper one with breathable sides and she does better it in
author: Stephanie Lopez
comments: Feels way more secure than I thought it would but my daughter gets too hot in it and doesn't last long in it. We ended up getting a cheaper one with breathable sides and she does better it in.

title: Five Stars
author: nichole wawrzyniak
comments: Awesome! Easy to use and easy to clean !

title: Great thing, happy to have good instructions included
author: Nik@
comments: A bit tricky for the first time to put on, but the instructions are very simple, well explained and with photos, so was nice to have them and then baby liked it, the only thing I'm kinda concerned about is heat, the wrap seems to be a bit too warm for hot weather, but we'll see

title: Lifesaver!
author: Megan Barron
comments: The ONLY way I could get my baby to sleep! I loved that it was a bit stretchier than the Moby so I could pop baby in an out :-). Don't be intimidated, it's very easy to use!

title: Love this wrap!
author: Toni Smith
comments: This is a great wrap!! It is super soft and comfortable. My daughter loves it and since she was over 8 pounds when she was born we used it immediately. For the first 6 weeks it was one of the only ways I could get her to sleep at night. It also made getting things done around the house so much easier. I could still snuggle her and paint with my 2 year old or do laundry. I highly recommend this wrap to anyone considering a wrap. The price is great compared to some of the other wraps out there and well worth every penny.

title: Amazing baby carrier
author: Emz
comments: Amazing baby carrier. Very soft and easy to master. Comfortable enough to leave on so you can easily take baby in and out.

title: Perfect for newborns and infants
author: Melissa Moore
comments: Best wrap for newborns!! I loved holding my baby close. My son loves to be worn and the Boba wrap was perfect for us.

title: I love this stretch wrap
author: kco417
comments: I love this stretch wrap.  It keeps us comfy for hours but doesn't stretch out the way other brands do :)

title: you can't go wrong!
author: Jessica
comments: Boba= the best!

title: Lifesaver!
author: Kathryn Preckol
comments: I can think of so many days that we would not have survived without the Boba wrap when my son was an infant! I miss snuggling with him in it now that he's outgrown it. It was hands down the best purchase I made for my baby!

title: Great first wrap for you and your newborn
author: Glamlashesandlips
comments: Great first wrap. I carried my newborn in this soft, squishy wrap until she was just over six months old. She loved it, I loved it, we had a great close bond and I got stuff done. When I first took it out of the box, it was scary because I never thought I'd be able to learn how to wrap a baby in that thing, but after a couple practice runs I was a pro. I would definitely recommend this for use with a newborn.

title: Supportive and comfortable
author: Laura
comments: this wrap is definitely in my top 5 necessary baby items. I couldn't have survived the newborn stage without it, especially having a toddler to care for at the same time. It helped me to bond with one baby while having two free hands to care for the other:)

title: A Baby Must Have!
author: Meg
comments: Love our Boba wrap...my baby was 10 days old when we (yes, even my husband loves wearing our baby!) first tried it. Loved it and baby girl loves it to - she's so content in it. Love the material, she feels so secure,  and it let's mommy be hands free to get things accomplished while having baby right up against me. Wouldn't change anything about it! Highly recommend

title: Cozy wrap!
author: ACarrasquillo
comments: I love my Boba wrap! I had a Moby wrap with my first child and thought I loved it. Then I was told about the Sleepy Wrap (now the Boba wrap) - purchased one for my second child and LOVED it even more. Thinking we were all done with having babies, I gave both wraps away and am now expecting our third child. I purchased a grey Boba wrap and it's perfect! It's light weight and much stretchier than the Moby. I'm hoping my third child loves this wrap as much as his big brother did - I just love how babies fall asleep in it whenever they're put in! So sweet and snug.

title: Great wrap
author: Jen
comments: I love my boba wrap! It is easy to learn to tie and simple to get baby in and out. I can pre tie before going out and just pop baby in, no tieing on the go! Stretchy but hasn't sagged at all (using with my 3 month old, 11ish lbs).

title: Very pleased
author: Latrice Nash
comments: My sister loves this. It's just what she needed for bundle of joy. It's very comfortable.

title: Five Stars
author: MW
comments: Best newborn stretchy wrap!

title: Great product but hot
author: Lauren B
comments: I love my wrap. The only down fall is it gets really HOT between you and baby, so it's not a good summer outdoors carrier, unless you live in a cooler climate. Other than that I love everything about this product.

title: Must have for parent-to-be!
author: Miriam Stoeckel
comments: Easiest way to get things done around the house with a newborn and great for walks, grocery shopping... I love to use it when the baby is fussy and then she falls asleep.

title: This wrap works well but it is not that comfortable when you child reaches 15 lbs and up
author: Stephen Teralynn Wortman
comments: This wrap works well but it is not that comfortable when you child reaches 15 lbs and up. My son was 15 lbs at 3 months and this wrap became useless to me because my back hurt to much to continue using it.

title: Love my Boba wraps
author: Tanya
comments: Love my Boba wraps! They are so soft and comfy, while being supportive and breathable. Hands down, my favourite stretchy wrap!

title: Five Stars
author: Sarah E Broome
comments: Perfect for a newborn

title: Amazing baby wrap!
author: zblondchef
comments: I absolutely love my Boba wrap. It's lightweight, easy to store, easy to wash. My baby was a large one (9lbs) and I love that when wearing the Boba wrap I can't feel the weight of her on my shoulders. I have a Baby Bjorn that I used twice and hated because I could feel all her weight in my shoulders. Once I used my Boba wrap I never used anything else again. I would highly recommend one to anyone over the traditional baby carriers. I did have trouble understanding the directions on how to put it on the first, but after youtubing it, it was a breeze!

title: Five Stars
author: Jamie
comments: LOVE my BOBA wrap! Very comfortable, easy to tie and babe sits safe and snug in it.

title: I love my boba warp and my 5 month old daughter ...
author: Sarah
comments: I love my boba warp and my 5 month old daughter loves being carrived in it.I used it at the dog park, shopping and sporting events. She is safe and secure and can nap comfortably or see what's going on around her.  I can even feed her in it.It evenly distributes her weight so that there is no strain on my back or shoulders.

title: I used this wrap for all of my children from ...
author: Nan1016
comments: I used this wrap for all of my children from day 1 until about 3 months. It makes a very secure fit for a newborn and washes well. I would keep my wrap on all day and just pop my baby in and out of it as needed. After about 3 months, it gets heavy and baby seems to want to start to look around. I would highly rec' it for those early days.

title: snuggles on the go
author: Takara
comments: we have loved our boba wrap. It was like having an extra set of hands. I could snuggle my baby and still get some things done around the house. When we were away from home or she was sick and needed to be held, she napped in the boba. now that she's big, we've upgraded to the boba 4g carrier, but I highly recommend the wrap for infants. It is one of my favorite pieces of baby gear.

title: Five Stars
author: Ruth Abolofia
comments: Overall great product!

title: My baby doesn't like being carried but if he did
author: Amy Carter
comments: My baby doesn't like being carried but if he did, I would wear him in this thing all day every day. We also have a moby and the boba takes the cake. Not only is it easier to put on, but the slight stretch in the fabric makes it more comfortable.

title: Didn't work for me at all!!! I ...
author: Inga McCollum
comments: Maybe other mothers like this Boba Wrap, but it didn't work for me at all!!! I don't feel safe to put my baby in it, and walk around  hands free.

title: Five Stars
author: Tina A.
comments: My daughter loves this. The material is soft, it can get hot if it's warm out.

title: Takes a little bit of practice to put it on ...
author: Lulu
comments: Takes a little bit of practice to put it on and baby in without any help but it works well.

title: Two Stars
author: Kristine&Kawena
comments: too much to get it like that.

title: Not for us
author: Lina
comments: Bla seems unsafe and my baby hated it. I think he felt squished by it since you have to tie it so tightly around your body.

title: Great for carrying newborns
author: Andrea
comments: This was a great wrap for wearing my newborn daughter, and I received tons of compliments on it. Plus it felt very secure. But it is extremely long, like 7 or 8 feet! I'm plus sized, and I had plenty of extra wrap available, so I tied it in a big bow at my back. I will add that it is very warm to wear too. Still, I really liked it.

title: Perfect for any Mom
author: usmcwife
comments: Absolutely love it! The fabric stretches, it's soft and keeps baby warm. I purchased mine in the maroon color. It has plenty of fabric to work with, even for larger women. It distributes the weight evenly so that mommy doesn't get any back pain. Five stars!!!

title: Just ok. Rides up on you. Too stretchy.
author: Beth
comments: I ended up giving mine to a cousin. This was just too stretchy for me. I'm 5'5" and 130lbs and I had to pull this pretty tight to keep baby from moving around when leaned forward. As a result it really bunched up and rode up my shirt in the back. That was annoying. Also baby kept sliding down and I was worried she'd not be able to breathe as well. It just needs to be a little less stretchy. It seems to be made out of good material though and probably works great for some people. Just not my favorite unfortunately.

title: Best wrap out there
author: Arianne Baumback
comments: Best wrap out there!  Love it over the Moby because it is easier to manipulate and stretches with movements.  Used all the time!

title: easy to use and very fast delivery
author: Giuliana P
comments: Light, easy to use and very fast delivery.

title: Wish i had it for my first
author: PJG
comments: I love this wrap. I wear my newborn everywhere. It is so convenient, light weight, easy to wrap, and soft. My newborn always falls asleep as soon as I put her in there.

title: Four Stars
author: L Koch
comments: This was a nice wrap but my baby hated it.

title: awesome product. My son hates a traditional carier but ...
author: Girl123
comments: awesome product. My son hates a traditional carier but loves this. He is 12lbs  and i can tell it will work for a while. It was easy to tie, i got it on the first try, and at 1 month old he feels really safe and secure in it. I never review things but i had to with this bc its so awesome üòä

title: This item has no clasps or buttons. While I ...
author: MichelleShops
comments: This item has no clasps or buttons.  While I know some swear by this wrap, relying on a complex knotting method to ensure my baby was secure, was not for me.  I returned it and received a full refund.

title: Five Stars
author: luke
comments: Use it everyday!!

title: I would definitely recommend this to other parents
author: Jessica Wagner
comments: I have an active three-year-old and a new baby.  I needed a way to be able to hold the baby and do things with the Tot (make lunch, color, play outside, etc) and this does the trick.  I was a bit concerned about how to wrap this around myself; however, the pictures and directions that came with the wrap were simple to follow.  Honestly the most challenging part was how to actually get the baby in the wrap but after a few uses I have it down.  I would definitely recommend this to other parents!

title: Five Stars
author: Ashley
comments: So far so good!!!  Just make sure it is tight or your little one slips down a little.

title: Five Stars
author: INDY MOM
comments: it was a gift and my cousin loved it, it's exactly what she wanted.

title: One of those items your wife wants but may not use after a week...
author: Bytes
comments: Great for a few days.... Not getting much use but she really wanted one. Also the black is a bad color if you have pets in my opinion.

title: Total game changer!
author: Patricia
comments: Wonderful wrap... total lifesaver for getting anything done with a newborn. The only con in my opinion is that it gets really hot. I live in Southern California and if it's not under 70 outside, I end up sweating.

title: Missing the boba label making it hard to find the ...
author: tamar
comments: Missing the boba label making it hard to find the middle, which the directions tell you to do to put it on correctly.  Also had an odor, came out after a wash though.  Not impressed.

title: Great for preemies!
author: Sarah K. Kleinman
comments: Love this wrap carrier so much! My son was a preemie and came home from the nicu at almost 4months old. He loves to kangaroo and this allows him to still be tucked together and close to me. Other carriers have baby's legs hanging out... This one gives you the option. If you use it right, your baby and back are nicely supported. Material is soft. I love having hands free but after a bit you will need to readjust when walking. Wish I would've had it for the nicu also.

title: Good
author: Gin n Tonic
comments: Haven't used it yet. Just washed it. I like that it is super stretchy. It will still fit me as I loose weight!!!  And seems to be a lot less fabric than my old one! It is adjustable since you tie it yourself.

title: Almost Perfect
author: B. Bentley
comments: I love this wrap and so does my daughter. My only complaints are it stretches out fairly quick and the fabric is a bit heavy. (Thick) It's very easy to wrap though and fairly simple to adjust once it stretches out.

title: Just an expensive piece of fabric
author: J. Gayetty
comments: This is just a long piece of fabric for $38. Not only that, but I cannot imagine how long it would take to tie this thing on your body. No thanks. Give me something to put on and drop the baby in.

title: I got a backpack-like carrier and that works a lot better for me
author: Allie G
comments: Exactly as described, but not for me. I'm small and this was waaay too much fabric. It was also a pain for me to get on every time I wanted to walk her around anywhere. I got a backpack-like carrier and that works a lot better for me.

title: ... have tried another brand of baby wraps that I like MUCH better
author: Bbrandt
comments: I have tried another brand of baby wraps that I like MUCH better!  This material on this one is strechy where they other ones were not.  As time went on my baby kept sinking lower and lower.  I didn't feel nearly as secure in this one.

title: Time Consuming
author: bgurlee
comments: Takes time to get the wrapping instructions memorized and can be time consuming. I just pictured myself bringing this on an outing with the baby and trying to figure it out while I'm outside of my car while she's waiting to be taken out of the car seat. The fabric is really long (will touch the floor while wrapping it around your body), so you have to make sure you have it tight wrapped around or it wont hold the baby up. I watched youtube videos for most of the instructions. My baby loved being close to me, but I'm a hot momma and she's a hot baby, not the perfect combo. I think this wrap would be great during chilly days, but not in hot Cali summer days.

title: though I have gotten pretty good at it
author: rakel
comments: a few things: I get tired of wrapping this all the time, though I have gotten pretty good at it, but my husband has no patience for it. The fabric is really warm and my daughter cries when it gets too hot. Also, when I first put her in she's snug up on my chest kissable close, but after wearing her for a bit she'll sag down and I have to try and lift her up. It'd be better if it was slightly less stretchy and a thinner material that doesn't get so warm.

title: Five Stars
author: Ebonee Winfrey
comments: Great for keeping baby calm. Can have baby nearby while doing chores and is great for outings.

title: Five Stars
author: Ruth Ann Cranford
comments: This was a gift and she loved it

title: Love love love!
author: Amber Winkles
comments: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this baby wrap! My son also loves it, the first day it came in the mail my son was actually sick and I couldn't get anything done around the house because he wanted me to hold him. Well I put the wrap on ( which was easy to figure out thanks to you tube ) and put him in and he slept the whole time I cooked and cleaned for my family! I would recommend this wrap to anyone. Love it!

title: Just what I expected based on other reviews
author: Esperanza
comments: I read about a gazillion reviews for different types of wraps before finally settling on a Boba Baby Wrap.  Reading about the various types of wraps was mind-boggling, and I didn't know which one to choose; so finally I decided to let my color preference settle the matter.  I chose the Boba Wrap so I could get PURPLE.  And it is a very nice, grape-y shade of purple, similar to the color of my favorite sweatshirt jacket in college days.This was a purchase for use with my fifth child.  I hadn't even heard of this kind of baby carrier before, with my previous pregnancies.  I watched several video demonstrations on how to put it on and get the baby into it, so by the time it arrived in the mail, I knew just what to do.  What all the other reviewers have to say is true---put it on pretty tight.  The material is like a super-soft, stretchy T-shirt or like a very lightweight and cozy sweatshirt.  Lots of give.  And it is warm, which was great for me with my Christmas baby.  But now that the weather is warming up here in Florida, it's not the greatest for use outdoors.For use around the house---like when baby wants to be held and I want to be able to type on my computer or sort laundry---it's perfect.  But if I want to be able to wear it out and about, I have to put it on in the house before I leave (same as so many other reviewers).  It IS a ton of fabric, and I don't think there would be any way to put it on without it dragging on the floor/ground at least a little bit.  And if you need to nurse or pump milk, unless you're wearing special clothing for nursing, you'll probably need to take the thing off (or loosen it so much that the only way to get the baby back in would be to completely re-tie it).This wrap IS super-cozy for the baby, though.  If he is tired and I put him in, he's asleep in no time flat.  If he's awake and wants to look around and be able to move a bit, though, then it just kind of makes him mad.  That's partly because he still has weak head/neck control.  Babies who can hold their heads up and look around probably like it much better.The bottom line for me on this type of wrap (and why I gave it four stars instead of five) is that it's just not as convenient to use as certain other types of carriers.  I brought both the Boba and a linen ring sling along on a recent family vacation.  I used the ring sling constantly but never once reached for the Boba.  It just wouldn't have been as convenient.

title: Comfortable
author: Douglas Teixiera
comments: Great for carrying the baby around without the need for a buggie. A bit difficult to wear but once you figure it out, it is a life saver and very comfortable for mother and baby

title: Love my boba
author: Presley
comments: Love my boba wrap! Only this I hate is putting it on in the parking lot or public because it's so long and gets dirty because it touches the floor. It's a little time consuming to get on until you get the hang of it. My daughter always falls asleep in it and I love the stretchy material unlike the moby that has not as stretchy material.

title: Five Stars
author: Marlee
comments: Love it. It's a little hot to use during the summer though.

title: With the Boba Wrap he is positioned perfectly and he is secure enough I don't have to keep holding him like with the ring sling
author: Cacie
comments: I thought this product would be difficult to use and it is completely the opposite. I was using a ring sling for my son and found it pulled on my shoulder leaving me in pain and also my back because the baby was on one side. With the Boba Wrap he is positioned perfectly and he is secure enough I don't have to keep holding him like with the ring sling. This product is awesome and you're able to use it until 35 pounds so I will get a lot of use out of it since my son is 6 months old and only 12 pounds.

title: Great wrap for the money
author: Chris
comments: Bought this for my wife to use for our newborn and it works great, just takes a little getting used to. The fabric soft and stretchy, so it's comfortable to wear. You just need to make sure that it supports the infants head well. I'm sure that when summer comes the light weight of the fabric will be another plus. We definitely recommend this product!

title: Amazing!
author: Elizabeth
comments: Loveeee my boba wrap. It has saved me on so many occasions. What an amazing product!

title: LOVE my Boba Wrap
author: Melody
comments: LOVE my Boba Wrap.  Very easy to use and received many compliments on it.  Great to wear newborn while chasing 4yo.  Returned Moby & Maya wrap (good products, but less forgiving).  Boba Wrap is stretchy fabric so easy to tie & securely wear baby.  We also have the Boba 4G carrier we used w/4yo.

title: Great carrier!
author: Sara Rainwater
comments: This is excellent for carrying baby in when she wants to be held but you have stuff to do.  Easy to put on after watching video online.... wish I had this with my first!

title: Great product. If it is the first time wrapping
author: Des
comments: Great product. If it is the first time wrapping, it will take a few times to get it right.

title: Too cumbersome!
author: Siri Kristenson
comments: This wrap was just to complicated!  It took forever for my husband and me to figure it out and required both of us to put baby safely inside.  Too much work and unrealistic for one person.  I then got the K'Tan carrier, which I highly recommend.

title: but decided to get a boba based on the great reviews. The material is nice and soft and ...
author: Stefanie Jeanne
comments: I had never tried a wrap, but decided to get a boba based on the great reviews.  The material is nice and soft and stretchy, which I liked.  When I tried to use it, there was a bit of a learning curve.  I had to watch several videos explaining the proper way to wear a baby and how to assemble the wrap.  I practiced with dolls, and finally with my baby.  While my baby loved being in the wrap, I never felt super secure with her in there, despite making the wrap fairly tight.  I always made sure to put my hand down over the wrap supporting her as well, so I was never truly hands free.  Finally, when she reached about 12-14 lbs, I completely stopped using it and got an Ergo carrier, which we love.

title: Better than Moby
author: MKS
comments: Love the soft, stretchy fabric!Baby loves it too.. Much better than the Moby- so much easier to wrap this,  to get the baby in and out, to shift positions, and even nurse while she's in it! Love love love, thank you! The floral print was a pretty bonus for my me.-Happy Wife

title: Five Stars
author: Marissa
comments: Love it!

title: Love it. Tried many baby carriers in the past ...
author: jessica
comments: Love it. Tried many baby carriers in the past and never used them. They were uncomfortable for both the baby and myself. The wrap is easy to use, comfortable, and supportive. Wish I had tried it sooner!

title: The fabric is soft and of great quality.
author: DRS
comments: No feedback yet. It is a gift. The fabric is soft and of great quality.

title: Absolutely fantastic. I didn't think I needed this until I ...
author: chibimaron
comments: Absolutely fantastic. I didn't think I needed this until I realized how non-functional I was at the house when I'm alone with the baby. He just doesn't want to be left alone! So now with the Boba wrap, I can take him around the house and have my hands free! I highly recommend this product!

title: but it doesn't seem to get baby as snug as I need her and still feel comfortable.
author: KSheck
comments: I may just need more practice with it...but it doesn't seem to get baby as snug as I need her and still feel comfortable.

title: Too difficult
author: Michelle
comments: This is so hard to get used to that for me it's impossible to use. The fabric is so long that if you were to keep it in the car and put it on at a different location it would drag all over the dirty ground. I'll stick to my Baby Bjorn.

title: good price great product
author: brittany moore
comments: Came on time as described works great for me very easy to use if you watch the video on YouTube or read the pamphlet carefully that comes with it. I use for front carrying and even for discreetly breastfeeding in public can't wait to try back carrying with my little one. Good price and great product.

title: My baby loved this when I first brought him home
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My baby loved this when I first brought him home! It made doing things around the house much easier. Once he got older I used a baby bijorn though.

title: I LOVE my Boba Wrap
author: Tabitha Shenk
comments: I LOVE my Boba Wrap! For my second child I used a Moby Wrap and loved it but decided to try out a different wrap with my third. I'm so glad I did! The fabric used for the Boba wrap is so soft! It's very stretchy compared to the Moby wrap which makes nursing so much easier. (The only problem is that because its very stretchy you need to adjust baby more often from sliding down.)

title: Five Stars
author: Jo Po
comments: It was exactly what my daughter wanted

title: I love this! I watched a video on you tube ...
author: avande91
comments: I love this! I watched a video on you tube for putting it on and I got it right in one try.  Only problem is that it makes my baby sweat,even if she's only wearing a onsie.

title: BEST THING IVE INVESTED IN SINCE MY SON WAS BORN.
author: James Devroy üóøüíôüê£
comments: So I was a little skeptical about this wrap. But I am so glad I bought it!!! My son normally wakes up when I set him down for a nap so I bought this so I could kill 2 birds with one stone. He get a sleep, and I can get things done. I've only had this for about 4 hours and he is already sleeping in it, very peacefully. He loves it, I love it. Buy this product.

title: ... only had this for a few days but it's great I thought it would be complicated to figure out ...
author: Alison McClure
comments: I've only had this for a few days but it's great I thought it would be complicated to figure out and I was able to do it on my first try my baby girl loves it after not liking to other wraps and slings.  She has a cold right now and this works great for me to keep her upright and carry around and be close to her all day

title: Five Stars
author: Christine
comments: Well received...

title: I love the Boba
author: Foxylady
comments: I love the Boba! Price wise it was a better price when compared to the Moby but the quality is definitely there. My 1 month old literally falls asleep whenever I put him in. Wrapping it was a little challenging at first, but I quickly got the hang of it after watching a couple of YouTube videos. I also use it to nurse. This may be trivial but I don't like the fact that the tag in the front is not sewn on completely. It rolls up & makes it harder to find the center. It also makes the product a appear cheaper. The box & paperwork that came with this appear to have a different logo. I almost thought this was a counterfeit until I visited the website. It would also be nice if there were a pocket at the top front. Other than that, this is a must have product. Thanks Boba!

title: Great
author: lara
comments: I used this one a lot with my first child. I'll get another one for my next one. Good for winter, but not so good for summer (it get's hot). Good up to 3 or 4 months, after you'll need something that has less give, because of the baby's weight. But for newborns it's cozy and comfy.

title: Five Stars
author: Amanda M Torres
comments: My baby is so snuggly with the wrap :)

title: Good quality and soft
author: Michelle
comments: Never used .. Couldn't keep it to hold up with baby.. Good quality and soft.. My baby didn't care for it

title: Skip this wrap
author: Rachel G.
comments: My baby is six weeks and we've been using it from about week one. I have mixed feelings about this wrap. I'll start with the positive. Once the wrap is on and baby's in it, the wrap is okay. But to get to that point is a nightmare...This wrap is not for busty women. In order for baby to be secure, the wrap has to be snug. So if it's snug around your waist and rib cage then it super snug around your bust. This makes baby squished at your chest. There is no way to adjust the level of snugness around the different body parts. If I loosen the wrap at the chest and keep it tight at the waist then baby just slides down off chest and ends up under the breasts.As many women have posted...the wrap is several yards long. If you care about germs, you don't want to put this on in public, it will be all over the floor.Next, it is tricky to get baby in and out of. The fabric is tight against the chest so it's tough to "slide" baby into, out of the wrap. It's also very hot to wear this wrap, then add baby and it's even hotter. I have used it in MT and in southern CA where it's currently 70 degrees. Much too hot in Cali but was ok in February in Montana.Also , this wrap is made in China by a company based in Colorado. Easily this product could be made in the US.I would never have bought this wrap had I known how not user friendly it is. Perhaps when my baby is bigger it will work better. I have the Ergo 360 but not the infant insert and I'm looking forward to using it once my baby is larger.

title: The boba baby wrap makes it so much easier to ...
author: Shaina
comments: The boba baby wrap makes it so much easier to get work done around the house. My only complaint is my back hurts after wearing it for more than 30 minutes.

title: Four Stars
author: Cesar Martinez
comments: Great product!

title: Best thing!
author: Mark Blackhurst
