comments: This is a must have for all new parents. My sweetie loves it and she sleeps or just hangs out with me all day happily in the Boba Wrap as I do chores or just hang out around the house. Gives me the comfort of knowing she is safe and the ability for me to work.

title: Works absolutely excellenet!
author: Sy-Huey Doong
comments: Love it! Highly recommended!

title: Must have for all moms!!!
author: New mama
comments: This is the best thing for newborns! My daughter is 2 months old and constantly wanted to be held. I had another carrier, the harness type, but it didn't hold her snug enough to allow me to wash bottles, pick things up, and etc. The boba holds her close while so I can still get things done! Not to mention, everytime she's upset, a few seconds in this wrap and she's either back to being happy and calm or sound asleep! It's absolutely the best!

title: The stretchy fabric made it easy to use
author: TTomasso
comments: The stretchy fabric made it easy to use. helped us get through the witching hours in the first 2 months. my husband and I could both use it as well.

title: Too complicated for me
author: Lexypr
comments: The material and color was very nice but I returned it. The whole process of putting it on was too complicated for me. I bought it to travel by myself with the baby and after tryng a regular carrier vs this wrap, I opted for the carrier.

title: ... on how to wrap this and you'll see it's pretty simple! This wrap is great
author: Rosemary Garbowski
comments: Watch a YouTube video on how to wrap this and you'll see it's pretty simple! This wrap is great, it's comfortable for you and baby and is easy on the back!

title: This is a great wrap for a growing baby
author: Lisa J Jones
comments: This is a great wrap for a growing baby.  It is great for a mom on the move.  We use at home doing house chores and working at the home office.  It packs well in the diaper bag or purse to carry my son while shopping comfortably.  I would recommend this purchase for anyone.

title: Three Stars
author: Glen Menezes
comments: OK. Very hot to wear in the summer, sweats a lot.

title: I love this wrap and so does my baby
author: Kathryn Walser Little
comments: I love this wrap and so does my baby!  Much more comfortable that a Baby Bjorn and easier on my back!

title: One Star
author: Autumn Jesme
comments: way to difficult for quick on the go use...

title: Great Buy!
author: SteffieH
comments: I LOVE my Boba wrap! The material is so soft and baby is so comfortable in it! I did have to watch the videos a couple of times to get the wrapping just right, but after that....Perfection!

title: It is useful for soothing him as well as for trips out ...
author: maadj
comments: The baby loves it. It is useful for soothing him as well as for trips out and about.

title: I LOVE the boba
author: aMommaWhoKnows
comments: I compared to a moby from a friend. I LOVE the boba!! The fabric is softer and stretchier than Moby which makes it easier to put baby in and more comfy to wear for me!

title: Five Stars
author: Alexey
comments: i love it!

title: Five Stars
author: karla
comments: Love it!!, and my baby loves it too, so we're both happy

title: I love my Boba wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I love my Boba wrap.  I actually didn't really consider other options, as I wanted something easy to put on and comfortable for me and my son.  The first time I used it, he fell asleep in it within minutes because he was nice and snug against me and as a brand new mom, it was ideal for me to be able to get up and get a few things done around the house.  Our first outing, I wore him very comfortably for over an hour in the store and he again was nice and cozy and had a nice nap while we shopped.  I've gotten lots of compliments on it as well, and someone even stopped me to ask where I got it.

title: Four Stars
author: Sandy
comments: Good product

title: Five Stars
author: Frances McArtor
comments: Love my boba! Super easy to use and easy to travel with. My son loves it!

title: Five Stars
author: Devin Noonan
comments: Love it baby loves it easy to use

title: Love it!
author: tori
comments: Works great! My baby is 3 months and about 16 pounds, I do find that it stretches out a little after wearing it for about an hour or so but it isnt anything a quick readjustment can't fix! Love it!

title: its like an helping hand I can ware it when I ...
author: Krystal
comments: its like an helping hand I can ware it when I need to get chors and tsk done around te house ,I use it when its only me and baby to go shoping ....its just an all around comfy wrap if you have an fusy baby put in wrap and they instantly fall asleep. Great to breast feed in them ...all in favor of the boba wrap me!!!!!

title: Five Stars
author: Yolanda
comments: Love it!

title: BUY THIS ITEM!!!!!!!!!
author: John Collier
comments: The boba wrap is awesome!! Let's me be hands free yet cuddle with my little one!! It's great for the grocery store so I don't have to put baby in the dirty cart! The boba is light so you don't get over heated which I love!! My baby has reflux and has to be elevated so this is great for that! I would recommend and I have to all my friends family and even strangers!!!

title: Hot!
author: Katie
comments: I ordered this wrap when my baby was about 3 weeks old. I didn't find the wrap hard to put on with the instructions provided, but it was incredibly hot! My baby seemed uncomfortably smashed into it, and was red, sweaty, and crying within 30 minutes. I was sweating too! And we were inside! I returned this product and ended up using a sling wrap (love it) instead and later purchased an ergo carrier now that my girl is 5 months old and bigger!

title: Five Stars
author: Juliana Castano
comments: Love them!

title: Four Stars
author: erin hainor
comments: Love it! Baby falls asleep as soon as gets in. It is a little hot though.

title: Five Stars
author: Nora Eastway
comments: Absolutely LOVE it!

title: I found that this was a very comfortable way to wear my very young infant
author: Sarah Woolverton-Mohler
comments: I found that this was a very comfortable way to wear my very young infant, but that as she grew, I found it increasingly difficult to put this on correctly. The wrap would sag after a few minutes of wearing this with my baby after she was about 2 months old, despite tying this on very tightly. Also, despite frequent use and practice, I never quite got the hang of putting this on without having one of the ends end up hitting the floor (which I hated when I was putting this on in a parking lot), or without having to re-tie. I'm sure that much of this issue was (my) user error, but I ended up using an Ergo (original), Ergo 360 as those both offered comfort for the wearer and baby, and a much more expedient process.The Boba customer service and quality of the wrap itself were wonderful, and I have friends who really love their Boba. Just wasn't for me. :)

title: This wrap is a lifesaver!
author: Whittley
comments: From the minute I put this on my baby has been 100% different. He's 6 weeks old and VERY cranky due to his inability to nap during the day. He has already DOUBLED his nap time and is the happiest he's been since he came home from the hospital. I am writing this as I am wearing him and am ecstatic with the results. (especially since I have 2 free hands!) Best thing I've ever bought! He even refuses to sleep in his swing.

title: Works...
author: heather
comments: This is a great product but a bit of a pain to put on.  So I have not used it as much as I intend to.  But it is a good product just takes a few minutes to sort out when putting on.  My baby likes it.  Hubby tried it too and it works for him also.

title: hot and sweaty
author: Stacey
comments: I wanted to like this wrap, I really did.  But I just couldn't get comfortable with it. I wore it several times, I just felt hot, baby felt hot, felt awkward all the time.  Not for me...

title: Five Stars
author: cpb
comments: Really great fabric! Soft, elastic and pretty color. Baby loves it too!

title: Five Stars
author: Katie egeland
comments: 4th trimester is the best and I love the boba!!!! Get it for all baby showers I attend!!

title: Very Welcome Gift
author: Jessica Watson
comments: This was purchased as a shower gift.  Mom and dad love snuggling with their little sweetheart and find this to work great.

title: Great for Preemies!
author: Claudia M-C
comments: I gave birth to a preemie who came home weighing just under 6 pounds. He likes to be close to me pretty much all day so I knew I would need a wrap or carrier. Because he was so small I needed a wrap that would allow me to position him in a way that would simulate the womb and this wrap has been perfect for that. We use it while around the house and while out shopping. I can allow him to poke his head out and look around or completely cover him (while in crowds) to protect him from people's big germs. He usually falls right asleep when placed inside.Getting the wrap on is easy and fast. I watched a few you tube videos before the wrap even came so when it was delivered to me I knew exactly what to do. I love the stretchy fabric!The one drawback that I have noticed is that we both tend to get hot. I've learned to strip him down to a onesie instead of a whole outfit to keep him from completely overheating.I wish I had this while my son was in the NICU as we could have used it to do skin to skin from the beginning.

title: Fantastic
author: ZachMelissa Nelson
comments: I love my Boba! I have used it almost daily since my little one was born 7 months ago. He now weighs 21 pounds, and you would think that the wrap would have been stretched out by now, but it is still like new. Very easy once you get the hang of tying it.

title: Four Stars
author: Damien Manzanares
comments: Me and my daughter are loving it. Comes with everything you need instructions and a pouch to store it

title: Five Stars
author: Liz Per√©z L√≥pez
comments: Nice very very good

title: One Star
author: R. thella
comments: Too tough tie

title: like it but too hot for humid climate
author: W. Michelmann
comments: I like it but it's too long and can drag the floor while tying it up. It is also too hot to wear in humid weather like singapore where I live

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This wrap is beautiful. The plain side is almost Terry cloth like. Definitely thinner than the moby.

title: The most comfortable but not the most convenient
author: Melissa Bell
comments: This carrier is super comfortable and I can walk in it for a long time. I wish it came in sizes though. I'm thin and there is so much extra fabric hanging down when I wear it. It's easy enough to put on but it does drag on the floor in the process so it can't be put on anywhere.

title: Four Stars
author: Tatiana Lickliter
comments: It gets a little warm using it in Florida.

title: A must have for new moms
author: sew what
comments: I had my baby a month ago and I'm sooooo glad I bought this wrap. I'm able to get house done, sloth him when he's fussy and keep him away from unwanted attention from strangers. So if you are a germophobe, clean house having protective mom then this product is for you

title: LOVE this wrap
author: Pamela
comments: LOVE this wrap! My baby loves to be snug against me and with 2 toddlers this wrap has saved me. I can cuddle her and care for my other children, clean, or do the laundry. I took her shopping and it was perfect. The best part no one just walked up and touched her while we were out. I don't know how I had my other babies without one of these!

title: easy to wear
author: yessy
comments: My baby loves being close to mommy , easy to wear , I take it when I go shopping and she falls asleep ,also wear it when I'm home and she wants to be held but I need my hands to be free to do other things works well.

title: Loved it! Baby was with me and snug as ...
author: Meredith Whittingham
comments: Loved it! Baby was with me and snug as a bug for the first few months. She loved peeking out to see what was going on and being safe and secure next to mum or dad.

title: Love this wrap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Love this wrap. Much better for me and baby than the moby or k'tan or any of the other carriers I have tried. It is a lot more stretchy than expected, which is great.

title: Very confusing & flimsy. My son (2 mo. ...
author: Caitlin
comments: Very confusing & flimsy. My son (2 mo.) Is a tiny baby & it barely supported him, had to keep one hand on his back the whole time which prevents me from getting much done. Returning item.

title: Wonderful product. The more you use it
author: Erin
comments: Wonderful product. The more you use it, the more familiar you get with it. My 3 month old settles down immediately everytime I put her in. This is my new go to gift for every baby shower!

title: Great item! It's a little hard to get at ...
author: T. Kester
comments: Great item! It's a little hard to get at first, but my baby loves being carried around so it's worth it.  This is perfect for me! I can bake and still carry him at the same time!!! I love the color too!

title: Don't waste your money on any other wrap
author: Lindsey Roberts
comments: Don't waste your money on any other wrap, sling, carrier, etc... This is the best one out there! I've tried many with my 3 kids and this is by far the most comfortable for mom and baby! Worth every penny!

title: Love this wrap!
author: EAnderson
comments: Love this wrap. Great for new squishes you want to keep close. Great for skin-to-skin time as well. Super easy to learn to use as well. Love it!!

title: I researched wraps what felt like forever.
author: Joseph Wilder
comments: I researched wraps what felt like forever... and it was worth it. My daughter loves it! Ive been using it for 11 months now and still very comfortable for both of us. I will be getting this for baby gifts for years to come!!!

title: Three Stars
author: pinkladee
comments: By the time you master how to wrap this around yourself your baby will be walking.

title: Five Stars
author: Amy
comments: My wife and newborn loved their boba!

title: BEST decision I ever made
author: lissabell234
comments: I'm a mother of a 3 year old, and had a  baby on  the way. Decided to give this a try to help free up my hands..and also I didn't want to sink in big bucks towards a double stroller, BEST decision I ever  made. There is a bit of a learning curve, but after doing it a few times I got the hang of it. I highly recommend this product! It makes life with a baby a little easier. Plus is super cute snuggling your baby in it  (which you wouldn't get with a stroller).

title: Five Stars
author: Kathy N.
comments: Best and most affordable wrap out there Loved it with my son from NB till 9 months old!!!

title: A Lifesaver For Colic Baby
author: Candice
comments: I love it! The instructions they provided were easy to follow, and the baby really liked being in it. Its definitely a life saver if you have a colic baby, because I've noticed the baby crying less, and napping more peacefully when she is in the Boba wrap.

title: Can't get comfortable. These are just not for us
author: Onward
comments: Just too hot for me and the baby. Can't get comfortable. These are just not for us.

title: Two Stars
author: Jennifer K. Cochran
comments: Extremely long very awkward to wrap around body.

title: A MUST for babies with colic or teething kiddos
author: Tannen
comments: The first few months of our baby girl's life were challenging. She had colic and would scream in pain on a daily basis. We tried many tactics but the most consistent way of easing her discomfort was to wrap her up in the Boba Wrap and wear her close. My husband and I both wore her too many times to count, and my mother even got into wearing her grandchild when she visited. I love the stretchy fabric and especially how easy it was to throw in the wash - which we did a LOT! It came in handy once again when she started teething. Something about being close to Mom was soothing in a way nothing else could be.She's 16 months now and so we prefer to put her in the Boba 4G but are looking forward to having baby #2 in the future and wearing them in the wrap while we chase our toddler around :)

title: Very comfortable, dog hair magnet.
author: Joy G.
comments: As far as function, I love it. My sister had given me a baby bjorn carrier from 2001 and it wrecked my lower back.  This is a thousand times more comfortable, basically an unbloated version of pregnancy, totally standable. The bummer is just that I have a tough time getting it on without it hitched the floor, and maybe it's worse because of winter, but the static and dog hair situation is pretty grim. It'll be great for the house, but need a good sticky roller job for going out. I'm washing it today with a heavy shot of fabric softener,  hoping that helps the situation.

title: Best purchase for mom!!
author: Jamel J. Burgos
comments: Best purchase for mom!! Easy to use! Comfortable to wear! However it can get quiet hot during the summer and your walking around outside. Totally worth it in every way! My wife uses it everyday to make it easier to walk and pick up our older kids to and from school

title: Love it
author: Corie
comments: I love it!!Watched a couple youtube videos on how to wrap it, just to make sure I had it right. But once u figure it out, its easy. My baby boy doesn't mind it & it didynt hurt my back. I much prefer this carrier over others.

title: Five Stars
author: Brandy Gleason
comments: I love it I don't feel like I am smothering him and he is at ease

title: Great Baby Tool
author: Maria Grove
comments: Love it - great gift!  My friend used it constantly

title: Best purchase I made as a new mom
author: looloo
comments: Best purchase I made as a new mom!! My IBCLC tells every client this is a must for sanity and she's right!!

title: hearsay has it that the happy parents loved it
author: Mena L. Kates
comments: This item was a gift, so I am not personally able to rate it.  None the less, hearsay has it that the happy parents loved it!!!  It was on their gift list, so no doubt much research went into this item.  PIctures were posted and the baby looked happy, comfortable and safe.  Maybe one day I will get to tote a grandchild around in a Boba Wrap.

title: Five Stars
author: Hellen
comments: It's perfect!!!! I love it

title: ok but not for warmer climates
author: Gloria Chen
comments: Liked it better than the Moby because it's thinner and is more stretchy . But, gets very warm even if you just wear a tank top or bra underneath. I live in California so doesn't even fly for the winter months sometimes! My baby was fine in it but he also got too hot. It's long, as intended, and takes getting use to to wrap around yourself but overall not too difficult as others have complained about.

title: Would buy again!
author: hfrey12
comments: This took me a few tries to get the fit right - but now I love it!  I have a very needy baby and this makes life so much easier!!! I like this much better than a normal carrier bc the weight seems to be more evenly distributed.  Like others have said - My little one does tend to get a little sweaty in it though!

title: Five Stars
author: Edith
comments: Love this. It works well.

title: the Moby was super easy to throw on
author: Sophisticated Mommy
comments: Only baby carrier that I could use that wouldn't hurt my back. Once I watched the video instructions online to use it, the Moby was super easy to throw on. Only thing was I always had to dress light because with baby it made me hot, but baby seemed fine in it. I used it all the way up to two years old with my older kids.

title: Two Stars
author: Ashleigh Lyn Johnson
comments: Material is toooo stretchy. Sadly I wasn't able to use much because of this.

title: Wonderful and SO comfy
author: Janna
comments: I love this so much! I have two other carriers and this is my go to as it is soooo comfortable to wear.  My 6 week old fusses a bit when I first put him in it but calms down. Hubby loves it too! It's great to actually be able to get some work done.

title: love the color and fabric is very soft
author: karlee hiatt
comments: Once I am able to put it on without the directions in front of me it will def serve its purpose! love the color and fabric is very soft!

title: Five Stars
author: Mary-Margaret Chaffe
comments: Love it!!!

title: The wrap is great quality.
author: Jonathan
comments: Product as expected. The wrap is great quality.

title: Great wrap, not great color
author: MImom
comments: I love love love the wrap itself but found that the black color and the material used attracts and collects lint and fuzz from everything.  It just looked dirty all the time.  Exchanged for the grey and am much happier!

title: Amazing !
author: Gabriela
comments: Love the boba wrap! It's amazing when they are newborns and you need to be hands free! i also wear my 4 month old now and she loves looking around everywhere! It's very comfortable and I have never had any trouble with back ache!

title: ... friend requested this on her baby wish list- and love it when she opened it
author: jodi regan
comments: A friend requested this on her baby wish list- and love it when she opened it!

title: Five Stars
author: MChandler
comments: Worked great for my newborn!

title: I really like this and very happy that I purchased this
author: Joanne
comments: I really like this and very happy that I purchased this. I can pop my newborn inside easily and away we go.

title: This is light and my baby love it. She sleep right away when input her ...
author: Lan Duong
comments: This is light and my baby love it. She sleep right away when input her on a boba wrap. Hiwever, there is a bigger problem for me. I had back pain afyer just 10 min wearing this with my 3 months old baby. I had to return.

title: My baby was just too heavy to use this, ...
author: Malisa H. Brown
comments: My baby was just too heavy to use this, he sagged too much by the time he was 3 months old- (he was 15 lbs at that point so if you have a smaller baby, will probably work better).

title: Five Stars
author: Sopol78
comments: My baby and I love this wrap, it is very comfy.

title: It was very warm to wear this on a hot ...
author: Elene Tan
comments: It was very warm to wear this on a hot summer day and its summer every day in SIngapore! Totally not feasible in our climate and does not work in air-conditioned malls as well. Baby hates it!

title: Too Much Stretch for Safety
author: Mark and Kim W.
comments: I was trying to choose between this and the Moby wrap.  I did a lot of research about both.  Ultimately, I chose this one because it offered a bit of stretch, which reviewers said made getting your baby in it easier.  I thought that made sense.  The trouble is that there's so much stretch that within about 3 minutes of wearing it, my 14 lb baby has lowered so much that it's unsafe.  I've tried wearing it over and over with the same result.  I know I'm putting it on correctly.  It is just way too stretchy.

title: Perfect for us!
author: acarone
comments: I LOVE my boba wrap. My daughter loved 'moving around' with me, and she often fell asleep in this wrap when she was smaller w/the newborn hold/technique. This wrap is also significantly more comfortable to me than the other non-wrap style carriers on the market.

title: Worth it for sure
author: Kindle Customer
comments: Great love this

title: Ridiculous.
author: jlove417
comments: Based on the reviews I bought this wrap. Three months in and I am wondering if this was some sort of mean prank on sleep deprived desperate new moms. It is a giant piece of fabric you transform by wrapping and weaving and then cramming your baby in the correct position (this part is very important because otherwise she might DIE from suffocation as the tag on the fabric warns you).I am all for the baby carrying trend and wanted a way to walk with my baby. I have made it work a few times after a significant struggle. I have ended up sweaty and frustrated even after watching videos and reading instructions. The stretchiness of the fabric allows you to have it loose or tight in all the wrong places. I thought it was me...then I was gifted a sling and a backpack like carrier....complete no-brainers to use. Baby loves them.

title: Not ideal for plus sized moms
author: Jamie
comments: Wayyyy too much fabric. I am a plus size mom and no matter how tight I pulled this wrap it was never snug enough to feel comfortable and safe wearing my baby. Very disappointed.

title: Five Stars
author: teresa v
comments: I LOVE IT!!

title: Five Stars
author: Kato
comments: great for smaller babies

title: Makes things that would otherwise be impossible to do with a baby easy.
author: Joe
comments: My wife loves this.  Makes things that would otherwise be impossible to do with a baby easy.

title: Great carrier! Baby loves it and falls asleep almost ...
author: Pal
comments: Pros:Great carrier! Baby loves it and falls asleep almost immediately.I can do almost anything while wearing my baby.Cons:The fabric is too stretchy. Im afraid to bend because his head gets kind of hanging, like a hammock.Have to wash almost every time you use it if baby poops while being worn, the fabric kind of keeps the bad smell.

title: Five Stars
author: Kristopher James
comments: Great, works as advertised.

title: Three Stars
author: michelle b.
comments: Love it but WAY to big for short people. I'm 5.2 and it's hard to get on.

title: Nice fabric, But not for us.
author: Adrienne M. Richey
comments: Pros:Soft, heavy, comfy jersey for colder months.Adjustable for a precise fit for your body.Useful for small newborns to larger babies.Cons:Soooooo much fabric to deal with. When my baby is crying, it just seems to take forever to get the thing situated on my body and the tails drag on the floor in the process of me trying to wrap it on.

title: Useful but almost to warm
author: Jamie Downs
comments: Our wrap was a big time saver with my newborn. I wanted to hold and snuggle her all day long, but needed to get something accomplished and this wrap allowed me to do both.It took a few tries to get her in without another set of hands, mostly because I was worried about hurting her.We recieved the Stardust print as a gift and my only complaint is that the fabric was so thick and heavy that we both overheated if I wore it for to long. I don't know if a different fabric would have been lighter or more breathable?

title: Comfy wrap!
author: C. Tucker
comments: I recently purchased this after the birth of my twins. I have experience using ring slings and Mei Tai carriers and find this much more comfortable. Although I can't put both babies in the wrap together, it makes it easier to care for both.

title: Five Stars
author: Camila Oliveira
comments: Great product!!!!!!!!

title: Love it!
author: Dawn K
comments: I love this wrap! I was a little intimidated by it at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's great! I love that it's one size so you don't have to worry about getting the right fit. Once you get the hang of it (which only took 2-3 times) it's super easy & comfy! I did watch a YouTube video, which showed a slightly different way to put it on than the instructions show. It was helpful!My baby girl fell right asleep the first time I put her in it. She felt snug enough that I was able to do other things around the house while she slept! Definitely recommend this wrap!

title: Way too much fabric, not ideal for quick errands
author: Asun
comments: I purchased this wrap due to all the rave reviews but it didn't work for me.  There is deceivingly a lot of fabric so it took much longer to wrap than expected, not conducive at all when running quick errands in a hurry (sometimes with a crying baby).  Unlike the Baby K'Tan, my spouse could use this as well but he was quickly stretching it out which did not help.  Most importantly, we live in California where the weather is mild and even though I am almost always on the colder side, I could not get over how sweaty and hot I became after just 20-30 minutes of carrying my baby.  It was so uncomfortable that I would end up moving around the wrap and risk waking up the baby.

title: Great investment
author: Kim Brown
comments: I LOVE this thing!!! My baby is now 2weeks old and she doesn't sleep well especially by herself, but when I put her in this she goes straight to sleep and I'm able to move around and be my daily chores and cook.. Freedom finally.. I'm so serious, she wouldn't allow me to get nothing done, but with the help of my BOBA I'm finally in power lol. New mommies no the struggle :) great investment.

title: However I was not satisfied with this and ended up only using it a ...
author: HKBASS1315
comments: I bought this to carry my newborn who was too small to fit in a boba 3G carrier. However I was not satisfied with this and ended up only using it a handful of times. It is definitely Not appropriate for warm weather. I would sweat when I wore this and I worried that my baby would overheat.  Also it tended to stretch and loosen after only 30 minutes of use. Also I found the whole tying process cumbersome and not "on-the-go" friendly.

title: ... on my 4 1/2 lb baby girl and it's perfect! Easy to tie and she loves hanging out ...
author: sab1158
comments: I'm currently using this on my 4 1/2 lb baby girl and it's perfect! Easy to tie and she loves hanging out and sleeping in it.  It has made it so much easier to do things around the house with a newborn!

title: I Never Want to Take It Off!
author: Danielle
comments: I love my Boba wrap and so does my daughter. I've been wrapping her since she was one week old (two weeks premature, 5 1/2 lbs at birth). The fabric is stretchy and super long but that allows for even plus sized people to wear it comfortably. While you can't use it for back carries, front carries work just fine. (I haven't tried hip carries yet.)I've worn my daughter comfortably for hours. This wrap keeps her snug and warm (born in the fall) for outings or just when I need my hands free. (I use taking out the trash as an excuse to wear her.) Excellent for keeping her calm or putting her to sleep.Learning the different wraps is not difficult at all, and putting the wrap on and baby in only takes about a minute! To avoid dragging the tails on the ground, I just put the wrap on before I leave out. I also  tie the ends in the back so that it looks neater.I love this wrap and will use it for my future baby. A great price for a quality carrier when other types of carriers are $100 or more! I just wish I had chosen a different color! Love my Boba Wrap!

title: Five Stars
author: L. Tadeo
comments: i love this!!! its very long and stretchy!!

title: Wish I had it earlier...
author: Diana C.
comments: I am in LOVE with this wrap. At first glance it seems complicated to wrap, but after two wraps it was easy. I wish I had this wrap when my son was a newborn, but it is still fabulous for him at 18lbs. He was sick and it helped me snuggle him all day like he wanted. I love this design and get compliments wherever we go on it. In colder weather it seems to help keep him warmer than my other carriers as well. I am a #BobaAmbassador and received this wrap as part an ambassadorship with the brand. I was not required to post a review.

title: User Error?  To hard to wrap....
author: Sugrhigh
comments: I had to return this.  I just couldn't get the hang of wrapping it and it didn't feel secure enough for me to use on my son.  I really wanted to love it but it just did't work out.

title: I Loved It And Will Use Again for the Next Kid (In Combo With Ergo As Kid Grows)
author: Kelsie Tregilgas
comments: I bought this one as a gift, but used a olive green one myself not too long ago. It does take a couple of times putting it on to get the hang of it, but once I did I really loved it. The material is very soft and held up well after being washed the whole time I used it. It really lets you snuggle comfortably with your baby while being able to be mobile. I remember reading a lot on the wraps vs backpacks and safety, and bought an Ergo Baby carrier because of it. However, when I tried to use it, the infant insert didn't seem to hold my baby quite right and there wasn't enough support without it. So I got a Boba wrap to try out. It was great. I don't see how it could be anything but safe so long as 1) your cease using it when your child is too big and 2) you put it on properly (really not hard). Later, when my son got bigger and more active, I retired to Boba and returned to the Ergo, which I loved for outings. When I have the next one, I plan to do the same thing.

title: THE MATERIAL IS AMAZING! SON LOVES IT!!
author: BB
comments: Love this!!! My son loves it better than the moby the material is much more stretchy and a better quality than Moby brand have both bought through amazon love this wrap will be purchasing another for optional color wearing :)

title: Love my Boba
author: Skogstjerne
comments: Love my Boba! Comes in handy when my 2 week old wants to be with mommy and mommy needs to get a few things done :)

title: a little too bulky
author: connie s
comments: I love the idea I having a wrap for my 4 month old. Its just too bulky and it can get a bit too warm for both baby and me while wearing her.

title: Five Stars
author: Spyridon
comments: Perfect! I'm just really sad that I didn't use it from the first days of my baby.

title: So disappointed!
author: Miles Per Gallon
comments: I purchased this in anticipation of my second baby. Used it twice before the stitching around the edges came out.  Wish I could return it, but since the baby came late I missed the return window :(

title: Just what I was looking for
author: emma denise
comments: My little one isn't here yet, but I fell in love with this wrap as soon as I removed it from it's packaging. I can't wait to wear my baby!

title: Five Stars
author: Judith
comments: Love it. Is a perfect way to keep your baby close of you and no feeling tired

title: there are videos to help you figure out how to ...
author: Edie
comments: there are videos to help you figure out how to wear this. it really takes energy and perseverance to do so. I was simply too tired and busy. Also, the material makes for a sweaty you and a sweaty baby if you live in a warm climate. we found the traditional carrier (also Boba) more utilitarian.

title: Love it!!!
author: Amberlee
comments: I love my boba wrap! Currently my baby is 8 weeks old and it has worked wonderful for us. She loves it, I love it, were both happy. We went on a 1 hour walk the other day and it didn't hurt my back like other carriers have. I continue to look forward to using this wrap as my baby grows! And it comes with a matching fabric bag for storage when not in use or on the go. The only downside is washing it in the washer since it's so long, but we just use the delicates cycle. WARNING: If your baby hates being swaddled or held too close, this carrier isn't for you. My friends baby is always moving and hated this wrap compared to other carriers.

title: Fabric too stretchy. Baby does not feel secure.
author: MC2010
comments: I ordered this after the rave reviews. Let me start by saying that the print on this wrap is beautiful! I watched videos before ordering this so putting it on was a breeze. I think it just seems intimidating at first,  but once you get the hang of it, it's super easy. The fabric is beautiful, but it's too stretchy for me. I put on the wrap pretty snug and after putting my daughter in it just felt like the fabric was too stretchy and my daughter was sagging. She did not feel secure at all, and for that reason, sadly, I will be sending it back.

title: Five Stars
author: mjk5058
comments: Life changing. My 3week old loves it, and it allows mom to be hands free!

title: One Star
author: Rahul Gokulnath
comments: Didn't work for me and my LO at all.

title: Can't go without it!
author: Ashley Francis
comments: Absolutely LOVE THIS! My daughter refuses to nap, so I bought this in hopes that she'd be lulled to sleep by the motions of me trying to get things done around the house. It works. We've been using it successfully since she was around 3 weeks!It's even more amazing when you go out. Everyone constantly comments on how well-behaved and quiet she is while I'm wearing her. I can go grocery shopping without worrying over a fussy baby! She either quietly watches the world around her or nods off for a nice little nap.The comfort level is good, though you may find some strain on your neck despite the "proper placement." This is especially noticeable once baby gets a little bigger and has their feet hanging out. It's still comfortable, however! And it's fantastic sitting, as it doesn't bunch up or pinch the baby's legs like 'harder' carriers seem to (I have a Boba 4G and baby does not like it when I sit in it!)There's also some preparation involved if you're using it outside of the house. It's best to put it on before you leave and just wear it while driving and then put baby in it when you arrive. Putting it on DEFINITELY has a learning curb, I'd recommend videos on youtube and lots of practice! It's certainly worth it.

title: Good for around the house
author: Elise
comments: Like other reviewers have mentioned, this wrap does take some practice figuring out how to put it on. And even when you have it down pat it will still take a minute to do it. I would say this is a great wrap for around the house so you can do dishes and things you need two hands for, but it isn't the most practical for outings because of the getting on/getting off process. I bought the orange colored wrap and it is definitely orange. On my monitor it looked more coral, but it isn't. Just be aware it is ORANGE. Also, I thought about making this myself since it is just a strip of fabric, but the cotton/spandex knit fabric at the store was around ten bucks per yard, so this really isn't a bad deal considering that you're getting 16 feet of this fabric :).

title: This is a beautiful piece I got this for a friend as a ...
author: Cornelius
comments: This is a beautiful piece I got this for a friend as a gift for their first baby they loved it, and shipping was super fast.

title: Love it! Perfect for home and on the go!
author: jane booker
comments: I love this wrap and more importantly,  so does the baby. My little one weighed 5.8 at birth and weighs 17.2lbs now and she still likes the wrap. I plan to use it as long as possible!

title: Five Stars
author: Elizabeth
comments: nice

title: Good quality.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Very helpful with carrying around a small baby. Good quality.

title: Love our Boba wrap!
author: Krissy
comments: Most comfortable, supportive carrier I've used. My 5 month old loves it too!

title: I love this wrap
author: jimmy ramirez
comments: I love this wrap! I've had other carriers since my baby was born, but when my baby was about six months I started wanting a wrap. I was hesitant to buy one because by the time I purchased it he was seven months and 20 lbs. I thought I may have missed the mark, thinking it was just good for smaller babies but I was wrong!! He feels very secure in it and we'll supported. It is fine on my back, which I was also scared of. I love the material, it has a nice stretch to it, but is also strong enough to easily support my big babe. My favorite part of having a wrap as opposed to a different carrier is the ease of sitting down and getting up and it still being comfortable on you and baby. I love that my babe can fall asleep in it and then I can just sit on the couch for the remainder of his nap, still comfy. I also have the Air and 4G and am still pleased as ever with Boba. Thanks for making me and wrap believer!

title: Five Stars
author: Du Jian
comments: Very good

title: Supreme comfort!
author: Lexa
comments: Bought on the 2nd, received the 10th. The wait was worth it! The first thing I've tried like these, and I'm very satisfied with the purchase. I've tried carrier but their bulky and my son hated climbing in em. He is 13 months old about 20 or whatever lbs, I never weigh him. After it took me a few tries to figure out the wrapping situation, I called him over. He climbed right up to hug me and I simply placed him inside. Simple and easy. It came with a carrying case which is lovely for the length of fabric. It's really comfortable! I can't stress this enough. We're pleased and will recommend to others. I love the color. I love the stretch, I love how my boy can move. I see use using this for years.

title: Better than the rest!!!
author: REBECCA
comments: I prefer my Boba over all my other wraps, slings, and carriers. Why? It clings them to me better with the hint of spandex. Just wonderful. :)

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this wrap
author: KB
comments: LOVE LOVE LOVE this wrap.  Easy to put on, not stupid hot in the summer.  We were in Cuba and we walked the 45 min walk to Veradaro and back and it was simply wonderful.  Those streets are much to crowded to maneuver a stroller.  Can't praise this wrap enough.

title: Five Stars
author: Tammi
comments: Love our Boba Wrap!  Stretchier and a little less material than a Moby. Perfect. :)

title: It was amazing. Not only did the little man get extra ...
author: Melody
comments: The Boba is stretchier, but more supportive than any other carrier of its type.My son was born 8 week prematurely and my sister in law gave me a Boba. It was amazing. Not only did the little man get extra "womb" time by being in the Boba all the time, but it kept well -meaning strangers from touching him when out in public. I could discretely walk and nurse him In the wrap as well.He had an entire year of being in the boba and it was the best year ever!

title: Hands Free Baby Carrying
author: Blisslife
comments: This is perfect for my newborn. She loves it and it allows me to keep her close and still use my two hands! The online tutorial Boba provides helped me figure out how to use it. When she gets bigger I'll move onto a tula or ergo.

title: You won't regret this purchase!
author: Carolyn
comments: Love love love LOVE it! I originally purchased for my 1 year old that had out grown the Bjorne infant carrier we purchased during pregnancy. We looked at this carrier & the Ergo mainly. The Boba is so easy to adjust & the chest strap fits my broad shouldered hubby! Ergo was too narrow in the chest for him. We have since had another child. This time we will be using it birth until she no longer fits or wants to be carried. my only complaint is that I would like a better hip carry method that is comparable to another popular competitor product.

title: Boba wrap for the win!!!
author: essmie feliciano
comments: I won a Boba wrap before I was aware we were expecting a new little one. I was so excited to try it, but also discouraged as I had many friends with a Moby... I had seen how they had to adjust and readjust to right slack for baby but than I learned I didn't need to do that and right from the start it was awesome! I actually wore it while pregnant to compress my belly for support, and than used with my new baby for 2 months. I got compliments everywhere we went, and people asking me where I got it!

title: Five Stars
author: Kindle Customer
comments: Love

title: I loved this stretchy wrap with our babies
author: Jessica Snodgrass
comments: I loved this stretchy wrap with our babies. It is so comfortable and convenient. I would just tie it on in the morning and wear it all day, popping the baby in and out as needed. It was just a tad bit better than the moby wrap for us, a little thinner. The color is perfection, too. Totally neutral and goes with everything. Once I got good at nursing in the stretchy wrap, my life was complete. Boba really nailed it with this one!

title: we LOVE our Boba
author: RaRa
comments: I, correction, we LOVE our Boba! My daughter asks to be put in it on my back all the time. She weighs 34 pounds, but the way that it sits on your hips it feels like she weighs about 10. :-)

title: Loved it for my newborn twins
author: Renee
comments: Amazing. I have twins and could not have survived the first few weeks without this. I practiced putting it on multiple times before I tried with the babies, it's easy and quick to pick up on. Comfortable with 1 or two babies! I suggest you put it on in your home before you go out, then in the parking lot you simply slide the baby right in. This made shopping much easier! It's also great around the house to comfort a baby (or 2!) While you have your hands free. Even my husband has worn it l. Boba products are high quality and built to last.

title: Sags after a while.
author: Sonia Q.
comments: The wrap stretches too much even when put on tightly. After a while my baby would be sagging too low. Also, this is not for babies who do not like to be swaddled. It holds them tight & makes them a bit warm.

title: Absolutely love our boba wrap
author: Autumn Blair
comments: Absolutely love our boba wrap! Baby loves it too, she sleeps great and keeps her from getting fussy. Took a bit of practice to perfect the wrapping, but once mastered, never going back. Love baby wearing!

title: Three Stars
author: Paola
comments: it's impossible to use it in summer, too hot.

title: Perfect for newborn!
author: Bonnie3
comments: I have been using this wrap for five weeks and love it. It took a little practice to learn how to use it but now I have the hang of it and find it very easy. Be sure to watch videos on YouTube - it is the best way to learn how to wrap compared to reading the instructions .My newborn always falls right asleep when I put him in it i. t's great to have the skin to skin contact but also be able to do things like dishes. I look forward to continue to use this with my five week old son.

title: Makes me want more like it!
author: Kindle Customer
comments: Works perfect for my baby girl, I was able to use it from day one of bringing her home!I can get so much done and still be close to her. I can chase my 14 month around and play with him all the while holding my daughter! Would definitely buy again!

title: Not for me, but a wonderful company and product.
author: Brenda
comments: Didn't use it, the baby was born at 9.4 and it just didn't feel my baby was secure, and I had bad lower back pain while trying to use, no matter how tight we pulled it.  We watched YouTube videos as well as reading instructions. I doubt if I can ship back as it was ordered a few months before baby arrived. Anyone need an unused boba lolUpdateA rep from Boba contacted me and gave me a my purchase price toward something else from their store. What a wonderful company

title: Love this wrap
author: Andrea Mitchell
comments: Love this wrap, and keeps my LO quiet when I need to get things done and he won't let me put him down :)

title: I hate this thing
author: Nicole
comments: I hate this thing. The baby kept slipping out of it. I had to tie to to myself almost to the point where I couldnt breathe and even then it didnt work. The material is so silky and stretchy that it just loosens again anyway and the baby feels like shes going to fall out.I bought the Tula and I love it. Its a little pricey but worth every penny.

title: Works!
author: Tara Allen
comments: My only complaint is the your little one cannot face out (not enough neck support, but it is not designed for outward facing baby) at 3 months when she wants to see all that is going on.  Other than that, she is snug and sleeps comfortably.  Boba super easy to learn how to wrap and you feel that baby is well supported.

title: Magic for fussy baby.
author: Stephanie Prince
comments: My husband and I both love the Boba wrap! Once you get the hang of it, it's easy to use and our baby girl loves being in it. It's magic for a fussy baby and brilliant for when you're out and about.

title: Four Stars
author: Maylin Nohemi Melendez
comments: So hot for tropical weather im in Panama Republic of Panama, for the rest is very practical

title: Good wrap, length makes it awkward to put on while out
author: DotDot
comments: I love the wrap once it's on and baby is comfortably in it. Tip- search for instructional video on YouTube for easy to understand, quick directions. Looking at the included instruction sheet is a bit confusing. However, I had to take off 1 star because of how impractical the length is- it is so long that it inevitably drags on the floor at some point when you first start the wrap process. Not convenient if I want to take it off for awhile while we are out.

title: The wrap was easy to put on and my son loves it
author: jessica
comments: The wrap was easy to put on and my son loves it. He falls asleep as soon as we put him in it. It does get very hot though.

title: I love the Boba products
author: Alicia Maltzman
comments: I love the Boba products!  As for wraps, I tried a Moby and a Hugabub and then found Boba.  The material is soft and thick and stretchy.  It wears well and is cozy and comfortable.  Excellent product.  I also tried several baby carriers: a Lillebaby, an Ergobaby and a Bjorn.  The Boba was the one carrier that fit snuggly without hurting my back with my baby placed in front.  My baby is well supported with her legs in a perfect position and the carrier is light and comfortable.  Great products.

title: Great wrap!
author: Rachel F.
comments: I love this wrap! It is really soft and comfortable. It can look a little intimidating at first with so much fabric but after a using it a couple times I got it down, now it's quick and easy to get on. I love that I can put it on before I get in the car and then quickly get my baby into it when I get to the store, etc. I also use it at home when she just won't go to sleep. Overall great product!

title: Happy Momma!
author: Linda R.
comments: Daughter loves how it keeps her hands free and has a happy baby!

title: Beautiful, Durable, Lightweight, Perfect!
author: Lucas Simoes Turolla
comments: The Wildflower first off is GORGEOUS. I was thrilled to have finally found a wrap that was lightweight, comfortable, and durable. I have tried many different wraps and Boba is by far the best. The are affordable and have beautiful patterns. I get asked every time I wear my wrap how I like it and which brand it is and of course I send them straight to Boba! Thanks for such a great product.

title: Best item we bought for our new baby
author: Jerry
comments: Life saver! This wrap helps my wife sooth my newborn son and do some light tasks at the same time. Didn't have on registry but quickly bought in time of need and soooooooooooo glad we did.

title: Definitely get!!! Totally worth every penny.
author: Hugo Sanchez
comments: Definitely get! !! Totally worth every penny.

title: I absolutely love this wrap
author: Ari Coyne
comments: I absolutely love this wrap! It is extremely comfortable and makes it easier to move around with my 8 month old. I love this so much more than the carrier I have that is like a back pack.

title: Five Stars
author: Marcelo Lima Filho
comments: My baby loved it. Good user manual

title: Seems they like it. But to be on fair side I ...
author: Aydin_Hasanzade
comments: I purchased this product for my friends. Seems they like it. But to be on fair side I am not the right to rate it.

title: Not for Small/Petite people
author: Carrie
comments: I purchased this wrap and quickly returned it.  The fabric is super long, so it was much too big for my 5 ft petite frame.  It was also really stretchy, so I didn't feel like my baby could sit securely in it.  It was a very soft material and a nice navy color.  But, wasn't for me.

title: A Perfect Gift!!!
author: Kathi Nelson
comments: This was a gift for my daughter. Her baby was a rather large 4 month old. She absolutely loves it. It frees her hands when shopping, going out to eat, etc. It keeps her from having to lug the heavy car seat everywhere she goes. The weight of the baby is evenly distributed, so her back doesn't get sore. The baby is always content or asleep because he is being held close. I will probably give this as a gift at every baby shower I attend!!!

title: Two Stars
author: Brittany Marie Martin
comments: Too long!!! Too stretchy!!!

title: I like this wrap however the original baby bjorn is much ...
author: Christina
comments: I like this wrap however the original baby bjorn is much easier to put on and more breathable.  This does take some time to use and is much better for babies 4months+. Also, I feel like if you live in colder areas the wrap is better whereas it can be way too hot for some more moderate areas.

title: Good for a snuggly baby and a mom who needs her arms
author: gcCassie
comments: Got this to be able to hold my little girl while still able to do things around the house or with my toddler and it does its job. I haven't tried the moby or ktan as a comparison but thus is easy enough to quickly tie up and scoot the baby into. Just make sure you tie it tightly to you as per the instructions so it doesn't sag too much.My only complaints are that eith the length I often have it drag on the ground while initially tieing it so I wouldn't want to have to first put it on outside or somewhere yucky. I mainly use it indoors so that isn't a problem for me.

title: LOVE this wrap
author: Adara
comments: LOVE this wrap! I would never get anything done without it, and it makes breastfeeding in public super easy!

title: I like how snug you can get the tiny human up ...
author: Chris B
comments: Though I was going to try to go the route of using duct tap, my wife talked me into picking this little number up. I like how snug you can get the tiny human up next to you and know that they are perfectly safe. Just need to remember not to have too much garlic for lunch...

title: This is perfect! Not only can I clean the house and ...
author: Jordan Albers
comments: This is perfect! Not only can I clean the house and carry my baby but I can nurse him in it too!! Also this is great for babies with colic.

title: It's OK.
author: Asim ALTUNBAS
comments: Not super useful. Some children won't be happy being wrapped like that way. But it's OK for carrying your baby along a close distance.

title: Four Stars
author: CptShakespeare
comments: As expected, no problems

title: Highly recommend!
author: Janelle Hansen
comments: Every mom needs one of these. Mine has been a life saver! Highly recommend!

title: very stretchy
author: ZUTYREYE
comments: Very stretchy, pull it so tight you don't think the baby will fit in there to get it right.

title: I absolutely LOVE my wrap
author: Sandra
comments: I absolutely LOVE my wrap. It is amazing. I used it when my daughter was an infant, and still use it,  she's 19lbs and 31 inches and it works great still!

title: Two Stars
author: jami urban
comments: Two much to do to get it on. That it's why I give this eating.

title: Five Stars
author: Katherine Hunt
comments: I absolutely love the Boba wrap!!! I works great for my infant!

title: 4th child, first wrap
author: Andrea Taylor
comments: Easy to follow directions.  Comfortable. Baby loves it. I love it!

title: Not for hot babies!
author: Cassidy Riddle Crilly
comments: I really wanted to love this wrap. I envisioned mom and baby walking around the house, neighborhood, even the mall. Turns out, my daughter hates this thing! She almost immediately overheats. The material is wonderfully thick and stretchy, but not breathable. And, I found it somewhat difficult to get this wrap on and get my baby in it all by myself!

title: Im amazed more people dont have
author: TJ
comments: My wife gets comments about this anytime we go somewhere with our son.  Im amazed more people dont have one

title: love it but thick fabric
author: katie
comments: Love this wrap! I used it with my 2 week old at the mall and he slept the entire time. He did get hot though. That was the only problem with the cloth being a tad bit to thick.

title: Complicated tie
author: Vikki2001
comments: Seems like it would have been a great idea, but I could not get it tied

title: I love this wrap
author: ashley
comments: I love this wrap. People complain that it's too hard to wrap, which is the biggest lie. I watched the video once and got it down. Takes seconds to wrap if you're not an imbecile. I love the wild flower print, it looks just like it does in the picture. I've seen the biggest complaint is the actual act of getting it on, but it's not hard in the slightest. If you have a problem with the tag, that is easily remedied: CUT IT OFF. If you tie it right, your baby should be secure. It comes with a pamphlet to demonstrate tying and baby placement and if you have internet to review and complain about your stupidity and not being able to wrap it, perhaps you should look on youtube where there are multiple fantastic videos to show how to tie it.

title: Very happy with this product. Would recommend this for anyone.
author: Gabor
comments: Very happy with this product. Very easy to use. Versatile and can be worn prolonged. The only downside is any if worn prolonged it can be quite warm where it actually covers the skin since the fabric is quite thick. Would recommend this for anyone.

title: Baby bonding
author: dmb
comments: Every new Mom should have one

title: I haven't got the change to use it with my ...
author: √úlle
comments: I haven't got the change to use it with my baby, so I really don't know how does it works in reality,but I've practiced it with baby size doll and it felt OK. So I can't wait.

title: love it !
author: Irais Flores-Marquez
comments: It's not as hard as I thought to wrap... The instructions show you step by step and my little guy loves being in it. It's especially easy for when I have to do my holiday shopping, I don't have to worry about not having enough room in the cart for my stuff and a car seat.

title: Must have for me!
author: Jaylinn
comments: I was a little intimidated by this at first because of how long it is. I wanted to baby wear but didn't want to spend a lot of money on some of the other ones that are available on the market. I am so happy I went with a Boba. Once I put it on a few times and got used to it, it is super easy to put on and to use. I love that I could start using it right away considering most carriers and wraps say to wait until the baby is over 8lbs. My daughter was 6lbs 11oz at birth so I was able to use this right away. I love that the material is slightly stretchy so that it allows my baby to move a little and get comfortable. The material is soft and feels good on the skin. I recommend this wrap to anyone I know having a baby. Great purchase!

title: Love this wrap
author: Natalia
comments: Love this wrap! With it, I can make breakfast, go to the bathroom, clean, do laundry, or almost whatever I want while keeping baby with me and lulling baby to sleep very quickly, and still have the use of both my hands.

title: Three Stars
author: Aron
comments: VERY VERY hot to wear for more than 5 minutes. makes baby really hot.

title: Must have for baby wearing!
author: mchendesign
comments: This has got to be the BEST thing we have ever bought for our baby. It's definitely a life saver when out and about...just put it on before you leave the house and it's ready to go when you reach your destination with baby. Our baby is not generally a fussy baby, but when we are out at a restaurant, she tends to get bored after a while in her stroller and gets antsy. I pop her in this wrap and she gets cozy and falls asleep in no time. The fabric is breathable and I love that I can just throw it in the washing machine when it needs to be cleaned. It's great for hands-free tasks while carrying the baby, although for newborns, you will still feel the need to keep one hand on their head just to make sure it's not flopping around. I definitely recommend this if you're looking for a baby wearing apparatus. Works great.

title: I love this wrap
author: Danielle
comments: I love this wrap! The days my daughter is fussy and wanting to be held, this is a life saver! It's so easy to get on,  even with the directions in the box and there's the added bonus of online videos. I would definitely recommend this or buy for my friends baby showers!

title: Perfect wrap for newbies!
author: C. Parrish
comments: With baby #4 on the way, I knew it was time to invest in a wrap to make getting around easier. I have always been intimadated by these and stayed away from wraps in the past b/c they looked too difficult. So, once this arrived, I made it my mission to practice as much as I could before baby arrived. The video was way more helpful than the insert and in no time I had this figured out. Baby LOVES being in here and instantly falls asleep when wrapped up. Baby is 2.5 months old now, and every Sunday I put baby in the wrap and he sleeps through Church. I use it to go down to the bus stop, grocery trips, shopping trips, and outings with the family. He will stay asleep in this for hours!The material is just great, provides ample back suport, and streches around baby perfectly. Only con is that it does get hot, but I think that is unavoidable when baby is tightly wrapped against chest!I plan on using this just as much when baby gets older! Love it!

title: Everyone's different.
author: Mike
comments: Good quality, great idea ...but just not made for everyone.  When wife tried it she said felt like it wasn't meant for her body,  felt to loose and unstable. If she doesn't trust it why keep it. Don't get me wrong it may be prefect for others.

title: LOVE this. It is comfortable and my child naps ...
author: reillylassy
comments: LOVE this.  It is comfortable and my child naps like a dream in it.

title: AWESOME! Best baby product we've ever bought
author: Dan Harmer
comments: AWESOME!  Best baby product we've ever bought.

title: Love this product
author: Kate
comments: Love this product. My daughter likes being carried in the Boba. Although it takes time to out on, it is comfortable to wear and for my baby to cuddle in.

title: I wouldn't buy it if you live in a hot climate like we do
author: Mommyof2
comments: This would be ok if we lived in a colder climate....I wouldn't buy it if you live in a hot climate like we do! It seemed very nice, just very thick.

title: Great for younger/smaller babies
author: tiffanyann7
comments: Bought this when I was expecting because I remembered my son didn't fit well into the Baby Bjorn when he was a newborn which was when I needed it the most so I didn't have to lug the carrier around after a c-section.  This one was rated for smaller babies than most of the other wraps I saw which was the determining factor for me.  It is pretty easy to use and after a couple times you can get it on pretty quickly and easily. Used it from our first week home with my baby who was probably about 6.5 lbs at that time.  My baby wanted to be held all the time, so I often would put her in the wrap in order to get laundry or anything done around the house during my maternity leave.  Also used it going to Target, the mall, and other outings and it worked great.  She loved being in the wrap and snuggled close to me and would sleep very well in it. Once she was able to hold her head up well I switched back to the Baby Bjorn as it's just quicker and easier - in fact I gave this to my neighbor who is expecting, so I can't comment on its use with older babies, but the Boba was great for those first few months.

title: Good purchase
author: Maria Ceaser
comments: I love my boba wrap, it's comfortable, and it keeps my son warm on a cold day.

title: Double Edged Sword
author: Glitter Gal
comments: I'm torn between love and hate....The loves: Having baby close and snug, baby stays nice a warm, the quality of the fabric.The hates: Ridiculously LONG, too hot, very stretchy and very pricey.This would be great for cooler weather, but in South Florida during the summertime (really all year round here) it's very hot. I have a shorter 100% cotton wrap and it's a bit cooler. It may be the length of the wrap that causes the internal heat wave due to the multiple times one has to double wrap and wrap. The fabric is a nice, sturdy cotton and wouldn't rip or tear easily.The length makes it near impossible to wrap baby anywhere, but home. You could charge admission for the show you put on for the many onlookers in the grocery parking lot. I have wrapped at home prior to going out, but it's difficult to put baby in and take out comfortably. It's much more convenient and comfortable for both of us to wrap baby to me. That's where the awkwardness of the length gets in the way. I have gone in the nursing rooms or dressing rooms to wrap, but I think that defeats the purpose.The stretchy fabric is also bit strange. You want to wrap baby so tight to keep them snug, but it ends up stretching out anyways... It seems like you keep pulling and pulling the fabric to tighten.If I was to purchase a wrap I would opt for a shorter, less stretchy, more affordable one

title: Way too much fabric with this thing. Wrapping it ...
author: Jessica Lucas
comments: Way too much fabric with this thing. Wrapping it around yourself is a hassle and not quick. I wish I had gone with a different kind- next time I would try the k'tan or go with the Moby carrier.

title: Three Stars
author: Lori Vangstad
comments: For babies that like being really close nice

title: Wrapped up in Warmth
author: Bradleygirl
comments: Good fabric, good color, but way too much fabric for me. I'm only 5'2" and had to return it. This wrap will keep you warmer than toast.  Depending upon where you live, climate wise, I might recommend making this purchase. Baby would be happy. Very well constructed item.

title: glad I purchased this!!!
author: zork
comments: I was torn between boba and baby ktan but chose boba because of the extra fabric around the waist. (Alreadyhave an Ergo but prefer to use it only after baby has full neck control.)  Im a size 10 (pre pregs) and wanted the extra wrapping of the boba to help hide the dreaded muffin top. Also my husband is a big guy (wears 3xl) and this fits him too (unlike the ktan which is sized). Fabric is soft and stretchy. Took me 2 tries to get the right snug fit for my 2 week old baby girl but now its a breeze to put on. I recommend watching a few youtube videos first even thought this wrap comes with a nice users guide.

title: Great product! It even fits my husband
author: Arwen Roth
comments: Great product! It even fits my husband, who is 6'6'', comfortably.  Our daughter who is 3 weeks old, loves being carried in the Boba.

title: comfortable for both baby & mommy
author: Angela Nua
comments: I purchased this wrap because my second child was not a fan of my sling. She is two months now & we've used this since she was just 2 weeks old. When she insist on being held, this is my go to. It's convenient, comfortable for both baby & mommy, & I would highly recommend it to all mommies out there.

title: AMAZING
author: Lindsey
comments: I bought this wrap because some of my friends recommended it. I love this wrap. My baby is fully supported, it is very comfortable to wear and once you wrap it a few times the process of putting it on is very simple. I would highly recommend this wrap to any new mom who is in the market for one. 5 STARS!

title: Love the product
author: Aleksandra Stewart
comments: wear it all the time, really like the wrap. Arrived quickly, easy to use and my son loves it

title: Great buy!
author: Heather L.
comments: My sister said this was a dream item. Her baby does so well in it. He was 10 pounds when born and he has been using it constantly since birth. She loves it!

title: Five Stars
author: Adriana Walker
comments: I'd be lost without this thing!

title: It's easier to use than expected but still, my ...
author: Linda Parker
comments: It's easier to use than expected but still, my restless child won't settle in it as I hoped. Will keep trying around the house but will stick to my Baby Bjorn outside of home - at least I know that works.

title: Five Stars
author: B.
comments: Baby and mammy love it.

title: Love it, wish I had bought sooner.
author: FM3
comments: Love this. Use all the time much better than backpack carriers.  Much more comfortable. No digging into shoulders & better on back because holds baby closer too you & higher. Does take a few times to get use to wrapping it around you especially since it's stretchy (you have to tie tight) but one you get it, it's super easy.  Baby will stay happy & sleep..well.. like a baby all wrapped up.

title: I LOVE this Boba Wrap
author: Brittney Shae
comments: I LOVE this Boba Wrap! I sincerely wish I would have had one with my other two kids. Instead, I jacked around with those horribly uncomfortable back pack type ones. NEVER AGAIN! This wrap is comfortable for me and my baby. Thankfully, there's lots of videos demonstrating how to use it. It's an extremely user friendly wrap. It's super soft and secure feeling. I get tons of compliments every time I use it in public.

title: She loved it.
author: JJ
comments: I used it to travel with my daughter when she was 15 days. She loved it.

title: Not for bigger/heavier babies.
author: jmarie417
comments: we have a moby and a maya sling and thought we would like this --- nope. it's comfortable fabric but our baby is 12 lbs at 2 months and even with the tightest i could get it, he slipped down with his weight and i could not keep him snug in the right position. it was evident he was just "too big" for this wrap. he still fits and holds great in the moby, so this fabric just isn't great for larger babies.

title: I love my wrap but have noticed that if you have ...
author: Catharine V Pittman
comments: I love my wrap but have noticed that if you have a more active child they tend to make it slip and have to be readjusted a lot. Can be very inconvienant

title: I am wearing her, breastfeeding her and rocking her, all as I write this review!
author: Steph
comments: I just got my Boba Wrap and had to write a review. I already had a sling (by Seven) and an infantino carrier and both were uncomfortable, even though my girl is only 3 weeks old and a little over 8 pounds. I ended up getting this because I need to be able to get things done around the house and wasn't having much luck when the babe is having a fussy day, not to mention the tension headaches from holding her to comfort her. I am wearing her, breastfeeding her and rocking her, all as I write this review! Now I can answer emails for my business and actually get things done. Awesome! So stoked.

title: I gifted that to my sister and she enjoy it a lot
author: Jose Fernando Corredor L
comments: It work perfectly as Kangoo for baby. I gifted that to my sister and she enjoy it a lot.

title: I followed the directions and watched videos online but I ...
author: Cody Hammons
comments: I followed the directions and watched videos online but I never gelt it was wrapped securely enough to hold my baby.

title: Love it!
author: Leigh
comments: I spent months agonizing over what type of wrap to get (I had never used one before) and couldn't decide between this Boba (which is a stretchy wrap) or a Moby, or a woven wrap.  I went with the Boba because I had read that it was especially good for the newborn phase and I was planning to get an Ergo for when my baby was older.I love the wrap, and I'm really glad I went for the stretchy material.  My daughter wanted only to be held in the first several months and using the Boba wrap I could easily carry her around everywhere (and make dinner, and go shopping, and help my toddler).  I looked up videos on how to tie it and used it from the moment my daughter was 2 weeks old.  It's comfortable and easy to use and I even got handy with putting it on while seated in the car.  I travelled with my daughter in an airplane when she was 3 months old and kept this wrap on the entire flight (8 hours) and used it to help support her while breast feeding (did this often elsewhere as well) and she slept for hours while snuggled up in it against me.Some disadvantages are that as she got bigger, I still usually used a hand to support her as she would slide down in the wrap (if I didn't have it pulled tight enough), and we didn't use this in the summer months because it was just WAY TOO HOT and my baby would sweat within minutes of being put in this.  Also, I have the black colour and parts of it became discoloured within a few months of use.  But these are minor annoyances (except the heat!).  So for cooler months/climate, I would absolutely recommend this.  I've also purchased as gifts for friends.

title: love my Boba!
author: kcoleman1009
comments: I love this wrap so much!!! I bought it to use with my second child. With my first, I had a Moby. I like my Boba so much more! It is stretchy and easier to get my daughter into!

title: Five Stars
author: Alicia Navarrete
comments: Great and versatile product! Although it is sooo long that sometimes is difficult to handle....

title: MIRACLE
author: mobetta
comments: I have two!  I love that this equally distributes the baby's weight across your body and doesn't have pressure points.  We didn't use it for a month or two and then she got to where she didn't want to take her nap or go to sleep at night so we pulled it back out and it still works.  She fusses for a second then goes right to sleep.  My husband even uses it.  My mom was worried about the babies hips being spread, so I asked my pediatrician and she said that it was better than confining them to a closed position, and that as long as we were careful about smothering and the baby could breath well it was fine.  ***She also said it would help with digestion for the baby to sit upright!*** This is awesome!

title: difficult to use
author: Jacob Gluck
comments: It's a bit difficult to learn how to wrap this correctly (I tried to take the shortcut and learn it intuitively or by trial and error --didn't work out well). Moreover, it takes a good 2-3 minutes to harness the wrap to your body AND you may require help by another person who will insert the baby into the wrap. I would not have bought this had I known all this. Nevertheless it may be useful to some folks since the wrap does allow you to make very subtle adjustments ion snugness, height etc... and it is very compact compared to other baby carriers.

title: awesome
author: mayra
comments: Awesome

title: I figured out how to put it on fairly easy by watching all the you tube videos
author: Volprincess24
comments: I have used this wrap from the day my baby was born. He loves it! I figured out how to put it on fairly easy by watching all the you tube videos. My baby is now 3 months old and a whopping 15 lbs and I am still comfortable carrying him around in it. I recently decided to buy a different carrier to have another option and I paid $136 dollars for it. And he can stand it!!!! This wrap is stretchy and to him it feels like he's just being carried by me. It moves with him when he takes a one to stretch some, as all babies like to do. He felt really constricted in my other carrier. If I could give this more than 5 stars I would!!!

title: Best Stretch Wrap I've Used
author: Rachel B. Ramey (blogger/author)
comments: Most baby carriers have a learning curve -- some styles more than others.  And we all have our preferences.  For me, a stretch wrap is not my first-pick, go-to all-purpose carrier.  However, a "snuggly" carrier like this is excellent for tiny babies.  And this is, hands-down, the best one I've used.I had tried stretch wraps in the past, and I *hated* them.  They were bulky and heavy and seemingly a mile long.  I felt like I was drowning before I ever even got them wrapped, or put a baby in them.  Then I tried the Boba Wrap and it was like night and day.  Yes, it still requires tying -- that's the nature of a wrap.  Yes, it's still fairly long -- that, too, is just the nature of a wrap.  But this is SOOO much lighter.  And there's not a lot of excess length.  I'm a tiny woman -- just over five feet tall and under 100 lbs. -- and I don't have a ton of fabric left over after tying this.(Do be aware, though, that if you're tying it right, there should NOT be slack before putting the baby in.  It's designed to be stretchy enough that it STRETCHES to make room for the baby.)If you want something you don't have to wrap and tie, a wrap might not be for you, at least as a general-purpose carrier.  (My personal favorites are the Boba 4G and the Maya Wrap, for general "around town"-type use.)  But if you're looking for a stretchy wrap, I think this is the best.I received this carrier free for review purposes.  However, all opinions are 100% my own.

title: better than Moby, IMO!!
author: Teece Smith
comments: Love this, once I took a few attempts to get the fitting right. Much better price than the Moby. I love my Boba!

title: Love this wrap
author: Laura
comments: I wanted to try a wrap for my newborn, but I admit that I was hesitant. I wasn't sure I'd be able to trust that the wrap was tight enough. I was worried that my baby would fall out! The first time I tried the Boba wrap, I realized that I had nothing to worry about. Just follow the directions (included in the package and also posted on Amazon and on the Boba website) and you'll be ok. Remember that young babies shouldn't have their legs hanging straight down--their hips need to be in frog-leg style. The instructions help you figure it out. Also, make sure your baby can breathe.My baby is 2 1/2 months now and I've been using the wrap since she was about 3 weeks old. She didn't like being in the wrap for very long in the beginning, though she'd tolerate it on some days for up to half an hour. I also tried to use the wrap when she was cluster feeding, but I never really got the hang of it and it was easier to just cuddle with her.Now, though, my baby is often happy to be wrapped close to me for longer amounts of time. She's able to hold her head up better, so for the most part my hands really are "free" when she's in her wrap (before, I had to support her head most of the time because she wouldn't keep her head inside the wrap). It's really great to be able to hold my baby near me without actually holding her. My arms and shoulders feel so much better at the end of the day.To summarize: I love this wrap and I haven't once worried about dropping or suffocating my baby.

title: Happy Mom and Baby!
author: Nicole Mitton
comments: The Boba Wrap sends my baby into peaceful sleep. Its length is a little disconcerting at first, but the stretchiness of the material is fantastic. Once you master the wrapping, it's very comfortable and convenient. I would wear my baby in this all day.

title: One Star
author: Vee
comments: Waste of money. Never used it. Not strong enough for heavier baby.

title: Five Stars
author: s_j_w
comments: love it

title: Our first carrier
author: MissLesliB
comments: This is the only wrap or carrier I've used thus far. Used it age 2 - 4 weeks. Baby fits snugly inside, it's easy to wrap, and the fabric is very comfortable/breathable.

title: It's very comfortable for me and baby
author: Allie G.
comments: I initially registered for this just because it was on the list Babies R Us gave us. My husband said we'd never use it and suggested we return it. He's singing a different tune now! Our baby wants to be held constantly, will go beserk if put in a crib, swing or bouncer, so this wrap is the only way I get anything done around the house. It's very comfortable for me and baby.
