Took a couple of times to learn how to tie it on, but I can now put it on in my sleep. Baby and I do get quite warm while wearing it, so I only wear a T-shirt under it.

title: Love the Boba!
author: katherine
comments: Very useful! It's soft, it's easy, & comfortable. Wish I had purchased this sooner. My baby loves being held and sometimes we can't use a stroller. He's content & comfortable. He falls asleep in here, and even nurses in it. It's a must for me.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Very well made and functional, It gets the job done!

title: It's nice and lightweight but the long length makes it extremely ...
author: Lindy Tsang
comments: It's nice and lightweight but the long length makes it extremely difficult to wear without the ends touching the floor which makes it unhygienic. Not so good for hot seasons due to the fabric either.

title: wonderful
author: N.Mel
comments: I had tried the seven sling prior to the boba wrap since it was much cheaper. I can now honestly say the boba is worth the money. The cloth is sturdy yet soft on my baby's skin. It is one size fits all so you don't have to worry about ordering the wrong size like the seven sling. It keeps baby comfortable and has been a lifesaver during collic hour. My newborn wants to be held 24/7 and I can finally do laundry and eat since my hands are free. I am so glad I bought this product. Wish I didn't wait until baby was 2 months, could have made life easier sooner!

title: Perhaps when he gets bigger the wrap will workout better for us
author: Desirae
comments: My son is 9 lbs and he just sinks to the bottom of the wrap. I have to hold him up so he can breathe. Perhaps when he gets bigger the wrap will workout better for us.

title: Not worth the money, or time needed to learn to use this wrap.
author: Alicia
comments: I bought this wrap as I read it had good reviews here on Amazon. After the initial excitement of receiving the wrap, I broke open the box and had my first experience with the Boba Wrap. Not only is the wrap wayyyyyy too long, but it takes some time and lots of practice in order to put it on properly. I found I had to put this on in front on the mirror each time other wise it was a disaster. After much practice putting the wrap on, I finally felt confident enough to put the baby in the wrap and try it out. Even though I had it on properly, I felt as though the baby might fall out. I never felt comfortable enough to bend over with the baby in the wrap without holding onto the baby to make sure she didn't come out. I found the wrap its self to be very stretchy, and no matter how tightly  I would wrap it around me it would stretch out and make me feel insecure about putting the baby in it. Therefore, I've used it maybe 3 times and it just sits in its box in the closet. Very disappointed. I thought this would be a more convenient product then it is, and easier to put on without the feeling of "OH GOD IS THE BABY GOING TO FALL OUT?!?!"

title: Hot for mom, uncomfortable for baby
author: Kristen Childers
comments: My baby cries whenever I try to use this wrap so I don't think she finds it comfortable. It also makes mama and baby extremely hot from all the layers--which is just intolerable in the summer or when being active (which is why I bought it) so not ideal if sweating all over your baby bothers you.I gave it 3 stars because I think if my baby liked being in it and it was wintertime, I would love it--finally a way to hold my baby and actually get some chores done around the house...but it just doesn't cut it, unfortunately.

title: but I did not like the grey at all
author: SillyMonkey727
comments: The fabric of the grey is different than the black. it stretches out more and therefore loosens the hold on my son. I'm not sure what accounts for the difference, but I did not like the grey at all.

title: It's like an all body shirt wedgie
author: WBA
comments: Is this a joke? I put this thing on and nearly had a fit trying to get out of it immediately!! It's like an all body shirt wedgie! I could see it being useful if you go topless but all these pictures of people wearing it over their clothes have to be photoshopped! It's about 10ft of thick stretchy fabric that must be wrapped around you tightly. I tried it wearing a button up and a regular tee shirt and neither worked. both ended up pulled in every which direction and the fabric just made me so hot. I managed one use and put it away. What a waste! That being said, I'd love some suggestions on better ways to wear it so that my money is not wasted.

title: LOVE my Wrap!
author: josh cody
comments: I am thrilled with the wrap! I didn't wrap with my first son and so when we found out we were having another one... this was something I couldn't wait to try. The material is so soft and stretchy. After practicing a couple times, you can accurately 'wrap' yourself in about 25 seconds without much hassle. My baby boy is due to arrive in about 2 weeks and I cannot wait to put him in it. Being able to be close to him and still have my hands free. Totally amazing and worth the money.

title: Better than a Moby
author: kbalboa730
comments: I love this wrap! Its lighter than a Moby and its stretchy so you dont have to leave room for the baby. We wear it for a few hours every day and it holds shape during wear.

title: good for small babies
author: Jessica
comments: As far as the boba wrap goes, I found it comfortable for only when the baby was very small and didn't move around much.  The wrap itself was very soft and stretchy (much more stretchy than the Moby wrap) and the directions for tying it on yourself were very easy to follow, especially for a first timer.  I found the wrap to be less bulky than a structured carrier, however with this particular wrap I found that even when my son was a newborn, I didn't feel like he was as secure I would have liked.  The stretchiness of the material did lead to some sagging over time, but baby didn't seem to mind at all, he loved to sleep in the Boba wrap and it was great for getting chores done around the house while he napped.In short, I would recommend this wrap to parents who are new to wraps and have very young or small babies.

title: And I don't like the fact that you can only have them in ...
author: Leah Cooper
comments: It works, but for me its too much work to put a baby in. And I don't like the fact that you can only have them in there facing you. My four month old perfers to face out now. So I only used this many 3 times...If you have a kid that loves facing you, then i guess this would be worth the money. Great material though.

title: Super handy!
author: m.pettit
comments: I love this wrap.  I have tried the ergo carriers and a ring sling prior to getting this wrap for my second baby.  This wrap is comfortable enough to wear for hours at a time and doesn't hurt my back.  Once you get the hang of tying it, it only takes a minute to get baby in it.  The fabric is thick and stretchy which I think makes it feel more secure for you and baby.  My little one will sleep in it, nurse in it, and it always calms her down.  A life saver when I need to chase my toddler, go shopping or get some housework done.  Wish I had one with my first baby!

title: Great wrap!
author: Momof4boys
comments: I really like this wrap, there is a bit of a learning curve (and I'm still not sure that I have perfected the tightness of the tie that is required to secure the baby for hours) but my son absolutely loves being carried in this thing! There are so many benefits to babywearing that had never occurred to me, I highly suggest that you Google the term and read up on it. I think this wrap is perfect for the newborn stage but I wonder how well it will work for an older infant. I will be sure to update when my son is a little older.

title: Five Stars
author: C.C.
comments: Great!

title: Too Much Fabric
author: natasha
comments: This wrap didn't work for my son and I too much fabric, I was never comfortable with the way the wrap held him and I had it tied correct, there just is an over abundance of fabric for my body

title: Works great
author: David A Thomas
comments: Baby loved it. Little tricky putting it on at first. Baby does get a little bit over heated sometimes.

title: Great wrap! I thought it would be too hot ...
author: Julia Alyse Knowles
comments: Great wrap! I thought it would be too hot since I live in FL, but as long as we are both lightly dressed, it's perfect. I can now take my two year old to the park and play with him while wearing my three month old :D

title: This product is so awesome; I'd definitely recommend it for anyone with a ...
author: BT
comments: This product is so awesome; I'd definitely recommend it for anyone with a baby!  After I had my third baby, we had 4 weddings to go to within 4 months, and I did not feel comfortable taking her into so many crowds with so many people... and I'm not the type of mom who likes to pass around my babies.  The Boba Wrap not only keeps her safe and tucked away, but it also prevents people from trying to snatch her to hold her.  I'm a huge fan, and my baby, who loves to cuddle, loves to be in it too.  As she is getting older, however, she likes to see everything that is going on, and you cannot face her forward in this wrap- that doesn't bother me at all, but it does bother her sometimes.  Another great thing about this wrap is that it doesn't hurt your back!  I had several other slings with my first 2 babies and my husband and I didn't like them because it made our backs ache.  This wrap, however, is super comfortable! It's almost like being pregnant but without any of the associated discomfort!

title: I use this almost every day!
author: njensen
comments: I love my boba wrap! I was concerned that this might be hard to use but it isn't! I wear mine almost daily and love the comfortable stretchy fabric. My baby goes right to sleep in it, he LOVES it. I like how it feels to have him in it and close to me. The design is supportive enough for a young one, my guy now two months... I'm not sure exactly how long he'll fit in it, but it's a great option for this age and so much easier than breaking out the stroller. I also like to wear it at home while cooking. Only thing is, you can't really bend over without using hands to support the baby, but I don't think anything would fit that bill. This wrap totally works and looks great. I've had a lot of compliments on the color. It also washes really well. I definitely recommend it!

title: I love this wrap!
author: Taylor
comments: I'm a bigger chested girl so I was afraid this might be uncomfortable for baby and me, but luckily I was wrong. This wrap has already made my life so much easier! My little one is close to me and perfectly content, and I'm able to go about my day. Love it!!

title: One Star
author: Charlotte Sanders
comments: I couldn't get it to stay snug

title: Love my Boba Wrap!
author: Amelia Mayer
comments: I've used quite a few wraps, and prefer the Boba because I can get a GREAT fit every time :) Perfect for newborns and small babies. Plus, the new colors are beautiful!

title: I love Boba wrap
author: katie
comments: I love Boba wrap! It is so user friendly and an overall comfortable baby carrier! I prefer Boba over any other baby carriers currently out on the market.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This is the best way to carry a baby.  So secure!

title: Five Stars
author: he xiangfei
comments: It's very useful right now.But I think it's to hot in summer.

title: I wouldn't recommend the boba wrap for newborns/toddlers whose heads aren't strong ...
author: Denise Smith
comments: I wouldn't recommend the boba wrap for newborns/toddlers whose heads aren't strong enough to hold up yet. I found it very difficult to put my baby in the wrap alone with the baby not being so strong yet. I felt like her spine and head were out of line plus she was very uncomfortable.

title: The colors are beautiful and not super bright which I really love and ...
author: AlexWMamaof2
comments: I absolutely adore this wrap! The colors are beautiful and not super bright which I really love and appreciate! The fabric is very soft and stretchy, and learning to properly wrap yourself and your baby is a breeze with the help of their detailed manual and the videos on their website. If you need a wrap for your small infant I highly recommend this one!

title: Great Wrap
author: Momma In Flip Flops II
comments: I've been using wraps for years and Boba was my first and favorite. Easy to use, comfortable for mom and baby with excellent instructions to help get that perfect fit for you both. That material is thick & stretchy, but not overly stretchy that after awhile you have to completely readjust.I love that I'm able to wrap baby securely from infancy into the toddler years. If you're new to baby wearing I highly recommend the wrap for infancy, it's my favorite time to wear baby & has been proven after three to put them to sleep. Perfect for men and women & Boba has many different prints to choose from!

title: Best wrap!
author: NewMama
comments: Love, love, love!!! I've used a Boba Wrap for a long time, but just recently got the new wildflower print and it is GORGEOUS! Boba is a babywearing carrier I love and trust and have used for years, with both my kids (now 4 and 2). Once you get the hang of wrapping, I promise it's really easy. It becomes like second nature and you can whip it on in no time, it hold your baby close and snug, and is very comfortable to wear with the "straps" of fabric spread across your shoulders and your back.It's definitely a must-have carrier for newborns (among all the types out there - slings, soft structured, etc.). Once they get a little older the wraps are harder to use because of the stretchy fabric and the weight of the child. BUT, I still wear my 2.5-year-old daughter in our Boba Wrap.I actually just bought another Boba Wrap for my friend having her first baby next month. It's the best baby shower/new mom gift because it's a life saver that they'll use all the time!

title: Excellent wrap for your newborn
author: The Soulicious Life
comments: Excellent wrap for your newborn. He or she will appreciate being held cozy and close. I appreciate the super thick, soft and flexible fabric. As with any wrap, there is a short learning curve to wrap it correctly, but once you get it, you'll love it!

title: Hot and Hard to Handle.
author: C. Siders
comments: I returned this product because it was hot and it was hard to put on.  They say you get used to it, but I tried 3 or 4 times and my baby was never in there right.  Since it was also hot, I decided to go with something different.

title: Love it! My reflux baby sleeps without problems when ...
author: Kristina
comments: Love it! My reflux baby sleeps without problems when in the wrap. She fusses just a little bit when first placed in, but settles down and falls asleep. It does get pretty warm for her after some time so I make sure she is not overdressed before placing her in it.

title: Soft and stretchy - great wrap!
author: Gena L.
comments: I'm a Boba 4g fanatic and I thought I wouldn't like the Boba wrap but I definitely do! It's great for teeny tiny babies or big babies like my 26 lb 10 month old.  I love the feel of the fabric. It's much higher quality than other wraps I've tried. And the color gray is anything but ordinary. I just love it!I was sent this product free of cost to review honestly.

title: Perfect wrap!
author: Kelly
comments: LOOOOVE this wrap. I've tried so many different wrap style carriers and this is by far my favorite. The fabric is so soft, and is easy to tie. It's perfect for snuggling my baby!!! The colors are beautiful! Mine is sangria! Love!

title: I have used their products for 6 years and became a Boba Ambassador so I could shout from the roof tops how much I love Boba. Th
author: A Barrett
comments: This is rebranded from Sleepy Wrap.  I have used their products for 6 years and became a Boba Ambassador so I could shout from the roof tops how much I love Boba.  The Sleepy Wrap cured my son's colic because it allowed him to stay close and have pressure on his tummy so it didn't hurt so much.  Boba recently sent me a new wrap (the floral one) so I could review.  I received no other compensation.  I'm a Certified Babywearing Educator and help many parents wear their babies.  I mostly use wovens, soft structure carriers, and the occasional ring sling with my 9 month old but I tried this on.  If you wrap tight enough you can still support the spread squat positioning in a 9 month old.  The Boba carrier is a better option for this age but it works in a pinch and is ridiculously soft.  The pattern is beautiful.  I can't wait to help parents love babywearing by sharing this in my consultations.  Boba makes quality products that stand up to time and use through multiple kids.

title: It's also very warm so prob not ideal for summer wearing but I do like how close baby is
author: Sarah
comments: Very long, and a bit difficult to get it tied and get baby in & out without someone there to help you. It's also very warm so prob not ideal for summer wearing but I do like how close baby is. A bit pricey for only a long piece of fabric.

title: Takes time to put together!
author: sofia basraoui
comments: A hassle to put together every time, plus my baby did not like it.

title: Great for hands free
author: Jamie Pearson
comments: Takes a while to figure out the wrap (four times a charm for me). I have twins so it helps to be hands free for one of them. Comfortable. Easy on back currently (babies are under 10lbs right now).

title: Best baby product
author: Deborah Ruth
comments: I love the boba wrap so much. It was amazing for holding my new baby close while I chased after her sisters. I have had newborns in spring, winter and summer and loved it for all seasons. The stretch is perfect and doesn't get saggy or stretched out while wearing it. I recommend it to all my friends.

title: this will be perfect for when it's cooler
author: Tanya
comments: I live in Texas, this will be perfect for when it's cooler, but during late summer, early fall, is too hot. Unless we are just around the house.

title: My child didn't like it and neither did I
author: claudia
comments: TOO COMPLICATED AND STRETCHY. My child didn't like it and neither did I.

title: This is the best gift for yourself and your baby because in my ...
author: PG
comments: This is the best gift for yourself and your baby because in my case my baby loves to sleep in her bobba cuz she is with mommy all the time... Also let you use your arms while you hold your baby... Its really nice!!! I love it!!! Its very useful ;)

title: Five Stars
author: Emily K.
comments: Wish we had gotten this sooner.

title: Love how it keeps baby close
author: Karla
comments: Love how it keeps baby close, but it's SUPER complicated to put on and then we were both hot and sweaty - in February!

title: Four Stars
author: Dan
comments: It's a great wrap and it allows air to breathe in. It is quite long but it works well.

title: Great wrap! Love it.
author: Angela
comments: Absolutely love it! So soft and comfortable. I love that baby is happiest when I wear him and the boba wrap is stylish and made with high quality materials. I also like that the wrap comes with a little bag for storing that matches the wrap's design.Highly recommend it!

title: I liked the color and my son seemed cozy in it
author: Becky
comments: I liked the color and my son seemed cozy in it. When he constantly wanted to be held his first few weeks, The Boba was great because it allowed me to keep my hands free, but still keep him close. I did feel that after he was wrapped for a little while the fabric would stretch and be a bit loose and I'd have to re-adjust to tighten it up.

title: Must Have Baby Item
author: Melissa Griffiths
comments: As a mom of 4 I didn't start babywearing until #3 came along because I just had no more hands free. I tried lots of different things and then I found Boba! I love this wrap for younger babies, when they are very small and cuddly still. They like to be in nice and warm and close to you and they sleep very well. It holds their weight comfortably, it washes well, has a nice stretch.... very good wrap. When babies get bigger though, around 4 months or so I like to more to a more structured carrier like a Boba 4G. This is my very favorite thing to give to new moms along with a lesson on "how to" once the baby gets here. Anyone who doesn't like wraps just hasn't been taught how to wear them properly IMO :)

title: easy to use and keeps our baby quiet
author: James Crow
comments: My wife absolutely loves this wrap, with another kiddo this product is a lifesaver, easy to use and keeps our baby quiet

title: Nice Quality - Ultimately Not for Me
author: Mrs P.
comments: I liked the quality and style of this wrap.  I used it a couple of times when my baby was around 12 lbs.  It wasn't too easy to get baby in and out without a second pair of hands, but can be achieved with practice, and once in, baby was comfortable and settled eventually once she got used to it.  It was comfortable to wear for me too and felt secure.  I did feel that I always had to cradle her head when leaning forward so doesn't always free up both hands.  Ultimately I decided that I wanted her to get good quality sleep in the dark in her crib, and as she tended to fall to sleep in this I stopped using it.

title: We weren't smart enough to figure this out
author: nick guglielmetti
comments: We weren't smart enough to figure this out. It is pretty much just fabric that you tie in a knot. Tried to use during a 2 am wake up call, I some how tied my hands behind my back and needed to wake up my wife. Next thing I know she was tied up too......Spider web?

title: Boba wrap better than Moby wrap
author: fightontrojans
comments: LOVE LOVE LOVE this wrap! Wish I would have purchased this then my baby was a newborn. I didn't get this until she was about 3 months old, and had been using the Moby wrap. I love the Moby wrap, too, but here are some key differences:Moby: thicker fabric, no sagging baby after hours of wear; pre-wrapping is much harder and much higher learning curve necessary to pre-wrap than the Boba. If you pre-tie it too tightly, then you have to start all over again.Boba: less thick fabric that is stretchier, tends to sag after a few hours of wear, but easily adjustable; more forgiving when it comes to pre-wrapping because of the stretch. If you tie too tightly, stretches out. in fact, you want to tie it a little tigher than you think you need to so that you have room for it to sag a little once you've been carrying baby around for a while. More "breathable" fabric for those hotter days in Southern California.Between the Moby and the Boba, I'd recommend the Boba for sure!

title: You NEED this.
author: EightInTheNest
comments: We've loved the Boba Wrap since it was the Sleepy Wrap! We've always called it our "secret weapon"! This thing is a LIVESAVER!

title: One Star
author: Sharen F. Hanna
comments: returned

title: Love it, but wish it came in a lighter fabric
author: hajeh
comments: Love my boba wrap, It causes no back or shoulder pain, great support for baby, been using it since birth and he will be 5 months soon.  I gave it a 4 star because it can get really hot where I live and this makes me sweat like mad! I wish it would come in a different fabric , this fabric is really heavy.

title: I love the ergo carrier
author: John
comments: I love the ergo carrier, but it can be tricky with a newborn.  I thought I would only use this for the first couple of weeks, but I use it all the time!!!

title: Five Stars
author: shagnc
comments: Daughter loved it!

title: BUY  A WRAP INSTEAD OF A CARRIER!!!!!
author: ShelbyAnne84
comments: Don't waste your money on $200 baby carriers when you can get a wrap for $40-$50. I love this wrap, it's easy to use, easy to put on (you'll be a pro in no time with a little practice) and baby LOVES it. If you haven't tried baby wearing before, I HIGHLY recommend it!!! Boba is one of the best brands around, you won't be disappointed.

title: I buy this for my friends because it has been so awesome for me!
author: Shannon
comments: I cannot say enough about how great this has been. The boba wrap gets my vote, along with my nursing pillow, for absolute MUST HAVES with new baby.

title: The Boba wrap is a must for any parent.
author: K & M Williams
comments: When you receive the warp it comes in its own little tote bag made out of the same fabric of the wrap. The tote bag makes the wrap so compact and portable so when it‚Äôs not in use you simply roll the wrap back up and tuck it back in.  The wrap itself is very soft and stretchy it is made out of 95% cotton 5% Spandex, which is something I love because whenever it gets dirty I simply toss it in the washing machine and either let it air dry or if I‚Äôm in desperate need of using it again I toss it in the dryer. I prefer to let it air dry because my wrap is grey and I feel like it fades with so many washes.When you put the wrap on you do need to have both handles available, the wrap is a really long piece of fabric, the dimensions are 6x6x11.5 inches. Essentially you wrap the fabric around your upper body to create a little pocket for you baby to be in, It takes a few seconds to put the wrap on. I do suggest watching the videos on the Boba website, they are very helpful. I love my wrap and I am very passionate about recommending it to everyone I know. The wrap doesn‚Äôt make me feel sweaty when I am baby wearing and its made of a light fabric so I never feel like my child will be too hot.I have gone in the pool with my wrap on and the chlorine didn‚Äôt affect the color, I have hiked for hours with my wrap on and it has held up perfectly and offered me and my child great support. I take my wrap to Disneyland and discreetly nurse in public while wearing my wrap. My favorite thing about the wrap is that it has no hooks, cords or straps that rub up against my face or worse my sleeping baby‚Äôs face. In summary, the wrap is portable, compact, easily stored and perfect for bonding with your little one while still having free hands, which is great in my book because I have 3 other children that require my attention :) . The Boba wrap is a must for any parent.

title: Five Stars
author: Jennifer S.
comments: Such a great tool as a new mom. Frees up my arms

title: he decided he loved it. He still fusses right when putting him ...
author: Monica
comments: This wrap is a lifesaver! At first, my son wasn't too into it. He would fuss and cry every time I put him in it. But once he was about 5 weeks old and I pushed it a little more, he decided he loved it. He still fusses right when putting him in (I imagine it's not too comfortable), but once he's in it, he instantly calms down. I can get him to fall asleep in the wrap within minutes and stay that way for a few hours, which is a big relief. He's the type of baby that only wants to be held and wants you to put him to sleep, so this is a lifesaver for the times when I need my hands! I highly recommend this wrap to all mothers!

title: Not My Piece of Cake
author: leelily
comments: Honestly I don't quite understand wraps - it is just a piece of long thick of fabric. Boba is one of them - it requires skills and practice to learn, it takes time to wear when you need, and it can become a pain to use in summer.  It is not bad, but just not my piece of cake. And my baby obviously prefers another carrier so I returned it.

title: The instructions are easy to follow
author: AMANDA
comments: I'm 5'3 and when I opened the package I thought OMG! I think I need to be 10 feet tall to use this! But it actually is perfect- the cloth wraps around well and the extra is just even more support/safety. The instructions are easy to follow. My newborn is 6.5 pounds and I was nervous at first about putting him in, and had to hold him upright at first until I got the hand of the product doing all the supporting. It's working out really well. It's great for postpartum exercise when you're itching to get out of the house and do some physical activity!

title: I have twins and I wanted to use this to ...
author: PuppyQueen
comments: I have twins and I wanted to use this to carry them around together but it is way too difficult to do that and time consuming. With one baby, I might see things  differently, but id rather use two ergo carriers (or similar) for my twins.

title: Lets you get things done
author: Stella Quinn
comments: Comfortable for baby and mom. The wrap criss-crosses over the back providing comfortable support. Having hands free means you can get things done.

title: Excellent!! Babies that are carried are happier
author: Silvia Cangrejo
comments: Excellent!! Babies that are carried are happier!!! this is the best option: you can have your baby with you all the time and also gives you freedom!

title: I bought this because a friend had recommended it to me
author: Meghan Nichols
comments: I bought this because a friend had recommended it to me.  It may have been great when they are really small but if they are already up to 10 lbs and want to be active I am not sure it is worth it.  (My baby was born 6 pounds) The wrap is really long and does not feel secure enough for a baby that can hold it's head up and wants to look around.  I will try it again for my next child as a way to get them to sleep while I am doing things around the house.

title: Great Overall
author: Product Reviewer
comments: Overall a good product, it allows me to get things done and helps the baby fall asleep.  However there is a lot of excess fabric, even after you knot it.  Also the fabric can be very hot for both mom and baby.  The baby has a tendency to keep slipping downwards in the wrap and you need to keep adjusting it.

title: Item not as pictured.
author: Victoria
comments: This wrap was a big disappointment. In the picture, there is a logically placed patch and inch or so below the edge of the fabric. What I actually received has, instead of the patch, a small, cheap looking, scratchy shirt tag attached on the edge. Not only is it tacky, the tag falls right on the baby's neck or cheek, depending on which way the baby is facing. I called Boba customer service, and the woman was both unhelpful and condescending. I will be returning mine, which is unfortunate because other than that stupid tag, it's a great wrap. It's super comfortable, easy to use, and has great support if you tie it correctly. Such a bummer.

title: Five Stars
author: MaKaibree Reese
comments: Quick shipping.! Exactly as advertised.!

title: buy this!!
author: Shopper
comments: hands free nursing. get things done while bonding with baby

title: Awesome, but bag needs handle
author: Jennifer J Bailey
comments: These are awesome as long as you watch a few youtube videos about how to wrap it and put your child in it.  Otherwise it's very confusing.  It also takes a little practice.  My only complaint and why I didn't give it 5 stars is the bag it comes in.  They need to put a handle on it, or something I could use to hook it to the coat rack or put it on a hanger for her closet.  Even if they just put a Boba tag on there to hang it by... Too much baby crap everywhere. Everyone needs something to help them be organized...handle please!

title: Five Stars
author: kay_w
comments: Easy to use. My baby snuggles up and falls right asleep.

title: My baby doesn't like to swaddle and prefers a lot more movement
author: ChrissayB
comments: My baby doesn't like to swaddle and prefers a lot more movement. This doesn't allow that at all it constricts the baby to be super close to you. If your baby likes to be swaddled this would probably be the carrier for you.

title: ... it in the mail today and the fit is perfect for my little man and his
author: laylani
comments: just got it in the mail today and the fit is perfect for my little man and his seizures

title: grear
author: Victoria W.
comments: Really like it, as does baby!

title: Complicated to put on, fabric to thick, after ...
author: Stephanie
comments: Complicated to put on, fabric to thick, after wearing it for ten minutes both my baby and my were so hot!

title: The boba wrap arrived promptly and service was good buy the wrap disappoints
author: M. Rochon
comments: The boba wrap arrived promptly and service was good buy the wrap disappoints.For starters, tbere is just so much fabric: it is uncomfortably warm to wear in the summer heat.Secondly, it takes a while to learn how to wrap properly. I had to watch several youtube videos ti get it right.It is comfortable once on, and my LO slept soundly while in it, but I would not recommend this product to my friends. I ended up going to Target and buying a baby harness to use instead.

title: I love it
author: Czechthing
comments: Love this wrap.

title: Handy and comfortable
author: Rebecca Bley
comments: Made a big difference for me - I could finally get some work done around the house!  Much easier to learn to use than I expected.  It does take awhile to put on, which feels worse when the baby is screaming.  And it's unwieldy in public when you don't want the ends trailing on a dirty floor.  But it's comfy and cozy and the baby seems to like it.  I could let her nap on my lap and still type on the computer!  She's still small enough for it at 8 months, but way too interested in seeing the world, so she twists around all the time to see where we're walking.  I can no longer put her in there hands-free because she lunges out.

title: Great product!
author: review4you
comments: Works great!  Easy to travel with our baby.  Infinitely adjustable to anyone in the family!!  We got grey and the color is exactly like the picture.  Very happy with this purchase.

title: Two Stars
author: Laura J. Phillips
comments: Does not work for plus-sized women. the wrap rolls up over your belly.

title: Five Stars
author: Laurie
comments: Works great!!

title: I absoluetely love my Boba Wrap
author: Kristin Adams
comments: I absoluetely love my Boba Wrap...I use all the time.  My son also loves it because he loves being held close.  I am able to get alot of stuff done around the house using this awesome wrap.  I would definitely tell others to purchase this wrap for their babies.

title: Five Stars
author: aldridge.mn
comments: Perfect gift for new mom!

title: HOT!
author: Marie
comments: Not suited for hot climates, summer, or even just around the house unless the a/c is on high... My baby kept getting hot and sweaty after about 15 mins. I plan to try using again in the winter and see...

title: Love it
author: Clare Skyles
comments: Both my baby and I love this product, it's simple,comfy and not too hot. It is a life saver when my LO pitches a fit, I just pop him in and he falls asleep. The biggest downfall is you can't wear it too long as it gets a bit exhausting and when putting it on in a public place you can't help it touching the floor- but this is true of all wraps like this.

title: good for home use, not good for public use.
author: TJCarr
comments: Alright, going to be honest. There are a lot of high quality carriers out there, for being under 50 dollars, it does the job. But the amount if inconviennce it is to wrap a 20 foot price of cloth around your body keeps me from wanting to use it in public, like shopping, walking in the mall, a stroll through the park. Wrapping this carrier on your body involves a lot of dragging on the ground. I'm not sure how many moms would be willing to drag it all over the mall floor then put their baby in it-i don't reccomend it. Also, because you tie a large knot in the back, you cannot sit wearing this (like say you are trying to be smart by putting it on at home so when you get to the store you can place your baby in it) unless you find it comfortable to sit with what feels like a foot being pressed into your back.Because this material is stretchy, after using it for a while you have to take it off and re wrap. That may not seem like a big deal but sometimes you don't have a place to put your baby down to do it...since you know, you left your car seat in the car because you bought a baby carrier. It is such a pain in the neck to take off and pit back on, unless you are a professional calf wrangler or have intermidiate lasso skills or something.For at home use, under 45 mins its great. For tiny 5 pound babies its great. But if you want something you'll be able to use at all times, take on and off easily, I would suggest a non wrap baby carrier.

title: But I like the material
author: Barbara Shaw
comments: Too hot to wear in summer! But I like the material, soft and stretchy.

title: A great Find!
author: yarvet
comments: We bought this as a shower gift for our daughter. She loves it and after reading all thegreat things it does for baby, she'd like another one for Daddy to wear too!Maybe in brown. Nice colors to choose from, and soo many benefits for baby.

title: My wife and I both love this Boba wrap
author: B. Sexton
comments: My wife and I both love this Boba wrap!! Our newborn seems to like it too. We enjoy having both hands free to do things around the house or walk around the subdivision. It supports in all the right places and is easy to use!

title: this is an awesome product.
author: Wolfgrrlie
comments: I am a plus size woman, this is an awesome product.. It makes you hot and sweaty because it is so much fabric, but it FITS... i can never find a baby carrier that actually FITS without squeezing and hurting me and/or the baby and this is so comfortable and adjustable and has decent back support the way it wraps.

title: Love!! A great wrap for newborn babies
author: Rachel
comments: Love!! A great wrap for newborn babies. I don't reach for it as much now that my baby is getting bigger, but for the first 3 months of her life it was my go-to babywearing choice. I also have a woven wrap, an ergo and a mei tai.

title: Great wrap option
author: S Snyder
comments: This is a great wrap!! My little girl loves being in it. It's really easy to use and works great when I'm grocery shopping or running errands. Only 4 stars as it is really warm. My daughter was born in June and I haven't been able to use this outside yet as she gets too hot. I'm hoping it'll get more use this fall and winter.

title: Worked wonderfully first time I put it on
author: Loli
comments: Worked wonderfully first time I put it on. Felt nice & tight. Baby was sitting nice & high very comfortably. Didn't even feel the involuntary need to put my hand under her as if she'd fall. Felt very secure. But every use after I have never felt the same. As much as I tighten it baby always slips down as I walk making me feel like she'll fall out. End up having to walk with my hand under her because she just hangs. Dunno if material just stretches out after first use but it's just not tight anymore. Very disappointed.

title: Simple and comfy
author: BethF
comments: Just got this. Easy to wrap. Not too much fabric. Easy to put baby in and out (a mirror helps the first time). 9 week old baby is comfy and immediately smiled when I wrapped him in this! Easy and quick to take baby out. Folds compact and comes with pouch for easy storage in the diaper bag. It's simple and comfy. Much better than my sling. I'm gonna love this, I can already tell :)

title: Great for a bit
author: Ksinge
comments: My son loved this. He's just huge and my back couldn't handle it. Lots of fabric, got smelly from sweat, did stretch a bit, but soft and comfy.

title: High quality for less!
author: Jubejel
comments: Perfect! Great quality for less than popular name brand one! Highly recommend!?!

title: Worth every cent
author: K. Brooks
comments: My 6 week old never wants to be put down. I absolutely love holding him, but honestly, mama has to get some things done during the day and this Boba Wrap has been awesome! It's not at all difficult to use. I am plus size and it fits me just fine, and my son cozied right up and fell asleep within minutes of being in it. This was a pricey purchase for my family to make, but it was (and is) worth every cent!

title: Stretchy Not So Great
author: TweedBunny
comments: I had a simple piece of jersey/interlock material cut off the bolt from a fabric store that was given to me by my sister-in-law. I used that for awhile and then decided to upgrade to the Boba Wrap because it was a cuter color and seemed like it would be softer. When it arrived, the fabric was indeed very soft, but I found that the material is actually TOO stretchy (which you'd think would be a good thing but in this case is not). Because it is so stretchy, I have to wrap it around me and tie it much, much tighter than I did the big piece of fabric I used originally. Doing this requires more coordination and placing the pieces exactly right; its less user-friendly. Once my baby is placed inside (she's 15 lbs), she sags down much more than she did in the piece of "harder" fabric I used before.I'll go back to my free, cheap piece of material, even though its not as cute or as soft as this one.

title: Great gift for new moms!
author: Memphis Mom
comments: Bought this as a gift for a friend, and she couldn't be happier with this. Her little one stays secure and content while mom cleans house, cooks dinner etc. It's also great for at church to keep well meaning folks from waking a sleeping baby by touching her hands and feet. Durable, washes well and very comfortable to wear.

title: Overwhelming in Fabric Length, Underwhelming in Use.
author: Melissa Ott
comments: I really thought I was going to love this wrap, and maybe I will in the future. Learning how to tie it was honestly very labor intensive. It took my mother and I a good hour to get it on properly. After we did and took the baby out to run errands, I felt like I was constantly pulling it down around my waist area or adjusting the fabric on my shoulders because it kept pulling my shirt sleeves around.Part of the problem when learning to wrap this is the sheer amount of fabric. It's kind of ridiculous how much fabric there is and trying to handle it all is a little overwhelming. I ended up putting it back in the little bag they give you for storage and purchased a couple other carriers to try (the Baby K'Tan and Infantino Mei Tai Sash). So far, I've much preferred the Infantino Mei Tai Sash to anything else I've tried. I may take the Boba out to try again when our daughter is a bit older, but for now...not a huge fan.

title: Practicing with the Boba
author: Richard M.
comments: A great wrap; but moms, if you're pregnant, don't get flustered. Your stomach impedes your ability to practice with it.  No worries, it works just well!Note: It is VERY long, so if you can, try putting it at home, instead of in a crowded parking lot (it will get dirty)

title: Five Stars
author: janet Friesen
comments: Wonderful!

title: Ist my best baby buy yet!
author: mari
comments: Incredible! I'm so in love with it.. He has such good times and I can feel him exploring the sorrow dings when we go out.. He is 2 months so he is taking it all in.. After his experience he usually blacks out and sleeps the whole time.. I do my shopping and my walking a and he is snuggled up with mommy. It's truly incredible.. Tops things are to be able to to my things hands free but being close to him anyways. I am even mastering breastfeeding while in the wrap.. The only problem is that my breasts are huge and I can get him comfortable enough to do it until we work out for a couple minutes... While he cries manically until I get it right... Then just like that I continue with my things...

title: not for me
author: Scooter
comments: Even if properly tied around the body, whuch takes loads of practice and viewing videos on YouTube, the cloth drags on the ground picking upall kinds of dirt, etc.

title: Five Stars
author: Graciela
comments: Very nice!

title: This is so much better than the moby wrap
author: Rachel C.
comments: This is so much better than the moby wrap! The boba wrap is made out of a slightly stretchy fabric. It really makes it much easier to get a tight fit that feels secure. Great product!

title: Perfect way to carry your child
author: Rambles
comments: Fantastic and well made.  Perfect for bonding with and carrying your small children.No issues with the fabric in regard to wear and tear over extended periods of time.

title: ... con makes the baby get very hot so not good for summer
author: Amazon Customer
comments: one con makes the baby get very hot so not good for summer time

title: Love It!
author: lisad123
comments: I ordered this product after my first c-section.  It took me some time to figure out how to wrap it.  After reading the instructions about 10 times, I got it.  This product is a must have, I am able to do many things while my baby is snuggled close.  This product helps with my post surgery posture and allows me to get household chores done without a screaming baby.  Buy this product, it is adorable and functional.

title: Boba wrap...
author: lucille foster
comments: I hope it will be useful to my daughter. Hands free. After the baby is born I will do another review

title: Really good, easy to use and very comfortable to wear
author: Bec Maskrey
comments: Really good, easy to use and very comfortable to wear. I have tried lots of carriers as I have a bad back and find this the best by far!

title: Nice solid wrap
author: Leather Shoe Addict
comments: Nice solid wrap. If only our baby liked sitting squeezed close :) but we will keep on trying. One thing to note - it is a veeery warm wrap - not for summer months for sure.

title: Hard to use.
author: Kent B. Wong
comments: I wanted to like this wrap. It seems to be secure and snug but, to get the wrap to be secure you have to tie it really tight and then it becomes really-really hard to get the baby inside of it. I got it to use when I'm home alone and Kent is at work but, I needed his help to get into it every time. You need the instructions in the begining since wrapping it is not intuitve. I also had a baby in the spring so, I wanted to wear it in the summer, but there is way too much fabric to wear on a warm day. The sling has to go around you three times and I was sweating in it even without the baby. Be sure the shirt you are wearing is tight so it doesn't interfere with getting the wrap super tight. I don't see any way you could nurse in this wrap. It comes in nice colors and the fabric is a little stretchy -that is all I liked about it.

title: Save your Money buy an ErgoBaby
author: H. Fattah
comments: Wrapping your baby is much easier than it seems.  After watching a few videos I had the technique down pat.  The Boba wrap did get quite a bit of use for about a month.  Once my son reached about 2 months though he just didn't quite fit into it anymore.  It became rather flimsy and hard to get tight enough.  I own 4 carriers.  A ring sling (The best and only option for brand new babies till about 1 month). The boba.  A baby Bjorn (which I hate) and the Ergobaby.  In the end the only carrier worth using is the ErgoBaby.  We bought the infant insert and have used it non-stop since.  Yes it does get a little hot but for comfort and ease of use there is no match.  Save your money buy an ErgoBaby.

title: Excellent! My little girl loves it
author: Helen Louise Baerwald
comments: Excellent!  My little girl loves it.  Little hot for the summer.

title: love it!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Love this wrap! Much cheaper than Moby & is better quality material. Just wish it was lighter fabric for summer time.

title: It's almost like wearing a blanket
author: IMAGES
comments: I purchased this thinking I can keep carrying my baby at home, but it was too hard to put on. It doesn't really help me to be "hands-free" I still have to hold my baby. It's almost like wearing a blanket, so it's not good for summer time.

title: Five Stars
author: Safaa Mohammed Marie
comments: Excellent

title: BUY IT! Best thing that ever happen to us!
author: jonathan
comments: Boba has SAVED OUR LIVES! couldn't imagined using any other product, our Baby girl is almost 2months and  just climbs right in and she's out for the count.  You would think it would be so uncomfortable but its actually unnoticeable once your baby's inside . You almost feel like a ninja! Its crazy how snug and cozy it is f and it free's up both your hands so you can do your day to day! also its comfy when you sit which is a huge plus! BUY IT! don't think TWICE!

title: Great Wrap!
author: Vwelyn
comments: This has been by far the best thing I've bought for my baby. She loves the wrap, and I love being able to keep her close while getting my chores and running around done. The fabric pattern is very nice and any stains aren't very apparent. The fabric is stretchy (and has remained so after numerous washings), so it has been better at accommodating the baby than some of the other wraps that I have seen. The baby is easily calmed inside the wrap. If she's being really fussy the wrap calms her down almost immediately. The one negative at first was trying to get the wrap on properly- but once you learn how to do it, it's like tying your shoelaces. Now I can get the wrap on in about 30 seconds without looking in a mirror.

title: Five Stars
author: Juliana Costa
comments: Excellent!I love it! My baby too!

title: Five Stars
author: Stephanie W.
comments: Beautiful print! still trying to learn how to use it!

title: In theory it's a great product at a great cost...
author: Rachel
comments: Soooo...after debating forEVER over which sling/carrier to purchase for my somewhat high maintenance bundle of joy, I landed on this one because of the rave reviews.  Mind you, we already own the Ergo but I think that would be better for a bigger baby who can hold up their head (we bought the "infant insert" for the additional cost but dang, that thing is like a tiny baby sleeping bag which sucks in the crazy TX heat!).Here's my problem...dear god I am not coordinated enough for the amount of wrapping involved here.  I gave it a couple of goes before laughing myself silly (and a bit hysterical, as sleep is a luxury at this juncture) at how amazingly awkward I am with this thing.I refuse to buy yet ANOTHER baby carrier, so I will give it another try.  I will say it is made of good quality material.  Who knows, maybe this 3 star review will kick up to 5 when I can learn how to put on the damn thing!

title: Wonderful product!
author: Jameson'sMommy
comments: A total life saver, my two month old hangs out in there while I shop, clean, cook and do everything else I need to! He usually falls asleep within minutes. A must have for new moms!

title: Worked great
author: Nicole MacCallum
comments: I loved wearing my baby in this. It felt secure and she would sleep well in it. My only complaint is that in summer the material is thick and hot.

title: Love to wear baby in this!
author: Cynthia
comments: I was just about to get a moby wrap when I read reviews on this. I'm so glad I went with the wrap instead. It's so easy to put on and my baby loves being worn. I let a friend borrowed it who then received a moby wrap. She returned the moby and bought one of these because she liked it so much better!

title: Carry your baby like the ninja you are!
author: Wakegirl_13
comments: The Boba is awesome once you get the hang of wrapping it...there are videos online to help if you find the written instructions too confusing.  I will say to have patience and to not try to use it if you're in a hurry until you are used to how to do it.  I also found it easier to use once my baby could sit in the position shown in the picture....if you are trying to use it with a newborn or infant that can't hold their head up yet and hating it, try again later when your child is larger.  At this point, my baby prefers this carrier to our Ergo.  The one thing I haven't gotten the hang of is adjusting it on the go because sometimes things do stretch out a little.

title: great for newborn
author: a.ibrahimi
comments: Great delivery service. The wrap is so easy to use. My baby seems to like it so far but it's very hot right now so she gets overheated in the wrap. Yet I am excited to see how it goes from now

title: Returned it
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It was not difficult to put it on but both baby (2 month old) and I felt extremely hot in this even while we were inside the house. I also did not feel secure about baby's head position while wearing this. Returned it.

title: Love this wrap
author: Amy
comments: Love this wrap.  It does stretch to washing it and learning to wear it tight helps. Would have liked if instructions showed other ways to wrap than the basics. But that's what YouTube is for :)

title: I love my Boba wrap
author: calahair
comments: I love my Boba wrap. I used YouTube videos to learn how to put it on properly, and now we're all set. It provides a snug and secure hold for baby. I didn't realize before buying it that the fabric was so elastic--just the right amount. Baby loves being held in it. The pattern is attractive as well.

title: Saved my sanity!
author: Brooke T Smith
comments: I really like this wrap for my one month old daughter. We were having some issues with crying at night and napping in the day. So I wear her in this twice a day while she naps and she still sleeps well at night in her bassinet. The material is comfortable and once I watched the videos online, it was really easy to put on.

title: it became very clear to me that this was not the best choice. After you get the stroller through security
author: Kayleen Overlund
comments: I have 4 children and with the first three, I never gave in to purchasing a "wrap". I thought they looked a little hippy dippy to be honest and I still sort of do. That being said, who cares... This makes life so much more simple. I admit that I still will not wear this out in public on the daily. However, we are flying to TN in a week and this is going to save us and the general flying public a lot of time and hassle. Originally the plan was to bring the stroller so we had it while in the airport. After reading thousands of tips and watching quite a few youtube videos about flying with babies, it became very clear to me that this was not the best choice. After you get the stroller through security, you then have to take it apart and pack it in the stroller bag so you can check it at the gate. What a pain in the butt! My layover is only an hour and a half. I do not want to be breaking down and putting together a travel system stroller for such a small amount of time. The only reason I was entertaining the idea of checking the stroller at the gate, was so that I had a place to set my baby down so I could have both hands free when I needed them. This product solves that problem. I can wear this through the airport and have both hands free to do what I need to do! I can walk right through security wearing my baby in this wrap and never have to be separated from her. My hands are free to roll a suitcase and hand over my passes and just do whatever it is I need to do without holding up the line. I ordered the grey so that my husband can also wear it if he should ever need to... The point is, this was a simple solution to a big problem. Worth every dime. I also plan to wear it on the plan with my daughter in it on my lap. My hope is that she will feel restrained enough to feel as though she is in a car seat and not want to move and wiggle around during the flight. We'll see!

title: Five Stars
author: Jamye Simpson
comments: It's great! It will definitely be useful in the winter... summer heat is a bit much for baby!

title: Neat product.
author: ChrisColt
comments: Great product to use with infant.  Still trying to figure out how to use with a wiggly baby.  Feel unsure about whether or not I have it on tight enough to support baby.

title: A great wrap! Not to easy to wrap but some ...
author: Valerie B
comments: A great wrap! Not to easy to wrap but some YouTube videos helped. I wouldn't recommend this for summer use though, it is much to hot! Works great on infants that need to be wrapped with their legs on your chest.

title: Three Stars
author: Debra G.
comments: hard to get tight enough by yourself to hold the baby secure

title: Soft and Lightweight
author: Alexandra L.
comments: Soft and stretchy, liked it a lot more than my friend's Moby wrap.  Gray color is beautiful.

title: Go elsewhere, this wrap is not that great.
author: RSQViper
comments: My wife got this and let me tell you, this product is a STEER CLEAR from us. It's hot, uncomfortable for the baby, unwieldy and just plain not that functional. Sure, the pictures make it look like it's great, but this thing is not made for a woman that is 5'3" tall. it's for someone much taller than that.My wife is thin but with larger bosoms so what that does is give the baby nowhere to go comfortably without pulling you forward and making you walk funny. The constant shifting of the wrap is also problematic.Also, summer time and this do not mix! It has to wrap around you several times (as per the instructions) to be functional. Well, that only adds heat, plus there is a 97 degree baby attached to you and this is a blanket for them as well so now EVERYONE involved is hot.We got a Kangaroo and THAT is the way to go. Not this thing. Avoid this and save yourself the headache.It has two stars because it is at least quality material. Certainly not cheap material, but the whole functionality of it (and any wrap, really) is the pits.

title: Four Stars
author: candy
comments: works great.

title: MY favorite!! I tried Moby
author: Sharon
comments: MY favorite!! I tried Moby, Ktan and Mama's Milk and BOBA is by far the best when it comes to newborns and infants up to 6/7 months!  Then i switched to Mama's Milk slings~  It was much easier to use after the kid go bigger.  Will use again with second baby~

title: Just in case you were wondering (and you probably weren't) it works great for kittens too!(...I swear I'm not a cat crazy lady)
author: kaitlin
comments: So I didn't buy this for a baby (thank GOODNESS, seeing as how I'm only 21) I bought it for my kitten but it's such a good product I thought I'd review it anyway. He's a little over 2lbs now and probably about 11 weeks but we aren't exactly sure since I found him starving to death, dumped in the woods when he was barely big enough to walk. Since he was so tiny, so fragile and so scared when I first found him I pretty much held him nearly 24/7 for the first two weeks. He's a strong, healthy, happy little man now and even though I feel comfortable letting him run around the house he's very attached to me and often loudly and relentlessly demands to be held and carried. This poses an issue when I have housework to do or even when I sit down at my computer to complete school work. I felt bad having to reject his pleas for affection so I looked for a kitten friendly version of a baby sling but couldn't find anything. I decided to take a chance and just order one made for infants. I purchased the smallest Boba wrap and the problem was instantly solved. It's easy to put on, and comfortable for both of us, and now I can let him sleep on me or just ride around and purr while I have both hands free. It also keeps him from plopping himself down on my keyboard when I'm trying to type, so that's certainly an added bonus. It's doubtful anyone reading these reviews is looking for a kitten friendly product but just on the off chance that you are, I thought I'd let you know that this product is purrrrfect ;) (sorry, I couldn't resist)

title: love it
author: Theresa
comments: Well worth the money, it takes a little practice to get use to but my baby love it. She falls asleep with in mins every time she is in it. She was a bit of a fussy baby and loves to be swaddled. The material is a bit stretchy which I love. I think it makes it easier to use because of that.

title: Ehhhh....not my favorite carrier.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I wanted to like this wrap.  My 3-month-old daughter didn't seem to like it at all though - she cried the whole two times I put her in it.  Perhaps it is because we live in Texas, and Texas summers are just HOT.  There was just a LOT of material and I felt like my baby sagged in the wrap, no matter how tightly I tried to tie it.  I'm going to continue in my quest for the right baby carrier(s) for my daughter.

title: Hands free!
author: Shortytorty
comments: This works great for moms who need to get things done! My baby liked it as a newborn and almost always fell asleep while I'd do some housework. I also used it when he'd get fussy, and it almost always worked to calm him. We have the Boba wrap and a carrier. The wrap is a far superior product in terms of function and ease of use. It also secures a newborn's head really well, so you have both hands free. The carrier doesn't cradle his head, so I had to use one hand to secure his head. I have a toddler and would use the wrap for my newborn when we'd go out in public. I could keep close track of both children, and they were safer as a result. My baby continues to like it at 3 months, and I intend to use it as long as possible.

title: Love, Love
author: pollywollydoodleallday1
comments: Love, Love, Love it! Takes a little practice to get the whole wrapping thing down but it is well worth it.

title: Love it!
author: Monica Williams
comments: I would recommend this to all new parents! It has really helped me out when I needed my hands free. It also is awesome for calming my baby down and helping her fall asleep. I used this since my baby was born. She is now almost 7 months and I still use it for her. I do think she is starting to get a little big for it though so I will be looking for a carrier with a little more stability for a wiggly baby.

title: I love it, but getting it just right takes too long!
author: sara3737
comments: Once you assemble the boba to the necessary tightness, it's great. My baby loves the closeness. However, it takes too long for me to want to bother with it. I use the baby carrier with the buckles and that is much faster and easier. I'm all about convenience with a newborn. For me, it's what is the fastest way for me to do things. I also think the boba is more beneficial in the colder months because wrapping my newborn in it during the hot summer months doesn't work; he gets too hot in it.

title: Still not sure
author: Kristin
comments: I bought this a few weeks ago and have been trying to decide if I'm going to return.  When I do get it on tight enough it works, it's just really complicated.  The only reason I haven't returned yet is that my husband seems to like it:)

title: Love it!!!
author: Bard Owl
comments: LOVE Boba! It has improved upon the basic m*by wrap concept with stretchier fabric that makes it easy to adjust properly. More comfortable on your shoulders, and requires less readjusting as the day goes on. I do not agree with the manufacturer's note that this last to 18 months, however. After 15-16 pounds our baby sagged heavily and we switched to a more sturdy carrier.

title: Good for baby wearing
author: StefyPooh
comments: This is great for going shopping. I just pop my 2 month old in there and he always falls asleep-been wearing it for about a month now and he likes it. Not too hot either as long as you just wear something cool underneath. I like the stretchy fabric, it's soft. Not too hard to tie it either once you practice a couple times. I am glad I bought it. Great for price.

title: relatively easy to take off without waking him up if I ...
author: Tiffany
comments: works wonders when my baby is fussy! He falls asleep almost immediately when I put him in it. relatively easy to take off without waking him up if I want to lay him down. feels very secure in this wrap. excellent purchase!

title: Glad I have it but I don't know if I would buy it again..
author: Caitlin Grace Paradiso
comments: I love the concept of the Boba Wrap. Your baby fits in nice and snug against your body, close to your heart.. It holds a newborn nicely since they do not need to separate their legs and have them hang out, they can stay all tucked together. The second time I used my Boba wrap the fabric snug a little which was disappointing. Also, in the summer the wrap can be really hot for Mom and baby.. Not a lot of ventilation. It also hangs down and bit when walking- I find myself still having to support baby with my arms... Def easier then carrying baby but not entirely hands free.

title: Love my Boba
author: Jamie
comments: I love my Boba. People are constantly asking me where I got it.Since the carry is the same no matter the age or size, I had to learn to adjust when breast feeding in the wrap. But now, at almost 8 months... My little one discreetly feeds like a champ in the standard carry. Any time we are out of the house for an extended time frame where I expect my daughter to eat, I bring my Boba so she can comfortably eat wherever we are.I had a buckle and strap style carrier with my oldest and I was always sore from the straps... With the Boba, you don't even know you're wearing it. You know, besides having your baby in front of you. :)

title: Happy mama and baby
author: Mmyc
comments: I wish I bought this earlier. I purchased this when baby was 2 months because I was getting tired if carrying him and was getting carpel tunnel syndrome! I also was stuck on the couch or bed so I wouldn't wake him. This wrap gives you the closeness that baby needs. Read the directions and watch the YouTube video and it's easy to put on from there.It can get hot but no hotter than the other baby carriers. I dont feel it's the most supportive. I still support his butt or head when I feel he needs it.Overall still a great product

title: Not for us.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: We used this one time when my son came home from the hospital and that was it. I found it to be wayyyy too long, too difficult and frustrating to put on while baby is crying, etc. we use the ergo now all the time since he's older and more interested in being awake and carried around. For us, the wrap carrier was just a total waste of money.

title: Hurts my back.
author: Monique Remas
comments: Too hot for baby. Not enough support for a petite person and can cause back pain. The more expensive model is better and worth it.

title: Great wrap
author: Victoria Bowers
comments: LOVE this wrap!  When my nearly 4 week old son gets fussy, I tuck him in to the wrap and within minutes he settles down (and usually falls asleep).  The material itself is very soft and stretchy and is comfortable for both of us.  Once you get the hang of putting on the wrap and getting the baby nestled in the process goes really quickly.  Glad I purchased this!

title: Wonderful wrap carrier and easy to use.
author: Rebecca C. Griffin
comments: This wrap is wonderful for a newborn or very young baby. As they get older and want to wiggle more I find myself using other carriers. I watched the how to video on youtube a million times and you get the hang of it very quickly. My baby slept in this thing often and felt very snug and secure. It's a very comfortable wrap too. My husband is a big man and he can use it too, while the ergo is a bit constricting for him. Two thumbs way up. Will definitely use it with our next little bundle.

title: Too inconvenient and time consuming to use
author: Esther
comments: The wrap is so long that you trip over it just trying to wrap it around yourself. Not sure if I am not wrapping properly but I feel it holds my baby up too high on my chest. He cracks his little head on my chin if I don't keep my head pulled back. Afraid if I cross the wrap lower on my chest that it will too loose and my baby will slide out. I purchased a K'tan wrap and am very pleased with it. It is a breeze to put on but did shrink a little after washing.

title: ok
author: Joanna
comments: I agree with item. The item is accord with my spectates. Thank you for all. I glad with it. The item size is correct.

title: Perfect
author: Kristin Zuber
comments: I've been using this with my 2 month old since he was about a week old. He loves it and it keeps my hands free for my 1 and 2 yr old. Now that it's getting hot out we don't use it as much outside, but it still perfect For when we go grocery shopping.

title: Great for newborns!
author: sambi
comments: My newborn difn't ever want to be put down- this saved me! Easy once you get the hang of wrapping. Deducting one star because of the long straps that drag (I would wrap at home and not take it off when out) and because material is too  hot for summer.

title: we like it
author: lcarterd
comments: Baby loves this. It took several times for me to put it on correctly reading the directions, but once I figured it out its been great to have. Like that it can be thrown in the washer.

title: Was skeptical...
author: Em
comments: But I love it!I watched the youtube video and got it on my person in less than 3 minutes. Had a little trouble with wayward baby legs but eventually got her tucked inside of it too. I thought I'd have trouble because I bought the Moby wrap with my now-3 year old and that thing was a mess. Too bulky, too complicated and the baby never liked it. The Boba is super stretchy so no matter how tight you wear it, the baby is comfortable inside.I have not had stretching problems, as I've owned it for less than an hour, but will update on stretching and fading as soon as I wash it.Since I am an XL, I worried that it would wrap funny and I'd have too much hanging behind me. Not so, I was able to get it wrapped to the front with plenty to space (but not so much that it hung down and got in my way).Baby was snug and happy - and now I can do dishes and go shopping rather than watch Netflix with my momma's girl because she's never happy unless I'm holding her.

title: Great product for non super hot summer days
author: Melissa
comments: Great product so long as the temperature does not exceed 85-90 degrees. Otherwise my kids loved this and it made my day easier for trips to the zoo or grocery store.

title: Meh
author: Bates724
comments: I really wanted to like this and to use it more. I just can't use it comfortably. It holds my baby up against my breasts and I am sore from breastfeeding him so I can not really use it! I am hoping that in the future I will be able to. I am able to use a sling easier.

title: Can't live without this wrap!
author: Nicole
comments: I don't know what I would do without this wrap! I was using the ErgoBaby carrier before I purchased this and now I never use the Ergo. The Boba wrap is super comfortable for both me and baby. It's very easy to tie on, I watched a YouTube video posted by Boba 3 times and I had it. I love that I can tie this on myself and wear it all day and not have to retie it, I can put baby in and take her out multiple times and it never has to be retied. It's also pretty easy to nurse in it. There are many YouTube videos that show you easy ways to do so. I chose this wrap over the Moby because it has better reviews online. It keeps it's elasticity longer and it's softer than the Moby...It's also $10 cheaper! I definitely recommend it.

title: Worth every penny!
author: KStar
comments: I have a fussy baby that can't be put down. We have an Ergo, and while we like it, adjusting the straps every time between my husband and myself was annoying. I decided to try the Boba and this thing saved my life. My son loves it (started using it at 5 wks.) and we still use it to go for daily walks whenever he's fussy, which is sometimes 3 times a day (he's now 11 wks). I have also raked in it, gone shopping in it, and done household chores using it. I will say that the key is properly tying it (HINT: IT NEEDS TO BE VERY TIGHT with the middle part starting to ride up as you pull it tight). It isn't hard to tie once you get it, but it is subject to human error.  Nevertheless I love that anyone, in any size, can use this. It is easy to clean, and is also relatively stylish. One con is that it does get hot. I strip my son down to just a onesie before I put him in it on warm days, and I make sure I have on a tee-shirt and shorts. But once I started using this, I started to really enjoy my son who is a demanding, spirited baby.

title: Great product
author: Kindle Customer
comments: Bought this for my daughter-in-law and son for their first child and they love it. It's super easy for two people to do but my daughter-in-law tells me she struggles a bit to do it by herself but my granddaughter really loves it!

title: please get this product
author: anjie b.
comments: I recommend this product to every mom. I live in the city and it is so amazing not having to carry a stroller and car seat.

title: Too big, too warm, too stretchy
author: Aurelie
comments: I read about a zillion reviews for this and watched a zillion more videos.  Try as I might, I just couldn't get this thing to work well for me.  It's just too big (I'm 5'3/115 lbs) and it swallowed me.  The fabric pools on the floor and gets wrapped around your legs when trying to put it on.  When I finally did get it properly wrapped, it did NOT hold baby secure at ALL.  Too stretchy.  It is also way too warm to use in the summer.  And finally, perhaps it works for older babies, but I felt like I was suffocating my newborn. I really don't have anything great to say about the Boba folks, sorry.

title: It's ok
author: Nicole Ray
comments: The material stretches out pretty quickly. I wouldn't use this outside of the house or for a larger baby. If you're on the fence, go with the moby wrap instead.

title: Perfect for snuggling with baby
author: Kiran
comments: I initially purchased the Balboa baby sling from BuyBuyBaby (my other favorite baby gear store) but returned it within one week because I hated it because my baby hated it! The sling was difficult to get right for my then 6 week old who was too young to put in that contraption - no matter how tight I made the sling (which for those of you who have tried it, once you make it that tight to fit a tiny tiny person, it is extremely difficult to get off - especially when your baby is wailing!) I tried that thing a few times during that week but I never felt comfortable that no matter what I was doing, my baby was breathing properly and that it was safe. So I returned it.I initially did NOT want a long wrap with lots and lots of fabric that I had to figure out what to do with.  Not to mention that I was uncomfortable with the thought that the fabric might unravel and that I might drop my baby!  But after failing at one of those pre-made slings, I had to try something that I could make on my own and women had been using for centuries to carry their little ones.So I did a little bit of research on wraps and slings and narrowed it down to this or the Moby wrap from Amazon. I don't remember what I saw that made me select the Boba over the Moby (price maybe) but I went with this.  So far this product is amazing! This is my favorite item next to my baby's car seat, here's why:1. I can hold my baby super close to my heart and chest giving both me and my baby lots of comfort. I didn't realize how much I missed having that close connection with my baby during my pregnancy until I wore him in this for a couple of weeks and remembered that this little guy that i was hugging on the outside of my body was just inside my body a few short weeks ago.2. The color in grey is nice and subtle and sometimes when I wear this wrap, it looks like its a cool part of my outfit (not really but at least I don't feel like i'm wearing a backpack).3. I can wear the sling all day long.  When I put baby in his car seat, I hop into the driver's seat and take off without unclipping/unwrapping/undoing anything. When I get to where I need to be, I just pop baby back in and we head off. I didn't realize how much mobility this offers me compared to a stroller but if you don't have one of these - you seriously need one.4. BEST thing to get baby to go to sleep.  You can wear this 3 ways from what I've seen so far (infant hug hold, cradle hold, and baby hug hold -where the baby's legs are dangling from the bottom). I use this in the cradle hold to get my baby to sleep and tuck him in the fabric to hold his head secure and his body snug to mine. With a few bouncy bouncy bouncies on a quick 2 minute walk, my baby is out for his nap!I love the concept of this baby carrier, which is why i gave it 5 stars. However, I am on the lookout for a cooler version of the wrap for the summer time as the material doesn't breathe very much and after an hour walking with my son, he gets too hot and sweaty (for those of you who are trying to figure that out, when you are hot and sweaty, so is your baby because heat transfers when you are holding your baby).If you currently do not have a baby carrier and have a newborn or infant less than 12 weeks - I HIGHLY recommend the wrap. it is perfect for you and your baby and is probably easier to get him accustomed to being in this early on rather than later on.

title: Wonderful
author: Rachel303
comments: I love this wrap.  I am new to baby wearing.  Let me just say that I am spatially challenged so wrapping this thing was very frustrating for me the first few times.  I've got it down to an art now and can easily wrap my daughter in less than 5 minutes at two months.  Let me just say that it was challenging for both of us at first....keep trying! If your baby seems to hate it at first,  try again in a few days and keep working with them.  My daughter is easy to wrap now and loves being able to look around at an adult level,  then fall asleep on mommy.One thing I would recommend,  dress baby lightly because this wrap does get warm.  I also started to put a thin burp cloth on my chest because spit up is ummm...interesting in this wrap.  It also helps keep her a little cooler than being skin to skin.  Oh, and the written directions suck.  Look up instructional videos on YouTube.

title: Easy on the shoulders
author: Victoria E. Medina
comments: I as confused at first on how to put it on but it comes with a booklet with lots of pictures. I wish I would have had this with my first baby because it evenly distributes the weight. My shoulders and back never hurt and if my baby falls asleep, the wrap will support his head if I flip it over him.

title: Very warm
author: BBeav07
comments: This has been great to use with my little one. However, you have to make sure you have it on TIGHTLY or else baby slips around. My son has not fallen out but he definitely slipped way down into it when we were out walking one day.It is also VERY warm. My son usually is sweating by the time i get him out after we take our dogs for a 20 minute walk. I would definitely recommend using this in cooler weather

title: Liked it, love the customer service
author: developergirl
comments: I used this wrap with my first for 10 months, from before she could fit into our soft structured carrier until she was just over 22 pounds. I'm only 5'0" and appreciated that the Boba has less fabric than many stretchy wraps. I had to wrap the end ties around about 3 times, but it worked. My daughter slept in the wrap many hours during the newborn phase as well as joining me on most of my housework. It was the only place she would sleep other than her crib from about 5 months on.
