The wrap was not as comfortable as I would have liked at the end of my use, but still could be worn for short trips.At 10 months I was wearing her in the store and looked down and noticed two small holes in the wrap along the corners of where the label was sewn in. My baby was well within the advertised weight limit. I was busy so I put it away and didn't think much of it.Fast forward a little over a year and I'm expecting my second and trying to figure out what carriers I will have. I called Boba on the off-chance that they would do something about my torn wrap. They immediately offered to e-mail me a prepaid shipping label for a defect return and send me a new wrap. I'm impressed with their customer service and hope to have several more months wearing number 2.

title: Baby loves it, I don't
author: Book Fiend
comments: I live in Southern California and this thing just gets so hot. The baby, himself, emits a ton of heat and then there are all these layers of fabric on top of him.  I think when he was a newborn, this was particularly useful because it provided a lot of close bodily contact. Also, he was tinier than other babies and didn't have much head control making a lot of other carriers hard to use. You get the hang of wrapping it pretty quickly but it's long and unwieldy so there is no good way to do it in public without all the fabric dragging on the ground. Because of that, I tend to only use it indoors when I want to keep the baby with me while I'm reading, watching TV, etc. A piece of advice is to wrap it tightly, a lot more tightly than you initially think is necessary.  The fabric is incredibly stretchy. Once you add the weight of the baby, it really sags, so it needs to be snug before you put him in.

title: Great carrier for a newborn
author: Tegan D
comments: My little girl did not like the carriers given to us. This carrier is great for newborns and babies that like to cuddle. She is getting bigger and doesn't like to be held in the newborn position as much, and seems much happier with her legs free. I wish I had gotten this carrier sooner, especially in the early weeks. I really like that she feels snug but that this carrier has a bit of flexibility, I find it makes it easier to get her in and out of because of the stretch.

title: A little too constricting
author: ktasmth
comments: In order to get it tight enough to be secure, my baby felt squished. From very early on she liked to be able to squirm and wiggle and this constricted her movement too much. If your baby liked being swaddled tightly then this would be great. Otherwise, it is a very long scarf :)

title: works great with fussy babies!
author: Aimee Jensen
comments: I bought this because my son wouldn't nap for more than 10 minutes if I wasn't holding him.  I have 3 other children, so I can't sit on the couch all day!  This has saved my sanity!  It is VERY easy to put on (and I'm more than a little accident prone!) and always feels secure.  I started using it the day I got it, and my son was only 5 weeks old.  When he gets fussy, I can just put him in and he calms down right away.  I'm not sure how well it will work this summer, because it does feel a bit warm, but overall we love it!

title: LOVE it
author: Kat
comments: This is seriously the BEST wrap I've ever come across! I've tried so many different wraps/carriers on my son, and this is the only one he loves. It helps when he's colicky, it's comfortable for me to wear, and it's not made cheaply. I highly recommend!

title: Great for newborns!
author: Tori
comments: We got this because our son was too small to wear in our more structured Beco Gemini carrier for the first month or so of his life, but he really wanted to be held constantly so this allowed us to get some things done while still keeping him happy and close :).  We like it a lot, it's comfortable, sturdy, and looks nice.  It's pretty easy to wrap - we watched the YouTube videos, but it also comes with instructions.  It has a nice pouch for travel/sticking it in the diaper bag or stroller.  It is very long, but that just allows it to be worn by people of all sizes.  I'm 5' 2" and it works for me and for my 5' 10" husband equally well (and would work for even taller people too).  Also, with this we don't have to constantly readjust the fit like we would for the Beco carrier since you re-wrap it for every use, so it's a bit more versatile between partners.  (Don't get me wrong, this is NOT a negative review for the Beco - we love that a lot too, but this Boba wrap just fills in some of the gaps).

title: fantastic!
author: Jordan bradley
comments: My daughter loves it! So much easier to have this to carry her around Hands free so comfortable for sure!

title: Love!!!
author: Julie A
comments: I bought this when my daughter was a couple months old. We were in the process of moving from an apartment and into our very first house and this carrier was a life saver when trying to unpack all the little things when she was fighting sleep or just wanted to be held. The holding bag is great as I can easily carry this wrap around with me where ever I go and it fits nicely into any diaper bag or stroller. Only recommendation I have is to put the wrap on before going out places as it can be hard getting it on in the parking lots or stores because it's so long. Highly recommend this to all my friends!

title: loved it
author: Cindy L Fierro
comments: its for my soon to be grandbaby  , I know she will be so comfty , I had one for her Daddy and it worked great not as nice as this one but it did the trick. great material ..

title: Awesome wrap!!!
author: Kristin
comments: Awesome wrap for baby and mother!! Easy to use and the wrap is soft to the baby and mothers skin.

title: The best!!!!
author: Wyoming8
comments: Recently purchased both  a Boba & a Moby for my daughter & her baby.  My 'grammy' time with baby has been wonderful with the use of either but my preference is for the Boba as it is less bulky, easier to wrap, and much cooler.  With the Moby, I often make the mistake of twisting the material when wrapping across my back, not as much of a problem with the Boba. As these are 27 feet of material, they take up a lot of room in a diaper bag for portability.  The Boba is easier to stuff in my purse, as the material is lighter and a little stretchy.  Either product is well worth the investment, I just happen to prefer the Boba.

title: Boba baby wrap
author: funstuff63
comments: Really nice soft stretchy material. The only downside is that it sort of stretches out after the baby has been in it a while. Also it's kind of awkward to put on when out and about because of how long it is. It's hard not to keep it from dragging on the floor when trying to put it on.

title: Great Wrap!
author: CC
comments: Baby and I love the Boba wrap!  She doesn't like to be put down and this wrap allows me to carry her and still get housework done.  It's easy to use and comfortable enough to go for long walks.

title: GREAT WRAP!!
author: Joe L.
comments: I bought this wrap on accident because I thought I was buying another moby wrap.  I like this MUCH better than the moby so I am glad I goofed!  The fabric is stretchy and I dont get hot wearing my baby anymore.

title: Boba Wrap - Grey
author: Patricia W Mitchell
comments: It was a gift, and she was delighted with it.  She said she will really enjoy using it.  She wanted this because her son did not like the child carrier she had.

title: Not as great as expected
author: Tory
comments: I ordered this wrap when my baby was a couple weeks old. All the reviews said how great this wrap was.....but it was not what it was hyped up to be. My baby would only sleep when she was being held, but as soon as you put her down, she would wake up a few minutes later and start fussing and eventually crying. I needed something that I could put her in that would allow me to at least do things, like the dishes, cleaning, vacuuming, etc. I tried several times to get her in it, but she was not liking it! A couple times, I waited until she was deep asleep, then tried to put her in. But the confusing and unrealistic mechanics of the wrapping, make it impossible to get your baby in without pissing her off! I may try a different position when her head is a little stronger, but by then, that weight to carry around is not good for your back.

title: Not for me
author: Jheneya
comments: After watching a couple of videos on YouTube, it wasn't difficult to put on, but it was tricky to put my baby in it.  He didn't like it at all.  He sat in it sort of awkwardly and his neck and head didn't feel very supported.  He was also really hot in it.  The material is very hot, so the baby and I were sweating after only a few minutes.  I live in Hawaii where it's hot and humid year-round, so this wasn't a good choice for us, but I could see this working somewhere else during winter months.  For now, we'll stick with our Infantino carrier, which provides a lot of support and is much cooler.

title: It is an amazing notion that other peoples have been using for centuries
author: LK
comments: The Boba wrap was a gift for a friend who is pregnant. She just received it and absolutely the notion of carrying her little girl (her first child) around on her first adventures out into the world! I wish when I had been raising my kids decades ago this was an option. It is an amazing notion that other peoples have been using for centuries!

title: Love this wrap! And Boba's customer service is amazing.
author: Katie
comments: I had a moby wrap with my first son but I like this boba wrap way better. The stretchy fabric makes it so much easier to put on and get the baby in. I was always worried that I didn't have the tension right on the Moby. With the stretchy wrap, I just tie it as tight as possible and then it seems to relax slightly around the baby. I never feel as if the baby is too tight.  It comes with a really handy stuff sack which I promptly lost the third time I used the carrier. I called Boba to see if they would sell me a new one and they put one in the mail for me, free of charge! I like the company so much that I bought the Boba 4G which is also awesome.

title: Not enough hours in the day to manage this thing...
author: Emma T A
comments: For heavens sake - way too complicated. Hate it. When my baby screams, I don't have 10 minutes to wrap this complicated thing around me.  The picture is great, but you know there was a stylist and art director on that photo shoot to get it all looking just right for the camera. 'Then, once you have it on, it stretches out and needs to be re-wrapped so baby doesn't fall out.  I want my money back.

title: Love it but is hot to wear
author: Allyson Marrs
comments: The material is great and I love wrapping my little guy into it.  BUT I've been using it during warm/hot days 70-80 degrees and I'm sweating with in minutes of using it.  Not a very comfortable during warm days!

title: Fussy baby is soothed and loving it!
author: Bethany Maddox
comments: Just got this in the mail today.  Fortuitously arrived mid-baby fuss.  I passed the baby off to my husband, followed the easy instructions for wrapping, slipped my girl in, and now my little one is resting peacefully against my body.  No more screaming!!  :D  Color me a happy mommy.

title: Bopa wrap
author: etienne
comments: Very very helpful indeed, i had no idea such a simple thing could work so well. Thank you for the help!

title: Pretty Nice
author: Kyle D Kinder
comments: Had the Boba wrap for a couple of days now - first and only wrap or sling I've tried. Firstly, there is ALOT of fabric to this wrap when you're wrangling it around yourself, but it works just fine if you watch the YouTube vid on how to wrap it. Don't be intimidated by the fabric. Also have to make sure you wrap this pretty tight around yourself to start with, or your baby will ride too low. Our kiddo is 6.5 weeks, 12 lbs, 24" long - a big boy. He fits very well in this wrap, and I find it's fairly comfortable to wear. It has really freed up my hands - he's sitting in the Boba right now while I'm typing, which is great! I have noticed, however, that the baby gets a bit warm in this wrap - it is about 2-3 layers that cover him. I've taken to putting him in the wrap with just a diaper on or just a very light t-shirt halfsie. My reason for the 4 star is mainly because the baby runs warm in it, and that limits using this wrap outside in warmer weather.  I also wish this wrap could be used in a face-forward position for the baby so that he could look around more.  But I really do enjoy having him pressed right against me as I sit and work at my desk, buzz around the kitchen and house, etc.

title: Bummed :-(
author: AW
comments: I borrowed my sisters Moby with my newborn and decided to get the Boba because it was cheaper than the Moby and I liked the solid black color thinking they would be the same. Well...the Boba's fabric is far stretchier so my baby would bounce every time I wore it, no matter how tight i made it.  I've used it twice and wont use it again because of the elasticity in the fabric.  Bummed :-(

title: I LOVE IT
author: jackie
comments: I love it and so does the baby. It is easy to use and comfortable. I also use it for breastfeeding when I am out.

title: LOVE MY BOBA!!!!
author: Kristin
comments: I love this wrap.  I had a carrier with my first child but only used it a few times.  I use this wrap almost everyday. I recommend this wrap to anyone and everyone.  I love it!

title: My baby loves it!
author: Mommyof2
comments: I'm not one to write reviews but I feel like I have to for this product.  I absolutely love this wrap.  I have tried many different wraps and carriers and this one is my absolute favorite for babies (I love the boba 3G for toddlers).  My newborn sleeps in it for hours and I can have my hands free to play with my two year old.  Don't be scared off by the tying, once you learn how to tie the wrap, it literally takes less than a minute.  The reason I prefer this to other wraps is because of the elasticity.  Once you tie it on, you can take your baby in and out and it doesn't get too loose.  Also, the customer service for this product is wonderful.  I would recommend this to anyone who asked.  This is a must have!

title: Love it
author: Jake Shy
comments: I love it so far, because I can carry the baby and be hands free. It was a lot easier to use after I practiced wrapping it a few times, I recommend practicing a few times

title: Boba wrap
author: Money House
comments: I could not love this wrap any more. It was the best purchase I could get for my baby.  It is a great buy.

title: Nice comfortable wrap
author: Ann
comments: I purchased this carrier for my daughter-in-law and new grandbaby.  Other than the cumbersome nature of the long fabric to work with, this is a very nice stretchy wrap/carrier.  Recommend it to anyone wanting a baby carrier.  Tip;  When going out, put the wrap on before getting in the car, and when you arrive at your destination, you only have to place your baby inside.  No trying to work with those long fabric lenghts in a parkinglot.

title: Boba Wrap
author: Jennifer Jones
comments: This was a gift for my cousin who loved it.  She said that it is such a help having more hands free movement.

title: All moms should have  this!
author: Proudmommyofthreee
comments: I absolutely love this wrap.  I couldnt loveIt anymore than I do.  This wrapAllows meTo feel so close and bonded with my baby.  I highly recommend. I also get compliments- even from men- about howCool the wrap is and how neat it looks!!

title: Awesome wrap
author: Danielle
comments: I love this wrap. I'm really short and found other wraps so cumbersome to use. This one is slightly stretchy and not so long. Very comfy and easy to use. I'm a mom of 3 and this wrap is my fav :).

title: LIfesaver
author: Wha?
comments: First of all, it's not complicated to use once you figure it out which took me about a minute after watching a video on You Tube.Second, this has been perfect for my little one in her first month -- she was tiny at under 6 pounds and at 7 pounds it's still perfect for doing stuff around the house and short hikes.  I just got her into the Ergo for a longer walk which is more ergonomical for longer hiking but for around the house and shorter walks (2 miles or so) this thing can't be beat.  I have washed and dried it once and it held up beautifully.  I am tempted to get another just so DH and I have our "own" -- he is loving it too.

title: Too confusing
author: anonymous
comments: Hated this because it's very complicated to wrap.Was disappointed with it and with its instructions.Not worth it at all.

title: Comfortable
author: Melissa
comments: I bought this to use for our newborn (we borrowed an Ergo Baby from a friend but didn't have the newborn insert). I used this anytime I had to run errands or clean the house and she would just fall right to sleep. I loved that it keeps your baby so close to you and it doesn't feel bulky.

title: Love love love
author: Nathaniel zackery
comments: I love this wrap. Material is great. And I love the bag it comes with. Easy to put on. I plan to buy this for every pregnant woman

title: Comparison: Boba Wrap, Baby K'Tan, Lillebaby, and Ergo Baby.
author: PepiBumbo
comments: I used four different carriers for my baby: a Baby K'Tan, this Boba Wrap, an Ergo Baby, and a Lillebaby. Here are the pros and cons of each:First, the Baby K'Tan. I tried this one first and loved it for my newborn. The main advantage to the K'Tan is that it is sort of a Boba or Moby Wrap for Dummies: easier to put on, and made of less stretchy fabric. This held my baby snugly to my chest, and this was the ONLY way she would nap most afternoons. I spent a lot of time with her in this! The fabric does stretch out eventually, but I simply put the K'tan in the washer and through the dryer on high heat, and it went back to its original size. Cons: The K'Tan is sized, so unless you want to buy two (or you are the same size), your partner wont' be able to use it. As my baby got heavier, we needed a carrier my husband could use, too. Also ,the support strap ties in back, and this is uncomfortable if you want to wear the carrier while sitting (for example, on a long airplane flight).Second, the Boba Wrap. This was the second carrier I bought. I love the soft, stretchy, thick fabric--much better feeling than a Moby. Also, the wrap ties in front so there is no knot in the back when you are sitting. Unlike the K'Tan, this one requires you to figure out how to wrap and tie, and it is a bit of a learning curve. However, the plus side was that my husband could use this, too. Now that my baby is over 6 months old, though, we mostly use the Lillebaby as it is more supportive and distributes her weight better.Third, the Ergo Baby. We ended up returning this one. For one, the infant insert just did not work out for us. Every time my husband tried this, the baby would start crying and fussing. For a newborn, it is definitely better to use a stretchy wrap like the Boba or K'Tan.Finally, the Lillebaby. This is the carrier we are currently using for our 7 month old. It supports her weight well, allows for multiple positions (including outward facing, which she now prefers), and does not require her to dangle from her crotch (as a Bjorn does). But this would not have been as comfy for her as a newborn.Overall, if you plan to get two carriers, I'd recommend the Boba (for an infant) and the Lillebaby for a larger baby.

title: not great for newborn
author: kyle
comments: Hard to get it to wrap so that it supported baby's head. So I still had to use an arm to support his neck negating the purpose of being hands free. Maybe it will be more useful when he is older. In all fairness though my newborn is huge so maybe that made it difficult.

title: This is a lifesaver...
author: Britt
comments: Best item I've purchased for my son!  Just a few days after birth and he is addicted to being attached to mom, but mom likes being active around the house. This was the perfect solution. Even now, my son is about 10 lbs and works great.  I couldn't see using it past about 20lbs though.It was easy to learn how to use it. I checked out a couple of videos on you tube for it, so it only takes 15 seconds to wrap it around, then slide the little one in.  I've used it while shopping.  I've used it while eating out.  Otherwise I would leave him in his car seat and carry that thing around, but he hates sitting in his car seat too long (key fit 30). When he is cranky and needs to get to sleep I use it (creating a habit I'm sure, but hey, he is 5 weeks) I slide him in and he's asleep within 10 minutes. I've also become an expert in sliding him out of it to lay him in his crib while sleeping.  The fabric is stretchy and soft.  As long as it isn't twisted across your back, it distributes the weight and shouldn't hurt your back. It does make me waddle if I tie it too low, then I feel 8 months pregnant again lol.

title: Awesome!!
author: Shelley
comments: This is a must have if you have a little one that loves to be held. Easy to use! Wish I had this with my first baby.

title: Baby and I are happy with the boba, not too hard to use.
author: stacey
comments: I love baby wearing and so far baby loves being worn. This wasn't too hard to figure out. Just watch a couple of YouTube videos and it's a breeze for the newborn wrap. I haven't tried the other ones yet.I was originally debating between the moby and boba. Boba won because of simply two things...fabric based on other reviews and price.So far, baby and I are happy with it. Next step, how to nurse while wearing the little guy!

title: Colic Cure
author: Kimberly
comments: My baby is almost two months old and is the definition of colic. It took a bit of practice getting a screaming baby into the wrap, but once he is in he usually calms down within minutes and sometimes even falls asleep. Getting the wrap on takes a bit of practice, but after watching the youtube videos provided by Boba I figured out how to get it on easily. You just have to get it on really tight. The first time I wore my baby I did not get it tight enough and that caused my back to hurt. It really only took about three days to feel really comfortable with the wrap, so don't be immediately discouraged. I love this wrap so much that I am considering buying a Boba Carrier for when my little guy is a bit older. I think the wrap might be a little too warm in the summer, but is fantastic this winter!

title: easy to use
author: Lisa
comments: Ok so I had read all the reviews on this, and so I watched the video of how to wear the thing, however, the package comes with instructions that are fairly easy to understand. Criss cross, cross tie. Done. I can get this wrap on while holding the baby, or if I'm lucky enough to be able to put him down, i can get it on within 30 seconds. The material is stretchy which is nice, since you dont have to worry about how tight you are tying it. I tie it on, stick baby in and we are good to go, though I have noticed he tends to slip further down the more i move. However, its easy to adjust. I have not yet figured out how to nurse while wearing the wrap, so I just quickly remove a strap by lifting over my head.

title: It's working well for my two week old
author: mamaroks
comments: I like the Boba Wrap. My almost nine pound baby fits well inside and feels secure. I don't feel that I have to keep a hand on her because I'm not worried about her falling out. I had a sling with my last baby and I never felt secure enough with that to totally let go and just walk around hands free. The wrap is much more comfortable. The fabric is stretchy so it's easy to put the wrap on tight and still be able to put the baby inside.So far all I've done is the newborn hold. It comes with a booklet that tells you how to put it on and the different holds you can do but I found it more helpful to search youtube for videos that show you. It's actually very easy to use.My baby likes to be in the wrap, she'll either look all around or fall right asleep. I highly recommend the Boba Wrap.The only thing I don't like is that the stardust pattern is only on one side, the other side is white. It's not a big deal but I didn't realize this when I ordered mine.

title: Two free hands.
author: Dawn
comments: Should have bought this during pregnancy.  Baby number two and TWO free hands.  A must have for all moms/dads.Only downside is how thick it is. In relation to summer heat.

title: It is awesome!!
author: miriam220
comments: I absolutely love the Boba wrap! It is a great way to complete all my daily chores and still comfort my grandson

title: Use it every day
author: Landylion
comments: we love this wrap helps my baby settle down so quickly and he loves being with me as I do light housework. I couldn't get anything done before I had it. Wish someone would have told me about it sooner! (got it when he was 3 months) Even my husband uses it!

title: One of my best purchases for baby!
author: Ellie V
comments: Absolutely love this thing! Makes life so much easier! So at first you need to spend the time learning how to put this on and practice. It's really not that hard and with some practice you and baby are on your way! My munchkin loves this... I put her in and she falls asleep almost instantly. She is comfortable and happy to be so close to mama. I get things done around the House and take walks with her bundled in. Quality is great and really makes baby feel secure. I read a few ppl saying the baby kept slipping down that's bc it wasn't tight enough, instructions say to make sure it's snug on certain parts while ur wrapping it around urself, just takes practice. It's washable too. Only thing negative I can say is it can get kind of warm since baby is pressed up on you and ur wrapped in cloth, but not that serious.

title: I own 2 because I had twins!
author: Elizabeth
comments: I have loved the boba wraps. They are great for babies up to about 20 - 25 lbs. My husband and I had twins so he walks around with one baby in his wrap and I walk around with the other baby in my wrap. They are life savers!!‚Ä¶ Our babies are 7 months old and weigh 19Lbs and 24Lbs and we still use the wraps! The one thing reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is because I'm disappointed that I can't use these much longer‚Ä¶ now that my babies are getting so big it's hard to get these wraps tight enough to hold the baby in place without sagging some, because they stretch a lot. I am gonna have to try the moby wraps. I hear that they are not stretchy, so they hold the baby in place better. The stretchiness was great at first, because it seemed to make the baby perfectly comfortable, but now that the baby sags, its getting rough on the back‚Ä¶ I'm told that a non stretchy wrap will solve this problem.

title: Better for smaller babes?
author: Truth Be Told
comments: I did not find the wrap hard to put on, but it did take a little longer to do so than I would have liked. I sent it back because my baby is 6 weeks, twelve pounds and he just could not seem to get comfortable in there.  Even with the cloth nice and tight, he didn't seem totally secure to me, but he did seem a little scrunched.  I might suggest this style for a smaller baby.

author: leticia martinez
comments: Exelent it doesn't feel the baby's wait it allMy back doesn't hurt.Exelent quality I just love itThe price a little bet high.Deliver on time. I'm so happy.‚ô•‚ô°‚ô•‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ Stars

title: Carrier "Mommy Style"
author: Eloquentia
comments: I got this wrap mostly because I was tired of sitting there with my fussy baby and not getting anything done at home. My daughter was 1 week old when we took her for a short walk around the block (she's a New England winter baby, and it's sooo cold here). I put her in a carrier we got from friends, but it just didn't do the trick. I constantly felt that my newborn was too far away from my own body and more or less bouncing around. So I ordered the Boba.It's really simple to put on (I actually watched the youtube videos and found them much easier to understand than the printed explanations) and whenever I put DD in it, she loves being so snug. We now mostly use it for shopping trips (hands-free is a wonderful thing as every new mom can imagine) and not so much for the household. That's just because I cannot figure out how to put her head in there without suffocating her. She hates turning it to one side.So when I bend over a lot (while doing laundry for example), I always need to put one hand behind her head. That's a bit annoying, but pretty surely my own fault.Being in a grocery store, I am mostly in an upright position and she instantly falls asleep in it.It's also nice, that you can always check on the baby and kiss and cuddle him.The fabric is very comfy and of high quality. Very stretchy, but not too much (I was worried about that before). It holds her in place without strangling me and you can't really feel the weight of the child.I prefer the Boba over the Moby Wrap, because I don't have to deal with 'pockets' and I like the fabric on the Boba more.I would definitely recommend this wrap to anyone who wants to keep their child close. Because of its softness it's more for moms I think, my hubby prefers the carrier. It's "more masculine".. whatever that means.

title: Works as it should, but I think it takes too long
author: Amazon Customer
comments: The wrap isn't very hard at all to put on and figure out - it's actually very straight forward.  And it works as it should, and even for my tiny newborn twins it worked very well.  They were able to fit in all curled up in little frog positions, which is what they preferred at that point anyway.  Now they are 3 months old and approaching 15lbs each, so they can sit with legs out and wrapped around me.That being said, we never use this wrap anymore.  It just takes too long to get on and off.  I breastfeed twins, and while sometimes I can get a kid to boob while in this thing, often I can't because they just aren't positioned right or they just don't want to eat in that position.  So I have try to get the darn thing off (or it's the OTHER twin who wants to eat, which is more typical).  With 2 babies crying it also just takes too long to get on.So my husband and nanny use the baby bjorn, and I use a Maya sling or a Seven sling.  When our babies were newborn (6lbs and 7.5lbs) this wrap worked best.  But once they crossed about 8lbs or so the baby bjorn and slings were faster and more convenient.

title: Very inconvenient
author: Angela Ip
comments: I like the idea of combining swaddling and carrying.. But honestly this is too much work to put the baby in. And most likely you can only put it on at home... Imagine putting this on in public!At the end I paid more to get BabyBjorn The One, easy to put on and take off. It's much more expensive but it's all worth it. I use it few times a day! Watch the youtube instructional video, you will get what I mean.

title: Great but tedious
author: S. Bennett
comments: Once you've managed to get the hang of wrapping the Boba and baby is in it, it's worthwhile. However, it can get tricky getting baby inside and calm. I suggest practicing and finding what baby likes before giving up. Follow directions on how to tie the wrap around, place it high and tight because baby starts to stretch it out and it ends up loosening if you don't. I don't use it regularly, but there are times it comes in handy. I use my Ergo more, easier and quicker. But I still do like this wrap and will keep it.

title: Best for Baby Connection
author: Bense
comments: I use the Boba everyday, it allows me to get things done around the house and spend quality time with my baby. She sleeps better, and can view things from a different angle. The only issue I have with it, is that I ordered it in black and it tends to get dirty very quickly.

title: AWESOME!
author: missy
comments: A great baby wrap is as important as diapers in our family.  They make secure, loving, and sociable babies and emotionally stable kids WITHOUT flat heads from being carted around in car seats all the time.  This one is the best I've owned with the stretchability that %100 cotton alternatives do not offer.  The minimal % of spandex makes a big difference.- Missy, mother of 4

title: Great quality stretchy wrap!
author: J. Yi
comments: I used both woven and stretchy wraps for my newborn and am of the opinion that this brand is the best stretchy wrap available. The jersey is soft yet thick -- better quality than other brands that are more like thin T-shirt material -- and molds easily to mom and baby. The Stardust print is very cute and modern and makes a functional item wear like an accessory. I stopped use once baby was more mobile and I began to prefer the easy up/down of full buckles or ring slings, but it was very loved in the early stages!

title: I love it!
author: Britani Pinkston
comments: I take it everywhere I go. I currently went back to work and my sister who has twin toddlers watches my three month old, so I make sure that I pack my Boba  in the diaper bag to free up her hands. I showed her how to wear it and it is Great for all seasons.

title: I hate this thing!
author: Alison
comments: This wrap is complicated and doesn't hold the baby well.  It's only one long piece of fabric.  I followed the directions to get it on but the material is so stretchy that once I do it the baby hangs to low.  It's very difficult to adjust.  I'm going to buy a KTan sling.  As a new mom you want to be able to slip this on and off easily.  I will never use the Boba Wrap again.

title: Lifesaver
author: Hazel T
comments: Love love the boba wrap. I was looking for a carrier that didn't have a weight requirement. Most infant carriers say at least 7.5-8lbs and I wanted to "wear" my baby right away, at 2 weeks old, she was only 6 lbs, she wanted to be held most of the time and I needed my hands free. It takes some practice to get used to tying the wrap but me and my fianc√©e have gotten pretty good at it and the baby loves it. It's the only way I'm able to do chores around the house with my 8 week baby. Totally a lifesaver.

title: One of my favorite baby items!
author: Savannah
comments: I love this!! It's a little confusing to put on a first but once you get the hang of it, is really easy. It does come with good step by step instructions. I use this several times a week whether I'm out and about or at home cleaning. The material in a good stretchy cotton.

title: Mom and baby love it
author: nicole
comments: I tried to put my month old son in the ergobaby carrier (with the infant insert and without) and he hated it and cried each time. He loved the boba wrap from the first try and fell asleep in it after only a few minutes. I love that it's soft, very cozy for baby and easy to wear and carry when on the go.

title: Takes a Little Practice, but GREAT Wrap
author: PB&Jam
comments: When I received this as a gift at my baby shower, I practiced putting in on using the instruction manual and a stuffed animal. What a mess. hahah. I was ready to send it back. When the baby got here, I checked out the videos on Youtube and just like that, baby was all wrapped up. This is great because I can actually walk around the house and get some things done without feeling disconnected from my baby. One word of caution, I usually take the extra fabric and wrap it around my waist and tuck it in. I'm short and if I let it dangle it is definitely a tripping hazard. Also, if you're putting it on in public, be careful that you are in a clean area because inevitably, the fabric will touch the floor/ground as you are putting on the wrap and that could get nasty.

title: Love the Boba Wrap!
author: Jennifer Maenaka
comments: I really like the Boba Wrap and purchased it for travel (flying). The best way to learn to put on the wrap is watching a few videos. The most difficult part was positioning the wrap across my back without twisting it and keeping it tight enough so when I brought it to the front I was able to fit baby securely inside. I am a small person so there is quite a bit of fabric left, but I wrapped it a few extra times, eliminating the issue. My baby enjoyed being close to me and was able to see most things that were going on around him. We were also both very comfortable walking around. We continue to use this wrap at home and when we go out. It was a great purchase!

title: Fantastic Carrier--comfortable and cozy
author: Laura
comments: I love my Boba Wrap! The fabric is amazing, super soft and stretchy. It is moderately thick, and if you don't like the feeling of being wrapped in stretchy fabric, look elsewhere. However, I love being wrapped securely in stretchy fabric and that makes this so comfortable for mom and cozy for baby. The instructions are very simple, I had no problems getting it on and off. For young babies this is a life-saver to get baby secure and close to a caretaker. My absolute favorite for babywearing!

title: Gives me the ability to get things done
author: Teresa M.
comments: The Boba wrap gives me opportunity to get things done around the house. I love having my baby against my chest, and it calms her almost instantly when she is crying. Prompt shipment.

title: Absolutely gorgeous!
author: relaxdesign
comments: I was so in love with this good that I had to buy it and ship it to a friend who was temporarily living in new York, because Boba won't ship outside the U.S. :)

title: greatest!
author: Danielle
comments: It's sooo great I can do anything in it! My daughter just fall's right to sleep every time I put her in it! So worth it!!!

title: Meh - it's okay, but not practical for me
author: Fl_Gal
comments: Meh - it's okay, but not practical for me.  My son is 6 weeks -- I was looking for a way to wear him so I can still go about my day both at home and out in public.The wrap is VERY long -- took a while for me to get the hang of wearing it.  I still have 'do-overs' if I'm not putting it on in front of a full length mirror.  That being said, this is not the ideal wrap if you're out & about running errands.  Best used while at home.  Even then, it's still time consuming & frustrating trying to put this thing on.

title: Serves the purpose without having to make it myself
author: Marvina Jones
comments: It's stretchy and secure for your little one.  I love getting out of my car and placing my 2 month old in the wrap and running my errands. I don;t have to worry about a stroller or car seat and I am hands free. I also love to use it working around the house to keep my baby upright after a feeding to eliminate the spit up factor. They are overpriced. If you have time to make your own I would suggest it. That way you can save a little money and put more effort into the look.  I wish they were more creative and fashionable. Overall, a great find for me, a first time mom!

title: Oh my Boba wrap.....where do I begin....
author: ngoveia
comments: I just love my Boba wrap!  I bought it when my second daughter was just a few days old.  I could see that I was not going to have my hands free to take care of my 2 year old AND my newborn.  My baby loved being wrapped up close to me and napped very frequently in it.  The bouncing of me walking around put her right out!  I could make dinner, pick up the house, play with my other daughter, all while wearing the baby.  As she has gotten older, we continue to use it.  I put her in it for walks outside when she was a few months old.  I wore her grocery shopping so my other daughter could ride in the seat of the cart.  Now she is 11 months and I just had her in it to vacuum the whole house!  It has been one of the BEST baby purchases!

title: would by again
author: John Wesley Denham
comments: Not hard to put on at all. The fabric feel is nice. Wrap settles my 5 week old very well.

title: Is great !!!
author: Christy Muir
comments: Extremely HAPPY !!! My baby 3 months old smiles every time I pick him up to place him in to the Boba :))) I wish I can take a picture right now he sleeps like "a baby" late evenings are so much easier to make him sleep.

title: Awesome for baby wearing
author: Valerie Chambers
comments: I love this wrap!  I wear it at least once a day, whether its around the house or walks around the clock.  I give it 4 instead of 5 stars because in the summer time, even in Pittsburgh, it can get a bit hot and we both get really sweaty.  Otherwise it's perfect!

title: Get this wrap!
author: katbruns
comments: I haven't tried the Moby wraps, but all my friends recommended the Boba over it, so I went with it and I've loved it.  Easy to use, seems comfortable for my baby and it's comfortable for me.

title: I don't get it...
author: Geoffrey
comments: My wife was boasting about how this was the best wrap, and best way to haul your kid around. So she convinced me to buy it, considering the time it takes to wrap this around your body, it is not a quick fix for hands free baby holding. It took me about 45 minutes to figure out how to just wrap it around me until i had to watch a youtube video.Since we bought it, i've seen my wife use it 3-4 times. It's just to complicated to tie if you're in a hurry.

title: Boba Wrap
author: Rachel
comments: This is an absolute lifesaver! Love it. Fabric and price were perfect for me. If your child is warm blooded be aware that it can get warm but it's worth it to have both hands free and know your child is safely wrapped.

title: Comfy carrier
author: Erin F
comments: The boba is so comfy! My baby seems to love it and it's not too hot, very breathable. Once you get the hang of the wrapping, it's pretty simple.

title: My must have baby item
author: B. Prince
comments: The Boba wrap has been great...for walks or housework or shopping or just calming down a fussy baby. Really easy to get on, watched video before it arrived and had no problem once it got here. Material is nice and soft. Highly recommended.

title: maybe just me
author: Sarah
comments: I like the product- just feel too short for it at 5'2. Fabric length is also intimidating. Maybe not super suited for petites?

title: Great swaddler
author: MIsti
comments: Very helpful in calming my new born. Item cam be tricky to put on at first, my husband and I watched some videos online to help us figure it out.

title: This was Christmas gift for my daughter in law.
author: Sandy Quackenbush
comments: She wore her baby in this wrap for the holidays and the baby just slept and was kept close to Mommy.  It also helped from being passed around so much...you know...germs and stuff.

title: Excellent Gift!
author: Heidi
comments: Bought for a friend who recently had a baby!  She has let us know many times how much she and her baby LOVE this item!

title: My new best friend!
author: Debbie P
comments: I got a Moby at a baby shower and was happy to get it but, when our son was born early, ended up ordering this on Amazon because it's suitable for preemies and the price was right.  I like the feel of this carrier even better than the Moby.  I like that it's lighter-weight and I love that there's some 'give' or stretchiness to the fabric!  I'm so happy to be getting the skin to skin closeness with my preemie and I couldn't be happier with the Boba Wrap!

title: Did not work for me.
author: TESS
comments: This item did not work at all for me. I had my sis ter come over and follow the instructions be is was ineffective and not safe to carry a baby.

title: Great Wrap!
author: Thamel
comments: This wrap is awesome, kiddo loves it. I am 5'4" my husband is 6'2" and we are both able to wear it no problem. One thing I wish I would have known is that once the baby gets heavier (my son is about 18lbs) he starts to sag too much to be comfortable. We've tried wrapping it tighter but it doesn't help much. I realize now (after doing more research) that a woven (non stretchy) wrap would have been better for my sons weight, but I love this wrap so much I'm definitely keeping it. It'll be perfect for the next kiddo.

title: It's getting hot in here
author: SL
comments: 1 star for comfort, but HOLY crap, after 20 mins, it got too hot to wear. I can't image wearing this during summer time. I tried it once and had to return, plus, there was a VERY small hole in the knit, causing concern that it might get bigger as the fabric stretches.

title: Love it for my second baby......
author: ngoveia
comments: I had tried a Moby wrap with my first baby, and for whatever reason it just did not work out.  When I had my second, it was quickly apparent that I REALLY needed extra hands, so I revisited the idea of a wrap carrier and stumbled on the Boba.  The Moby Wrap does not have spandex, so it was hard for me to get it on with the right amount of space for the baby.  Not with the Boba!  I wrapped it as tight as I could and stuffed my little newborn in.  Viola!  I had hands free to make dinner, play with my toddler, throw in a load of laundry, and my baby would usually fall asleep with all the bouncing.  At one point I was actually putting her in it for naps because she slept so well!  Now my baby is 10 months old and I still put her in it when my toddler wants to play outside.  I also find it VERY helpful when shopping with my two girls alone.  I put the wrap on before I leave for the store, and then put the baby in when we get there.  No messing around with it or getting it dirty.  It's awesome!!!

title: Was a Christmas gift for daughter
author: tammy jones
comments: She really wanted this for baby.  The instructions not great, but once she figured it out.....loves it.  And so does baby

title: Definitely not what is advertised
author: achami06
comments: This product is downright dangerous.  I carefully read the instructions and put it on properly and still my 3 month old (12 lbs) almost fell out.  It's enormous size makes it very impractical.

title: I'm Glad I have this!
author: Bethany Lemon
comments: This wrap is great. I don't have a stroller right now but it's ok because I take my 1` week old on a walk in my wrap most days. Pretty easily put on. I can even breastfeed in it! Love the Boba Wrap!!

title: Love it!
author: Valorie Moses
comments: I had to use a video tutorial to learn how to wrap/tie it the way I wanted it, but once I got the hang of it, this thing has been nothing short of awesome. Great gift for a new Mom, people!

title: My baby loves it.
author: JaneD
comments: My baby just loves it. He can sleep very well in the wrap. Also the flexible fabric makes it easy to adjust the baby's position and the touch feels nice and soft.

title: Previously had a Moby... Love the Boba better!
author: TizaJane
comments: I borrowed a Moby wrap for my second child and loved having my hands free.  With the third, I felt it was time to finally invest in my own.  Based on other reviews, opted for the Boba Wrap.  Glad I did.  The material is super soft and is extremely comfortable to wear with baby.

title: Nice to wear while at the park.
author: afwife182
comments: Now this is coming from a mom with a 2 year old and a now 4 month old.  I tried to decided between this and the Moby wrap and I am glad I went with the Boba instead.  Why this is better.1. Its cheaper.2. Its more stretchy.I don't use this item very often since it does become semi complicated to take on and off.  Thats why I gave it 4 stars.  It does become easy to remember how to set it up though.  I just think it is slightly time consuming to get it set up.  But if your in the market to buy something like this skip spending $50 on the moby and buy this one.  They are pretty much the same.

title: Way too difficult to wrap
author: Rachel E
comments: I wanted to like this wrap, but who wants to have to put the baby down somewhere while you spend time perfecting the wrap so that it is just right when you put the baby in? I am much happier with my HotSling which needs no adjustment, as well as my boba carrier. This is just way too much work, and oftentimes I felt like my baby was sliding down as it would loosen.

title: EXCELLENT GIFT!
author: Cheryl Lang
comments: My daughter absolutely LOVES the Boba Wrap for my grandson!  To get the most out of your Boba Wrap, my daughter highly recommends getting an expert to help in learning how to wrap it correctly for support of the baby AND your back!

title: Does not work as described
author: jessicaleigh1231
comments: I ordered this because the reviews said how easy and amazing it is to use.  Once I figured out how to use it (took quite sometime because I didnt think it seemed right) I walked around the house with my newborn baby but felt very uncomfortable.  I felt like she was going to fall out.  I looked up the instructions over and over to make sure I was doing it right and yep, I was.  Personally, I don't feel it is safe and I requested to return it.

title: okay product but not great
author: amazon queen
comments: Best for around the house. It's sort of difficult to use in public because of all the wrapping which can be an annoying inconvenience.

title: Like better than moby, but still use moby too!
author: SammaLynn
comments: Have this and the moby.  I reach for this more often because once you learn to tie it REALLY TIGHT (that's the key), its so much easier than the moby because it is more forgiving.  I also like it better because baby can adjust and move a little, yet still be tight against you.  But, I only liked it until my baby hit 10-11 lbs (about 2 1/2-3 months).  11-15lbs is moby time because it has more structure.  Over 14lbs, we do ergo or something similar.  This is a MUST fit any new mom, especially one with more than one child!

title: Just like a moby and less expensive!
author: Leslie D.
comments: Comfortable wrap-style carrier.  We used this when baby girl was very small, birth up until 3 months or so...at this point she is big enough and wiggly enough that I prefer carrying her in a more structured carrier (we then used a baby bjorn until she was big enough for the ergo, which is our favorite carrier.)  It was a little uncomfortable in hot weather (for both us and baby, too sweaty!) but I was glad I had it because she was too small at birth for any other carrier.

title: LOVE THIS WRAP!!!
author: Sara E
comments: This is, hands down, one of the best things I have purchased for my baby. This wrap is easy to use and extremely comfortable. I wear this into church where space is limited and I don't have to worry about her carrier taking up so much space. I wear it around the house to clean or especially when she is fussy and needs to wind down. My baby loves being in it and most often goes straight to sleep. I can't say enough good things about the Boba Wrap. From now on every expectant mom I know can expect to get one of these from me at any future baby showers.

title: Great buy!
author: Alexander James Mol
comments: Works great! Light weight and comfortable to wear. We got months of great use from it. I was sad when my son finally grew out of it!

title: Nice product
author: Pat Bacon
comments: The Boba Wrap is not for me.  I bought it for my Daughter-in-law for Christmas.  A good friend of mine recommended it so I think it will be perfect for the baby due in May/14.

title: Great but challenging to get on alone
author: Mjonesy
comments: Using right now for a newborn and she likes it.  Keeps her snuggled really close and warm.  I rated at 4 stars as a bit complicated to get on alone and ensure the wrap isn't twisted inaccurately.  Also have the ergo structured carrier with infant insert and she won't tolerate being carried in that.  If you need to use both your hands at any point and have a baby that wants to be carried, this is great.

title: Love it!
author: Alison Harris
comments: Our baby was too small for the carrier we purchased before he was born, the boba was perfect (and cheaper than some other choices)! He quickly falls asleep in it so I can get stuff done around the house and it's a lifesaver while running errands!!

title: A great product!
author: C. Stack
comments: This is an amazing (albeit simple) product. My colicy baby spends at least an hour a day in this wrap; it is one of the few things that makes her happy. Not only does she rest, but she can eat and I can be hands-free the whole time. It's so basic I didn't think it would work, but it really does.

title: Love it!
author: A. Russo
comments: I did a lot of research on mommy forums and decided this was the right wrap for my newborn. I love it! I can see how it might be a bit warm in summer months but for now it's perfect. Wrapping is simple and my baby loves being in it and I love being able to be close to her and get some things done. I'm excited to use it when flu season is over and I dare take her out of her car seat at stores.

title: Not for me....
author: Hakkattack
comments: Maybe I'm not "granola" enough.....but I find this product completely annoying.  The fabric seems like a mile in length and it takes WAY too much effort to get the thing JUST RIGHT.  The enclosed directions are not that great.  I have worn it a few times, but found that I still had to place my hand on my baby because it just had way too much spandex or stretchy material.  It seems really popular with people, but its just not for me.  Maybe I'll try it again later and use it when my baby is a bit older.  He's three months now, so maybe it will do better?  Regardless, for anything outside the house I swear by my Ergo carrier.  Love that product.

title: Ok Baby Carrier
author: B.Rod
comments: I really wanted to like this product but I just can‚Äôt say I do at this time.  I have to start out by saying that I have the organic bjorn baby carrier.  I think that might have to do with why I am not so happy with this one.  I wanted a cloth carrier that was more basic & lightweight.  One good thing is that IF you get it on right, it is practically weightless and comfy.  I have a 20lb 6 month old (BIG BOY!) who loves to be in the bjorn facing out looking around.  The main thing that I don‚Äôt like is that once you get it on you (not all so difficult as some might‚Äôve mentioned), it‚Äôs hard to get your baby in right.  In this wrap, he has to face me so he is always trying to turn around and because of the way he is in the wrap (not so sure if it‚Äôs the way I get him in- he is uncovered from his shoulder up & his arms are out) he is practically leaping out.  Unlike the bjorn, where he is clipped & secured in, I feel that I HAVE to keep one or 2 hands on him at all times to make sure he doesn‚Äôt throw himself out.  Again, I only have the bjorn to compare this to- I don‚Äôt know how this compares to other cloth wraps.  I will continue to use it, just not when I need my hands free.

title: Ok wrap
author: HEATHER Schram
comments: It worked ok but had a hard time keeping my newborn in place. He kept falling lower on my stomach despite having tied the wrap tight enough. Soft material though.

title: love it!!
author: boba girl
comments: Easy to wear. I have even caught my husband wearing it!! Its great!! I will be buying more from this company!!

title: Accurate
author: Laura
comments: Great stretchy material. Super comfy! I don't get hot while wearing it. True to picture. Not hard to out one but you may need some practice first lol

title: Perfect for us!
author: Melissa Muir
comments: Even with a Pavlik harness on, our 3.5 month old loves this. My favorite part is that I can take her out after she's fallen asleep and the process doesn't wake her up (like with the Ergo).

title: Not what I expected.
author: Guahan MOM
comments: I purchased the Stardust print becuase I thought it looked very cool on the images.  The only thing is that the print is only on one side of the wrap.  The other side of the wrap was the interior gray of the fabric.  Not very nice at all.  When putting on the wrap it takes some effort to make sure only the printed side is showing.  I was also left with a whole lot of fabric dangling after the wrap and baby was on.

title: Not what I hoped for
author: Crystal
comments: My preemie does not like to stay in it! After a couple of uses it stretched out really bad and didnt hold him as snugg.

title: Tying issue
author: Ashby
comments: Nice and soft end grey goes with everything. Tying it may be only downfall. Not something u can just throw on in a hurry.

title: Comfy and cute!
author: Mama Marshmarlow
comments: Baby wearing is the way to go, and this sling is a bit cheaper than the others I found. Definitely a great buy and the instructions for different positions was nice! Also, I am a plus size (large bust) person and it fits great,

title: lots of trouble...love cuddling baby
author: A. Lemoine
comments: perhaps I just haven't learned how to properly tie this...but it is a BIG deal for me to get it on and get baby into...I love having baby with me...that's  the plus.

title: awesome
author: Lordmistress
comments: It's fantastic!! I love it.  Probably order another soon. I don't have much else to say about it. it does what it does

title: Good wrap and supplement to my Ergo
author: Itty
comments: I was hesitant to buy another baby carrier. I was gifted a ring sling and ergo. I love my ergo but the infant insert (a must for my little one) is too hot for her and me in the Alabama humidity and summer/fall heat. The ring sling is great for quick baby wearing but the rings are very uncomfortable against my collar bone and shoulder. I am a smaller person and the big rings just plain hurt no matter how I pad them with the tail or arrange them on my body. So I needed another option. I bought the Boba for a cooler baby carrier that is simple to use. I like this much better than the ring sling. It's easy to wrap after watching the instructional videos. It's also not as hot as the Ergo. My baby girl loves riding in it. I agree with other reviewers with small frames that there is simply too much fabric. I have to wrap it twice around my waist. I also find it hard to get the proper tautness, but I think that will come with practice and as my baby grows. I would purchase this again. It's great for hands free baby wearing and allows me to complete the housework, prepare dinner, work, and feel like I am still bonding with my baby. I'd purchase this again, as it is a great supplement to my Ergo (still my favorite baby carrier).

title: Too much fabric for petite users
author: Jayden17
comments: I bought this for my wife based on the great reviews and everything else I have heard about it. However she is very petite and there's like 75 feet of fabric (gross exaggeration) to wrap around yourself. I had no problem doing it, but she couldn't manage it. We have returned it.

title: PErfect for Fall
author: Luis Cardenas
comments: This is perfect to be used on fall season; it's kind of warm to use it during summer, my wife and I loved it!

title: Great wrap
author: I'm a mermaid
comments: I love this wrap and so does my baby. It's relatively easy to use, despite the large amount of fabric. I feel secure with my baby in this carrier.

title: nice product
author: Erin
comments: I like this wrap it a little hard to get used to but once you get the hang of it, it's really nice. It's a little complicated to get your baby out once done breast feeding without your boob popping out though.

title: Great wrap, but a little tricky to put on
author: Anna Murdock
comments: I use the wrap a lot with my 8 week old baby. He likes it because it keeps him close and warm. my only complaints are that it is a little complicated to put on and get tight, and it's also pretty hot. This definitely isn't a summer outdoor wrap. I'm looking forward to using it this winter though!

title: Love the boba!
author: Emily L Tate
comments: Love love love!!!!  My 4 week old instantly falls asleep when I wrap her in it.It's easy to put on and would recommend to any mom with a new born!

title: love it...must have for moms and dads!
author: Lisa Iris
comments: This is a must have! Extremely comfortable and my baby loves being snuggled close to me. It does get a bit warm, but I expected that as my baby is right up against me.

title: The best wrap!!!
author: caitlin roca
comments: This has got to be the best baby wearing wrap on the market. I use it to clean the house, go on walks, go to the grocery store, and pretty much everything in between!! Thanks!!

title: Love it!
author: Monica
comments: I have tried a ring sling, ergo, and moby, but Boba wins for newborns! This is best for the first few months, it saved me during the newborn phase when my little one would only sleep being held! For bigger babies (15 to 20 lbs and up) I'd recommend the ergo and both are really easy to breastfeed in!

title: Love my Boba
author: Monica
comments: I have this wrap in black and my sister in law loved it so much she wanted one too! It is a great wrap and I prefer it over the moby as it does not get as hot (still warm though!) and it is stretchy so I dont have to keep readjusting it! My first 4 months with my baby I lived in this thing and it is super comfortable! I breastfeed in it too :)

title: Absolutely LOVE it
author: Strong5
comments: The material is so soft and comfortable for me and my newborn. It took a tiny bit of practice to get the hang of getting it on but now, I use this wrap every day. Yesterday my baby got her first shots and was cranky all day and so she lived in this wrap. I could hold her close so she felt content while I was able to take care of my other 2 kids as well. This wrap is worth every penny!

title: i love it
author: Irina
comments: I so in love with this  wrap!So great!!!!!I recommended to buy! You love it . .Very easy to use !

title: Perfect!
author: LexiG
comments: My baby LOVES the boba wrap! It's perfect! I don't use my stroller anymore! Shopping has become a breeze as baby sleeps once she is in it!

title: great newborn wrap.
author: Colleen Roselle
comments: this wrap is great for my newborn who will only be calm if she is held, which obviously doesn't let me get things done without a carrier/ wrap.  this is the cheapest wrap I was able to find and is in no way a cheap product! great material and easy to put on (after a few frustrating trys to figure out first though). so glad I purchased this.

title: It' okay
author: Eli
comments: I bough this wrap to travel with my 5 months daughter - airplane. She is not used to get wrapped and it was complicated to put her inside after feeding her. The wrap goes up due to the normal belly or normal constitution, - unless you are a top model -. I will carry it just in case she likes it better the second time, but I am not a big fan. It's also heavy and very big.

title: Turns crying child to content child
author: Hannah Trulock
comments: My baby loves this and so do I!  After a little bit of practice trying in on became second nature (my first attempt was a disaster).  My only complaints are that it is a little too long on me (I'm 5'3") and I need to add additional knots to keep from tripping over the ends and that it's a little bulky and fills up my diaper bag when I take it with me.

title: Love this!!
author: claupate
comments: I saw this carrying wrap first in Mexico, and I am so happy to have found it here! I bought it for a friend of mine and she thought it was a great gift, she loved the HANDS FREE part of it. The box shows way of how you can wrap it but you can always look on YouTube.Perfect gift for expecting parents, yes guys use it too and they love it!

title: Calms baby like nothing else
author: N
comments: Pros:1. When milk, a clean diaper, being held/bounced/swaddled are not enough, this wrap usually calms my 6 week old baby down and he goes to sleep.  I don't know what I would do otherwise!2. This wrap allows you to get some things done while still holding your baby.  I actually was able to go grocery shopping thanks to this wrap (baby doesn't stay content in the stroller for long).3. I can sit at my computer and type with both hands while holding my baby.  This is SO much better than one handed typing!Cons:1. The wrap takes a minute to put on.  When you have a crying baby that you have to set down (so you can put the wrap on) you feel every second.2. You don't really have both of your hands free unless you're sitting.  When I'm standing I keep a hand on my baby's head to make sure he is supported.  I don't rely on the wrap for this because it's hard to make sure he breathing OK and staying cool with the fabric on his head.3. The wrap can get hot for baby and mom, so it's not the best for the summer.  However it's worth the higher A/C bill to have a calm baby.Comments:-Some reviewers point out that the fabric is really long.  It is, but I just wrap it another time around my waist another time to tie up the long ends.  No problem.-The wrap is easy to put on and comes with clear instructions.  Make it really snug so the baby stays higher up.  This will help prevent your back from getting sore too quickly.-If you tie the wrap on before you drive somewhere you are all set when you arrive (baby doesn't have to wait).-The wrap is even helpful when baby gets cranky in the middle of the night; it helps him to calm down so he can go back to sleep.UPDATE (baby is 5 months old now):I have the Boba Wrap, a sling ring, and a fabric (non-stretchy) wrap.  We still use this one the most because it's the most comfortable over a long period of time.  We go for walks and to restaurants and stores with baby in the Boba wrap.  It's easier than using a stroller because you don't have to avoid bumps in the sidewalk or stairs.Compared to the sling ring wrap: now that my son is old enough to support his torso and head this is a nice alternative because it's faster to put on.  However, it hurts your back faster than the Boba because the weight is all on one side of your back.Compared to the fabric wrap: the Boba is more comfortable because it's stretchy, but it's hotter than the natural fiber tie wrap I have.

title: LOVE IT!
author: Joann Unutoa
comments: Love the design. Love that it stretches not like the moby wrap, gives that little extra you might need for the medium and large size woman to wrap around and tie in the front.I absolutely LOVE IT and would definitely recommend it

title: Wrap..
author: Vino
comments: I really think that wrapping your baby is the best thing that you can do for him! Weather it be swaddling or kangaroo care, it definitely is a plus!!

title: Just More Complicated Than I Wanted
author: Kindle Fire Reviewer 10
comments: For me this wasn't the right product.  I wanted a good wrap for my daughter and the reviews were great.  Product arrived quickly and was packaged nicely.  It comes with an instruction manual.  I would've appreciated a DVD instruction though.  The fabric is super long.  I have the worst time tying the thing onto me while trying to get my daughter in there.  I watched youtube videos numerous times while trying to practice with the wrap.  I could get it on but it just took me so long and was never on the way I thought it should be.I really wanted to like this and I'm sure for alot of people this works.  The fabric is nice.  It will fit lots of body types.  I just want something a little more simple than this.  Since I purchased this awhile ago, I can't return.  It's already in my garage sale pile.

title: Works great- not for tropical climates
author: E
comments: We live in Florida and I knew it, I should have just skipped the wrap and gone for the carrier but I have always loved the look of this style of wrap. It's just too hot. I have it folded and put away for cooler weather and I'm using my old Bjorn in the meantime. The fabric is very thick and slightly stretchier than a Maya wrap (my friend brought hers over to compare). It's difficult to tie on when out in public when trying to hurry and having it on beforehand is too much heat for the summer with a baby born in April.

title: A pain for the beginner
author: Danielle
comments: I love the stretchy feel of this sling, but honestly it's kind of a pain to get the hang of. It usually takes both my husband and I to get it wrapped tight enough, and the included directions leave a lot to be desired.

title: IN LOVE!!!
author: Whitney
comments: My husband reluctantly gave me the go-ahead to spend the money on this wrap.  After a week of use, my husband asked that I order another one.  He has enthusiastically told his whole family about how awesome the wrap is.  We have two other children, so it is nice to be hands free, and he loves the skin to skin time he can have with our little one.  I wish we would have had this with our other two.

title: LOVE the simplicity
author: kdep2012
comments: there are no buckles. no straps. no fasteners. It's just a REALLY long piece of stretchy fabric. and it works AMAZINGLY for my 4 month old (15lb) baby. No back pain like MANY of the others that I've tried! Highly recommend.

title: A little too much fabric
author: Heidi
comments: I bought this wrap because my baby girl loves to be close and this one looks great for snuggly babies. I wanted it for quick trips to the store but this is not convenient like I was hoping it would be. There is so much fabric that you really have to be sitting to put it on or else the foot after foot of fabric would be dragging on the ground as the twisting and wrapping is done to get it on and baby in just right. The print is lovely, and the fabric is really soft, but the concept just didn't work for baby and Me. I gave it a 4 because it is a nice wrap, but the design just wasn't what I needed, so I returned it and stuck with the Ergobaby...which my baby girl absolutely loves.

title: So sweet-a tad too stretchy
author: Sean&Amanda
comments: I love this. True to color and very comfortable. I do not have another brand to compare it to, but I do feel like, while the stretch provides comfort and ease, you do have to re-do it fairly often. I would always have to keep a hand on my daughter (even at newborn stage), because it would really begin to sag. If you have a baby that really loves to be extremely tight and you get really good at tying it, this would probably be perfect. I still used it and I still think I would prefer the stretch to none at all, but it's not 100% hands-free in my opinion. It is super soft and I do enjoy using it!

title: Love it
author: Anonymous, GA
comments: I love my wrap. It gives me freedom to do some chores while carrying the baby. It is very easy to tie as long as you follow the instructions provided.

title: I wouldn't buy it again
author: Lauren
comments: It was useful a few times but in general - it is complicated to get on and you have to continuously readjust it. I used it a few times to go to the grocery store and a few times out to eat but mostly it was too much of a hassle. The reason why it gets two stars? Since I used it with my infant he sat pretty far into the thing and when you ran into strangers in public - they never had enough gall to touch your baby when they had to basically reach down your shirt to do it. Soooo.... it kept the old ladies away. I liked that part.

title: Kinda hot.
author: Kim C.
comments: I don't know about all the talk about heat regulation, because when I'm in this thing around the house at 74 degrees, in less than 30 mins, the baby and I are sweating our buns off. Also, I have a wiggler, and if he can't wiggle because it's too tight, he gets frustrated and cries and I have to take him out. If I tie it any looser, the wrap is at my knees before I know it. It's depressing cause even though it's easy to put on, it does take some time, and when it's ruined in 30 mins, it's a big bummer.I like the concept of this, and the wrap is more comfortable than wearing a carrier minus the heat. If you don't live in a hot area, or it's winter or something, this will work better for you. It's quality made and feels very soft.

title: Excellent first wrap for a new mama!
author: Sarah
comments: This is an amazing thing to have with a newborn baby.  The feeling of having your baby close, against your chest, secure and comfortable is priceless.  It worked great until my son was 5ish months old, then I had to move on to a full-buckle carrier.  I wore it nearly every day.  Highly recommend.

title: BEST wrap for newborns!
author: ShepherdClan
comments: I have loved using my Boba wrap, which I ordered when my daughter was three weeks old. The wrap keeps her snug and safe against my chest, and she has been much less fussy since I started wearing her during the day. She can sleep in it, and I'm working on figuring out how to nurse her in it. I flew across the country with her at 6 weeks and she stayed happily in the Boba through the airport, through, security and during the flight, only letting out a small squeak when she was hungry or wet.Before using the Boba, I tried two different slings (I thought they didn't provide enough neck support and she always looked "scrunched" in them) as well as our Ergo Baby carrier. The Ergo (with infant insert) is a GREAT carrier, but it's summertime and my baby would get hot inside the insert while outside.Now my baby is two months old and weighs 13 pounds. It's a bit harder on the back if I am standing or walking for long periods of time, but as an "in home" babywearing system, it's still my favorite. I recommend the Boba to all my friends and the random pregnant women I see :-)

title: A gift for my son and daughter in law
author: SC Mom and Nana
comments: My son and daughter in law had a hard time getting this on.  They felt it took two people to get it wrapped securely and they decided they wanted an easier option.  I am going to have to return it.

title: Love it
author: Kristi Thomas
comments: I love my Boba wrap and so does my daughter, every time she gets fussy I wrap her up and she falls asleep in no time. It has saved my back! It is so easy to use and so comfortable for the both of us.

title: Its Okay
author: graynbruce
comments: After having my baby, I had a hard time not having my hands free to get more done around the house.  I received a sport carrier from a shower but it was best used when my child could support himself more.  So I decided to purchase a wrap mainly to be more hands free for my infant (0-3 months).  It is not as hands free as its made out to be.  The material is a stretchy/slinky type material.  It can be pulled very tight or kept loose.  If you wrap it too loose your child is not very secure and bounces around a lot with little head support.  The instructions tell you that it should be tight enough to pull the child into you.  If its too tight, its uncomfortable for you and the baby.  When it seems to fit well, I find my child still bounces around a lot and you have to still support him with your hands (like your hugging your baby like in the picture).  If I lean over at all I have to hold on to him and support his back and neck.  It really doesn't allow me to do much more with the wrap than without it.  I tried to do some things around my yard too but we both ended up very sweaty.  The material itself does not seem too hot but when you press a little body next to yours and wrap it tight, it gets hot!  Even inside my child would be sweating after wearing it for a little while.  My expectations were much higher than the outcome. If you are looking at buying this to free yourself up to do all your chores, its not as free as it sounds.  It helps a little (I was able to wash some dishes okay but had trouble with anything that requires bending over or much movement) so I gave it 3 stars.

title: works best for tiny baby
author: jesslwin
comments: I used this more when my baby was smaller. Now that he's larger (over 10lbs) he doesn't like to be wrapped so tightly. Wish I had bought it for when he was just a few weeks old because I would have gotten more use out of it. Maybe I just need to look up different ways to wrap him up, but I think he's ready for a different carrier at this point.It is really soft, easy to use once you get the hang of wrapping it around you (only took like 5 times to memorize instructions correctly). Baby did have poop explosion while being carried it in one day and it washed clean nicely.

title: Love this wrap
author: Mom2four
comments: I love this wrap. I have 4 kids so I have probably tried all of the wraps ever made and this is my favorite! I love it because it is stretchier than the moby and feels lighter to me on hot summer days.

title: Must have!
author: Ellis Others
comments: I bought this for my best friend who just had her first baby. Since neither one of us had any experience with baby products, we were buying products based off of internet research and reviews. This product got good reviews, and the product's website raved about the comfort and health benefits for the baby. My friend's baby is now a month old, and she started using it. She and the baby both love it. She said that he prefers to be in the Boba carrier rather than in a swing or car carrier, and she enjoys it because she can do other things around the house. She said that she is also comfortable taking the baby out in public with this carrier. Her husband also used the item and said it was great. They both said it was a little long, but not enough to get in the way. They both like the color. The only complaint is that sometimes the baby would start to get warm after a while, but it is the middle of July.  I would highly recommend visiting the official website for more information.

title: wonderful!!
author: ryansgirl1
comments: I love this wrap! the directions make it easy to wear and baby always falls asleep when he is being carried in it.

title: Boba Wrap
author: Meaghan DeLore
comments: I love this wrap because it is super easy to use and comfortable. It makes outings so much easier when I can use this and my baby loves it too.

title: Best wrap out there
author: Jessica
comments: I bought this wrap after my lactation consultant suggested it. I was given the Moby wrap as a gift and also have the Baby K'Tan. The Boba works much better for me than the Moby. The fabric is stretchier and more lightweight. My baby and I get too hot in the Moby and it's harder to adjust the size to get my baby secured properly. I suggest having the Boba and the K'Tan - the K'Tan is great for short outings, but not nearly as snuggly or comfy as the Boba. Love the Boba!

title: I love it, and so does my son!
author: Emily McManama
comments: This is a great beginners wrap!  With the help of a Boba sponsored youtube video I was able to learn how to use this wrap fairly easily.  Once I got the hang of it my son and I love it, I was wearing him in it starting at 1 week old.  He loves to go out and about in it, and usually falls asleep.  It's easy to take on and off, stretchy, soft, comfortable.My only two complaints are with any wrap like this, not just the Boba - 1) It being July, its a lot of fabric and tends to get hot and 2) you have to have it on in order to put the baby in it, so you have to plan ahead if you are going out and about, and have to literally wear the wrap when you leave the house.  Now that I have mastered my Ring Sling I have been using the Boba a little less frequently.  But I'm sure as it gets cooler I will still use the Boba, and it will still be preferably to the ring sling if I'm gonna be walking for a while, as it is a little more ergonomic and symmetrical (The ring sling hurts my back after a while, the Boba does not cause me pain as long as I get it tight enough!).

title: LIVE in this wrap and LOVE it
author: ariw
