comments: Huge fan! My little guy is almost 3 months old and I use this every day---this is how I get things done around the house and how he naps every day! I have washed it at least 10 times and it is still in perfect shape. I am going to buy another one it is so great.

title: Sweaty, complicated and awkward
author: SpaceRocket
comments: Honestly I wanted to love this but it is not easy. And I need easy, convenient, cool (temp wise) and safe feeling. This was none of these. It took me watching the YouTube 3 times before I could tie it properly (which makes me sound like an idiot but I swear I'm not - just an anxious first time mom). And then getting baby into it was frustrating for both mom and baby. Not convenient if you are parked on a busy street trying to get sleepy baby out of a carseat and onto you to go shopping etc. - not good for the busy city mama AT ALL. And it didn't feel safe enough, it was super sweaty in the summer AND it scrunched baby up uncomfortably unless I was constantly re-adjusting. Major fail. Seriously I tried it a number of times and a variety of situations. We ended up going with the Bjorn - lightening fast, easy, comfy, breathable and safe... And Dad will wear the Bjorn. I know there are die-hard wrappers out there and respect to you for sure (are you also super good at mazes and puzzles?) - but I haven't got time for all that.

title: Yes!
author: Haley Gordon
comments: I love this when my baby is fussy and wants to be close to me but I need my hands free to do stuff around the house.  Good quality and easy to use, we both love it. It can get a little warm however, so when I use it, I strip my little one down to his diaper to help us keep cool.

title: Really comfortable; Easier Than Moby!
author: Krobin
comments: I was really skeptical about baby wraps. I resisted when I had my first son and just waited until he was big enough for a more traditional carrier. However my second son is a baby that wants to be held all the time and nurses super frequently, so a friend of mine basically forced one of these upon me.I tried the Moby and the Boba and I prefer this one for a few reasons.1) It's stretchy so you can pull the straps tighter for a more secure, snug fit.2) The fabric is more breathable which is really good for summer babies since it's not as hot. Also, the fabric has a nicer, softer feel.3) It ties in the front instead of the back so it's comfortable to sit down in.Also, it's less expensive!I wrap it before I leave the house so I can just grab baby out of the carseat and put them in for errands.After you get over the initial confusion of wrapping this it's a breeze to pop baby in, go about your day, and nurse in this. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you have a baby that loves being snuggled.

title: Tried
author: Naveed S.
comments: I tried but found it inconvenient. But def liked it better than the k'tan and ergo insert. I didn't try the moby.

title: Boba Wrap
author: lori ralph
comments: This is a high quality wrap. The grey color makes it nice either my son or daughter-n-law to wear when they take our granddaughter for a walk

title: Amazing wrap!
author: mbk
comments: I bought this wrap bc my baby is almost 11lbs and started causing me shoulder pains. She cries in carseat so I carry her for walks in hand. Watched video on you tube and it literally takes 2 mins to wrap... There is a reaaly good video with a girl in a green wrap! She makes it look easy and it truly is easy to wrap this around your body. Put my baby in and fixed her feet in the "m position" and adjusted her-- she squirmed for 10 secs and fell fast asleep. Material is soft and she feels secure! I love it!! I can cook, eat ...no wonder those African women carry their babies in wraps all day! Get this and save yourself shoulder pains. Hoping my back doesnt start hurting tho.

title: love it!
author: Lauren Murawski
comments: easy to put on once you practice a few times. The fabric is pretty and it holds my new baby and my toddler (at different times, of course) with the same level of snugness and security. The only con is that the straps drag on the ground when you are putting it on, but it washes easily and that is just the nature of the beast when you are working with a wrap style carrier.

title: nice soft wrap
author: Lauren
comments: I like how soft and stretchy the material is on this wrap carrier.  Instructions were clear and easy to follow and it holds the baby firmly.

title: love love love
author: kd
comments: i bought this as a gift for my sister in law and she absalutely loves it. In fact we take it everywhere with us and use it almost every day when needed. i highly reccommened the boba wrap! also it is very easy to wrap, and the baby always falls asleep while in it. :)

title: A lil hot for summer
author: Sneed
comments: Love the wrap, works great! I can cook an clean and carry my son around when he's being fussy! Only downfall is I am sweating like crazy in this and so does my son! It's awfully toasty! It's be great in cooler weather but I'm gonna look for something cooler for the summer!

title: Boba Wrap
author: Schneider
comments: I was a pro by the second time I wore it. Easy to use and not bulky. I keep it on as I drive store to store. Put my daughter in it and shop. She's happy and so am I. Very versatile. I can wear her forward, backward or on my hip. Adjustable, so I can get her in there nice and tight and very easy on my bad back. Love it.

title: A LOT of fabric to try to manage...
author: riirca37
comments: So I buy that wearing your baby is a great thing.  I wore my first a lot and she seemed happier for it.  My midwife suggested this wrap for my second who is a bit fussier than my first.  But this wrap, while comfortable, was totally unmanageable for me.  I read the instructions and tried the wrap a few times, but all the adjusting (and not just of the wrap, but the baby once in, your clothes, the tie as the material stretches out, etc) was just too much for me and makes this wrap, in my opinion, impractical.  It was difficult for me to imagine trying to use this while out running errands - it just takes too long to get just right.  I have a Bjorn that I just slip on, drop him in and buckle him up and it takes seconds.  While I thought I was in the market for a better carrier, so far nothing has topped the Bjorn.

title: Great product
author: Joshua R. Johnson
comments: I've used other front baby carriers, and they have really hurt my back. I have carried my 4 month old around in it all day and my back did not hurt at all. It is not that hard to figure out how to wrap it around you, but I got a little confused on how to put my baby in the carrier once I got it all wrapped around me. My son loves it, and almost every time I put him in it and carry him around he falls asleep. It's great. Has helped me get many things done around the house for sure! Also, I'm a heavier person and some carriers just don't fit around me comfortably. But this works for me. It is a "one size fits all" carrier. It custom forms to you. I love it!

title: Great carrier
author: ashrews
comments: This wrap is super comfortable for me to wear and it is the only carrier my baby liked being in for the first few months.  It was easy to learn how to wrap- just wrap it tight enough to keep baby supported high on your chest.  I use it for trips to the grocery store and walks around the neighborhood.  The only downside has been that I live in TX and it is already in the 90's every afternoon, and this wrap gets hot, with all the fabric around you.

title: boba wrap
author: Catherine Kutz
comments: I was really excited to get this wrap, hoping it would be more comfortable than the front carrier I received as a shower gift. However, it is a bit complicated to put on and even in very mild spring weather I was burning up in this (and I'm very thin)! My baby didn't seem uncomfortable and even fell asleep in it while I did some chores around the house. I'd recommend having a wrap carrier, but wearing it with minimal clothing on top or using it on cooler days.

title: Love it!
author: Onna
comments: I will admit this wrap takes some getting used to but once you get the hang of it, it's awesome! The fabric is stretchy so it forms to fit baby and you. I love how anyone can use it and it comes with a nifty carrying bag for ease on the go! It's perfect to tuck it in the car just in case I need it while we are out and my daughter loves to nap in it during the day (helps with her reflux!).

title: THE BEST WRAP EVER!!
author: Momof3
comments: I own two of these wraps and I absolutely love them!  Our little one fits snug and I have no back pain carrying him around!  He's two moths old so I've only used the one position.  As they grow there are many options as to how you carry them!  Great wrap!

title: Great for young babies
author: h. Richards
comments: I do love the wrap, however I wish it had less stretch.  After wearing it for a while or moving around alot, baby starts to slide down into wrap.  I do not have it on loose, he is perfect at first.  But after bending and twisting to say sweep the floor or what have you, it no longer keeps him supported against me.  The wrap doesn't let him fall, but he slides down into the pocket.  So while I love the comfortable feel of this wrap, it doesn't seem to be good of youre doing anything other than walking.  I'm considering either the air 3g, or ergo.  I definitely love wearing him on this wrap...until it starts to sag.  I'm actually going to make my own and see if I can't find a happy medium between this and the no stretch moby that I'm also going to make.  Had I known how simple this was, I would probably have just made it myself.  I would recommend this to someone with a small baby, but not so much over 10lbs or so

title: Life saver.
author: Kelly812
comments: The wrap is a huge, and a little tough to figuer out how to wrap it the first time, but when I figured it out and stuck my baby in it and he went to sleep my back thanked me immediately and I suddenly had my arms free.

title: not sure....
author: simplydawn
comments: Figuring out how to use it wasn't the problem..... I was worried about the safety of my newborn grandchild.  You definitely have to hold on to the baby when you are doing normal things around the house or shopping.  You can use your hands freely in some circumstances so I do like that.... but,  its a little bulky feeling and you wouldn't want to wear it in the summertime....  Don't love it, but its ok.

title: Cute & super comfortable
author: Ashley
comments: Very comfortable and distrubutes the weigh evenly on shoulders & back.  My baby is pretty heavy so I like how light it made him feel. :)

title: LOVE it!
author: Vanessa
comments: Before I bought this wrap I had done so much research on wraps that I even went to a wrapping demo class and this Boba was the best one. I bought it because I work @ home on the computer and phone and need my hands to work it keeps my baby in place unlike the moby it has no stretchy Don't like it.. with this wrap I can just wrap him up without having to measure the space. I just simply wrap him and he stretches it to his fit very comfy.. I rather carry my son in the Boba then in my arms because he doesn't feel as heavy in my Boba the weight evens out which makes it more comfy. My Son falls asleep so much better!! This wrap is even better the a carrier because the child is more @ eye level the carriers are just too low and opens there legs too much and bad for the crotch area. By far this wrap is the best way to carry your child not to mention is GREAT for bonding.. My son is 6 months now and I still use my Boba and will continue for much more months :) It's not just for infants you can learn different types of wraps for your growing child

title: Easy to Use
author: Sharon Gordon
comments: This item is easy to use and very comfortable, my baby falls right asleep in it.  It also helps my back!

title: Better then Moby wrap!!
author: Cheng Family of 4
comments: I love this wrap and like how it has a bit of a stretch to it where as my Moby doesn't. It is comfortable to wear and the black goes with anything. It's also much easier to fold then the other 2 brands I own. I will add that this is the best carrier wrap for any plus size mom or even dad!!!!

title: Boba Wrap vs Moby Wrap
author: Jasahm
comments: My first baby was born in December of 2012.  I was given two Moby wraps as gifts before he was born, and had even given a Moby wrap as a gift to a friend before I had a baby.  A few weeks after he was born I decided to try the Moby, I figured out the wrap part pretty quickly but I couldn't figure out how loose to wrap it to fit my rapidly growing baby.  After a few attempts I finally gave up.  After another few weeks I became really irritated by the fact that I had two perfectly good wraps, but that I didn't want to use them.  I contacted a woman in my town who sells all types of baby carriers (Frogmamma) and went to see her.  She showed me the Boba wrap, I fell in love.  It was the same type of wrap carrier that I wanted, but the material was stretchier (and softer to the touch) compared to the Moby.  You tie it so it is snug against your body and then put baby in, the material stretches to the perfect fit everytime.My son is now 5 months old and 16 pounds.  We still use the Boba wrap (I have two) constantly.  In those first few months it would help to calm him down during his fussy moments, which always happened in the morning.  This wrap allowed me to actually get breakfast while he would sleep.  I bought another Boba wrap and keep it in the center console of my car.  If I know in advance that I will be using it, I will put it on before leaving the house so I don't have to do it in the parking lot.  That is the only con about this type of baby carrier.  It's long and will drag on the ground while you put it on.

title: Too much of a hassle.  Try Baby K'tan instead.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I really wanted to love this wrap.  I got it when my first was 1 month old.  I used it until she was old enough for a simple front carrier.  That was sooo much easier to put on.  My second seems to be heavier, so the simple carrier isn't comfortable for me and she is only 4 months old.  So, I keep trying to make this wrap work.  But, it is too difficult to put on in a moment, especially out of the house (it drags on the ground), so I tried putting it on before I leave the house.  Usually that is when baby falls asleep in the carseat and all that is for naught.  So, I get uncomfortable and take it off. Then it fills an entire seat of my mini van.  I guess this works for some moms, but right now, with a barely 2 year old and an infant, I need something a bit more convenient.  Plus, I need something that takes less space in the diaper bag due to needing supplies for two!

title: Awesome
author: Julygirl
comments: I love this baby carrier. I used it from when my son was born (he was 8lbs 6oz) until he was 2 - 3 months old. Then he was too heavy for the boba and I started using a different carrier. But the boba is great for the beginning. You can carry your baby around in the house and clean or cook or just sit on the couch. The mostly sleep all the time anyway. And of course they're great for taking walks outside. I can only recommend it. I gave mine to a friend and she said that this was one of two items she didn't want to miss. She (and her husband too) used it all the time. And I just ordered another one for a neighbor who just had a baby and she also likes it a lot.

title: Magic for baby with GERD
author: S. Dixon
comments: My baby is struggling with reflux, and his medication still hasn't taken away episodes of pain.  When he is fussy and nothing else will soothe him, the MAGIC solution is to go for a walk with him in his Boba wrap. It holds him upright, which is important for the reflux and you can't do in a sling.  The closeness is soothing to him, and the bouncing lulls him to sleep no matter how upset he has been.Our baby was a preemie, and he didn't weigh enough for a lot of the infant carriers.  We could use the Boba right away, even though he was still quite small, which was very nice.  It's also well balanced for walking, and I think I'm getting a nice little extra leg workout.  Free hands are a real bonus for dog-walking.The only downside is that it is a bit of production getting him in and out, especially in the beginning when he is fussy.  For us, however, it is totally worth it.

title: love my Boba wrap!
author: Ms Bacon
comments: I absolutely love my wrap! I wear it all the time. I breastfeed in it with my 11 week old baby boy. He falls asleep in it almost right away no battery how fussy he is. It's definitely womb like to him. It makes taking care of my two year old easier, we don't have to take the double stroller everywhere.The only con i can think of is it's getting too hot to wear out in the sun with him. He's fine and doesn't overheat, but I'm sweating and uncomfortable. So lately I've been just using it around the house.Wonderful buy overall, totally worth the money.

title: Doesn't fit right!
author: akceb
comments: Hard to put on by yourself, and I am almost always alone.  The instructions don't help a whole lot .

title: Boba Wrap- Gray
author: NHBoucher
comments: Purchased this for a baby shower gift as it was her request list. She was very pleased with it and glad to have received it.I did not use persaonlly so I do not have a full review as as an end user.

title: Great Wrap, Don't Love the Material
author: LRiley
comments: Love this wrap. Took me a while to get the hang of it, but the online resources are wonderful to show you how to do it, step by step. My baby loves to be carried in it. I couldn't put her down for several months and this was a lifesaver. My only criticisms - the material is very hot during the summer. I thought black would be a good option and "go" with all my outfits, but I didn't think through the hot North Carolina temperatures in the summer. Both my baby and I "cook" while outside in this thing. Also, the material tends to pick up dog hair very easily.If I had to do it again I'd order a different color, but it's still a stellar product!

title: Great product!
author: Sarah
comments: I can hold my baby while making lunch for my other children. I don't let my son sleep in it, unless I need to because I still want him to sleep in his crib and not get used to always being held.

title: It is nice.
author: Janet
comments: It is the same as what I expected. Nice color, comfertable material, easy use after practice several times, especially combined with a package bag, make store easy more.

title: Wanted to love it...
author: kkyhung
comments: I bought this with high, high hopes before my baby was born. I loved the idea of carrying him around in a sling to keep him close to me while freeing up my hands to run errands. Alas it was not meant to be.My baby was born in October and we tried the sling many times. The first few weeks after he was born, he would last about 30 minutes in it before screaming to get out. As time went on, it got worse. He started getting hysterical within 5 minutes of me putting him in it and ultimately, I gave up. I'm not entirely sure why he hated it so much, my only guess is that he found it way too hot. Even in just a onesie, he still cried to be taken out after a short time.My other complaint with the wrap is that it is sooo long. It's not a problem if you're putting it on at home but if you're out in public, it's not ideal to have all the fabric dragging on the floor as you set it up.I ended up selling this on Craigslist - if it works for you, I have no doubt that it's amazing but sadly, it wasn't the case for me.

title: very comfortable
author: Umm Ibrahim
comments: Very comfortable, alot better then the ones that buckle and have straps.. they use to kill my shoulders! Wrapping is easy once you get the hang of it a few times. Watching a video on youtube was much easier for me then looking at the pictures. Very comfortable soft fabric... Thanks!

title: Not easy to use
author: Love Joy Sy
comments: Not easy to use, especially in the matter of adjusting the tightness of the wrap so that the baby fits properly.

title: so much better than a moby
author: L. faisca
comments: i would definitely recommend this product. because it has some spandex in it (i think 3%), it's just enough to give you that stretch so its fits just right. i had a moby before this and i would either tie it too tight or too loose. this one alwys goes on just right. it's also more comfortable and easier to get your baby in, compared to a moby. i'm glad i returned my moby and got a boba!!

title: I LOVE this wrap!
author: LH
comments: I've tried many baby carriers, and for my newborn son, this is the best carrier that has worked for us. It's like magic - I put him in, and he's asleep within 10 minutes, and stays asleep until his next feeding (2-3 hours)! Other carriers I tried (Baby K'Tan, Joovy Baba sling, Lillebaby Nordic Carrier) that all said they were newborn-safe just didn't feel right. None of them supported his head well, and therefore I couldn't be totally hands free when walking and doing things around the house. The Boba wrap supports my son's head perfectly where he can sleep and be comfortable and I can be hands free! I absolutely love it. I bought the Boba 3G carrier as well for when he's older. I really like the Boba products and have already recommended this wrap to many new mommies! Actually they are the ones that ask me about the awesome wrap I'm wearing my son in and I tell them all about Boba. :) I don't write many reviews on here, but I am very passionate about this so wanted to share with others. Buy the Boba wrap for your newborn - you won't regret it!

title: Boba Wrap
author: Momma's Bacon
comments: I kept hearing the hype of the Boba Wrap Baby Carrier and wanted to check it out for myself.  I can see now why so many people are voting this as the best baby carrier out there!  The stretchy material keeps baby in place and tying the wrap in a criss-cross angle gives much support without a ton of adjustments.  This is also a great wrap for the novice!

title: Great quality wrap
author: Ernie
comments: This was a gift for my sister and she has only good things to say. She said the fabric seems very durable but breathable, likes the print and after a little experience was able to put it on easily. Mostly, she loves bring able to use her hands and keep baby protected from adoring siblings!

title: So far so good.
author: Thop
comments: Just received my Boba wrap in black. I've been wanting a carrier or wrap, This wrap had decent reviews and the weight limit was 35lbs which is awesome since I am just now getting one for my 11 month old daughter. I wrapped it fairly quickly considering I've never done it before, placed my daughter in it(can be tricky) and we went walking around the house. She was content and enjoy being close to me. I'd recommend this product for sure, It's easy but secure which is great for a first time wrap user. I also purchased a Boba 3g carrier for back carrying.If anyone is curious, it's a very long wrap, I feel as if it would accommodate lots of body types, it's also comfortable to wear and spreads the weight out evenly over your back and shoulders. I wish I would have gotten this when my daughter was a newborn. I'll probably purchase this again for a baby shower gift. Good product and great price, can't beat it.

title: Hard to use and intimidating
author: Jayde S Gater
comments: When I pulled the wrap out of the box I was immediately overwhelmed by the length of material. I couldn't figure out how to use it and gave up quickly. I ended up purchasing a carrier that was more structured and easier for me to figure out. Someone with more patience may be able to tolerate this product. Pros - it was soft and stretchy material that felt good.

title: Great carrier!!
author: Kristy Shrock
comments: This is a great product!! I was hesitant at first until speaking with a friend who owned one. It's actually a breathable material so you don't get overheated wearing your baby. It's comfortable for you and the little one! It takes some "getting used to" when you tie it on yourself... But once you know it; it's done in less than a minute!

title: works for little dogs as well!
author: Cheryl Leland
comments: Sounds odd but our little dog (9lbs) had a dislocated knee and the vet wanted him to rest it for 2 weeks. The only way we knew we could accomplish that was if we held him most of the time .....this worked! It is a lot of fabric to deal with when the pakage is so small.

title: It's ok
author: ej119
comments: I like the wrap once its on but it is really long (like 15 feet maybe) and I couldn't see anyone putting this on while they're out and about. It would be all over the floor...gross! I wish I would've known that before I bought it cause I wouldn't have got it.

title: Great product-smooth transaction.
author: carrie p huhn
comments: I absolutely love this wrap. My little guy loves to be close to me. It's so nice to have my hands free. Also wearing him as a newborn deters people from wanting to hold him which worried us with a preemie. The material is much more stretchy than the moby wrap which makes it so much easier to get tied the right tightness.  LOVE IT!!

title: Not too hard to put on alone
author: RemiNix
comments: Once you get the hang of it, it seems to go on quite easily. I have learned how to position my son so I can breastfeed him discretely. I highly recommend practicing at home, as with anything new it takes a minute to get the hang of, but youtube has great videos. I absolutely love how my husband can also use this wrap and he says it is comfortable. I am ordering a second one in a lighter color for summer.

title: I have my arms back!
author: cottagehome
comments: Baby loves it and goes right to sleep. Fabric is soft. Took a few tries to learn the wrapping technique but now we have it down.

title: Love my Boba wrap! Cute & comfortable for mom & baby!
author: K House
comments: Me and baby both are so very comfortable wearing the Boba wrap. Tricky getting it on tight enough, you are good to go!

title: New Name still a great product!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: The Boba Wrap used to be called Sleepy Wrap, but it merged with Boba and became the Boba Wrap. I received one when I was a new mom and I could not have lived without it. I purchased this for a friend who is having a baby. It is my go-to gift for baby showers now. This is a great gateway carrier for a new mom. Easy to use, easy to care for, great for kangaroo care and great for breastfeeding. If you are thinking about a wrap - get this one. You will not be disappointed.

title: very comfortable
author: LBrunney
comments: I bought this so I could get some things done around the house with my 6 week old.  I have an Ergo but he's a little small for it.  I had a Moby with my last baby but the fabric was stiffer than the Boba so there wasn't alot of stretch and it would sag easily.  The boba material is more stretchy so it's easy to breastfeed in and still sturdy enough to hold his weight.  He has been sleeping in this thing for an hour now.  Loving it so far!

title: Boba wrap... Why did I not discover you earlier???
author: Peachmango
comments: I nearly went insane during the first month of my baby. He was a fussy one and you need to be constantly on the move to please him! One sleepless night, I finally had the genius idea of looking up baby carriers on Amazon. I finally stumbled to this one and with the amazing reviews. Decided to try it.OH EM GEE... lifesaver! I finally found what my baby was looking for. And as an occupational therapist, I loved how you can orient your child to facilitate attachment to mom as well as the perfect positioning of the legs. Our friend gave us one of those carriers that had the legs dangling and I was dubious with those. The Boba is made of a stretch fabric so it allows some moving and squirming of my baby as well as shaping to my body. It also encourages correct alignment of the hips by using the frog-leg position or the hip hugging position.I will admit that it took a couple of times to learn how to tie it. Not because it was difficult but how to make it FASTER! With a fussy child, you always want to know how to make shortcuts of things. After maybe 5 times of wearing it on and off, I can have this thing on for less than a minute.

title: Comfortable and Simple
author: JenniF
comments: I used a different kind of baby carrier for my other children, but decided to try a wrap-style for my youngest. I absolutely love the Boba Wrap. It is very comfortable, and I didn't realize how easy it is to tie. It seems intimidating at first, but after a few tries, it is fast. The fabric is soft with just enough stretch to give a nice snug, comfortable fit. I love using it, and I love how easy it is to wash and dry... much easier than washing my Becco.

title: Arrived super quick.
author: beth999
comments: I haven't got to use this yet since my due date is in March, but it arrived SUPER quick. We're stationed overseas in Germany and have an APO address, so anytime a purchase gets to us in days (and not weeks or months) it's impressive. This is the exact color I ordered and is in perfect condition. Can't wait for the baby to get here so we can use it!

title: Boba wrap
author: Anna S
comments: Haven't used it yet but Love the stretchy material. Seems like I won't have to keep re-adjusting it for a good fit

title: Amazing!
author: AB
comments: Amazing product!  Easy to use and our 3 month old could not be happier.  Freeing up your hands to get stuff done around the house while still being close to the little guy is great.  Awesome product, would reccomend to all moms!

title: Awesome!!!!!
author: Alli
comments: Baby loves this wrap! Calms him instantly when fussy. Falls asleep within minutes. Also, great when asleep, because the wrap can support his head. Highly recommended!

title: Great wrap
author: Chitown0825
comments: Very easy to use and I love the stretchy material.  Makes it very easy to put my little in and also take her out.

title: It's great! Glad I bought it!
author: Sage
comments: The product got here very quickly. I use it all the time. It's just kind of hard to adjust it to where its not too tight or too loose.

title: Not for the sleep deprived, clumsy, hurried, or easily frustrated
author: V
comments: I'm trying all sorts of carriers because I'm looking for one my son (1 month old) likes and that I can get him in and out of fast enough and smoothly enough to avoid him getting revved up. This is not the carrier for us. It is essentially a very, very long strip of high quality sweatshirt-like material... and it will definitely take some practice getting on (the parent) and then getting the kid in. If you have a placid child - this maybe for you! If you have time or are someone who isn't clumsy, this may be for you. I made through trying it twice and gave up.Also gave up on ring sling style carriers too. I have an Ergo with infant insert, but I don't like how the infant insert sits, but I figure it will work better when he is bigger and no longer needs the insert. I also have a friend's Bjorn -- that is fairly quick to get in and out of too. I just wanted to see if I could find one of the softer, wrap-type carriers that kept you in close contact with your baby because generally that is where my son likes to be, but the jostling (and my ineptness?) makes the Boba (and the ring sling) not useful.

title: Love love love it!
author: Mommy of one
comments: Before I had a simple front carrier & now that I have the boba I absolutely love it! My daughter love it more then the front carrier & it's so much safer for her as well. I recommend it to any parent & it's worth the money :)

title: I absolutely adore my Boba Wrap
author: Amanda H.
comments: I have had other styles of wraps before but I love the fabric that Boba uses for their wraps. It is stretchier but holds its shape better. With other wraps I found myself adjusting as the hours wore on because the fabric would begin to sag and lose its shape. I never had this issue with my Boba Wrap. Washing is also a breeze. I just toss it in the wash and then dry - nothing special.  I highly recommend this wrap.

title: Love!!
author: Jen
comments: I bought my wrap while still in the hospital after having my baby & it arrived the day we got home (love amazon prime!). I never used a wrap with my older daughter but did babywear her. After watching a few YouTube videos & practicing putting it on I really fell in love with it. It took practice in the beginning like any baby carrier I've used but once I got the hang of it it was perfect. I had a very difficult baby in the beginning (reflux, had to change formula a few times) & she didn't sleep well. The only way my newborn would nap for any period of time was when she was worn. She would sleep 2 hours in this carrier but if she wasn't in the carrier I'd get lucky if she would sleep 20 minutes.The wrap kept me sane...seriously.

title: Worth a million dollars
author: kristin
comments: I cannot overstate how much we LOVE the boba. We had been given a Bjorne & ergo used from friends but our 6 lb 8 oz baby disappeared in them. We looked for something for smaller than 8 lb babies online & tried the boba. Don't be intimidated by thinking its complicated to tie-- the picture directions that come with make it very easy. Once our little lady developed reflux & stopped sleeping well day & night, the boba absolutely saved us. She could sleep comfortably upright in it & I could still get things done. Now she sleeps well at night but is still a bad napper. When all else fails, putting her in the boba always always works. A friend at lunch was so amazed when my baby started to get tired & fussy, I popped her in the boba & she just passed out in 2 minutes.  :)My friend is pregnant & went home & added it to her registry! We run all kinds of errands and shop with this too-- so much easier than toting a car seat, my hands are free & baby is more snuggled and happy. Its made of very nice soft fabric & it washes well. I've even worn this on 100 degree days and while carrying a baby around will be hot in that weather no matter what, the fabric is surprisingly breathable. I'd give the boba 100 stars if I could. I will buy this for every pregnant friend from now on. It's one of my three all time favorite worth their weight in gold baby things (other 2 are rock & play sleeper & miracle blanket)

title: not spit-up friendly
author: Natassia
comments: i would not recommend this for babies who spit-up frequently, because it will end up all over your chest! it is also a ton of material for me (5 ft tall) and very hot.

title: Great beginner wrap
author: Breezy Bee
comments: We have one BOBA and one Ellaroo. The BOBA came first. It is GREAT for learning to wrap your baby. It is also great for when the baby is an infant for front carries. What a lifesaver. Your baby feels safe and you can get something done! We have since moved on to the Ellaroo. While the Ellaroo has a much harder learning curve because it's a stiff wrap, both my husband and I find that it distributes the weight of the baby better (especially as she gets bigger) and you can do back carries with it, which you CAN'T (or definately should not) do with any flexible wrap like the BOBA. Another major reason that we purchased the Ellaroo is that our baby was born in April. The BOBA was going to be way to hot and sweaty to carry our baby in during the summer. The Ellaroo is much more breathable and better for hot weather babies. FYI, YouTube has some GREAT videos for the BOBA (and other wraps) that explain how to get the thing on your body FAR BETTER than the booklet that comes with it. Watch them, you'll save yourself a lot of grief (I got grumpy with the wrap, grumpy with my poor husband... prior to watching the videos). Get a visual, you won't regret it. Even though I like my Ellaroo better, this is still a great wrap and one of the best baby gifts you could get for yourself or anyone you know that has a baby coming.

title: Fast shipping, well packaged, great product
author: Andre
comments: I love my boba wrap, still waiting for my baby to arrived but after a lot of research, reading boards, going to baby wear classes, the boba wrap was perfect for my summer baby!!

title: Love it
author: Dustin Brace
comments: I have used this wrap almost daily since having my daughter.  It is perfect for a newborn.  I also put my 11 month old niece in it (she weighs 19 pounds) and it worked wonderfully as well.  As long as you tie it tight enough around you, it should support your child and hold them close to you.  It is great to use to chase my 2 year old around in while still keeping baby close.  I have no complaints so far.  It does take a minute to get the wrap set up, but once its on you can just leave it on after you take baby out.  I leave it on while driving then put my daughter back in.  I can't recommend it enough.

title: Great Find!
author: Momma J
comments: I have been an avid user of a ring sling for over 8 years and 4 babies, but after using it for a few months on number 5 something had to give!  I don't know if I'm wearing this baby more or if I'm just getting weak, but I needed something to spread out his weight better.  I almost bought something similar to the Boba wrap, but then at the last second I read that this stretchy material actually works better, so I figured it was worth a shot!It took a minute to figure out the mechanics of putting it on (my brain just doesn't catch on to those things too quick!), but I got it on quicker than I thought I would and each time I use it I get a little better.  Baby fell asleep in there today while I was helping other kids with chores, so bending, moving things etc., and I didn't even notice the weight... it was awesome!  I'll definitely be using this all the time and may even have to purchase a few more colors.  I think this is a safe bet for anyone!  I've loved my sling and still use it for quick needs, but my body is SO much happier with the Boba wrap and I'm able to do a lot more with my other kids now.

title: Love the Boba and so did my little boy
author: CRanum
comments: I used the wrap the first 4 months with my son. Whenever he was fussy, just sticking him in it and walking around put him to sleep in 5 minutes or less. He is a big baby and it was nice that the wrap is snug but not too tight for him or I. I do not use it anymore because he is 4 1/2 months and weighs 15 lbs. It just isn't as comfortable for me to wear as the fabric seems a bit too stretchy for him now and I feel he slips around in it when I move around. We also have a Bjorn which is excellent for when the baby doesn't want to be held in so close. I have a friend who bought the Moby and she said she hated it and her baby didn't like being carried in it. She tried mine out and said my Boba is softer and more comfortable to wear. My only complaint is that it can be a little warm to wear (I think this is true of all the baby wraps carriers)and I wish I would have been able to use it longer but other than that its a great product.

title: complicated & uncomfortable!!
author: Jen L.
comments: I bought this wrap after reading many glowing reviews on both amazon & other sites.  I have been shown in person how to wrap this, but it is fairly complicated & needs practice.  I am a small person, so I have so much extra fabric that it is a problem.  I have tried wrapping the extra around my waist a few more times, but I end up feeling like I am being constricted by a boa constructor.  THe other downside w/ this wrap is that it is almost impossible to wrap when you are out of the house (you just end up dragging it around on the floor...).  The solution is to wrap it before you leave the house, but this was never comfortable for me.  And as the other reviewers say, it get's VERY warm for the baby....I am so disappointed in this product - I am sending it back to Amazon today & getting a baby K'tan instead.  Same concept, no wrapping needed!!!

title: Like stretchy fabric..just gets hot.
author: alissadg
comments: The stretchy fabric of this is great. It wasn't too difficult to get on, the instructions were very good. This is good for cooler temperatures. It gets really hot where I live, and I think this would be too warm for the little one.

title: Great for newborns...
author: Lee
comments: I purchased this wrap while pregnant with my second child after doing tons of research on baby carriers.  Never had one with my first but needed one now so I could still chase around my 2 year old.  First the good... the fabric is wonderful and the quality of Boba products is second to none.  And the wrap is great for a tiny newborn.  It keeps them close and snuggled to your chest which is exactly where they want to be.  Now the bad... my son is a big boy, 15 pounds at 9 weeks, and I don't feel like it supports him fully.  You could definitely feel the sag when his big butt was in it.  Maybe it was just me but I always felt like I had to keep one hand on him.  It wasn't super complicated to put on after some practice but not practical to throw on while out and about.  Since I had only used it twice, its now on its way back to Amazon.  I just received my Boba 2g organic carrier today in the mail.  This carrier has a minimum weight of 15 pounds so not an option for a newborn but will work great for my chunky baby.

title: love it!!
author: Noel
comments: Absolutely love this wrap! It is my first wrap and it makes my life so easy. My daughter will be 4 months this month and Ive used it since she was 2. No need for a bulky stroller at any store. It helps when she is fussy. I put her in it and shortly there after she is content, if not asleep. The fabric is stretchy and holds tight. If I want to breastfeed in it I just wrap it a tad lose. Then I can maneuver her a bit better for positioning. I've only used it in the winter so far, so I can't tell how hot it will be in the summer. The only downfall is that, to use it out of the house, I generally put it on before I leave and have to wear it around. But its still do able to put it on in public. if you don't like the idea of putting it on out in public, then getting it just for home use is still very much worth it!

title: I Can Move!
author: MrsC17
comments: I purchased this wrap after researching many popular brands. I love it. It does get warm after a while of your bodies being close together, but I have a December baby so it is actualy nice when I go for walks. My daughter is a Velcro baby and screams as soon as I put her down and nothing soothes her but being picked up again. I couldn't get any chores, errands, etc done which won't work for me since I also have a toddler. Now I just strap her on and go about my business and she usually just falls right to sleep. I do think this wrap will only work until she can really support her head as it isn't for outward facing babies. I imagine as my daughter gets bigger she won't want to be facing me but rather look around more. but for now it's wonderful. Wearing my baby higher on the chest also makes this wrap much easier on my back than my mai tai wrap carrier. While I can't do everything with this on, I am glad to at least be able to vacuum my house, sweep, fold laundry, etc.

title: High-Quality Stretchy Wrap & Great Company!
author: Lin Snow
comments: My daughter is 15 months old and 23 lbs. I was skeptical about using a stretchy wrap with her because she's a big kid, but I followed the tying instructions and it was very comfortable. Putting her into the wrap stopped the mid-afternoon "whinies" and makes her happy when she's teething. She sees the wrap and gets very excited to climb in! I'm looking forward to trying this wrap with a newborn in a few years. :)If you are using this wrap (or any stretchy wrap) with an older child, make sure that you follow the directions for bigger kids. If there is any pain or discomfort, re-tie it!Boba is also extremely approachable as a company and works very hard to connect with customers. I've been incredibly impressed with their customer service!(Disclosure: I am a Boba Ambassador, but all opinions are my own!)

title: Holds its shape, so comfortable
author: Drea
comments: I am a huge fan of the Boba Wrap. After trying many wraps similar, yet being dissatisfied with the way they held for longer periods of time, the Boba Wrap takes the cake. It is by far the most comfortable carrier. Hugs baby and you perfectly. The fabric is like butter!! I love how soft it is, yet how well it keeps its shape.I will say there is a small learning curve, but its small. Once you watch the videos Boba has showing how to use it, it is only a matter of time before you master this carrier. Enjoy!! and these make the best shower gifts btw.

title: Perfect starter wrap
author: R Coy
comments: As an experienced sling user I have never really liked stretchy wraps however, after trying the Boba Wrap I have been converted. The instructions are easy to follow and give even a novice a clear guide as to what to do. The babywearing safety material also provided helps to ensure the sling is used according to safe babywearing practises but allows the wrap to remain comfortable for both the mother/father/carer and child to wear. I would (and have) definately recommend purchasing this wrap if looking for a simple to use ergonomically designed sling.

title: Nice, stretchy, and much cooler than moby!
author: merebearsmommy
comments: I love this wrap carrier!  I purchased the moby a while back and ended up returning it.  It was way too hot, even in winter I was burning up with no baby inside...can't imagine summer time.  The boba/sleepy wrap is awesome!!!  It is a nice stretchy jersey knit type material that is really comfortable and cool.  Very much like a nice, quality t-shirt.  And, because of the stretch, I think it fits a lil better on fluffy mommas.  ;) No baby here yet, so I guess we will see how it performs...unfortunately I don't think I can convince my 4 yr old to get in, despite how much she enjoyed her carrier when she was little.  I also love that you can cover [newborn's] legs.  My 4yo loved her snugli when she was a baby, but she got a lil chilly on the legs.  I am very much looking forward to using this wrap with baby #2!

title: boba wrap
author: Upa
comments: Love, love, love it! I wish I had it with my first baby. I also have a ring sling( mayan wrap), boba wrap is waay more comfortable both for the baby and me. It is stretchy which makes the baby bounce nicely when you are on the move. What a lifesaver! I also have ergo carrier, which i also love, but boba wrap is definetely more comfortable to use with newborns and infants whereas ergo is great for 6 months and up. really love my new boba wrap. Was easy to learn how to tie it, great instructions. i bought it in olive dark green, lovely chic color.

title: fantastic!
author: Victoria
comments: I did a lot of research on baby carriers and wraps and decided on this "stretchy" for when the baby is little. It is so soft and wrapping really isn't that complicated. It has more stretch in it than the Moby wrap and I think that it will hold the baby more snugly with less drooping. My baby is still on the way, but I am totally in love with this wrap!

title: My baby loves this wrap
author: looker
comments: My daughter is a very active and alert 2 month old and when we're in public she likes to see everything which causes disturbances in quiet places.  With this wrap though she falls right to sleep on mommy's chest.  I guess it reminds her of the womb because she seems so comfortable in there and now I can take her places knowing she won't make a peep.

title: Perfect for Baby and Me
author: Roo
comments: My son and I both love the Sleepy Wrap. He is the kind that will usually only sleep in a crib, so I wondered about whether he would sleep in this when we go out and it's nap time. The great thing is that he does! The wrap seems a little complicated at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's really a cinch. It's comfortable and it holds my 25 lb. 7 month old very well. I love that it doesn't leave tons of red marks on his legs. I think it's comfy for him too b/c he never complains. Well worth the price.

title: Excellent purchase!
author: lhseverance
comments: This is the most comfortable carrier for both myself and my little one!  It distributes her weight across my body very well and she is so comfortable in it with either option of facing in or out.  It is actually much easier to manuever and adjust (although intimidating at first) than the more common front carriers and offers her much more support and stability.  With the baby bjorn-type carriers, I always feel as though they cut into my daughters thighs and force her arms in uncomfortable or unnatural positions, but this wrap allows her to move and be held close in a more flexible and fitted way.  The baby bjorn-type carriers also cause my shoulders to get sore and my back to strain.  My daughter is 7 months and 17 pounds...we went on a very light hike yesterday and was wearing it continuously for almost an hour and a half without any pain.  I have also used it (with a much looser adjustment) while she is sitting on my lap at restaurants or on lawn chairs at outdoor concerts and events.  It allows her to play and be a part of things while also keeping her exploring hands and mouth away from anything dangerous or inappropriate.  It also prevents her from falling or tipping while freeing up my hands.  My friend still uses it with her 18 month old at carnivals and outdoor events.  We both highly recommend this for families on the go!!  Also-I love the fun colors that you can chose from for the same price!  I have fun wearing the orange and don't mind wearing it even if she is out of it for a bit--makes it easier to get her in and out!

title: Easy to adjust but too hot
author: M. Brisson
comments: This wrap is great, easy to adjust, but it is simply too hot if you live in a hot weather like I do. In 2 minutes baby and I get so sweaty that I have to put her down. Maybe in winter time ?

title: A stretchier version of other wraps
author: Randa
comments: This is a great wrap. It does take a few times of trying on/wearing to get the wrapping down quickly and find ways to keep the long material from dragging. But my 6 pounder felt very secure in the wrap once I got her in there properly and she loves it. I can do dishes, shop, have her in the carrier during church service and she is content. My back did not feel strained as it did when I used a Bjorn carrier with my other children.I did end up returning this wrap and exchanging for a Moby Wrap after trying one in a store recently. They are almost exactly the same, but the Sleepy Wrap is stretchy in both directions of the fabric. The Moby Wrap stretches in only one direction which gave more of a secure feel to me. Some people may like the feel of more stretch, but it seemed after carrying for a while she sagged from the position she started in. Also, in my opinion, the Moby was not as hot as the Sleepy Wrap since it is 100% cotton. The Sleepy Wrap has 95% cotton and 5% spandex.

title: Great for smaller babies.
author: C. Reed
comments: Our daughter was born on the small side and the bjorn was just not safe during the first couple of months. This was the answer. Its remarkably easy to get the hang of, soft and washes easily. She loved it and we loved it. Even when she got to be a few months old this wrap worked beautifully at calming her down or soothing her when she was irritable. Great value.

title: Perfect!
author: Kayla Heaviland
comments: I LOVE this wrap!  It fits perfect for ALL sizes and carries the baby so close and comfy!  My back doesnt ache like with other carriers I have used in the past!  I definitley recommend to everyone!

title: not my favorite
author: kim
comments: I bought the sleepy wrap on the recommendation of a friend, but have found I never use it.  There are two main issues I have with it.  First, it is really warm, which makes wearing it with my baby in Arizona very uncomfortable.  Second, I bought a dark blue sleepy wrap, not realizing that it would collect lint, dog hair, etc. to such an extent I never had it on for more than a few minutes before I felt 'hairy'.  It's also really long, and it's hard to get on without having the ends hit the floor.  Waste of money for me.

title: Bad Quality
author: Jamila Fagge
comments: My LO loves being carried and I chose the sleepy wrap over the Moby wrap after reading the reviews. Unfortunately, I noticed today that my material is ripped for no apparent reason straight down the label front. After dropping $40, I wasn't expecting this at all.Also, the material gets hot easily, my LO gets so hot and sweaty! Sad to say, I'm shopping for another baby wrap after less than a month of owning the Sleepy Wrap.

title: comfortable and cozy!
author: C.M.N
comments: i love this wrap, i bought one for a friend who just adopted a baby and she wears her around the house all day to bond, it's so beautiful. my son sleeps so well in the wrap, but he does get really warm, even when i dress him down. I have to make sure he's not wearing too many layers since the fabric of the wrap has about 3 layers when it's all said & done. it takes a few tries to get it tied just right but once you've got it, you're good! Don't try it out when the baby is fussy, have it tied on to you and try them in it when they're calm, otherwise you'll get a bad impression of a great product!love it! wish i had the budget for all the colors!

title: My baby and I love it!
author: Traci Combs
comments: I had read many good reviews for the Sleepy Wrap when I decided to order mine. I was concerned that it might be difficult to wrap but I read the directions and got it right the very first time. When I put my baby in it I was surprised that he didn't fuss or cry like he did when I'd tried to get him into other carriers. He liked it right away and looked around curiously until he fell right asleep about 15 minutes later.Since then my baby has logged many hours hanging out in his Sleepy Wrap. It's been a wonderful way to keep him happily close to Mama and keep both hands free! It has also proved to be a good conversation starter since it's not how people are used to seeing babies carried. One man in the grocery store walked by trying to juggle his little girl with one arm and some produce in the other and said, "That looks so much easier than what I'm doing!"I only wish I'd had this with my other babies. It would have also been GREAT to have with a newborn! My baby and I love our Sleepy Wrap!

title: wonderful wrap
author: Regina
comments: I got this for my baby when she was 4 months old, and used it often while preparing dinner, or watching my toddler at the playground, etc.  It's a nice, hands-free way to connect with your baby.  I also found that I had less back pain with this wrap, than other carriers I tried.  I only wish I'd gotten it sooner!

title: better than expected
author: doula girl
comments: This arrived in a timely manner and is in wonderful condition, great directions, so easy to use once you learn how to wrap it, a wonderful way to carry your bay and be able to use your arms!

title: Amazing!
author: Katie M. A. Abeyta
comments: For my baby shower, someone bought me the Bjorn baby backpack. I never used it, because I was uncomfortable, and I figured so was my baby.I received this in the mail, and immediately put it to the test. He is actually asleep in it right now as I am writing this review. It is amazing, I would not use anything else!

title: wife loves it
author: Keith M. Jones
comments: My wife tried the moby wrap first and found that it was much too hot for the North Carolina climate.  Also, the material did not stretch enough to accommodate the Baby without quite a lot of experimentation. The Moby will go on ebay I am guessingThis one fixed both issues.  She is quite a bit happier with this one.Peace...

title: Love this product
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This is the best carrier it allows my baby to be close to me and is very secure. My colicy baby is calm when in this wrap and it allows me the freedom to get things done around the house. It has made christmas shopping possible I just put on the wrap go to the mall and slide baby into wrap. Comfortable for me to no back aches or sweating. I am a plus size women and found slings never fit right. that is not a problem with this wrap and it truely is one size fits all. I get asked about it everytime I wear it. This is a must have for a mother of 2 boys. I will be buying this as future baby shower gifts.

title: We couldn't live with out it.
author: Katy
comments: I got this carrier when I was pregnant with my first baby last spring.  Since the day she was born, this carrier has been awesome.  When she was very little and colicky, this was the only way to sooth her.  I think that was partially because when a small baby rides in this carrier, their knees are tucked into their tummies which helps to get rid of gas pains.I will say there was a month when we couldn't use it.  She was too big to be in the newborn hold and would slide to one side.  At the same time, she was too little to sit with her legs out.  Once she put on a little weight, we went back to using it often.My LO is now 9 months and we still use this carrier on a regular basis.  It's comfortable for both mom and dad.  We even take her hiking in it.  She still loves it, giggling and waving her arms as we walk through the trees.  It also makes for easy public nursing.  The fabric is very wide and can support her head and cover any wobbly bits.

title: Very good wrap
author: Lauren Kawaguchi
comments: I bought this wrap when my baby was about a month old- I was on the fence about babywearing and didn't know where to start. This wrap is an excellent introduction! The fabric is cotton and thick- it feels strong and slightly stretchy. The reason it is 4 stars and not 5 is that now that my baby is older, I have to make the wrap REALLY TIGHT before I put her in or else it starts to sag after about 20 minutes, which doesn't happen with the Moby wrap or probably others that have no stretch to them. I'm pretty petite (5'1") and making the wrap so tight means I have to wrap this around myself a few times, and that also gets hot. However, on cool days or for general use, it is very secure and my daughter does tend to go to sleep in it, so it does what it says!

title: buy it, you won't regret it
author: J. Campbell
comments: I had been using a phil&teds pepe carrier for the first 5 months, but once my boy started getting heavy it would dig into my shoulders and he didn't look so comfortable, even though it stated it's designed to accommodate much heaver and older babies.  After much research I decided to order the sleepy wrap in green.  It really is a beautiful shade and gender neutral.  The soft super stretchy fabric is really comfortable for both of us.  I watched several movies on YouTube about tying the wrap, and after the first try myself it was very easy.  I love that I can put it on at home, drive to the mall, then put my son in, without this big bulky mess up front.  Just pull it tight when your putting it on and you'll be fine.  Its easy getting baby into.  Once I have his legs in, I give him a bounce to get him into his final place before adjusting the fabric over my shoulders.I could seriously walk for miles and miles with this carrier.  My 5 month old loves it (I was worried about the transition), people comment all the time, and with living in the middle east any sweaty patches (only once) wash straight out in the washing machine.I am a larger lady and it is generous on fit, I can tie it exactly as per the directions.  If not I could tie it at the front as advised, the back would be equally as secure.The only slight downside, which nothing could be done about, is its length.  If your out and want to put it on find a chair/or your car seat to set the ends on so they don't drag on the ground and get dirty, but then again the don't touch the baby, so you can always pop it in the washing machine once your home.Buy it, you won't regret it.

title: Love it
author: A. Simeone
comments: This was a great buy for us. Our new baby pretty much desires to be held constantly when she is awake, and I've been using this since she was first born (now 6 weeks old). I use it to carry her around the house and always bring it on trips out of the house (grocery store etc). I feel very comfortable putting her in the wrap and can even use it to carry a burp cloth or even tuck in a bottle in case she gets hungry or upset while we're out. I've even been able to use it to nurse her in public without really anyone knowing!

title: Awesome wrap.  Great quality
author: E
comments: This wrap is amazing!  The quality of the material is first rate.  Baby hasn't arrived yet but i've been practicing with my dog and even he loves it!  It's easy to use and big enough for me 6'3" husband too.  100% recommended.

title: must-have for moms
author: M. Seitz
comments: I recently had my second child and was not happy with the sling I owned nor was I ready for the Baby Bjorn.  A friend suggested the Sleepy Wrap and I ordered it immediately.  It is so simple and my newborn LOVES it.  I can slip him in and within seconds he is calm and comfortable and asleep not much later.  I can be hands-free to watch/chase my 2.5-year old in total comfort.

title: Not stable or sturdy at all
author: Kindle User
comments: I read MANY reviews on this product before choosing to buy it, and now I wish I hadn't. The fabric is stretchy and my baby sinks down way too far. After wearing the wrap for 10 minutes, I have to take it off and put it back on to keep the baby up. My son is now 17 lbs and I bought this when he was 10 lbs. The entire time I've had it I've had nothing but problems, but wanted to get my money's worth so I've used it about 6 times. If you're in a warm climate, this wrap gets VERY warm and the baby and you will both sweat profusely because of the large amount of fabric.

title: A Must! You will love it and so will your baby!!!
author: Lacie5515
comments: I saw this wrap in use at the Baby Time Expo. The lady had a 18 month old big boy in it. He was happy and so was she. I wanted one but thought I can do without. I WAS WRONG! The moment I got this I put it on (easy) and slid my daughter in it. Instant bliss. This is the only carrier that has supported my lower back and abs. Ladies we know how hard it is to get those lower abs back after pregnancy. I feel no pull on my body or shoulders. The material is super soft like a t-shirt. Moves with you supporting both you and your baby without restriction. Fits all size babies easy.(Mine is long and skinny and nothing has held her secure.) This will be my baby shower gift to everyone from now on![...]

title: Worked like a charm, the first time!
author: Elizabeth Stern
comments: I received the wrap today, and was anxious to put it to use. Tonight, our 3 week old son was not wanting to sleep or calm down. After my husband held him for a few hours trying to comfort him, I put on the sleepy wrap. Within 4 minutes, he was calm and sleeping. My husband and I were so relieved! I can't believe that he took so well to it. We have a Baby Bjorn and a sling, but he gets really fussy with those. The Sleepy Wrap worked like magic! I watched the video on their website on how to use it, and had no problems putting it on.

title: Heaven Sent
author: Nancy P. Avila
comments: Awesome product. My baby is happy and content just like when she was in the womb. I can even breast feed her while she's in it! I read in a book that you should treat the first three months like a 4th trimester. This helps me do that. Also it relieves any back ache. Only downside for me is that when putting it on I do it at home before I leave because the fabric touches the floor when I put it on. However I am not very tall (5'5). I still love it.

title: Confusing and Weird
author: H. Chung
comments: I have no idea why it got such positive reviews. It's just a long long piece of elastic cloth (like 8 ft by 2 1/2 ft), which I could have easily stitched myself. It's not something where you can put a baby in right away and be on the go.  Each wrap session takes like 5 minutes and if it becomes loose or undone, you have to unwrap to rewrap it with both hands (and the baby might fall out while you're doing this).

title: A wrap that lives up to its name.
author: Kevin Downey
comments: It took my wife and I a few tries at getting a good wrap, but once we did, and put our 3 monther in it, he went right to sleep. Quite a blessing for us as our son has been quite colicy lately. Great product. Speedy shipping. Quiet baby. Need I say more?

title: Better than the Moby
author: Summer Kinard
comments: Before I bought this, I wondered if anything could work better than my Moby wrap, which my son loves.  The sleepy wrap is better than the Moby.  They are about the same length, but the Sleepy wrap fits both me and the baby better.  I'm plus-sized, and even I could tie the wrap around my waist after crossing in front and going around my waist twice.  I think the tighter tie makes the whole contraption more secure.  The baby really does sleep better in this wrap than in my Moby (which I still use).  If you are a fan of Moby wraps and are on the fence about ordering this one, do.  It's a great wrap.  Just make sure to tie it on tight per the instructions.

title: The Only Carrier You Will Ever Wear Again!
author: Julie Paquette
comments: I LOVE the SleepyWrap!  I happened to buy the orange one and it is such a great color.  I was hesitant to buy a wrap for some reason, but decided to give it a try based on the rave reviews.  Everyone is right, it is amazing!  So comfortable to wear, you hardly even feel the weight of the baby.  And my son loves being so close to me as I do everything-chores around the house, grocery shopping, the mall, walks outside....The fabric is very secure feeling, soft, stretchy and highly resilient, won't stretch out.  It is actually energizing to wear this with the baby-I feel ready to take on the world-with both hands free!

title: Best carrier out there!
author: K. Dunn
comments: I tried a few other baby carriers and ended up returning them. This is by far the best baby carrier out there! It's so comfortable to wear and it's very snug, creating a secure carrier for you and your baby. What I love best is that this sling is made for all sizes. I have a fairly large top and this can fit anyone! Highly recommended!

title: How Awesome!
author: L. Juarez
comments: These things are amazing...They make not only baby feel secure and close - but Momma too! Not to mention, HANDS FREE! Miracle product right here - I cannot say enough good things! :D :D :D

title: Better carrier for my second born
author: Alexis M. Lavarias
comments: I wish this was more readily available when I had my first born.  The security the ease and the fashionable style all are 5 stars to me.

title: The perfect baby carrier
author: Alexandra C. Hurley
comments: This is the ideal baby carrier.  It is soft and comfy, yet secure enough that you don't have to worry about the baby falling out of it if you sneeze, like with sling-style carriers.  Nothing's better than keeping baby close to your heart - this let's you do it comfortably, with the weight evenly distributed throughout your upper body and without painful thin straps and what not.  A great buy.

title: Long product life for the right price.
author: R. Federman
comments: I bought this when my second child was born, two years ago, and I am still using it now with him. It's much, much more comfortable than any other style of carrier I've tried. It's not nearly as fiddly as it looks and my baby was a very happy camper! If I were to have another child, I would be able to use this wrap for them as well as it's held up VERY well(through everything my son has thrown at it...and the washings upon washings which followed..). I'm definitely a fan!

title: Great product.
author: Michele L. Sanders
comments: My daughter-in-law swears by these. When hiking to do geo-caching, it is a great way to carry your child without all that back strain. Super comfortable to wear, easy on your backs, and super cuddly for you and your little one. It frees up your hands to be able to do chores while keeping baby close and comfortable.  A whole range of colors to choose from. Recommend to all!

title: Comfortable, Sleek, Convienent, and Priced Just right!
author: L. Falcon
comments: These are super popular but don't let that be the factor that convinces you.  They are super comfortable to wear, easy on our backs, and super cuddly for you and your little one.  Recommend to all!  A HUGE improvement over the old timey backpack style;)
